column17: Demolition: The safe houses of fifty militants were set ablaze and unlicensed cars used for attacks on security personnel and entities were confiscated by military forces in Rafah.

Seven pickups and two motorcycles used in violent operations were also destroyed.
Two soldiers were wounded when an explosive device went off targeting a fire engine belonging to Rafah security forces on Thursday.
Armed assailants killed a policeman in Northern Sinais city of Arish on Thursday

A group of Muslim Brotherhood [MB] students tried to break into the administration building of Zaqaziq University on Thursday [24 October] and when failed, they smashed the building facade by throwing stones.
Protests in support of Egyptian Defence Minister Abdel Fattah al-Sisi were staged in Alexandria, calling that he runs for the upcoming presidential elections.
Clashes erupted in Alexandria between supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood, pro-army residents and the security forces, wounding 15 people,

Supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood withdrew from streets of Suez City following clashes with residents and security forces Friday [25 October].

Clashes erupted in Tanta town, Al-Gharbiyah as a rally by MB supporters was taking place. Protesters resorted to violence and sabotaging public property, which forced residents of the town to clash with them.
Islamist protesters staged two protests in two different Cairo districts on Friday in what they dubbed ""Friday of resilience, from Suez to Jerusalem"" protest.
Islamist protesters staged two protests in two different Cairo districts on Friday in what they dubbed ""Friday of resilience, from Suez to Jerusalem"" protest.
In El-Arish, officials arrested four alleged Muslim Brotherhood members for attempting to stage a protest in front of a school to prevent it from opening Saturday
Demonstrators gathered in Downtown Cairos Talaat Harb Square to rally against the proposed law restricting political protests.
Militants fired an RPG at an armoured vehicle that was passing by at a road south of Al-Arish city. No casualties were reported.
A number of women from the Muslim Brotherhood group organized a protest along Alexandrias Corniche on Saturday [26 October].
Supporters of deposed Islamist President Mohamed Mursi attacked a police vehicle in the Upper Egyptian city of Sohag, leaving a policeman dead and another wounded.
A security source in North Sinai said gunmen targeted on Sunday 27/10/2013 an armored vehicle with an RPG shell but no injuries or damage were reported.
On Sunday, hundreds of students protesting in Cairo University chanted ""Morsi is my president"" before scuffling with opponents inside the university as police and soldiers were stationed outside.
Unknown assailants killed three policemen who were posted near the University of Mansura in Egypts Nile Delta region

Security forces launched an operation in the governorate of Sohag. The operation, in the village of Al-Atamnah in the Tama district, resulted in the death of one person and the injury of a police sergeant.
Egyptian security forces fired tear gas to disperse students protesting in support of ousted Islamist president Mohamed Morsi at Al Azhar University
Nile News TV said that its crew were attacked as they covered student protests at Al-Azhar University.
A limited number of MB members staged a brief protest in Shukri al-Qutali area in Al-Mahalah. They ended their protest when they thought shop owners wanted to clash with them.
Security forces managed on Monday [28 October] to disperse a protest staged by supporters of deposed president Muhammad Morsi in Farshut village of Qina governorate
Supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood group protested outside the High Court on Tuesday where the trial of some of the groups leaders was being held.
Scores of members of the Muslim Brotherhood group staged on Tuesday rallies in the Delta cities of Shihin al-Kum and Sadat calling for reinstating ousted president Muhammad Morsi.
Scores of members of the Muslim Brotherhood group staged on Tuesday rallies in the Delta cities of Shibin al-Kum and Sadat calling for reinstating ousted president Muhammad Morsi.
Two students have been injured in clashes which erupted between pro-Muslim Brotherhood students and other independent students at the Technological Faculty in Alexandria
The son of a tribal chieftain was killed by unknown gunmen in Al Arish
Protesting students closed main gates to the administrative building of Al Azhar University and destroyed walls and some automated teller machines.
A militant was arrested after trading gunfire with soldiers in Sinai.
A car bomb intended for Egyptian troops in the Sinai exploded on Wednesday without causing any injuries
Seven students were wounded in the Nile Delta Mansoura University when Islamists clashed with opponents
Clashes between students were also reported in Zagaziq University north of Cairo.
A soldier was attacked on Wednesday 30/10/2013 by ""militants"" while on duty guarding a security building in Arish city.
Ain Shams university witnessed clashes between MB supporters and students causing some injuries.
Cairo university witnessed clashes between MB supporters and students causing some injuries.
Alexandria university witnessed clashes between MB supporters and students causing some injuries.

Twenty Azhar university students were arrested on Wednesday for participating in riots that erupted into clashes
A journalist was assaulted and tortured by police in Al Minya

North Sinai security forces arrested a group of ""militants"" suspected of being involved in attacks on security forces and facilities. Egyptian Armed Forces also captured a leading figure in the ""extremist ""militant"" Al-Takfir wal Hijra"" organization in North Sinai,
Security operations in Rafah led to five vehicles used by Islamists being damaged and three smuggling tunnels along Egypt-Gaza Strip borders being destroyed

Students belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) in Alexandria University organized on Thursday [31 October] a rally in front of the Faculty of Arts to protest the arrest of some of their colleagues and campus violence in Egyptian universities.
Thousands march to presidential palace ""against violence and terrorism"" in Cairo.
Supporters of deposed President Mohamed Mursi staged a march in the Maadi district of Cairo to voice their support for Mursi
In the Nile Delta city of Zaqaziq, five people were wounded when pro-Morsi protesters clashed with civilian opponents
Gunmen opened fire on a hotel in Cairo near the famed Giza pyramids. There were no casualties.
In Giza, Mursi supporters arranged marches from al-Mahrousa mosque. They carried banners with the Rabaa symbol and chanted slogans calling for the return of Mursi to power.
Protests also took place on Friday in Assiut in support of Morsi
In Giza, Mursi supporters arranged marches from al-Istiqama mosque. They carried banners with the Rabaa symbol and chanted slogans calling for the return of Mursi to power.
Minor clashes erupted between supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood group and residents of a village in Al-Fayyum [south of Cairo]. Four people were wounded.
Police forces fired teargas bombs at Muslim Brotherhood supporters in Suez on Friday after the latter hurled stones at the police
Clashes broke out Friday [1 November] between Muslim Brotherhood (MB) supporters and residents of Nasr City.
Small-scale clashes erupted in Suez between residents and a number of Mursi supporters.

Eight people were injured on Friday as clashes broke out between supporters and opponents of the Muslim Brotherhood in Kafr al-Sheikhs Metaubus. Residents of the area assaulted demonstrators marching against the army and the police.
Protests also took place on Friday in Minya in support of Morsi
22 women were arrested in Alexandria after a demonstration they held in support of Morsi.

In Alexandria there were limited clashes between a pro-Mursi march and Alexandria residents and police forces. The MB website Ikhwanonline reported a number of demonstrators were killed as they participated in a procession on the Corniche Road when they were attacked by live ammunition.

Protests also took place on Friday in Mahalla in support of Morsi
Allies of deposed President Mohamed mursi marched on Friday to the military intelligence headquarters
Zamalek residents took to the streets protesting the declining status of their island
Al-Minya security forces foiled an attempt by relatives of prisoners to smuggle them after attacking a police vehicle that had been transporting them to court.
Ten people were killed in clashes between two families in the El-Badari area of Assiut.
A rally took place in support of Minister of Defence Abdel Fatah Al-Sisi.
Supporters of ousted President Mohamed Morsi held a demonstration in front of High Court demanding the cancellation of the former presidents trial and the release of the arrested Morsi supporters.
Gunmen killed two Egyptian policemen near Ismailia on the west bank of the Suez Canal. Another policeman was injured.
Ain Shams University witnessed protests organized by Students against the Coup (SAC) Movement in front of Al-Zafarana Palace inside the university campus
Al-Ahram reported that hundreds of students in multiple faculties protested on Sunday in Cairo University in condemnation of the Cabinets decision

Students Against the Coup (SAC) organised a protest on Sunday in Alexandria University when hundreds demonstrated against the arrest of 22 women in Alexandria on Friday for organising a demonstration in support of former President Mohamed Morsi.

Anti-coup students at Al-Azhar University organised demonstrations in front of the Agriculture and Engineering faculty. Minor skirmishes occurred between the anti-coup demonstration and police forces inside the campus as the demonstrators chanted against the army and Defence Minister Abdel Fatah Al-Sisi.
A demonstration to support university chairman Osama Al-Abd took place at the Physical Education Faculty under the slogan ""No to Vandalism"".
Muslim Brotherhood supporters attack journalists at Morsis trial
Two policemen were killed on Monday [4 November] in a militant attack on a security checkpoint on Al-Ismailiyah-Port Said agricultural road near the entrance of Al-Ismailiyah governorate
An army officer died of wounds he sustained in a militant attack on a security checkpoint on Al-Ismailiyah-Cairo desert road near the canal city on Monday [4 November].
Supporters and opponents of ousted president Muhammad Morsi clashed outside his house in Al-Zaqaziq.
Security forces attacked journalists in Alexandria.

Arrests: Security bodies in North Sinai have managed to arrest an officer belonging to Al- Qassam Brigades of the Palestinian Hamas movement upon infiltrating into Sinai through one of the border tunnels.
Clashes intensified between the banned Muslim Brotherhoods elements and citizens outside High Court and in Ramsis Street in central Cairo. 5 injured.
The Muslim Brotherhood protested outside the constitutional court and blocked the Nile Corniche Road. Police forces dispersed them.

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: The building of Journalists Syndicate was attacked by unknown protesters during clashes erupted nearby it after Morsis trial had been adjourned.
There were ""limited"" protests by pro-Morsi protesters in Suez.
Policemen dispersed pro-Morsi protests outside Al-Zaqaziq court. 1 person injured.
18 rioters were arrested in Alexandria after protesters were attacked by army supporters
There were also anti-Brotherhood pro-army protests reported outside the High Court.
A number of unidentified gunmen attacked the HQ of the intelligence office in Rafah Tuesday [5 November]. Troops exchanged fire but no casualties reported.

Three ""Takfiri"" elements have been killed in an exchange of fire with law enforcement troops in al-Mahdiyah village in North Sinai. One soldier was injured. Six people were arrested in manhunt campaigns for an alleged involvement in attacks against Armed Forces elements. Three Palestinians were arrested in the campaign in North Sinai.
Riot police intervened to separate Muslim Brotherhood supporters and residents who clashed in the vicinity of Al-Shuban Al-Muslimun Mosque in Fayyum.

The Armed Forces, backed by police, continued strikes against criminal outposts, raiding 55 hotbeds of ""Takfiri elements"" near villages at Rafah. The security forces arrested 11 suspected elements including five Palestinians, seized 10 vehicles and 15 unlicensed motorcycles and destroyed nine houses.
The family of deposed president Muhammad Morsi took part in a protest in the 6th of October [city].
A rally of Ultras Ahlawy [zealous fans of Al-Ahly club] took off on Wednesday [6 November] from Al-Ahly sports club to the High Court of Justice protesting the detention of 25 of their league members
A sniper shot dead an Egyptian soldier in Sheikh Zuwayed
The army killed three militants in the restive northern Sinai Peninsula.
Dozens of journalists and media men staged a protest Thursday [7 November] to condemn assaulting an MBC Egypt correspondent and holding him in Minya police station.

Security forces in Mansura dispersed on Thursday [7 November] scores of Muslim Brotherhoods supporters, who protested outside the house of a member of the judicial panel considering the case of ousted President Muhammad Morsi.

Supporters of deposed President Mohamed Mursi and the Muslim Brotherhood organised marches across Cairo and Giza following Fridays noon prayer.

Supporters and members of the Muslim Brotherhood in Al-Minufiyah governorate [north of Cairo] staged on Friday [8 November] three protests and formed a human chain to demand the reinstatement of ousted president Muhammad Morsi.
The ""National Alliance to Support Legitimacy"" staged a human chain in Tala city to denounce the arrest of two Muslim Brotherhood members in the governorate.
Supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood staged protests following Friday [8 November] prayers from several mosques in Al-Sharqiyah governorate

Aswan security forces arrested on Friday [8 November] two elements of Muslim Brotherhood for forming groups and recruiting outlaws to carry out violent acts during protests and rallies organized by the banned organization.
Security forces arrested five supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood in Al-Minya [Upper Egypt] after they tried to break into security barriers near Al-Minya security directorate headquarters
Four Muslim Brotherhood members were arrested after clashes that took place in Muntaza district between MB rioters and residents which left two people injured
Weapons Seizure: A wide security campaign launched led to seizing heavy weapons, including nine missiles, four RPGs, an RPG launcher, three kilograms of TNT and five hand grenades.
Muslim Brotherhood supporters staged a march a on Friday [8 November] evening to Al-Ittihadiyah presidential palace [in Cairo].
Muslim Brotherhood supporters staged a march on Friday [8 November] evening to Al-Qubbah presidential palaces [in Cairo].

Hundreds rallied at al-Qaed Ibrahim Mosque to urge army chief Abdel Fattah al-Sisi to run for president.
A group that goes by the name ""Tomorrow"" organized a bicycle demonstration in Egypts Suez on Friday evening where tens of girls biked on the Corniche in defiance of sexual harassment.
One person was injured in clashes in Beheira between supporters of deposed President Mohamed Mursi and security forces

A group of demonstrators marched from the Islamic Centre in New Damietta as part of the protests which the pro-Mursi National Coalition for Supporting Legitimacy called for. Police forces arrested eight supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood and of ousted President Mohamed Mursi in New Damietta on charges of rioting and inciting violence
Security forces fired teargas bombs to disperse supporters of ousted President Mohamed Mursi in Alexandria
In Giza, supporters and opponents of Mursi hurled stones at each other in Haram and Omraneya areas

Groups of the former presidents supporters and opponents hurled stones in Sharqiyas Zagazig. Three people were injured.

Security forces fired teargas bombs to disperse supporters of ousted President Mohamed Mursi in Alexandria. The Anti-Coup Alliance claimed that one person was killed.

Security forces raided one of the most dangerous terror hotspots in North Sinai and engaged in a heavy fire exchange with militants, which left 11 Takfiri elements killed.
Activist groups held a protest in front of the Shura Council building Saturday calling for the abolishment of military trials for civilians

A citizen from North Sinai handed over to security bodies in the governorate three Anti- Aircraft SAM-7 rockets in response to the initiative launched by Interior Minister Mohamed Ibrahim for handing over arms at his meeting with chieftains of Bedouin tribes in North Sinai.
Tens of Muslim Brotherhood supporters rallied by Egypts High Court in downtown on Saturday morning to denounce mass arrests that followed the armies ouster of Islamist President Mohamed Mursi.
The radio building came under fire from unidentified gunmen several times on Sunday [10 November] without leaving casualties.
Two soldiers were killed and three wounded in a ""militant"" attack targeting a military unit along Ismailiyah-Zaqaziq desert road.
Police used tear gas to disperse rock-throwing fans outside the stadium before the African Champions League final Sunday
Armed forces confiscated seven rockets in a security operation in South Rafah and North Sinais al-Sheikh Zuwayed on Sunday. 19 extremists were arrested.
Students in the university of Port Said protested on Sunday against the return of security forces to university campuses.
Students in the university of Tanta protested on Sunday against the return of security forces to university campuses.
Armed forces confiscated seven rockets in a security operation in South Rafah and North Sinais al-Sheikh Zuwayed on Sunday. 19 extremists were arrested.
Hundreds of citizens on Monday [11 November] staged a protest outside a liquefied gas factory in Kafr al-Dawwar city in Buhira governorate

A number of Cairo University students who are loyalists of the Muslim Brotherhood staged a protest on campus on Tuesday [12 November] demanding the release of some detained colleagues.
Pro-Muslim Brotherhood students staged a protest in Alexandria university

A police officer was killed Tuesday [12 November] in a drive-by shooting targeting a police station in Al-Arish. On the same day, unidentified gunmen opened fire on the radio building in Arish and fled the scene. No casualties were reported. Security forces traded fire with the gunmen who ran away after firing shots at the North Sinai provincial radio headquarters.

In Zagazig University, unknown attackers broke into the Department of Mechanical Engineering searching for students belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood who were involved in the clashes that took place the day before.

In Minya University, Students Against the Coup formed a human chain in front of the Faculty of Fine Arts, demanding the return of ousted President Mohamed Morsi and calling for the release of the students detained during late Octobers clashes at Al-Azhar University.
Students belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood organised a flash mob simulating a scene from the 14 August dispersal of the Rabaa Al-Adaweya sit-in.
In Azhar University hundreds of students chanted against the presence of Central Security Forces on campus
The MB organizations students throw fireworks at police [present] outside the walls of Al-Mansurah University north of Cairo. The police responded by firing teargas.
There were protests at Al-Zaqaziq University north of Cairo. The correspondent said that ""clashes took place between the pro-MB students and security"".
Mansoura University students staged an on-campus a protest on Wednesday calling for the resignation of university chairman Al-Sayed Abdel Khaleq and the release of detained students.
""Unknown assailants"" stormed the faculty of law building where a pro-Morsi demonstration was taking place. Two students were injured and taken to the hospital.
Nine high school students who belong to the Revolutionary Socialists movement were captured then detained from outside their school in Damietta. Four of the students were physically assaulted.

A number of women's organizations and movements staged a protest outside the Shura Council Wednesday [13 November] at what they considered an ignorance of their political rights in the new constitution
One police officer was shot dead on Thursday morning in Arish
Armed militants attacked an army checkpoint in Arishs Maseed district, injuring one army recruit. According to Al-Ahram the recruit was killed.
Police, along with army forces, clashes with militants leading to the death of three militants.
Protests took place in the governorate of Ismailiyah
Clashes erupted between Brotherhood organization elements and inhabitants due to delaying traffic in Al-Haram Street in Giza.

Shibin Al-Kawm [City in Al-Munufiyah Governorate, north of Cairo] residents disperse a march by the Brotherhood organization after trying to block the road and security forces arrest four members of the [Brotherhood] organization.""

Thousands of pro-Morsi supporters also demonstrated in the city of Fayyum, south of Cairo.
Dozens of residents of Gizas El-Saff district blocked the villages main road on Friday to protest the absence of security forces in the area
Six marches roamed Alexandria on Friday to express support for Mursi and the Brotherhood in Alexandria. No other information on specific locations.
a 13-year old was run over by a bus during a chase between police forces and Brotherhood supporters.
A 15-year old boy was killed on Friday in Alexandria in clashes between Muslim Brotherhood supporters and residents of al-Siouf neighbourhood in Alexandria.
Supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood clashed with residents of Minyas Mallawi on Friday during demonstrations which the Brotherhood had called for.
Clashes between demonstrators and local residents occurred in the northern city of Damietta but were dispersed by security forces,
Brotherhood organization elements blocked Abbas al-Aqqad Street in Nasr City.
Republican Guards stationed at Cairos Merghani street stopped a march for allies of former President Mohamed Mursi from accessing the Ittihadeya palace gates on Friday
Hundreds of Al-Azhar students protested on the university campus against the 17-year sentence handed to the students who broke into the Al-Azhar administration offices
A policeman was shot dead in the early hours of Saturday by unknown assailants in the city of Al-Arish in Egypts restive Sinai Peninsula
Central Security Forces (CSF) stormed the campus of Zagazig University upon the request of the university president and fired teargas at demonstrating students
Security forces forcefully dispersed a sit-in by workers of Samanoud for Wool and Weaving Saturday, in Egypts Gharbiya governorate. One police officer and five soldiers were injured

In Al-Azhar University, hundreds of students protested against the court verdict that sentenced 47 students to 17 years.
Three security forces were injured on Sunday [17 November] after bomb exploded in an armored vehicle on a side-road in Al-Shaykh Zuwayid [in North Sinai].
Dozens of Copts protested in front of the outside gates of the Shura [consultative] Council in Kasr al-Ayni Street, calling for the adoption of a quota for Copts in the elected councils
Scores of Muslim Brotherhood (MB) students at Cairo University have demonstrated Sunday [17 November], urging the release of their colleagues who were arrested during recent clashes.

A number of Muslim Brotherhood (MB) students staged a protest in front of the administrative building of Ayn Shams University. Clashes, which left two students injured, erupted between the MB and independent students, with each side using rocks and bottles inside the university campus.

Security forces fired teargas canisters to disperse a rally staged by supporters of ousted president Muhammad Morsi in the canal city of Suez. Eyewitnesses said skirmishes erupted between protesters and residents after the former smashed a number of vehicles.
Ansar Bait al-Maqdis killed a senior national security officer in Cairos Nasr City as he headed to his office

A number of students announced a sit-on on Sunday at Egypts Zaqaziq University, located north of Cairo, to protest the presence of police on university campus and the arrest of some of their colleagues.
In the Faculty of Commerce at Beni-Suef University, Students Against the Coup organised a human chain that included dozens of university students
Two policemen were injured during an operation near Tanta as two unidentified people, riding a motorbike, opened fire at the security elements deployed in the area.

Hundreds of Egyptians gathered in Cairos Tahrir Square to mark the anniversary of protests against the military in 2011 that ignited deadly clashes with security forces. Protesters defaced a newly inaugurated monument to those killed in the mass protests.
There were rival chants between supporters of the military and those against the current military-backed regime and the ousted Brotherhood-led government.
Dozens of Muslim Brotherhood supporters staged demonstrations in Al-Abbassiyah Square in Cairo [on 19 November] and tried to reach the Ministry of Defence headquarters
Muslim Brotherhood (MB) supporters staged Tuesday [19 November] two small rallies in the Nile Delta governorate of Damietta with the participation of some university students.
Political forces in North Sinai staged a march to pay tribute to slain protesters nationwide, chanting slogans supporting the police and army, such as ""army, police, people are one hand"".

Scores of activists in Alexandria participated in marking the 2nd anniversary of Muhammad Mahmud incidents in 2011. Supporters of Defence Minister Colonel General Abd-al- Fattah al-Sisi also chanted against the MB in a square opposite to Al-Qaid Ibrahim mosque in Alexandria.
Dozens of protesters marking the second anniversary of the Muhammad Mahmud incidents formed a human chain along Qasr al-Nil bridge demanding revenge for martyrs of the revolution.
Thousands of police and army supporters gathered in Al-Saa square in the Nile Delta governorate of Damietta
Dozens of Muslim Brotherhood students staged a protest Tuesday [19 November] at Cairo University to mark the second anniversary of Muhammad Mahmud clashes.
