Egyptian police fired tear gas at stone-throwing protesters in Cairos Tahrir Square on Tuesday as hundreds marked the second anniversary of deadly anti-military protests. Protesters early Tuesday vandalized the pedestal of a memorial dedicated to demonstrators killed in Egypts revolutionary turmoil. Two dead and 50 injured when Egyptian riot police stormed Cairos Tahrir Square to disperse stone-throwing protesters
Unknown men attacked the Arab Leagues headquarters throwing molotov cocktails, security forces deter them
Skirmishes took place between [Al-Ahly football clubs hard-core fans] Ultras and 6 April Movement [members] in [Cairos] Al-Tahrir Square
March staged by 6th April Youths Movement reaches Ramses [Street in Cairo] to show solidarity with those held in the previous days clashes.""
One student was killed amid clashes between Al-Azhar University students and security forces, which erupted in the university dorm on Wednesday night

Authorities dispersed a protest of about a thousand Azhar students who had blocked Salah Salem Road. Anti-Coup Students said on its Facebook that security forces and thugs attacked the students and chased them with teargas, injuring tens of them.
In northern Cairo, assailants hurled an explosive device at a checkpoint, wounding four policemen
A car bomb in Egypts restive Sinai killed 11 soldiers and wounded 34.
Dozens of workers protested on Wednesday at the Press Syndicate before and after a presser organised by its Liberties Committee to discuss violations against workers at various factories.

Security forces found maps of church locations and a list of the names of some police officers in the possession of the two ""Takfiris"" who were arrested in Qalubiyah. The operations left one security officer dead.
A number of Muslim Brotherhood loyalist students demonstrated Thursday in front of Cairo Universitys Dar-al-Ulum Faculty, protesting against the killing of a student at Al-Azhar University
Students staged a protest on Thursday morning inside Al Azhar university campus, condemning Wednesdays clashes.
A police officer was shot dead north of Cairo while on a mission to arrest militants suspected of assassinating a senior security official.
On Thursday a police officer was shot dead while on patrol in the Suez Canal city of Ismailiya, security officials said, adding that one of the two assailants had been arrested

Arrests: In North Sinai, law enforcement arrested 29 people including a member of the Muslim Brotherhoods Guidance Bureau, on charges of ""inciting against the army and funding ""militant"" organisations"".
Clashes erupted between Brotherhood [supporters] and residents of Kafr al-Dawwar [north of Cairo] due to [Brotherhoods] slogans against the army and police
Limited clashes broke out on Friday between two rival marches in Cairos Maadi

In the southern city of Assiut, police fired tear gas to disperse pro-Morsi protesters and arrested 23. Security officials said they were guarding the cities university campus to prevent protesters from entering.
Minor clashes were reported in the eastern Cairo district of Al-Matariya

In Nasr City, police forces fired teargas bombs on supporters of ousted President Mohamed Mursi and the Muslim Brotherhood. Morsi supporters, then, threw molotov cocktails into the metro cars of El-Nozha station, setting them on fire with passengers still inside. No serious injuries were reported

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: A correspondent and reporter was assaulted in Mohandessin by a protester.
Three people were injured in clashes that erupted between Brotherhood supporters and residents of Heliopolis
Five people who were taking part in a pro-military protest were injured when unidentified gunmen opened random fire outside the Al-Qaid Ibrahim Mosque in Alexandria.
Fighting erupted in the oasis city of Fayoum some 100 kilometres (60 miles) south of Cairo, but was later broken up by police using tear gas.
A man was killed in rival clashes in the central city of Minya.
Small-scale clashes broke out on Friday between residents of Alexandria and marching demonstrators who support deposed President Mohamed Mursi.

Clashes broke out in several areas in Suez such as Abul Hasm district, Ahmed Orabi, el-Nil Street, Al-Teraa area and the Al-Arbaein area prompting police forces to intervene and teargas the two sides. A 10 year old boy was killed in the clashes.
Police forces dispersed a pro-Morsi march in Ismailias Al-Sheikh Zayed district in downtown after they chanted against the army
Minor clashes were reported in the eastern Cairo district of Al-Zaytoun

Security forces succeeded in controlling clashes in the Sidi Bishr district in Alexandria, which began when pro-Morsi demonstrators, according to media reports, destroyed cars displaying posters of Defence Minister Abdel Fatah Al-Sisi.
Five injuries were reported in Damiettas Ezbet Al-Borg area when residents fought with a pro-Morsi march.

Unidentified gunmen fired three mortar shells on a foodstuffs factory belonging to the Armed Forces but no causalities were reported. A security source in North Sinai said security bodies reacted to the attack and a manhunt operation was launched.
Supporters of deposed president Muhammad Morsi staged a night rally in Suez city on Saturday [23 November].

Tens of Egyptians gathered to mourn the death of a boy killed on Friday near clashes between opponents and supporters of ousted President Mohamed Mursi in Suez. The mourners chanted against the Muslim Brotherhood.
The Muslim Brotherhoods Freedom and Justice Party said they had plans to hold marches to Rabaa Al-Adaweya Square.
Students belonging to the banned Muslim Brotherhood demonstrated inside the campus of the Al-Mansurah University
In Al-Buhayrah, Morsi supporters marched the streets of Damanhur while chanting against the police and army.
A rally of supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood arrived in the vicinity of the Al-Qubbah Presidential Palace in Cairo.
Dozens of Muslim Brotherhood students at Al-Minya University staged a protest on campus to mark 100 days since the dispersal of the groups sit-ins in Cairo and Giza in August.
Dozens of members of the so-called ""student movement against coup"" in Qina staged a march that paraded several streets.
Several students of Sadat University in Al-Minufiyah protested today to demand the return of Morsi to power and the release of detained MB leaders.
Students belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood demonstrated in different universities on Sunday commemorating 100 days that have passed since what they call ""Rabaa killing""
Students belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood demonstrated in different universities on Sunday commemorating 100 days that have passed since what they call ""Rabaa killing""
Protests were held outside Cairo University on Sunday in response to calls by the Anti-Coup Alliance to mark the passing of 100 days since the dispersal of the Rabaa-Al Adaweya and Al-Nahda sit-ins.
Students belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood demonstrated in different universities on Sunday commemorating 100 days that have passed since what they call ""Rabaa killing""
Four ""Takfiri"" elements were killed in a gun battle with security forces during a raid targeting ""terrorism"" hotbeds in Sheikh Zuwaid in North Sinai.

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: An activist was beaten and arrested by university guards and policeman near Cairo University.
Two conscripts were injured when unknown assailants on a motorcycle hurled a hand grenade on a checkpoint near Egypts presidential palace in Heliopolis
Around 500 protesters regrouped at downtown Cairos Talaat Harb Square on Tuesday after the police dispersed a demonstration outside the Shura Council earlier and arrested 52 protesters
Security forces dispersed a protest organized by activists to commemorate a young activist who was killed in clashes last year.
Female protesters, who all belong to the April 6 youth movement, said they were beaten and sexually harassed by police forces at the Shura Council protest
Six people were killed and several others injured in clashes in Nagaa al-Hagar

The Journalists union strongly condemned violations against journalists and media workers covering demonstrations (Tuesday), which amounted to prevent journalists from working and assault, and breaking down their equipment and taking it in addition to the detention of a number of journalists from the site of events and abuse beatings and insults.
A leading figure and two others in the extremist ""Ansar Beet al-Maqdas"" movement were killed by security forces in North Sinai. Another four suspected militants were captured in the operation.
Egyptian security forces fired teargas to disperse a protest staged in support of 21 detained Islamist women in Alexandria
Egypt's interior ministry has allowed activists to stage a demonstration in Talaat Harb Square in central Cairo

Students were arrested in Cairo for staging a protest in support of deposed Islamist President Mohamed Mursi after the security forces dispersed them due to violating the newly-enacted protest law. One student was killed and another was wounded in clashes between security forces and protesters near Cairo University
Clashes erupted between the security forces and students shortly after they gathered to demonstrate near a university complex in Egypts second city.
Students at the campus of the Al-Azhar University in Asyut also condemned the incarceration of the female protesters.
Four people were killed and ten others wounded in clashes between Muslims and Coptic Christians in Menya governorate south of Cairo over a piece of land.
Clashes erupted on Thursday [28 November] between Muslims and Copts in Badraman village of Minya [in Upper Egypt]. A man was killed while six others injured during the clashes.
Security authorities have granted Ultras Ahlawi permission to stage a march from Mariam Mosque to Al-Manshiyah Square in Port Said

Security forces managed to disperse a group of Muslim Brotherhood (MB) elements who staged a protest following Friday [29 November] prayers. The forces fired water cannon and tear gas to disperse the protesters.
Police in Marsa Matruh governorate [northwest of Egypt] dispersed a protest staged by supporters of the banned MB group.
Protests were dispersed in Mahallah by police forces.
Protests were dispersed in Qena by police forces.

In Mohandessins Sudan Street, the Middle East News Agency correspondent reported seeing security forces teargas a group of marching demonstrators to disperse it. Protesters retaliated by throwing stones and burning tyres in Mohandessin.
Security forces in Alexandria fired teargas bombs to disperse protesters marching in Loran area to denounce a verdict sentencing female protesters to 11 years in prison.

In New Damietta, police forces broke up a march for hundreds of pro-Brotherhood demonstrators after they clashed with residents near Saeedi Street. Four people were injured with shotgun pellets in the clashes.
Muslim Brotherhood protests calling for the release of the Alexandria female students were dispersed in Suez by police forces

Police forces fired teargas bombs to disperse protesters supporting the Muslim Brotherhood in Gizas Haram Street. The protesters threw stones and petrol bombs at the police. Unidentified persons set the Al Talibiyah police station ablaze.

Police forces in New Cairos Rehab city arrested a man on Friday for alleged involvement in assassinating a Homeland Security Officer. Police forces engaged in a five-hour-firefight with the suspect, leaving three policemen injured before the arrest was made.
In Cairo, demonstrators marched from mosques in Helwan after a new protest law curbing demonstrations was implemented.
In Cairo, demonstrators marched from mosques in Maadi after a new protest law curbing demonstrations was implemented.
In Cairo, demonstrators marched from mosques in Nasr City after a new protest law curbing demonstrations was implemented.
Police forces dispersed hundreds of pro-Muslim Brotherhood protesters who gathered at the Qubba Presidential Palace in Cairo. The police used teargas bombs and water hoses to break up the rally.
Security forces fired tear gas to disperse a rally by Muslim Brotherhood (MB) supporters before reaching the Judges Club in Glim district.
In the southern province of Minya, unknown gunmen shot dead a Christian, days after three people died in sectarian clashes. The assailants opened fire on a 50-year-old Christian man.
Police forces fired teargas to disperse a protest by Abdeen Court
Muslim Brotherhood supporters staged a rally on Sunday morning on the Maadi Corniche to denounce sentencing 21 Muslim Brotherhood girls and women, including seven minors, to 11 years in prison.

Muslim Brotherhood students staged a rally on Sunday [1 December] at some of the Al-Azhar Universitys faculties and marched to its main administrative building in an attempt to disrupt study. Clashes erupted between pro- and anti- Muslim Brotherhood students.
Dozens of engineering students at Ayn Shams University staged a protest Sunday [1 December] to condemn the death of a Cairo University student who was killed during protests last week

Security forces fired tear gas to disperse Muslim Brotherhood protesters gathered in front of the Qaid Ibrahim Mosque. Firing teargas on protesters led to a series of hit-and-run clashes and protesters reportedly ran into nearby streets as police controlled the area.

Hundreds of protesting students who belong to the Muslim Brotherhood [MB] gathered in Talat Harb Square after the dispersal of a protest in Al-Tahrir Square. Police forces attempted to disperse the demonstrators in central Cairos Talat Harb Square, using water hoses and tear gas.

Clashes erupted between Muslim Brotherhood students at Alexandria University and their opponents outside the faculty of arts.The two sides hurled stones at each other, leaving a number of students injured.
A number of students torched a police vehicle near Egypts Cairo University on Sunday during a protest against the killing of one of their colleagues during a protest last Thursday.
Egyptian authorities used tear gas Sunday to disperse protesters who entered Cairos Tahrir Square to demonstrate against Julys military-backed ouster of President Mohamed Morsi.
Police forces use tear gas and water cannon to disperse a gathering of Brotherhood students in front of the High Court of Justice, [Cairo].
Egyptian authorities used water cannons and teargas to disperse a protest held by the Muslim Brotherhoods ""7am"" movement in Heliopolis on Sunday and arrested 11 protesters
Clashes erupted in Cairo Sunday between residents and police after a policeman shot dead a student following an argument.
A student was shot dead by a policeman after the two had a heated argument when their vehicles crashed into each other in the capitals northern Amiriya neighbourhood.
Hundreds of people have gathered outside Qatars embassy in Egypt to protest against what they called the Gulf states unwarranted interference in Egyptian internal affairs.
14 members of the Muslim Brotherhood group were arrested in the wake of clashes between them and residents of Al-Raml district of Alexandria.
Defusal: Explosive experts managed on Monday [2 December] to defuse a homemade bomb which was planted on a ring road in Samalut in the upper Egyptian city of Minya.

Hundreds of Muslim Brotherhood students and their supporters in Al-Azhar University organized Monday [2 December] protest marches in front of some colleges calling for repealing the Demonstration Law and demanding the release of their fellow detainees.
Defusal: Security forces defused a bomb placed in a car and primed to explode on a roadside near the Egyptian capital.
Two conscripts were injured and a police truck was destroyed on Monday in confrontations between protesters and security forces by Alexandria Court.

Security forces arrested 15 Muslim Brotherhood students at Asyut University [in Upper Egypt] over their participation in a protest on Tuesday [3 December] afternoon. Hundreds of protesters blocked a road outside the universities campus, shouting slogans against the Armed Forces and police.

Five students were injured at Zaqaziq University [in Al-Sharqiyah Governorate, eastern Nile Delta] after fierce clashes took place between supporters and opponents of the Muslim Brotherhood on the universities perimeter.
Dozens of Muslim Brotherhoods students staged a human chain in Fayyum University, northern Upper Egypt, on 3 December to protest a first instance court ruling to prison 14 girls 11 years.
Muslim Brotherhood students staged a march on Zagazig campus, shouting slogans against the Armed Forces and police.

Scores of students supporting the banned Brotherhood group in Ain Shams University on Tuesday [3 December] staged a protest on the campus and blocked Khalifah al-Mamun road [in Heliopolis, east Cairo] leading to a complete traffic paralysis. Other students supporting the government and the Armed Forces clashed with the Brotherhood supporters.
Media and press persons working on covering the situation in Ayn Shams University clashes were also attacked.

Hundreds of Muslim Brotherhood-supporting students continued their protests in front of the administrative building in Al-Azhar University and some faculties in Nasr City to mark the ""Students day of marching"" called for by some members of the Student Union. Al-Azhar MB girls in the faculty of agriculture also demonstrated in front of their faculty building before some of them joined the male students march in front of the administrative building.

Engineering students of Cairo University held a protest on Wednesday in condemnation of the General Prosecution statement which said that a fellow student was killed by weapons carried by demonstrators.
In Alexandria, Students Against the Coup (SAC) in the Engineering Faculty announced a sit-in in front of the the facultys administrative building.

Egyptian authorities launched arrest campaigns against Palestinian refugees fleeing from the ongoing conflict in Syria to Egypt. Serious violations were reported in Egyptian detention centres against the Palestinian and Syrian refugees including sexual harassment, abuses, and poor treatment.

An attempt by gunmen to destroy a watchtower in Rafah was foiled. Troops of the Second Field Army in cooperation with security men were able to thwart an attempt by extremists from the Gaza Strip to destroy the watchtower via a 50-kg explosive device that was placed inside a plastic bag that could be remotely detonated via a mobile phone. Army troops managed also to destroy several tunnels and tanks used in smuggling operations in the city.
Suez Universitys students staged a rally on Wednesday [4 December] inside the campus, calling for the release of their detained colleagues and protesting against the new protest law.
Minufiyah security forces managed to contain clashes which took place outside the General Intelligence building during a march organized by students who belong to the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group.

column6: Military Forces of Egypt (2013-2014) Border Guards
column17: Four Sudanese were killed in an exchange of fire with Egyptian border guards, with 10 more wounded. Clashes erupted between the illegal migrants and Egyptian military forces along the Egypt-Sudan border, the officials said, and the wounded were transferred to Aswan hospital.

Two photojournalists were arrested by the military police from Cairo on Friday while covering a Muslim Brotherhood protest in Helmeyet Al-Zaitoun District. The journalist said that a military officer dragged him inside the Officers Club and assaulted him.
Rallies in Fayoum descended into violence, with security forces firing volleys of tear gas to disperse Morsis supporters rallying in city squares. A security officer was injured.
Rallies in the Mediterranean city of Alexandria descended into violence, with security forces firing tear gas to disperse Morsis supporters rallying in city squares.
Security forces broke up a march in Gizas Talebiya using teargas, which led the pro-Mursi demonstrators to clash with them.
Police tear-gassed pro-Mursi protesters in Mohandessins Ahmed Orabi Street after the latter hurled stones at security forces.
Police worked to disperse pro-Morsi protests in Alexandria, Beheira, Fayoum, Ismailia, Port Said, Minya, Matrouh and Menoufiya for disrupting traffic.
Police worked to disperse pro-Morsi protests in Alexandria, Beheira, Fayoum, Ismailia, Port Said, Minya, Matrouh and Menoufiya for disrupting traffic.
Police worked to disperse pro-Morsi protests in Alexandria, Beheira, Fayoum, Ismailia, Port Said, Minya, Matrouh and Menoufiya for disrupting traffic.
Police worked to disperse pro-Morsi protests in Alexandria, Beheira, Fayoum, Ismailia, Port Said, Minya, Matrouh and Menoufiya for disrupting traffic.
Police worked to disperse pro-Morsi protests in Alexandria, Beheira, Fayoum, Ismailia, Port Said, Minya, Matrouh and Menoufiya for disrupting traffic.
Police forces fired tear gas canisters to disperse Brotherhood protesters in Hilmiyat al-Zaytun Square in Cairo. An Officers Club was torched and sabotaged by a Muslim Brotherhood supporters march.
Clashes broke out in Gesr al-Suez and Alf Maskan areas between Mursi supporters and the police as the latter dispersed a march for Mursis allies using teargas.
Police forces dispersed a march in Helmeya Square in the Cairo neighbourhood of Heliopolis, and accused protesters of blocking traffic and clashing with the areas residents.
In Maadi, security forces fired teargas bombs at a pro-Brotherhood march to break it up.

Supporters of ousted president Muhammad Morsi staged a limited protest in Suez following Friday [6 December] prayers against a court ruling sentencing 14 female students in Alexandria to 11 years in jail.
19 rioters were arrested for hurling Molotov cocktails at security forces in Matruh.
Supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood staged limited rallies from a number of mosques in Cairo and Giza following Friday [6 December] prayers.
Supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood staged limited rallies from a number of mosques in Cairo and Giza following Friday [6 December] prayers.

In Cairos Ayn Shams district, clashes intensified between supporters of ousted president Morsi and security forces. Morsis supporters hurled stones at the security forces, who responded by firing water cannon and tear gas to disperse them.
A group that goes by the name ""7 am"" marched in Alexandria early on Saturday to support 21 members of their movement as they appealed their verdict.
Ten people were injured in confrontations between supporters and opponents of ousted President Mohamed Mursi in Damietta.
The Faculty of Engineering at Cairo University (FECU) Student Movement announced Saturday that they would extend their sit-in ""until their demands are met"".

Zagazig University students organised a protest, which was later attacked by ""thugs"" in front of the security directorate. The protest called for the release of the aforementioned students who were detained under accusations of ""thuggery"" and destroying public and private property.

The security forces halted a car bomb that exploded before reaching a security camp in Shiekh Zuwied. The driver refused to stop, accordingly, the security forces opened fired toward the van, causing it to explode.
Tens of Egyptian policemen organized a demonstration by the interior ministry in Central Cairo on Sunday to demand promotions.
Egyptian police fired tear gas Sunday in an attempt to disperse supporters of the countries ousted Islamist president protesting at the dormitories of an Islamic university in Cairo.
At least one police vehicle was torched amid clashes between students from the Students Against the Coup movement and security forces in Mansoura University.
Hundreds of Al-Azhar female students, who belong to the Muslim Brotherhood [MB] group, staged a protest on Sunday [8 December] inside the university campus in Cairos Nasr City district.

Police fired tear gas Monday in clashes with Islamist students of Cairos Al-Azhar University who hurled stones and torched vehicles during a demonstration backing ousted president Mohamed Morsi. Four civilian and two police cars were set ablaze by protesters, who also threw rocks at police.
Female protesters on a separate campus of Al-Azhar later took to the streets to protest against violence that occurred a day earlier.
Egyptian troops killed on Monday a leader of an Al-Qaeda inspired militant group that operates in the Sinai peninsula and that has claimed attacks against security forces, the army said.

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: Egyptian security forces yesterday, Monday, arrested 10 members of the Strong Egypt Party, Al-Dostour Party and 6 April Youth Movement in a cafe, Nasser City, against the backdrop of discussing the clashes at Al-Azhar University. The police attacked them and arrested them in light of their political debate.
Small clashes also broke out Tuesday at two universities in the southern city of Assuit, where police fired tear gas at rock-throwing students. 18 students were arrested.
Clashes took place near Cairo University between pro-Brotherhood students and the security forces. No causalities were reported.
Security forces in Sinai have foiled an attempt to blast a security point in Al-Mazarya, south of Al-Arish with a hand grenade.
Female members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) staged Tuesday evening [10 December] a protest outside Muntazah district building, east of Alexandria, against ousting president Muhammad Morsi.

Clashes erupted on Tuesday between students supporting the Muslim Brotherhood and the security located on Azhar University campus. A number of students pelted the security forces with stones and empty bottles. The forces responded by firing teargas to disperse them.
Members of the Second Field Army on Tuesday [10 December] managed to killed a ""Takfiri"" element in North Sinai.
The surrounding area of Mansurah University witnessed protests, road blocking, traffic disruption and attacks on police forces through hurling stones and Molotov cocktails.

In Al-Azhar University, Central Security Forces (CSF) stormed the student dorms after dispersing a protest of female students belonging to Students Against the Coup (SAC) movement, who were blocking roads.
In Cairo University a march organised by SAC moved out of the university campus and clashed with security forces in Nahda Square.
In Minya University seven students were arrested after a protest organised by SAC was attempted to exit the university campus.
A car bomb exploded near an Egyptian police building on Thursday in the Suez Canal city of Ismailiya, killing one policeman and wounding 35 other people.
Egyptian riot police fired tear gas and water cannon to disperse hundreds of pro-Islamist protesters demonstrating near the headquarters of the ministry of defence in Cairo on Thursday [12 December].
In Gharbiya, anti-Brotherhood residents dispersed a demonstration for Brotherhood supporters in al-Mahalla al-Kobra city.
Protesters blocked the main roads leading to the campus of Al-Azhar University.

One protester was shot dead while two police officers were wounded by shotgun pellets in clashes in Fayoum. Security forces used live ammunition and shotgun pellets against the protesters in downtown Fayoum.

Tear gas grenades were used against Islamists in several Cairo districts after protesters took to the streets for weekly pro-Morsi demonstrations. Protesters lobbed petrol bombs at police in the capital.
Clashes occurred in Qena in southern Egypt, between supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood and police forces. A police car was set alight.
In Cairos southern neighborhood of Maadi, demonstrators hurled Molotov cocktails at security forces who fired tear gas to disperse them.
Alexandrians supporting army chief Abdel Fattah al-Sisi and the army staged a demonstration at al-Qaed Ibrahim Mosque to voice their support for the constitution.
Muslim Brotherhood supporters marched in four different areas in Alexandria in response to the National Coalition for Supporting Legitimacys call for demonstrations
One person was killed and two others were injured in Suez when clashes broke out between supporters of ousted President Mohamed Mursi and police forces on Friday afternoon.
Limited clashes broke out between residents of Ezab al-Bahr area and Brotherhood supporters after the latter had chanted anti-army slogans.
In Adwa village in Sharqiya province, the protesters continued demonstrations. Three policemen were injured and other three civilians were wounded by birdshots.
Supporters of the banned Muslim Brotherhood staged limited rallies starting from a number of mosques in Cairo and Giza following Friday [13 December] prayers.
Supporters of the banned Muslim Brotherhood staged limited rallies starting from a number of mosques in Cairo and Giza following Friday [13 December] prayers.
Dozens of workers at Egypts Iron and Steel holding company staged a protest on Sunday outside the cabinet headquarters in Cairo.
Members of the Second Field Army on Saturday [14 December] killed a ""Takfiri"" element in North Sinai.
Second Field Army elements have killed a very dangerous ""militant"" who participated in several ""militant"" attacks that targeted army and police forces stationed in North Sinai.
Scores of residents in Mahalla city in Delta Governorate of Gharbiyah [northern Upper Egypt] staged a rally in support of army, police, chanting: ""Yes for constitution"".
Muslim Brotherhood (MB) members staged Sunday [15 December] a motorbike march in Damietta. They shouted slogans against the Armed Forces and police.
Supporters of the army and police staged a motorbike rally, calling people to vote the draft constitution in the upcoming referendum.

A number of students and political powers staged a protest in Talat Harb Square [in downtown Cairo] on Sunday [15 December] to demand the release of their colleagues who were detained in recent violent acts. Street vendors clashed with the protesters and forced them to leave the square and moved to central Cairo streets.
Arrests: 40 suspects were arrested and 22 huts, four motorcycles and three unlicensed cars belonging to ""militant"" elements were destroyed during a wide-scale security campaign in the North Sinai.
Pro-Muslim Brotherhood students continued their protests on Sunday [15 December] at some faculties of Al-Azhar University in a bid to disrupt classes and postpone the mid-year exams.

Tens of students who support the Muslim Brotherhood organized a march on Monday from Ain Shams University to the headquarters of the defense ministry. Egyptian police fired teargas to disperse protests. Dozens of students pelted the forces with rocks, some picking up tear gas canisters and lobbing them back.
Egyptian troops eliminated a member of radical Islamist movement Ansar Beit al-Maqdis in North Sinai. 20 other ""jihadists"" were also arrested in the operation.
Army troops in North Sinai, killed a lead militant suspected of being behind the killing of 16 soldiers in an attack in summer 2012.

Egyptian authorities arrested nine people near the cabinet headquarters on Monday evening for throwing rocks and Molotov cocktails on security forces. Two conscripts were injured in the clashes while security forces used teargas to disperse the protesters.
A taxi driver, died on Monday night after being attacked by supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood as he drove past a demonstration they were staging.

Student protests continued on Monday as hundreds of students from Ain Shams University clashed with police outside the Ministry of Defence in Heliopolis. A police conscript was injured after being hit in the face with birdshot.
Muslim Brotherhoods students set room of administrative security at Cairo University ablaze and attack journalists.
A handmade bomb went off in Cairos Nasr City district, but no injuries were reported.
Students and Morsi supporters in Assiut university clashed with security forces, prompting them to fire tear gas.
Students and Morsi supporters in the Nile Delta city of Tanta clashed with security forces, prompting them to fire tear gas.
A Central Security Forces captain and a militant were killed in a firefight in Ard Al-Gameyat district in Ismailia.
Clashes erupted between protesting students and security forces in Upper Egypts Minya University on Tuesday, leaving one guard wounded.
Scores of students, who belong to the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group, staged Tuesday [17 December] a protest outside the Al-Azhar Universitys main administration building.

Pro-Muslim Brotherhood students organized a protest at Cairo University amid high security presence and clashes erupted between administrative security guards and the students, injuring some of the guards.
Dozens of Muslim Brotherhood (MB) students staged a protest at Ain Shams University and blocked the street of Al-Khalyfa al-Mamun in both directions.
Students of the Muslim Brotherhood blocked a road outside the Alexandria University, calling for the release of political detainees.
Police in Egypt said an Islamist militant blew himself up in his hideout to escape arrest on Thursday, wounding an officer in the process.
An Egyptian conscript was killed in an exchange of fire between unknown gunmen and security forces in Port Said.

Egyptian authorities stormed the headquarters of the Egyptian Centre for Economic and Social Rights in Central Cairo, arresting five people, including members of the April 6 Movement. April 6 said that their member was beaten by security forces and is being held at an unknown location.
The Armed Forces killed two ""Takfiri"" elements in Arish, the local capital of North Sinai after they threw two hand grenades at troops.
Supporters of ousted president Muhammad Morsi marched in the coastal city of Suez on Thursday [19 December].
Weapons Seizure: Security forces seized 1,212 pieces of arms, 90 criminal hotbeds and 59 gangs during security crackdowns across Egypt in the past ten days.
Dozens of Muslim Brotherhood supporters hurled stones at police forces and attempted to cut off Mostafa al-Nahhas Street in Cairos Nasr City
Two Egyptian soldiers were shot dead Friday trying to arrest a leader of an Al-Qaeda inspired group spearheading an insurgency in the Sinai. Three ""militants"" were killed in the gunfight.
Clashes erupted in Gesr Suez, Cairo, where security forces arrested 25 protesters it accused of attacking forces with Molotov cocktails, firearms and birdshot.
In the Mediterranean city of Alexandria, Morsi supporters marched after Friday prayers and chanted against the military under the slogan ""Our 2012 Constitution"".
Supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood torched a police vehicle in Cairos Mohandessin after clashing with security forces. The police fired teargas bombs to disperse the protesters.
Clashes took place in Sharqiyah between supporters of Mohamed Mursi and the police forces.
A man was shot in the head during ongoing clashes between army and police forces on the one hand and supporters of ousted President Mohamed Mursi in Suez. He later died in hospital.
The police arrested a total of 42 ""inciters and rioters"" following Muslim Brotherhood protests in the governorate of Fayoum.
The police arrested a total of 42 ""inciters and rioters"" following Muslim Brotherhood protests in the governorate of Damietta.
The police arrested a total of 42 ""inciters and rioters"" following Muslim Brotherhood protests in the governorate of Ismailia.
The police arrested a total of 42 ""inciters and rioters"" following Muslim Brotherhood protests in the governorate of Marsa Matruh.
The police arrested a total of 42 ""inciters and rioters"" following Muslim Brotherhood protests in the governorate of Port Said.
Cairos Ittihadeya presidential palace witnessed clashes between Muslim Brotherhood supporters and police forces.
Security forces dispersed a march staged by supporters of deposed president Muhammad Morsi from Khatam al-Mursalyn Mosque in Giza Friday.
Security Measures: The Egyptian army started Saturday an operation to rid the mines planted by hardline militants of two villages near Rafah city.
Scores of students who support deposed president Muhammad Morsi staged a protest in front of a school in Kafr al-Shaykh city [north of Cairo].
Arrests: Egyptian police arrested two advisors to ousted president Mohamed Morsi in Heliopolis, eastern Cairo.
Four ""militants"" and ""Takfiris"" were killed in raids conducted by military troops in North Sinai, said a spokesman for the army on Sunday [22 December].
A number of protesters and students who support the army staged an opposing demonstration in the area of Ain Shams University.
In Kafr al-Sheikh, clashes erupted between riot police and area residents on one side and a march for Brotherhood students on the other side.

Strikes: More than 450 Muslim Brotherhood members imprisoned in Egypt launched a hunger strike Monday over their ""inhuman treatment"" after being jailed following the military's overthrow of president Mohamed Morsi.
Pro-revolution groups, including the April 6 movement, have called for a demonstration on Monday to denounce the sentencing of activists to three years in prison.

Five people were injured in Assiut during clashes involving Brotherhood students at Assiut university. Eight people were arrested in Assiuts clashes and one was severely injured. During the clashes, the protesters destroyed a police car and turned it upside down.
Clashes broke out between dozens of Muslim Brotherhood supporters and central security forces in Tanta.
Egyptian authorities arrested 25 Muslim Brotherhood supporters in confrontations with Black Bloc members in Behira. The protesters attacked the Damanhour police station and destroyed a few vehicles.
Police forces and a number of civilians teamed up to disperse a protest organized by students sympathetic to the Muslim Brotherhood at Ain Shams University.
Protests erupted on Al-Azhar University campus on Monday over news that university president Osama Ali has referred around 350 students to disciplinary boards.

Thousands of mourners gathered to mourn the people who were killed in an explosion in Mansoura. The Egyptian television aired footage of the mourners chanting against the Muslim Brotherhood and in support of defense minister Abdel Fattah al-Sisi.
A third bomb planted in Mansoura was defused by security forces.

A group of citizens mourning the Mansoura bombing victims stormed a residential building owned by the Muslim Brotherhoods Mufti and clashes occurred between locals and members of the Muslim Brotherhood.
Skirmishes erupted Tuesday [24 December] at Al-Azhar University between security guards and Muslim Brotherhood students, who attempted to halt study and exams at a number of faculties.

On December 24, in Mansoura, an Ansar Beit al-Maqdis suicide bomber detonated himself inside the Interior Ministryâ€™s security directorate. 16 people were killed and 132 others wounded by the explosion.
Non-violent activity: Egyptian Interim Prime Minister declared the Muslim Brotherhood as a militant group.
Three teachers were injured on the Arish-Rafah Road on their way to Al-Arish, after unknown assailants opened fire on a military tank escorting the vehicle.
Ten people were injured in confrontations that erupted between student protesters and security forces at Zaqazeeq University.
Four people were injured when a bomb detonated at a public transport bus on Mostafa al-Nahhas Street in Cairos Nasr City.
Egypts Interior Ministry has said that one person was killed on Thursday when students at al-Azhar University dormitories clashed with residents of the area opposite the university campus in Cairo.
Demolition: Fourteen houses have been demolished and eight motorcycles belonging to ""militant"" elements burned during a wide-scale security campaign in Sheik Zuwayid and Rafah.
Four people were injured on Friday when clashes broke out between Muslim Brotherhood supporters and security forces in Cairos Alf Maskan district.

Police forces tear-gassed hundreds of pro-Muslim Brotherhood Azhar students on Friday after they had rallied at Cairos Mostafa al-Nahhas Street and sealed it to traffic. The protesting students set car tires alight inside the university campus and hurled stones at the police.
Police clashed with protesters in the Suez Canal city of Ismailiya.
A security official in southern city of Aswan said that a pro-Morsi supporter was killed in clashes with police.
In the southern province of Assiut a small rally was quickly dispersed after pro-government civilians mounting pickup trucks fired their machine guns, into the air driving protesters away.
In the southern province of Qena a small rally was quickly dispersed after pro-government civilians mounting pickup trucks fired their machine guns, into the air driving protesters away.
A group of Muslim Brotherhood supporters torched two police vehicles on Omraneyas ring road in Giza on Friday.
Security forces put out a fire in a police vehicle in Der Mouas area after pro-Brotherhood protesters set it on fire.
Police troops dispersed a number of protests organized by the Muslim Brotherhood group Friday [27 December] in Nasr City.
In Damietta, hundreds of pro-army demonstrators rallied while carrying pictures of army chief Lieutenant General Abdel Fattah al-Sisi and chanting pro-constitution slogans.
Police troops dispersed a number of protests organized by the Muslim Brotherhood group Friday [27 December] in Hilwan.
Police troops dispersed a number of protests organized by the Muslim Brotherhood group Friday [27 December] in Al-Maadi.
Police arrested 20 supporters of former President Mohamed Mursi in Minyas Abu Qirqas area, which also witnessed clashes during which gunfire was heard.
Islamists protested in Fayoum.
According to the Health Ministry, 2 people died in clashes in Cairo on Friday.
The Muslim Brotherhood (MB) staged on Friday [27 December] a rally in Alexandria, challenging a government decision blacklisting the group as a ""militant"" organization.
In Giza security troops were deployed on Al-Haram Street to disperse rallies by the Muslim Brotherhood group. Clashes erupted between police and protesters leading to congestion on Haram Street.
In Suez [northeast of Cairo], security forces dispersed an MB protest following the weekly prayers. The protesters threw stones at security forces.
One person was killed and another was injured when clashes flared between pro-Muslim Brotherhood demonstrators and police forces in Samallout town in Minya.
One person was killed and 16 were injured in New Damietta on Friday when clashes erupted between Muslim Brotherhood supporters on one side and police forces and residents on the other.
While covering a Muslim Brotherhood march in Maadi, a journalist was hit with birdshot in the head and chest.
An improvised explosive device (IED) was found and deactivated inside a bus in Al-Hegaz Square in Heliopolis.

A student was killed and more than 100 arrested as police clashed with students who set fire to Al Azhar, Cairo university building on Saturday, in an intensifying crackdown on the Muslim Brotherhood.
Police forces fired tear gas at students in Zagazig university north of Cairo.
in Ain Shams University, SAC organised a protest in solidarity with the students in Al-Azhar.
A demonstration staged by [Muslim] Brotherhood students was dispersed in Cairo University.
A bomb (suspected of being a car bomb) exploded outside a military intelligence building northeast of Egypts capital on Sunday, wounding four people.
Clashes erupted on Sunday morning between security forces and students near the main entrance to Azhar Universitys dormitory.
North Sinai security forces found an explosive charge near a school in Al-Arish on Sunday [29 December]. It was defused by bomb experts.
Defusal: Security forces defused a bomb planted near Al-Azhar Universitys Faculty of Medicine in New Damietta on Sunday [29 December].
Security forces have arrested 15 pro-Muslim Brotherhood female students after they had attempted to disrupt exams and assault their colleagues at the girls faculty of engineering in Azhar University.

Clashes erupted in Damietta, north of Cairo, between supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood and some residents of the city, leaving one person killed. Security forces fired teargas to disperse the crowds and arrested seven supporters of the Brotherhood.
Security forces in North Sinai on Tuesday [31 December] defused an explosive charge on Shaykh Zuwayd/Al-Arish highway. No casualties.
Locals in a Damietta town attacked and set ablaze five shops owned by members of the Muslim Brotherhood group.
A man died in clashes between local residents and supporters of the Brotherhood on Tuesday [31 December] in Damietta.
Protesting Egyptian Islamists clashed with police Tuesday outside a church in Cairo.
Property destruction: Suspected militants in Egypts Sinai on Tuesday blew up a gas pipeline that feeds an industrial area in the peninsula.

In Shubra al-Khaymah police station in north Cairo three hand grenades from 16 which were in the possession of a suspect exploded in the station. Three policemen were injured in the blast and the station sustained several structural damage.
A citizen was detained, beaten and subject to tortue in Al Azouly prison in Ismailia for information about protests and demonstrations.
Two people died on Wednesday in clashes between Egyptian police and student supporters of ousted president Mohamed Morsi protesting against the new military-installed authorities

A woman in a town 250 km from Cairo told Amnesty International that her husband was arrested when the security forces dressed in civilian clothing and police uniforms raided their home in the middle of the night in January 2014. Before he was taken to Al Aqrab prison, they gave him electric shocks in front of her.
Police fired tear gas at a pro-Morsi student protest in the Nile Delta city of Zagazig.
Two people were killed in clashes involving pro-Islamist protesters and police in the northern Egyptian city of Alexandria
A police and army patrol killed a ""militant"" element as he attempted to plant an explosive device in in front of Sheikh Zoueid Hospital in North Sinais Kawthar.
Defusal: A bomb disposal squad defused Thursday [2 January] a local-made explosive device found under a level-crossing in Cairos Marj district [north eastern Cairo].
Members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group set to fire a police car in Aswan, leaving three conscripts injured.
Demolition: The army destroyed five tunnels that connect Egypts Rafah city with the Palestinian Gaza Strip.
Defusal: Seven medium-sized improvised explosive devices (IEDs) were found and deactivated near Tanta Police Station.
A total of 5 people were killed in Cairo in clashes between MB protesters and security forces.
Egyptian police found a murdered Swiss couple buried in the garden of their house in the Red Sea resort town of Hurgada

Three explosions targeted a military and police convoy in the volatile northern Sinai Peninsula, wounding four soldiers. The explosions, one of which was from a roadside bomb, hit near the town of Sheikh Zuweid.
Scores of supporters of army chief Abdel Fattah al-Sisi staged a demonstration to voice support for the constitution and to urge Sisi to run for president.
Supporters of former Islamist President Mohamed Mursi clashed with police forces. In Minya, one person was killed during a protest for Mursi supporters in Abu Helal area.
Muslim Brotherhood supporters clashed with security forces in Maryouteya area in Cairos Haram. Two conscripts were injured.
Violent clashes also erupted in Minyas Delga village between some Muslim Brotherhood supporters and security forces.
Supporters of former Islamist President Mohamed Mursi clashed with police forces. Two were killed and four injured in Fayoums Masalla.
Medical sources reported that two were shot dead, including one woman, in Alexandria when clashes broke out between Mursis supporters and police security.
Police forces tear-gassed a march for supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood in Alexandrias Bitash areas on Friday.
Police forces tear-gassed a march for supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood in Alexandrias Miami area on Friday
Police forces fired teargas bombs at a pro-Muslim Brotherhood march on the Nile Corniche in Cairos Maadi after they had attempted to cut the road in front of the Supreme Constitutional Court
One killed in Beni Suef in clashes between supporters of MB and police forces.
Protesters at Faysal district in Giza hurled Molotov cocktails at an armored police vehicle and set it on fire. They also blocked the roads and fired at police officers.
Supporters of former Islamist President Mohamed Mursi clashed with police forces. Between one and two people were killed in Ismailia clashes.
Troops fired tear gas against the students who were attempting to storm Al-Azhar universities administration building in Nasr City district of Cairo.
In Kafr al-Shaykh governorate [north Cairo], scores of people who belong to the Muslim Brotherhood group staged a march calling on citizens to boycott a referendum on the draft constitution.
Members of the Muslim Brotherhood group and the so-called the National Alliance to Support Legitimacy organized a march from Balbas Mosque in Qina following Friday [3 January] prayers.
Military and police supporters staged several rallies after the Friday prayers in the Nile Delta province of Al-Gharbiyah.
Clashes broke out between pro-Brotherhood demonstrators and the police in Cairos Gesr al-Suez Street near Alf Maskan area
Three ""militant"" extremists were arrested on Saturday after one soldier was killed while driving a military vehicle in North Sinais Arish.

Scores of the revolutionary ""Thowar"" movement took part on Saturday in a march in downtown Cairos Ramsis Street to demand the release of all those who were arrested in the Shura Council protests last November.

The founder of Tamarod, claimed that members of the Muslim Brotherhood tried to raid his residence in the Shebeen al-Qanater neighborhood in Qalyubia. He said his neighbors clashed with the Brotherhood members, leading to injuries.
Defusal: A bomb squad defused an explosive device that was planted close to the State Litigation Authority in Salam area in Arish.
""Non-commissioned military officer killed in explosive device blast in Al-Shaykh Zuwayyid [in North Sinai].""

Security forces opened fire on three other persons after they refused to stop at a security checkpoint. The three suspects were also driving a motorcycle in the same area at the time of another explosion in the area.
Scores of Muslim Brotherhood supporters demonstrated in Sidi Bishr and Hadra areas in eastern Alexandria on Saturday [4 January].
Clashes erupted between security forces and supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood in the Delta city of Al-Mahallah.
Scores of Muslim Brotherhood supporters demonstrated in Sidi Bishr and Hadra areas in eastern Alexandria on Saturday [4 January]. The protesters assaulted a police conscript.
A group of students, who support the Muslim Brotherhood, clashed with security forces on Saturday at Al-Azhar University where the protesters hurled fireworks and rocks at the forces
Minor clashes occurred between protesting students from the Muslim Brotherhood and security forces at Al Azhar University on Sunday. Police forces dispersed the protesters.
Scores of students at Al-Minya University, who belong to the Brotherhood group, demonstrated on Sunday [5 January] to condemn the killing of their colleague.
A supermarket owner was killed late on Monday in clashes between Muslim Brotherhood supporters and neighbors by the Salam Hospital in Damietta
Demoltion: Army forces destroyed an explosives cache that contained 500 kg of Nitroglycerin in Al-Shaykh Zuwayid City on Monday [6 January] and 24 extremist elements were arrested in the Peninsula.
Pro-Brotherhood protesters blocked the Khalifa al-Maamon Road near Ain Shams, causing a traffic conjunction.
Confrontations between pro-Muslim Brotherhood and pro-army students erupted on Monday where both sides chanted slogans against each other.
In Cairo, assailants threw a bomb and opened fire on a small traffic police station without causing casualties.
Clashes flared up between security forces and Muslim Brotherhood supporters in Mohandessins Gameat al-Dowal Street. The police tear-gassed the demonstrators to disperse them.
An Egyptian labour ministry official and three trade union activists were kidnapped in the Sinai Tuesday.
An explosive device blew up in Al Wadi Al-Akhdar area, east of Arish while security forces were passing.
An explosive device blew up near Al-Wifaq village in Rafah.
Defusal: Security forces defused two explosive devices placed on Al-Arish-Shaykh Zuwayd road.
Clashes erupted between security forces and supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood in Cairos Nasr City.
The Egyptian Trade Union Federation (ETUF) announced Wednesday that a strike will be held within their headquarters until kidnappedlabour union leaders and Ministry of Labour leaders are released.

Police troops, deployed Wednesday [8 January] in the vicinity of the court where deposed president Muhammad Morsi is being tried, arrested 17 members of the blacklisted Muslim Brotherhood organization on riot charges.
Defusal: A bomb disposal squad defused Wednesday [8 January] a remote-controlled bomb connected to car outside the Judges Club on the Nile in Giza.
Some supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group attacked the venue of a conference held by [Salafi] Al-Nur party in Daqahliyah.
The police dispersed MB marches in the governorate of North Sinai and arrested 30 more protesters.
In the southern city of Minya, protesters threw gasoline bombs at the police, who responded with tear gas.

Elements from the second field army in Egypts Ismailia arrested four ""militants"" with arms and an explosive belt on them. There was fire exchange with the militants, who were driving a private vehicle.
In Alexandria, one person was shot dead in the back when clashes erupted between Brotherhood supporters and the police.
Police forces dispersed marches for Brotherhood supporters in Gizas Haram area.
Police forces dispersed marches for Brotherhood supporters in Gizas Omraneya area.
Police forces fired teargas bombs at the MB protesters to disperse them as they marched in the Borg al-Arab area.
Police forces fired teargas bombs at the protesters to disperse them as they marched in Miami.

Police forces dispersed marches for the MB groups allies in al-Teraa al-Boulakeya area after demonstrators had halted traffic.
Morsis opponents held protests in Gharbiya in support of the military and the police in their "" fight against terrorism.""
Police forces dispersed marches for the MB groups allies in Shoubra after demonstrators had halted traffic.
Rioters were held in Rawd al-Faraj, Ayn Shams and al-Matariyah districts in Cairo after protesters blocked roads, assaulted residents and private facilities and opened fire at police and citizens.
Police forces dispersed marches for Brotherhood supporters in Cairos Mostafa al-Nahhas Street.
The police dispersed MB marches in the governorate of Sharqiya
Morsis opponents held protests in Qalyubiya in support of the military and the police in their "" fight against terrorism.""
In the eastern Cairo district of Nasr City, protesters hurled stones and empty bottles at security forces.
The banned MB groups members blocked Talatini street in Giza and set fire to car tires.
Clashes were reported between Muslim Brotherhood loyalists and security forces in the Giza district of Talbiya.
In Al-Ismailiyah governorate [northeast Cairo], security forces arrested 12 members of the Muslim Brotherhood group for storming public and private facilities.
Clashes erupted between supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood group and security forces in Al-Muhandisin district of Giza.
Rioters were held in Rawd al-Faraj, Ayn Shams and al-Matariyah districts in Cairo after protesters blocked roads, assaulted residents and private facilities and opened fire at police and citizens.
Rioters were held in Rawd al-Faraj, Ayn Shams and al-Matariyah districts in Cairo after protesters blocked roads, assaulted residents and private facilities and opened fire at police and citizens.
Supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood torched a police vehicle on Friday in al-Zaytoun. Security forces then intervened and tear-gassed the protesters to disband them.
Police fired tear gas at university students in Cairo on Sunday as they demonstrated in support of ousted president Mohamed Morsi, two days ahead of a referendum on a new constitution.

Police fired tear gas at university students in Cairo on Sunday as they demonstrated in support of ousted president Mohamed Morsi, two days ahead of a referendum on a new constitution. In Ain Shams University, a student died after being shot in the abdomen with live ammunition.
Police fired tear gas at university students in Cairo on Sunday as they demonstrated in support of ousted president Mohamed Morsi, two days ahead of a referendum on a new constitution.
Clashes erupted outside Giza Security Directorate in Dokki on Sunday between Students Against the Coup (SAC) demonstrators and Central Security Forces (CSF).
The SAC protested outside a police station in Nasr City.
Students protested outside a police station in New Cairo, demanding the release of a number of female protesters. A student was shot with live ammunition in front of New Cairos police station.

A member of al-Dostour party was according to his wife ""forcibly disappeared"" on Jan. 13, 2014. While the NHCR initially stated that he had been detained in Zagazig prison, his wife later stated that prison administrators told her he was actually in Wadi al-Natroun prison.
On Monday, Students Against the Coup (SAC) protested in several universities as part of what they have coined the ""Week of Student Rage"".
Three members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) were arrested following fierce clashes that erupted between security forces and the MB members in the Delta city of Mahalla on Monday 13/1/2014.
Two militants were killed on Monday in Sinai before planting an explosive device in Sheikh Zuwieds International road.
Demolition: The Army raided ""militant"" hotbeds in Arish/Rafah in concurrence with the referendum and destroyed hideouts.
Violent confrontations erupted in four governorates when supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood staged protests against the poll. Four people died in Giza.
Violent confrontations erupted in four governorates when supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood staged protests against the poll. Four died in Suhag
Violent confrontations erupted in four governorates when supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood staged protests against the poll. One died in Beni Suef.
Injuries were sustained in protests surrounding the referendum in Assiut. One person died of natural causes.
Injuries were sustained in protests surrounding the referendum in Kafr Al-Shiekh
Injuries were sustained in protests surrounding the referendum in Menufiya. One person died of natural causes.
Egyptian Muslim brotherhood supporters threw stones at voters outside a polling station during the vote on a new constitution on January 14, 2014 in al-Ayaat village at Giza.
Four journalists were assaulted by citizens or security forces in Egypt whilst reporting on the referendum.

column16: Menastream; Egyptian Organization for Human Rights
column17: Police and army forces arrested rioters belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood group, who opened fire in Mit Ghamr, Daqahliyah.
The Army raided ""militant"" hotbeds in Shaykh Zuwayid in North Sinai in concurrence with the referendum. One ""Jihadist"" was killed and other 9 dangerous elements were arrested.
An explosion took place at the North Giza Court early Tuesday 14/1/2014. The court is located in Imbaba, a district of Greater Cairo.
Supporters of ousted President Muhammad Morsi went on a protest on Tuesday [14 January] trying to disrupt voting in Al-Haram area.
Police dispersed supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood [MB] who staged a rally eastern in Alexandria
In Gharbia Governorate, a person threw a homemade bomb from a roof of a nearby apartment building at ""Horeya"" polling station in Abu Shaheen area, Mahalla Al Kubra. No injuries reported.

Muslim Brotherhood supporters cut off the road in front of the Educational Department at Faisal Area and set fire to tires, causing traffic to stop, and the police forces chased after them in collaboration with citizens and fired tear gas to disperse them.

In front of Omar ibn al-Khattab, that security forces arrested a number of supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood movement, specifically students marching against the coup possessing banners for a boycott of the Constitution and the panic of the citizens and provoking riots.
Muslim Brotherhood supporters threw some fireworks at the Police Headquarters of Atfeeh City.
In Ausim, the firing of anonymous shots was witnessed during a MB march that clashed with police. This resulted in one dead and two people wounded.

In Beheira Governorate, clashes erupted in Al-Saa area and Mohafaza Square in Damanhour between supporters of the Brotherhood Group and residents of those areas in order to disrupt the voting process and disperse voters. Security forces chased and dispersed them in the side streets.

Muslim Brotherhood supporters held a demonstration in front of Osman Mosque at Waraq Area and clashed with the security forces, throwing stones and fireworks; the security forces responded using tear gas.
In the province of Minya , the coalition observers witnessed a 30 minute halt to work due to supporters of the Brotherhood firing shells and Molotov before the voting committee.
Muslim Brotherhood supporters fired cartouche shots in front of the polling station at Om Al-Rida Primary School, Kafr Saad District. Security forces arrested one of them.
Defusal: Security forces have found an improvised explosive device near to Al-Saad Al-Aly School at Damanhour, but they were able to defuse it.
An explosion occurred in El-Sharkya Province alongside attempts of intimidating voters.
A number of Muslim Brotherhood supporters threw an improvised explosive device on an abandoned petrol station in Atfeeh City, causing no injuries.
A veiled lady tried to attack voters and the security forces in front of Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq School, New Damietta City.
In Alexandria Governorate, supporters of Muslim Brotherhood Group threw bricks and deliberately attacked voters using cool steel near to Salah al-Din Schools Complex at Mena Al-Basal.
In January 2014, a government employee also reportedly died as a result of violations by security members of the Matariya police station.
In Dalga, armored vehicles and police cars were deployed outside polling stations as Muslim youths burned tires behind police lines, pelting troops and approaching voters with rocks and marbles.
A member of the Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis group, was killed on Wednesday [15 January] during a security operation in North Sinai.

Homeland Security officers were accused of torturing dozens of detainees inside the headquarters in order to force them ""to confess they committed crimes they did not commit or to inform them of the people who lead protests in Alexandria.""
Unidentified armed men attacked a police officers family on Wednesday in Sinai, killing his wife and putting him in a critical condition.
A clash broke out in 10 Ramadan City when several Egyptians chased down six Sudanese men and attacked them with knives and pipes. Three of the Sudanese were taken to the hospital.

In south Cairo, scores of supporters of deposed president Mohamed Morsi who oppose the constitutional refendum blocked the Cairo Metro on Wednesday afternoon as they marched along the track of the southern Ain Helwan station

Defusal: In the North Sinai governorate, Security forces found a car bomb near a military boys high school located in Al-Arish on July 23 street. The bomb squad dismantled the bomb and two people were arrested.

In El-Sharkia province, Brotherhood supporters marched in the village of Adwa Hehia Center and cut off the road to the referendum committees to intimidate voters and prevent them from participating in the referendum. The security forces pursued them and arrested five of them.

In the province of Alexandria, supporters of the Brotherhood in the Gilliam area east of Alexandria demonstrated in an attempt to intimidate voters, asking the voters to boycott the referendum, chanting slogans against the army and police, and deliberately clashing with security forces.

Defusal: In the province of Aswan, security forces found a car bomb near the committee No.1 in El-Zakhrafya School in Aswan, the voting process was stopped for two hours until the bomb squad removed the bomb.

Supporters of Muslim Brotherhood Group gathered in Sidi Beshr calling for citizens to boycott the constitution and chanting slogans against the Army and Police. Security forces chased them arresting six persons.
In Giza Governorate, clashes erupted close to the polling stations of Al-Qahira Preparatory School at Auseem District between supporters of Muslim Brotherhood Group and voters.

In the province of Damietta, the coalition observers witnessed some people from the supporters of the Brotherhood trying to intimidate voters in order to prevent them from voting. Security forces pursued and arrested them.

In the province of Fayoum, clashes in the village of Qasr El-Basel Etsa Center occurred between a number of supporters of the Brotherhood and the people of the village during the passage of the Brothers march in front of the Referendum Commission in the village, which resulted in the injury of four people.

In Alexandria Governorate, Supporters of Muslim Brotherhood Group staged demonstrations at Dekhela region, west of Alexandria, chanting slogans against the Army and Police and intimidating voters in order to boycott the referendum.

Supporters of Muslim Brotherhood Group gathered in Montazah calling for citizens to boycott the constitution and chanting slogans against the Army and Police. Security forces chased them arresting six persons.
In El-Gharbya province, clashes erupted in front of Omar Zaafan Mahalla al-Kubra, during which a Brotherhood supporter was strongly trying to direct voters to vote ""no"".
In the governorate of Cairo, Supporters of the Brotherhood gathering in El-Mirghani Street and used fireworks and fired shots. The security forces pursued and dispersed them.
Clashes erupted in Cairos Heliopolis on Wednesday, as supporters of ousted President Mohamed Mursi set a kiosk on fire that he saw one injured man.

Muslim Brotherhoods supporters demonstrated at Hilmiyat Al-Zitoon Square, chanting slogans against the army and the police, and trying to intimidate the electorate not to vote in the referendum; the security forces chased and dispersed them.
A student was shot dead and four were injured during clashes at Cairo University on Thursday. Another later died in hospital.
Clashes erupted between the police and supporters of ousted Islamist president Mohamed Morsi in Beni Sweif.
In Cairo, clashes broke out between groups of Brotherhood supporters and the police in Gesr al-Suez. Several people were injured with shotgun pellets.
Suspected militants in Egypts Sinai blew up a gas pipeline on Friday for the second time in less than a month. No injuries reported.
Clashes were reported in the Suez Canal city of Ismailiya, while police fired tear gas to disperse a demonstration.
Police arrested 39 protesters in Cairo, where clashes struck the neighborhood of Imbaba.
In Suez, protesters threw gasoline bombs, fired birdshot and hurled rocks while police responded with tear gas.
One person was killed on Friday when a group of Muslim Brotherhood supporters clashed with the police in Bahaari area in Fayoum.
In Haram, supporters of the Brotherhood torched car tires and hurled stones at the police.
In Mohandessin, supporters of the Brotherhood torched car tires and hurled stones at the police.
Police forces dispersed several Brotherhood marches in Aswan.
Police forces dispersed several Brotherhood marches in Damietta.
Police forces dispersed several Brotherhood marches in Minya.
Police forces dispersed several Brotherhood marches in Alexandria
Police forces dispersed several Brotherhood marches in Sharqiya.
Muslim Brotherhood marches took place in the districts of Al-Basatin and Ayn Shams.

Hundreds of Al-Azhar University students, who support the militant Muslim Brotherhood (MB), staged a rally at the hostel in Nasr City. Students tried to block the street and disrupt traffic, hurling stones at security troops, who fired tear gas in response.
Injuries were reported in Port Said after clashes between the MB and police forces.
Muslim Brotherhood marches took place in the districts of Al-Basatin and Ayn Shams.
Demolition: A military campaign found and destroyed two secret tunnels in Sinai leading to the adjacent Palestinian Gaza Strip. Three ""extremists"" were arrested in Sheikh Zuweid city.
Three ""extremists"" were killed on Saturday in clashes with army forces in the Sinai Peninsula, a security source said.
Security forces used teargas to disperse a march of tens of Muslim Brotherhood supporters at Zaqazeeq University on Saturday.

The Second Field Army troops seized a large number of barrels of explosive materials and devices during a security campaign in Ismailia. Two ""militants"" were arrested after exchanging fire with the troops.
A leading militant, was killed in the Sinai Peninsula on Sunday in a security operation carried out by the army.
The dean of Zagazig University was attacked by student rioters who beat him up. They threw inflammable spray at his face, causing him a heart attack.
An improvised explosive devise exploded 100 metres away from a South Giza Court leaving no injuries.
A ""jihadist"" group based in Egypts Sinai claimed responsibility Tuesday for firing rockets a day earlier at Israels Red Sea resort of Eilat, calling the Jewish state the Muslim worlds top enemy.
Demolition: The security forces destroyed 15 huts that were ""used to launch attacks against the police and the army and arrested 9 ""militants"".
Fierce clashes erupted on Monday [20 January] between security forces and members of ""anti-coup movement students"" in the vicinity of Mansurah University.
Three bottles containing radioactive materials exploded at a subway station earlier Tuesday [21 January]. No injuries reported.

Thousands of Egyptians urged the powerful army chief to run for president during a rally Tuesday that also called for the third anniversary of the countries revolt to be used as an occasion to thank the military for overthrowing the former Islamist president.
Defusal: Bomb disposal squads defused a bomb in Cairos district of Zamalek.
Demolition: Egypts armed forces destroyed nine tunnels in Northern Sinais city of Rafah and thwarted an attempt to smuggle arms and narcotics.

Hundreds of football enthusiasts from the Ultras Ahlawy goup staged a demonstration in downtowns Talaat Harb Street. Plain-clothed men assaulted and dragged protesters from the square before taking them into vans. One witness saw a teargas canister shot, yet said he did not see ""a single uniformed officer"" around the square.
One person was shot dead and five others were injured during clashes betweenn MB and police forces in Alexandria on Thursday.
A second march was organised by MB students in Alexandria.
Masked gunmen attacked a checkpoint south of Cairo, killing five Egyptian policemen and wounding two others.
At least 1 person was killed during clashes between supporters of Egypts ousted president Mohamed Morsi and the security forces in Ad Daqahliyah.
In Cairo, clashes erupted in different areas including Nasr City, where a protest took place in front of Al-Salam mosque in the Tenth Settlement.

A school student was killed on Friday during clashes with residents in New Damietta while police forces were dispersing a march supporting the Muslim Brotherhood and former President Mohamed Mursi. Unknown men set the car of a security forces officer alight.
At least one person was killed in clashes in Qina.
A group of masked men attacked a police roadblock guarding a religious institute in Zagazig, Sharqiyah, wounding one and stealing his service pistol before fleeing away.
The residents of Al Omraneya, Giza took to the streets, chanting slogans supporting Armed Forces and Defense Minister Abdel Fattah el-Sisi.
Twenty-five rioters were captured in Suez, including a preacher of a mosque.
Two journalists and a driver working for German public television were attacked by a crowd in Cairo Friday as they covered a car bomb that struck the police headquarters in the Egyptian capital

Fierce clashes broke out in Giza between Morsi supporters and Egyptian security forces. Hundreds of Islamists gathered in the Imbaba district, west of Cairo, with some burning tyres and hurling lit fireworks at security forces, who responded by firing tear gas. One person died.
Protests erupted following Friday prayers in Al-Wasti which soon after developed into confrontations.
In Beheira governorate in Egypts Nile Delta, two were killed in clashes between the Brotherhood and residents of Housh Eissa city.
In Upper Egypts Minya governorate, a shop owner died from gunshot wounds sustained as he was passing close to the clashes. One more was injured.
Pro-Morsi protesters clashed with security forces setting fire to a police kiosk, sending a pall of smoke in the air.
Four people were killed and 51 were injured when a suicide car bomber blew himself up at the police headquarters.
A bomb exploded in a billboard on Ahram Street near the Talebiya police station in Giza on Friday. No one was injured.
One conscript was killed and six others were injured in another explosion in Dokki.
Groups of demonstrators have begun flocking to Cairo Security Directorate to denounce the suicide bombing that took the lives of four and injured scores.
Hundreds of the Armed Forces supporters gathered at al-Qaed Ibrahim Mosque amid tight security in Alexandria.
Four people were killed and two were gravely injured in clashes that broke out between security forces and Muslim Brotherhood elements in Bani Soueif on Friday.
A bomb exploded near Radobis Cinema in Gizas Haram district on Friday. One person was killed.
