Clashes erupted between security forces and Muslim Brotherhood supporters in the Giza district of Haram
At least one person was killed in clashes in Ismailia.
Police detained two Libyan nationals who were arrested during the riots in Qalubiya.
Fierce clashes erupted Friday between members of the Muslim Brotherhood group and residents of Omraniya district of Giza.

Gunfire could be heard late into the night in the Alf Maskan neighbourhood and 20 people died in Cairo and the surrounding areas. According to UN News Service (New York) a total of 62 people died on Saturday in Cairo and Daily News Egypt reported 72 deaths in Cairo.
A group of armed men opened fire while driving near Cairos Al-Tahrir Square, leaving one person injured.
Several soldiers were wounded in an attack on a military checkpoint in Sheikh Zuweid city by rocket propelled grenades, a security source told Xinhua.
A pro-Morsi demonstration was halted by security forces in Nasr City.

Several protesters gathered in the district of Matariya in Cairo, chanting against the military and raising the four-fingered Rabaa sign. They clashed with security forces and local residents. According to Daily News Egypt, 24 were killed with live ammunition.
A small protest was dispersed at Egypts High Court, only a few blocks away from Talaat Harb Square.
Police in Cairo have fired tear gas to disperse anti-government protesters near Tahrir square as Egypt marks the anniversary of the 2011 uprising that led to the overthrow of President Hosni Mubarak.
Clashes that broke out between the marching protesters and police forces left three injured and one confirmed dead.

Five Egyptian soldiers have been killed in a crash of an Egyptian Army helicopter in northern Sinai. An Al-Qaeda inspired group claimed in a video it shot down an Egyptian military helicopter in the Sinai peninsula.
In Cairo and around the country, police clashed with supporters of former president Mohamed Morsi, ousted by the military last year after popular protests.
Security forces succeeded in dispersing Muslim Brotherhood supporters in Hilwan.
A number of revolutionary forces, including Tamarrud [Rebellion] Movement and the Free Egyptians Party, organized protests to assert the demands of 25 January revolution.

Suez security forces dispersed a Muslim Brotherhood [MB] rally with tear gas on Saturday [25 January]. The MB protesters threw stones and fireworks at the security bodies, promoting them to fire back with tear gas.
Police forces arrested 73 Muslim Brotherhood supporters in possession of arms and ammunition while they marched in Alexandria.

In Al-Fayyum governorate [south of Cairo], skirmishes erupted Muslim Brotherhood supporters and families of the victims of Friday attacks during a funeral procession for the victims in Al-Sad al-Ali street.
A crowd also gathered in front of Ain Shams police station, the site of a minor explosion earlier in the day, chanting praises for the army and El-Sisi.
A pro-Morsi demonstration was halted by security forces in front of Al-Qudsi Mosque in the northern Ain Shams district.
Thousands of demonstrators in Cairos Tahrir Square chanted slogans backing General Abdel Fattah al-Sisi.
A bomb exploded by a police academy in Ain Shams earlier, injuring one man.
In the Muhandiseen district, police fired tear gas and birdshot at anti-government protesters outside a mosque, scattering them into side streets. One person reported killed.

Several other protests in support of Morsi took place in other towns in the governorate of Assiut where protesters initiated several marches chanting for ""a new revolution"" and the fall of the ""regime.""
In Minya, Upper Egypt, a pro-Morsi march leaving from Omar Ibn Al-Khattab Mosque also chanted against ""military rule.""
Security forces arrested at least 10 protesters from a pro-Mohamed Morsi march in front of a police station in 6th of October city.
A pro-Morsi march was dispersed in Gizas Haram, where security officials fired teargas and rubber bullets.
In Assuit city not less than 15 pro-Brotherhood protesters, including several women, were arrested by security forces.
In Ismailia, dozens of Brotherhood supporters were dispersed by security forces after organising rallies in the city.
Masked gunmen attacked a passenger train heading from Tanta [north of Cairo] to Al-Qanatir [north of Cairo], threaten to explode the train, and the security forces cordon off the area.

A protest at the Journalists Syndicate in downtown Cairo has been dispersed by security forces firing birdshot and heavy teargas. Armoured vehicles reportedly drove through the demonstration to disperse the crowd who were chanting against the military and MB. They clashed with supporters of General Abdel-Fattah El-Sisi coming up from the pro-military celebrations in Tahrir.

A journalist was shot dead while working for Qatar-based satellite broadcaster Al-Jazeera whilst covering the third anniversary clashes. Another photojournalist working for the center-right Wafd party newspaper, was shot in the face and underwent surgery to rebuild his mouth.

More than a dozen journalists were beaten by the demonstrators, or detained by police for protection from angry crowds. Demonstrators chased one Egyptian female journalist, mistakenly believing she worked for satellite news broadcaster Al-Jazeera - seen as pro-Brotherhood. They pulled her hair and tried to strangle her with a scarf until police took her into a building for protection.

Thirteen people were injured in a bomb explosion in Suez on Saturday on the third anniversary of the January 25 uprising that toppled Hosni Mubarak. The explosion was followed by gunfire that injured one man.

The Association for Freedom of Thought and Expression (AFTE) said it spotted 36 violation cases, which range from banning journalists and breaking their equipments or seizing it to arresting and assaulting them at coverage of clashes on Saturday.

Two have been reported killed in Upper Egypts Minya during a crackdown by police on a protest by supporters of ousted president Mohamed Morsi. Confrontations occurred in Abu Halal neighborhood on Saturday.
The Al-Qaeda inspired group, Ansar Beit al-Maqdis said it was behind attacks on military support forces in the area surrounding Jura International Airport using heavy weapons.
The Al-Qaeda inspired group Ansar Beit al-Maqdis said it was behind attacks on a bombardment of Al Zohour camp with mortars.
One death occurred in clashes in Daqahliyah.
20 protesters were arrested during a march in Maadi.
Injuries were reported in clashes between MB supporters and security forces in Beni Suwayf. According to Daily News Egypt one person died.
57 people were handed a 15-day-detention after being interrogated in Dokki Police Station having been arrested for participation in clashes outside Mostafa Mahmoud mosque.
Masked gunmen attacked a gas pipeline in Bear Al Abed village, leaving one soldier dead.

The EOHR expressed deep concern over torture of a demonstrator who suffered from attack in Azbakeya, Kasr El-Nile police station and Abu Zaabal prison, demanding an immediate investigation on the incident.
Two more small bombs went off early Saturday in Cairo as an assailant threw a small bomb at a Cairo police building.
At least four soldiers were killed and nine others wounded on Sunday when a group of unidentified gunmen attacked an army vehicle in Egypts Suez province
At least four hardline ""Jihadists"" were killed early Sunday morning while planting an explosive device in North Sinais Sheikh Zuweid city.
Four conscripts were killed and nine were injured in an armed attack by unknown assailants in Sinai on Sunday.
About 500 Brotherhood members had gathered in Gizas Haram neighborhood and threw Molotov cocktails and fireworks at security forces and residents.
6 April members mourned the death of a fellow member, on Sunday evening with chants denouncing police violence and military rule and demanding the downfall of the regime.
Detonation: Security forces arrested ten men as they tried to plant a bomb in the Kuthar district of Sheikh Zuweid. The explosive device ""accidentally"" detonated and killed one of the militants.
Ansar Beit al-Maqdis blew up a pipeline in Egypts Sinai that transports gas to Jordan late Monday in the third such attack in less than a month.
Movement of forces: An ""extended military campaign"" took place in Sheikh Zuweid, Rafah and Bir Al-Abed.
Muslim Brotherhood supporters clashed with security forces in Cairos Downtown early on Tuesday, shortly before ousted President Mohamed Mursis trial.
Interior Ministers Techincal Office Head was shot dead in Haram, Giza. Ansar Beit al-Maqdis claimed responsibility.

The Egyptian authorities arrested 17 supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood on Tuesday for trying to block the road and riot while protesting near the Supreme Court at the same time as the trial of ousted President Mohamed Mursi.
An Egyptian police officer was killed in an armed attack on a church in October 6 City on Tuesday.

Egyptian military officials say that troops backed by helicopters and armored vehicles have killed eight militants in the northern Sinai Peninsula, part of a continued offensive against rising militancy in the volatile region.
A 42-year-old policeman was shot dead in Hihya city in Al Sharqiyah Governorate.
A small bomb targeted a police station in Alexandria, but there were no casualties.
One person was shot dead in the Mediterranean city of Alexandria Thursday during clashes between supporters and opponents of Egypts ousted Islamist president Mohamed Morsi
Unidentified gunmen killed a police officer on Thursday night in Sinai.
Army troops destroyed two car bombs ready to be exploded in North Sinai
Suspected members of the Muslim Brotherhood detonated the car of the head of the Minya investigation department that was parked near his home.
Scores of residents gathered in the scene of the blast at a police station in Alexandria, chanting slogans in support of the army and police.
Ansar Beit al-Maqdis said Saturday that it fired a rocket at the Red Sea resort of Eilat which was intercepted by Israeli air defences, its second in a fortnight.
Pro-Morsi demonstrations were staged in Cairo, Sharqiya and Fayoum
Police fired tear gas to disperse a pro-Morsi demonstration when the deposed Islamists supporters clashed with opponents in the Mediterranean city of Alexandria.
Pro-Morsi demonstrations were staged in Fayoum. Police fired teargas and clashes with the protesters.
Egyptian military aircraft targeted suspected positions of al-Qaida-inspired fighters in the Sinai Peninsula, killing 13 people.
Security Forces dispersed a sit-in staged by supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood group in Naam Square in eastern Cairos Matariyah district on Friday [31 January].
One policeman was slightly wounded when his patrol car was hit by two roadside bombs in a Cairo suburb.
Four militants attacked a checkpoint in Oct. 6 City, west in Cairo, and exchanged fire with the policemen, which left the driver of the car carrying the militants dead and the three others arrested.
Supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group staged on Friday [31 January] limited marches in Cairo and Giza following the weekly prayers.
The MB group staged a march in the international coastal road in Kafr al-Shaykh [north of Cairo].
The Health Ministry said Friday [31 January] that one person was killed while 35 others injured during protests staged on Friday.
The Health Ministry said Friday [31 January] that one person was killed while 35 others injured during protests staged on Friday.
Pro-Morsi demonstrations were staged in Cairo. An attempt by pro-Morsi protesters to commemorate dozens killed in clashes a week ago turned into new battles with police and pro-military civilians.
Two extremists were killed in a crackdown on Saturday south of Sheikh Zoueid in North Sinai. 20 arrested.
A handmade grenade exploded in al-Omraneya neighborhood in Giza early on Saturday, but no damages or casualties were reported
Unidentified men threw Molotov cocktails on Al-Minyas city hall building and assaulted the conscript assigned with guarding it.
A manhunt took place in Arish, Rafah and Al-Shaykh Zuwayid by military forces. Hideouts of the militants were destroyed and two machine guns and four explosive devices were seized during the raids.
A manhunt took place in Arish, Rafah and Al-Shaykh Zuwayid by military forces. Hideouts of the militants were destroyed and two machine guns and four explosive devices were seized during the raids.

Security forces were heavily deployed on Saturday [1 February] in Suez after the Muslim Brotherhood announced marches to mark the second anniversary of killing of Al-Ahli [football team] fans in Port Said.
A citizen was detained, beaten and subject to tortue in Al Azouly prison in Ismailia for information about protests and demonstrations.

Three Central Security conscripts were injured on Sunday in a blast in Sinais Rafah city. Unknown assailants had placed an explosive device in the way of a minibus carrying conscripts on their way to vacation. According to AFP, 3 civilians were injured as well.

Security forces in North Sinai detonated a booby-trapped microbus in central Rafah City on Sunday [2 February]. The troops opened fire on the vehicle causing a massive explosion due to large quantities of explosives on board, security sources said.
26 were killed and injured in the village of Wady Al- Akhder in Sheikh Zuweid city in an army raid on hardline Islamists.
""At least 15 dangerous ""jihadist"" elements were killed and wounded in the village of Goes Abou Raad in southern Rafah city in an army raid on hardline Islamists.

An Islamist alliance called for demonstrations on Tuesday in solidarity with ousted President Mohamed Mursi as he stands trial with his top aides over violence that happened by the groups headquarters under Mursis rule.
A non-commissioned officer was shot dead on Tuesday [4 February] in the city of Sharqiyah.

Police and army forces arrested seven ""militants"", including two Palestinians, on Wednesday, in a security operation in the Sinai Peninsula. He added that 54 hideouts and 11 motorbikes, which were being used by extremists, were also demolished.
Police opened fire Wednesday [5 February] at three assailants who broke into a checkpoint outside Arish police station, killing two persons and injuring one.
An unidentified armed men fired at police checkpoint in Al-Sharqiyah Governorate [eastern Egypt] and several security personnel were wounded.
In Cairos eastern district of Nasr City, police fired tear gas to disperse demonstrators and chased them into side streets.
One person was killed in violence in Fayoum when pro-Morsi supporters clashed with police forces.
A child was killed and eight other people wounded in clashes between security services and pro-Morsi demonstrators in the village of Delga south of Cairo,
Police dispersed several protest marches that set off from mosques after noon prayers in Cairo.
There were also other pro-Brotherhood rallies elsewhere in Egypt on Friday, including in Cairo, the Mediterranean port city of Alexandria and in the Suez Canal city of Suez.
A group of Muslim Brotherhood supporters marched in Gizas Haram Street after the Friday noon prayer while holding banners showing support for former President Mohamed Mursi.
In Sudan Street in Mohandessin, hundreds of army supporters marched to urge Field Marshal Abdel Fattah al-Sisi to run for president in the coming elections.

Clashes flared up on Friday between locals residents in Cairos Mohandessin and pro-Muslim Brotherhood demonstrators after the latter marched in Lebnan Square while chanting against the army and the police. According to Daily News Egypt one person died.
Clashes broke out earlier in the Siouf area between security forces and a group of pro-Muslim Brotherhood demonstrators.

Security forces dispersed a pro-Muslim Brotherhood march on Friday at the Egyptian Media Production City in Gizas October 6 district. The police fired teargas bombs at the crowds to disband them after they rallied at Gate 2 at the Media Production City
Security forces aborted a Brotherhood march in Dekheila area before the demonstrators started roaming the streets.

Police forces arrested about 34 Muslim Brotherhood supporters in Alexandria on Friday. The arrestees were found in possession of anti-Armed Forces leaflets, petrol bombs, Rabaa symbols, and a live transmission device.
On Friday, 20 extremists were killed and 70 were injured in raids on the North Sinai region.
Egypts Interior Ministry said that between four and six policemen were injured as a bomb exploded on the Giza flyover on Friday morning. Islamist group Agnad Misr claimed responsibility.
Policemen attacked a CBC Extra channel reporter while covering the news on bomb blasts on Giza Bridge on Friday [7 February].
Police fired tear gas to disperse a large group of protesters in the capitals Ain Shams district, where Morsis supporters had unsuccessfully tried to set up an encampment last week.
A group of policemen closed the doors of the Kafr Al-Sheikh Security Directorate and staged a protest outside it on Saturday calling for better working conditions.
Policemen staged protests in the governorate of Gharbeya demanding better working conditions.

column16: Aswat Masriya (Egypt); Egypt State Information Service
column17: The 2nd Field Army troops along with military engineers and civil defense squads defused a highly-explosive charge planted on the roadside of the international coastal road, some two kilometers near Al-Gharouba village
Egypts military said it killed 16 Islamist militants Saturday in air strikes in the Sinai peninsula.
Four political activists reported being subjected to torture during a detention renewal session on 9 February.

Security forces arrested on Sunday [9 February] a suspected ""militant"" before blowing a suicide vest up near a Central Security Forces camp in Al-Ismailiyah. The troops arrested the suspect who fell injured after the policemen had opened fire at him.

An association of Egyptian reporters organized a sit-in [on 9 February] in front of the journalists syndicate HQ in downtown Cairo to condemn an attack by policemen on a CBC Extra channel reporter while covering the news on bomb blasts on Giza Bridge on Friday [7 February].
Army forces killed three extremists supporting the Muslim Brotherhood group on Sunday in a crackdown in North Sinai.
An extremist was killed and 12 others were arrested earlier on Sunday in Nagaa Shabana area South of Rafah.
Dozens of low-ranking policemen staged a protest in front of Minyah police station on Monday [10 February] demanding better pay, bonuses and incentives.

Sheikh Mansour bridge collapsed in El-Marg, Cairo, killing a police corporal and injuring two other people. People were fighting with gas cylinders and one blew up, causing the fire that led to the bridge collapse.
in the city of Ismailia, two unknown gunmen, also on a motorcycle, shot dead a policeman while he was standing at a traffic light
In the Suez canal city of Port Said, unknown gunmen on a motorcycle shot dead a police officer
Six ""militants"" were arrested during a military campaign in Al-Arish, Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah.
Six ""militants"" were arrested during a military campaign in Al-Arish, Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah.
Three Islamists, affiliated to the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group, were killed on Tuesday [11 February] during a security campaign in North Sinai.
A force chain was organized at the entrance to the 10th of Ramadan City and one in Al-Adwah village to mark the third anniversary of the ouster of Hosni Mubarak.
Scores of people rallied in the streets of the city to condemn the ""militant"" attacks that target the policemen after a policeman was shot dead in Port Said earlier.

Dozens of supporters and members of the blacklisted ""militant"" Muslim Brotherhood group organized a number of human chains in the Delta city of Sharqiya to mark the third anniversary of the ouster of Hosni Mubarak.
Unknown assailants blew up a natural gas pipeline in this Egyptian city in the North Sinai governorate early Tuesday
Gunmen shot dead three policemen near the Suez canal city of Ismailia and seized their weapons.
A group of people opposing Egypts popular satirist Bassem Youssef gathered Wednesday outside the theatre where he records his weekly show, El-Bernameg, and tried to block the crew from entering.
Unidentified gunmen bombed a natural gas line south of Arish City in the Sinai Peninsula on Wednesday

Two policemen were shot dead outside a church in Cairos Ain Shams district during a pro-Morsi rally. One died at the scene on Wednesday evening, the second died in hospital in Nasr City on Thursday morning
Unknown assailants opened fire on two policemen in the town of Badrashin, 30 kilometres (18 miles) south of Cairo in Giza province, killing them both.
Security forces dispersed protests by Islamists in the western Pyramids district in Giza.
Unknown assailants shot dead two policemen in Giza

A 12-year old boy was shot dead on Friday while standing in the balcony of his house in Minyas Samallout as a pro-Muslim Brotherhood march was passing by his street. The demonstrators used shotgun pellets to counter the attempts of police forces to disperse them
A man was killed in a Damietta village during scuffles between Brotherhood allies and the villages residents.
In North Sinai, Second Field Army troops managed to kill and injure more than 112 ""Takfiri"" elements during fierce clashes. Fatalities coded as half.
Clashes erupted Friday [14 February] between police and members of the Muslim Brotherhood in the Upper Egyptian city of Fayyum
Three MB members were arrested in Damanhur, Al-Buhayrah governorate [north of Cairo].
In Al-Minufiyah [north of Cairo], one supporter of the MB group was arrested as police dispersed a rally in Sadat city.
Clashes broke out in Cairos Nasr City on Friday when police forces attempted to disband a pro-Muslim Brotherhood march on Abbas al-Akkad Street
Army forces defused two bombs planted next to Sheikh Zoueid Hospital in North Sinai on Saturday morning

An explosion in an apartment in the Nasr City district of Cairo left four people injured, including a 10-year-old boy and the owner of the apartment. The source of the explosion appeared to be a bomb.
A number of workers gathered in front of the Mahalla textile companies headquarters on Saturday, chanting against the CEO and the chairman of the holding company whom they want removed.
Lawyers for Egypts ousted president and his co-defendants walked out of court on Sunday to protest the soundproof glass cage in which defendants are held during proceedings
Workers from Holding Company for Cotton Spinning and Weaving were joined on Sunday by thousands of Kafr Al-Dawar employees, who protested in solidarity with the Mahalla workers.
Policemen closed down the Security Directorates headquarters with chains on Sunday [16 February] and denied officers and the security directors assistants entry into the building.

A bomb tore through a bus carrying South Korean sightseers near an Egyptian border crossing with Israel on Sunday, killing three tourists and their Egyptian driver and injuring 16. Ansar Beit al-Maqdis later claimed responsibility.
Four people, including a policeman, were injured in a shooting resulted from a confrontation near an Assiut security checkpoint late on Monday.
Second Field Army forces killed five dangerous ""Takfiri"" elements, affiliated to the Muslim Brotherhood group, and arrested three others during security operations in North Sinai.
An Egyptian conscript was injured on Tuesday when unknown gunmen attacked a police vehicle during a patrol on the Egyptian-Israeli border.
Weapons Seizure: Several ""militant"" elements affiliated to the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group were arrested in Sinai. Several tunnels were destroyed and weapons seized.
At least 5 militants were killed in government air raids on their hideouts in Rafah in North Sinai governorate that continued from Wednesday evening until early Thursday
Protests continue at Mahalla textile Company.
At least 6 militants were killed in government air raids on their hideouts in Sheikh Zuweid cities in North Sinai governorate that continued from Wednesday evening until early Thursday
An army officer and a soldier were wounded by masked gunmen near a military area in Zagazig city.
Twenty-five police personnel were injured in clashes with Ahly fans following Thursdays African Super Cup game at Cairo.
An Egyptian policeman was killed and three others were injured in an attack by unknown armed assailants in Sharqiya on Thursday
Employees from the Notary Authority organised a protest last Thursday in front of the Ministry of Justice after taking a permit from the interior ministry to communicate their unmet demands
A crowd of Muslim Brotherhood supporters torched a satellite van belonging to Tahrir satellite channel in Gizas Haram Street on Friday
MB protests were held in the hometown of former president Muhammad Morsi, who is being tried over spying and jailbreak charges, of Hihya.
Supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood group staged protests in several towns and villages in Sharqiyah on Friday [21 February].

Anti-riot forces were deployed outside a number of police and vital buildings in Arbain Square in Suez in preparation for planned protests called for by the so-called pro-MB ""National Coalition to Support Legitimacy.""
Muslim Brotherhood elements cut off Abbas al-Akkad street in Cairos Nasr City on Friday. Clashes were reported between police forces and marching demonstrators.
Security forces clashed with ""Ultras Revolutionary"" members who had gathered in front of Abdeen Court in Cairo on Saturday.
Strike:Egyptian workers in various public sectors entered another day of strikes in protest at financial conditions and demanding the application of the minimum income law.
Weapons Seizure: Security forces discovered seven unexploded grenades inside a minibus outside a courthouse and security forces camp in Banha on Sunday
Four detainees were physically assaulted outside the prosecution on 23 February during a detention renewal session.

Mourners at the funeral of a police officer killed the day before shouted in grief condemning terrorism and calling for avenging the policeman. They blamed the outlawed Muslim Brotherhood group for attacks against police officers.

Non-violent activity: Egypts military-installed government resigned en masse Monday in a surprise move ahead of a presidential poll likely to bring defence minister and army chief Abdel Fattah al-Sisi to power.

Egyptian troops killed 14 suspected militants and arrested others in the northern Sinai Peninsula over the past 3 days. Egyptian armed forces also claimed the killing of an alleged Ansar Beit Al-Maqdis member, as well as the destruction of a field hospital they said was used by Al-Qaeda-inspired militants in North Sinai.
A policeman was shot in the head by unknown assailants while on his way home in Sharqiyas Zagazig on Monday.
An owner of a carpet shop for manufacturing home-made bombs and distributing them among members of the Muslim Brotherhood in the coastal city was arrested.
Property destruction: Militants blew up a pipeline in Sinai late Tuesday that transports gas to Jordan, security officials said, in the fourth such attack this year in the restive peninsula.

A protest to demand the release of political detainees will be held in Cairo on Tuesday. Strong Egypt Party, April 6 Youth Movement, Revolutionary Socialists and a number of other groups have signed a statement calling for the protest
An Egyptian policeman was wounded when unknown armed assailants fired shots at him in Sharqiya early on Tuesday.
Six cars with five members of the Muslim Brotherhood in each one attempted to storm a journalists house in 6th October City.

Demolition: Military troops burned 15 huts and destroyed six tunnels and three houses in Sarsurya area [Sinai]. They were used by ""militants"" in their attacks on police personnel and eight militants were arrested.
Clashes erupted between Muslim Brotherhood protesters and local residents on Friday [28 February], security forces started to use teargas to separate the two sides in Fayyum.

In the eastern Cairo district of Ain Shams, security officials said supporters of Morsis Muslim Brotherhood group used firearms and set fire to tires and trash cans in clashes that wounded a police officer and a conscript. A police officer was shot by Muslim Brotherhood elements in Ayn Shams district of Cairo is in critical condition.
Gunmen killed an Egyptian policeman who was on a security team guarding the home of a judge in the jailbreak trial of ousted president Mohamed Morsi in Mansoura.

Hundreds of Morsi supporters took to the streets on Friday to denounce the military-backed government and call on the release of their fellows detained during other demonstrations. Police fired teargas to disperse protesters.
Bomb squads defused a bomb planted by unidentified men on the ring road leading to October 6 City in Giza on Friday.
A man was killed and two others, including a child, were injured when violent clashes flared between Muslim Brotherhood supporters, Alexandria residents and security forces on Friday.
As many as 33 members of the die-hard fan group the White Knights were arrested by police during riots outside Cairo stadium on Saturday [1 March]
Dozens protest outside Libyan embassy in Cairo against killing of Egyptian workers in Libya

The co-founder of U.S.-based anti-war group CodePink said Tuesday that Egyptian police detained her at Cairos international airport when she tried to enter the country on route to the Gaza Strip and treated her roughly, fracturing her shoulder as they handcuffed her before deporting her.
At least ten extremists were killed and some 43 others were arrested Wednesday during a security raid in Egypts North Sinai province in northeast of the capital Cairo
A primitive bomb exploded at the reserve gas pipeline south of Port Said early Wednesday [5 March] but no casualties were reported.
A homemade bomb exploded on Wednesday in Qena, near the courts complex of the Upper Egypt governorate, reported state television. There were no injuries or losses reported.
Defusal: Security forces foiled another grenade found in the same area as a bomb that exploded in Qena.

Arrests: The Armed Forces and the special forces from the Ministry of Interior stormed Kirdassa and Nahya with the aim of maintaining security and eliminating militant and criminal hotbeds. Troops also arrested 120 thugs and criminal elements which intimidated citizens.

Unknown gunmen shot and killed a policeman as he had finished his work at the Rafah Crossing.
Tens of French activists continued their sit-in at Cairo Airport on Thursday in protest against the banning of 15 of them to enter Gaza through the Rafah border
In Cairo three people were killed and 23 others wounded in the fighting between Islamist protesters and security forces.
Police clashed with armed MB members in Ain Shams district after they opened fire and bird-shots indiscriminately, said the security statement.
In Damietta, a shooting occurred between masked gunmen and security personnel near Damietta Security Directorate with no casualties.
Four people sustained injuries from shotgun pellets in Fayoum and a conscript was injured during clashes between the demonstrators and the police.
Police forces in Gharbiyas Kafr al-Zayyat arrested five Brotherhood supporters after they had protested against the army and the police and hurled fireworks and petrol bombs at security forces.
Police forces arrested 10 pro-Brotherhood elements in Alexandria in a pro-Muslim Brotherhood demonstration.

In North Sinais Arish, the police dispersed a march for pro-Brotherhood protesters using teargas bombs.
Six people were hurt in Sharqiya in clashes between pro- and anti-Brotherhood demonstrators during an anti-army march.
A number of unidentified persons hurled Molotov cocktails at a police vehicle in Aswan. A police officer and a conscript were injured and the vehicle was greatly damaged.
The explosion of a suspected homemade bomb targeting a tram station in eastern Cairo wounded at least one person.
Armed forces arrested thirteen suspects in a security operation in Sinais Arish City. A workshop that was used to create explosive devices was demolished in Saturdays operation
One worker was wounded in Heliopolis when a hand grenade exploded.

A policeman was killed on Sunday [9 March] in a drive-by shooting in Al-Zaqaziq. Another policeman, working for the national security body, was also wounded in the attack. One of the attackers [a student from Al-Azhar university] was shot dead as a policeman opened fire at them
Students at Cairo University demonstrated on Sunday demanding the release of their colleagues.
Student rioters set fire to a van of a satellite channel and tear gas was fired outside Cairo University.
At Ain Shams University hundreds of SAC members protested on the main campus, with flags of the group, Rabaa signs, and fireworks being used.
Three of Egypts most prominent youth activists were beaten in the courthouse by their guards before a hearing Monday in the appeal of their prison sentence
Unidentified gunmen targeted buses, carrying conscripts on the Arish-Rafah Road in northern Sinai, with RPGs. No injuries reported.
Egypts former army chief of staff escaped an assassination attempt by unknown assailants.
An engineering student at Cairo University disappeared after he was arrested from Ramsis Street in the capital on 11 March. He was subject to torture in Al Azouly prison.

Egyptian police shot dead a militant suspected of being involved in a January bomb attack against Cairo police headquarters.
Students Against the Coup (SAC) protested Tuesday inside the building of the Faculty of Commerce at Ain Shams University.

Tens of workers at Egypts state-run Modern Fashion Company (Ben-Zaion, Ades, Rivoli) protested on Wednesday at the interim governments headquarters to demand withheld back pay and the removal of the companies chairman and board of directors.
Militants opened fire on Thursday [13 March] at the North Sinai radio building without causing casualties. Security forces responded by firing at them.

Egyptian authorities fired teargas to disperse pro-Muslim Brotherhood protesters in Cairos Al Azhar University.
Pro-Morsi students at the Fayoum University in Fayoum governorate organised a protest demanding the release of detained students and demanding the return of ousted president Mohamed Morsi.

In Beheira governorate, pro-Morsi female students organised rallies inside the Faculty of Agriculture and in Damanhour University, demanding the release of detainees

Two senior Egyptian army officers were killed during a raid on a ""jihadist"" hideout in Al-Qanatir Al-Khayriya, Qalyubiyah. Six members of the Al-Qaeda-inspired Ansar Beit al-Maqdis (Partisans of Jerusalem) group, which has been implicated in a spate of attacks on security forces, were also killed in the hours-long shootout, the army and police said.

In Gharbia governorate, the city of Al-Mahalla witnessed human chains Wednesday afternoon organised by pro-Morsi protesters.The protesters held banners in the main roads and side roads of the two cities calling on citizens to join rallies against the army and police.

Several hundred students protested in the southern city of Assiut. Police fired tear gas to prevent the students from moving out of the campuses into the streets.

Security forces dispersed a Muslim Brotherhood rally that was staged in Hilwan in southern Cairo on Friday [21 March]. MB supporters fired birdshots and fireworks at the security forces while chanting slogans against police and the army.

In Damanhur [north of Cairo], security bodies arrested nine MB members over charges of setting fire to a police station in Hush Isa village. They were also accused of inciting violence and non-peaceful protests in the governorate.

Clashes occurred between security forces and MB members in Al-Arbain district in Suez Governorate. The police fired tear gas to disperse MB members after they fired birdshots and fireworks at the forces and residents of the neighborhood. They damaged a number of cars.
Security forces in the Nile Delta province of Minufiyah dispersed a rally staged by supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood group on Friday [21 March].
Unknown assailants torched on Friday morning a police checkpoint at Gharbiyas Mahalla Abu Ali Village on the Mahalla-Mansoura Road.
Five people, including two policemen, were injured on Friday morning when Muslim Brotherhood supporters clashed with residents of Abu Hammad town in Sharqiya.
Egypts Health Ministry reported that in Fayoum, two people were injured in clashes.

The residents of Al-Jumhuriyah district in Al-Mahalah, north of Cairo, succeeded in standing against and dispersing scores of militant MB group members in a march.

As many as 50 members of the MB group gathered on Alexandria Delta road in Qalyub, in violation to the protest law. The protesters chanted slogans against the army and police, adding that five protesters were arrested.

Security sources entered Al-Azhar University [in Cairo] on Sunday [23 March] to stop riots by students belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood after the demolishing of the wall separating the university from the male dormitory and the launching of firecrackers.
Female Al-Azhar University students continued their protests on campus.
A number of students affiliated to the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group demonstrated on Sunday [23 March] in Al-Jamiah Street and Al-Nahdah Square [in front of Cairo University] using fireworks.

The attempt by Zagazig Universitys administrative security to disperse an on-campus Students Against the Coup (SAC) protest on Sunday involved the use of police dogs and batons. Administrative security, aided by students armed with bladed weapons and sticks, attacked the protest. She claimed that the use of police dogs caused several injuries.

""A number of Muslim Brotherhood [MB] supporters set fire to a school in Al-Minya [Upper Egypt] in protest against the issuance of death sentences against 528 MB members,"". The Ministry of Interior denied the event.

Unknown assailants shot a policeman dead in North Sinai on Monday.

On Monday the armed forces announced that it had arrested 26 suspected militants across the country, 21 in a series of raids in North Sinai. The army added in its statement that a militant was killed during the raids while attempting to plant an explosive device.

A young Coptic woman was murdered amidst clashes between police and Muslim Brotherhood rioters . She was reportedly dragged by a crowd and beaten to death. However, the states version, which was based on a report by the Forensic Medicine Authority, said she was shot in the chest.

A primitive bomb exploded in the vicinity of Al-Azhar University dormitory on Saturday [29 March]. No injuries or damage reported.

Militants shot dead a retired Egyptian army colonel between Cairo and Ismailiyah.

Clashes erupted at Al-Minya University Sunday [30 March] between Muslim Brotherhood students and security forces. The Brotherhood students hurled stones and Molotov cocktails at the police troops which were deployed outside the universities main building.

On 31 March 2014, several Security Forces officers raided a students home in Al Mahallah Al Kubra. Three Sisi supporters were hurt by pro-Morsi students in Damanhur. The two groups clashed when Sisis supporters had gone to register their backing for his presidential candidacy.
Clashes erupted in Cairo University, according to the pro Mohamed Morsi Students Against the Coup movement. Security forces reportedly used teargas to quell most of the protests.

Eighteen people were killed and more than 50 people were wounded in Fridays violent confrontations in Aswan. Violent clashes between al-Halayel and al-Dabodeya tribes erupted late on Friday following tension between the tribes students.
Egyptian security forces fired teargas on a march staged by dozens of protesters supporting the Muslim Brotherhood in Gizas Haram Street after they blocked it.

Clashes broke out between supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood and their opponents in Alexandria on Friday. Both sides pelted stones, empty bottles and Molotov cocktails at each other as police intervened.
Police troops confronted MB elements and managed to arrest 61 of them throughout Egypt including Assiut during Friday demonstrations for using bird shots and fireworks against security troops.

In Upper Egypt, police dispersed rallies by the blacklisted Muslim Brotherhood group in Al-Minya. Police arrested a number of rioters who had bangers and firecrackers on them.
In Suez, security forces arrested two members of the Muslim Brotherhood over violence charges that took place earlier that day.

In Al-Fayyum [south of Cairo], security forces managed to disperse a MB rally in Al-Barudyah area. Security forces fired tear gas bombs at the protesters who blocked main roads and set fire to tires in the Upper Egyptian city.
Police dispersed a rally by MB supporters in Imbaba neighborhood in Cairo.
In Upper Egypt, police dispersed rallies by the blacklisted Muslim Brotherhood group in the city of Samalut.

Egyptian police in Al-Gharbiyah governorate [north of Cairo] on Friday [4 April] countered protests organized by the Muslim Brotherhood group after the weekly prayers. Dozens of MB members staged a rally in the Delta city of Tanta, holding the four-finger signs of Rabiah and chanting slogans against the army and police.

Eleven persons were injured on Friday [4 April] after violent clashes erupted between citizens and elements and supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood group in Minya al-Qamh town, Al-Sharqiyah province [north of Cairo].

At least four ""extremists"" were killed and 36 others arrested on Saturday in a security raid on their hideouts in major cities in Egypts North Sinai province. ""The police-military raid in Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid also resulted in raiding a weapon warehouse that had two machine guns, two sniper guns, two Kalashinkov rifles and various ammunition,"". The death toll of violent clashes that erupted between Arab Ethnic Militia and Nubian Ethnic Militia in Aswan late on Friday increased to 23.
Medical professionals from the Doctors, Pharmacists and Dentists Syndicates marched to the cabinet building on Saturday to demand the passing of the draft Staff Law.
Aswan University saw fallout from ongoing clashes between two tribes on 5 April. Police forces launched tear gas into the campus to disperse students.

Scores of Nubians staged a protest late Monday [7 April] before the Journalists Syndicate in Cairo against the death of many Nubians in the deadly tribal clashes in Aswan and denounced the security inaction in the crisis.

The armed forces and police detained 24 people on Monday in a series of raids across the Sinai Peninsula. The security forces also burned down 20 sites ""used by ""militant"" elements as bases for launching attacks"" on the army and police, said the spokesman. Five vehicles without licence plates were also seized.
In Bahtin district of Shubra al-Khaymah [north Cairo] on Monday [7 April], security bodies managed to defuse a locally-made bomb found near Abu Bakr Al-Sidiq school complex.
Dozens of activists began a sit-in outside the Ittihadiya Presidential Palace on Monday in protest of a court decision upholding a sentence against three activists for violating the protest law

At Menufiya University, Students Against the Coup organised demonstrations on 8 April to ""condemn the campaign of arrests carried out by the security forces"".
On 8 April, police stormed the women's side of Al Azhar university, firing tear gas and birdshot at retreating students. AFTE notes that 20 students were injured by birdshot.

Police forces stormed Ain Shams University in response to clashes between students and administrative security on 9 April, a day after a dozen homemade bombs were found on the campus. The police incursion featured ""heavy"" amounts of tear gas and birdshot, resulting in ""numerous injuries"" to students eyes and chest.

Two police officers were killed in a shootout with ""criminal elements"" Wednesday when their patrol came under fire in the Upper Egypt village of Qena. Security forces killed one of the attackers and arrested another.

The Faculty of Medicine at Cairo University was stormed on 9 April by police forces and ""unidentified civilians"", who arrested demonstrating members of Students Against the Coup. Six students were arrested and imprisoned for six days pending investigations.
Police fired teargas canisters at Pro-Muslim Brotherhood students to disperse their protests inside the Qasr al-Aini Medical School.

On 9 April, security forces stormed both the men and women's side of Al Azhar university after demonstrations were held against abuses by security forces and the university administration. Tear gas was fired in both instances, although birdshot was only used on the men's campus. Injuries, however, were reported on both campuses.
Unidentified gunmen attacked troops transport buses on the Al-Arish-Rafah highway, North Sinai. Security forces in charge of securing the convoy exchanged fire with them until they fled the scene.
Alexandria University featured a protest in support of detained students on 10 April after which students were allegedly accused of trying to destroy the office of the university dean.
A policeman was injured when unidentified people threw a makeshift explosive charge under his car in Al-Husari Square in the Sixth of October City, Giza, Thursday [10 April].

Two bombs were planted near a power transformer in Kirdasah, Giza Governorate, Security Information Center official said on Tuesday [15 April]. The bomb squad managed to defuse it before going off and found another bomb after combing the area and was also defused.

Dozens of journalists held a vigil outside the Journalists Syndicate on Thursday while carrying pens and cameras. They demanded protection against ""being targeted during their coverage of news.""

An Egyptian police officer was killed on Friday evening when a bomb targeting a traffic police kiosk in Cairo exploded. A ""Jihadist"" group, Ajnad Misr, claimed responsibility. A policeman and a civilian were also wounded.
