Five pro-Brotherhood groups marched after noon prayer from Abu Seliman, Hanoville, Amereya, Borg al-Arab and al-Awayed areas to protest against what they called the military coup that deposed former President Mohamed Mursi last July.
Scores of MB members marched in Qaliubiya, Damietta and Monofeya and chanted against the army and the police.
Scores of MB members marched in Qaliubiya, Damietta and Monofeya and chanted against the army and the police.
A group of pro-Sisi demonstrators rallied in front of the al-Qaed Ibrahim Mosque after noon prayer to declare their support for him in the upcoming presidential election.
In Sharqiya, scores of Brotherhood supporters staged a demonstration while chanting against the police and the army.
Security forces arrested five Brotherhood supporters for assaulting a policeman in Sharqiyas Asher Men Ramadan City.
In Fayoum, security forces tear-gassed several Brotherhood demonstrations in Fayoum before they marched across the city.
Giza witnessed minor rallies for Brotherhood members on Friday. Police forces were able to disband the demonstrators.
Police forces tear-gassed dozens of pro-Brotherhood protesters in Gharbiya after they had marched in Botros area after noon prayer while chanting anti-police slogans and hurling stones at cars.
Cairo witnessed minor rallies for Brotherhood members on Friday. Police forces were able to disband the demonstratorson.
Security forces in Alexandria disbanded a march for Brotherhood supporters in Abu Seliman area.

Security forces in Alexandria disbanded a march for supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood on Friday. The forces intervened and disperse the marching demonstrators after the latter had clashed with members of an opposing group
An improvised explosive device exploded outside Al-Fayyum stadium [west of Cairo]. No injuries were reported.

In Suez, clashes broke out between pro-Brotherhood demonstrators and security forces on the Nile street in al-Arbaeen Square after noon prayer. The protesters hurled fireworks at police forces, which then retaliated by tear-gassing them.

Al-Qalyubiyah security forces managed to control clashes which erupted between a number of Muslims and Copts in Al-Khusus city, north of Cairo. The armed clashes left one person dead and four others injured.
Thousands of the ""Independence Current"", a coalition of 32 political parties and movements, staged a protest in front of Qatars embassy in Giza.
Thousands of the ""Independence Current"", a coalition of 32 political parties and movements, staged a protest in front of the Arab League (AL) headquarters in Cairo.
A police officer and a conscript were shot dead after unknown militants opened fire on their patrol vehicle on the road between Cairo and Suez.
Clashes erupted Sunday evening outside Al-Azhar University dormitories, following a protest organised by the Students Against the Coup (SAC) movement.
In Kafr al-Shaykh Governorate [north of Cairo], scores of Brotherhood students staged a protest outside Kafr al-Shaykh University building.
Two people were wounded when a bomb exploded in Giza, west of Cairo
The wife of an imprisoned political activist and other female activists started a sit-in on Tuesday outside the Heliopolis palace to decry the Protest Law.

Police forces teargassed a pro-Muslim Brotherhood protest outside Azhar University on Tuesday. Security forces threw tear gas bombs and fired birdshot at the students, injuring between five and ten people.
At least seven Islamist militants were killed and 20 others were injured in overnight air raids on their hideouts Wednesday in Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid cities in North Sinai.
Six Muslim Brotherhood (MB) members were arrested after opening fire on a security checkpoint in Nasr City.
Security forces stormed into Al-Azhar University buildings and attacked student protesters Wednesday after a night of violence between the two sides.
At least seven Islamist militants were killed and 20 others were injured in overnight air raids on their hideouts Wednesday in Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid cities in North Sinai.
A police brigadier general was killed when a bomb exploded under his car in October 6 suburb of Cairo. Ajnad Misr claimed responsibility.

A policeman and a militant were killed and another wounded in a gun battle that erupted as security forces raided a militant hideout in Alexandria. Police retrieved an explosives-laden belt and two home-made bombs.

Clashes between security forces and students broke out near or outside universities following protests in Fayoum. One student was injured in Fayoum by birdshot, while police also fired tear gas in the clashes.
Clashes between security forces and students broke out near or outside universities following protests in Assiut.
Clashes between security forces and students broke out near or outside universities following protests in Cairo.
Activists held a protest outside the Heliopolis palace on Thursday, calling for the revocation of the controversial protest law.
In Beheira, MB members organised an anti-government protest.
In Hilwan [south Cairo], scores of MB loyalists staged a protest, chanting slogans against state institutions
Supporters of deposed president Muhammad Morsi staged a rally in Al-Talbiyah district in Giza after the Friday [25 April] prayers amid tightened security measures.
Members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group on Friday [25 April] staged a rally in the Upper Egyptian city of Qina.
In Banha, north of Cairo, scores of MB members staged rallies in Khankah in Al-Qalubiyah Governorate. Police arrested several protesters.

MB rallies chanted anti-police and army slogans and marched streets of the city. The forces fired tear gas in Malawi to disperse a rally. The protesters called for the release of their detained colleagues.
Security forces dispersed rallies that were staged Friday [25 April] by the Muslim Brotherhood [MB] in Al-Minya [a city in Upper Egypt]. A home-made bomb exploded but no casualties were reported.
In Banha, north of Cairo, scores of MB members staged rallies in Shibin al-Qanatir in Al-Qalubiyah Governorate. Police arrested several protesters.
In Alexandria, security forces dispersed three rallies staged by the supporters of the MB group and arrested ten people.
Supporters of presidential hopeful Abd-al-Fattah al-Sisi staged a rally outside Al-Qaid Ibrahim Mosque in Alexandria after the Friday [25 April] prayers.
In Al-Daqahliyah, clashes erupted between residents and Brotherhood members who were organizing a march in Al-Manzalah city.
In Shibin al-Kum in Al-Minufiyah Governorate, a MB rally was dispersed when villagers threw hot water from rooftops of houses at the protesters.
In Banha, north of Cairo, scores of MB members staged rallies in Shubra al-Khaymah in Al-Qalubiyah Governorate. Police arrested several protesters.

Supporters of deposed president Muhammad Morsi staged a rally in Al-Marutiyah district in Giza after the Friday [25 April] prayers amid tightened security measures. A non-commissioned police officer was shot to death by members of the Muslim Brotherhood in Al-Matariyah.

Two people were killed in clashes on Friday between protesters and police in the Egyptian city of Fayoum. The Brotherhood members hurled fireworks and Molotov cocktails on the forces, who responded by firing teargas.
An Egyptian soldier was wounded in an armed attack on a security checkpoint in Sinais al-Sheikh Zuwaid on Friday
Egyptian authorities closed Tahrir Square to traffic on Friday ahead of protests supporting ousted President Mohamed Mursi.
Members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group and rioters distinct from the protesters in Heliopolis clashed with the police.
Several Egyptian opposition groups demonstrated outside the Heliopolis presidential palace on Saturday against a protest law and to demand the release of political prisoners.
Two police officers and a policeman were killed on Sunday in an armed attack. Unknown assailants fired gunshots at a police car while it was patrolling al-Samran district in Arish.
Two conscripts and a student were injured during the clashes that erupted on Al-Azhar Universitys campus.
Two suspects were killed and another was arrested in a police raid. They opened fire at the police who exchanged fire, leaving two dead.
Security forces dispersed protesters outside Minya criminal Court after the news that over 700 Muslim Brotherhood supporters were sentenced to death.

Non-violent activity: A court in Minya in southern Egypt sentenced up to 720 Muslim Brotherhood supporters to death on charges of killing two police personnel and attacking police stations in the cities of Matay and Al-Adwa there on the wake of the dispersal of pro-Morsi sit-in camps on 14 August 2013.

Egyptian police went inside Alexandria University on Monday and fired teargas to disperse protesting students who clashed with administrative security on campus. Students who ""support the Muslim Brotherhood"" used fireworks while the administrative security responded with fire extinguishers. Several were injured.
A Muslim Brotherhood supporter was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Damietta on Monday in clashes between supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood and their opponents.
Anti-coup night time demonstrations were staged in several Egyptian governorates
Defusal: Sappers on Tuesday [29 April] managed to defuse a makeshift bomb which was found inside Faculty of Agriculture on Al-Azhar University campus [in Cairo].
On 29 April, there were protests in front of Cairo University in which students chanted slogans against the government and armed forces.
Three ""extremists"" were killed in a security operation by the Egyptian army in Northern Sinai on Tuesday.
Three ""extremists"" were killed in a security operation by the Egyptian army in Northern Sinai on Tuesday.
Three ""extremists"" were killed in a security operation by the Egyptian army in Northern Sinai on Tuesday.
At least five people were wounded and a house was torched when clashes were renewed on Tuesday in the Nile Delta city of Damietta, north of Cairo

Dozens of the 6 April Movements supporters staged a protest on Wednesday [30 April] outside the Journalists Syndicate to slam a court ruling that was issued Monday banning the movements activities and confiscating all its buildings.
Student sources have said that ""the Egyptian police attacked Al-Azhar University students with tear bombs and birdshot shotgun shells
Anti-coup activists in 90 Egyptian prisons will begin an uprising in their prisons .
Train movement was halted on Wednesday between the Nile Delta cities of Tanta and al-Malha when factory workers cut off the railroad to protest the delayed payment of their salaries
In Giza, supporters of Morsi staged several rallies, causing traffic jams.
In Banha [north of Cairo], members of the MB staged several marches in three districts of Al-Qalubiyah.
Members of the MB staged several marches in districts of Al-Qalubiyah.
In Al-Minya Governorate [Upper Egypt], dozens of MB supporters staged rallies. The protesters raised photos of deposed president Muhammad Morsi and chanted anti-police and army slogans.
Hundreds of the MB supporters staged rallies and human chains in Al-Sharqiyah, demanding reinstating what they called legitimacy.
Police arrested on Friday [2 May] a member of the Muslim Brotherhood [MB] during a protest in Al-Qusiyah city of Asyut [Governorate, Upper Egypt].
In Al-Buhayrah, police dispersed a rally of the MB group in Kafr al-Dawwar. The protesters shouted slogans against the army and police.
Supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) attacked Friday [2 May] a resident in Al-Fayyum Governorate [south of Cairo] after Friday prayers because of his objection to their frequent protests.

In Shibin al-Kum, Al-Minufiyah [north of Cairo] security forces dispersed a march that was staged by the MB following the Friday prayers. Four civilians were injured when the MB protesters threw stones and fireworks at the residents who faced the protest.
In Cairo, clashes erupted between police and scores of Al-Azhar University students of the MB. The students staged protests at the universities dormitory following Friday prayers.
A suicide bomber and a soldier were killed when the former blew himself up in South Sinai.
The death toll of clashes between Muslim Brotherhood supporters and residents in Alexandria rose to two after one person was shot in the abdomen and later died in Hanoville Area.

A second blast occurred about 30 kilometres away from Tor, on the road to Sharm al-Sheikh, killing one and injuring four. A suicide bomber targeted a bus transporting workers. The bomber was killed while four bus passengers were injured after the bus caught on fire.
Two captains and a conscript were injured when shooting broke out between supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood and police forces in Ezbet el-Walda area in Cairos Helwan
Supporters of presidential contender Abdel Fattah al-Sisi staged a demonstration at al-Qaed Ibrahim Mosque on Friday.

One person was killed and three others were injured when Muslim Brotherhood supporters clashed with residents of Alexandrias Agami area. Police arrested 20 pro-Brotherhood protesters during the clashes.
One police corporal was killed and four people were injured when a bomb exploded at the Masr al-Gedida Court in Cairo on Friday morning.
One person was killed in a blast that occurred near the Ahmed Orabi Metro Station in Cairos Ramsis on Friday evening. The blast was due to a bomb planted beneath a parked car.
A retired army officer was shot dead by unknown assailants in Northern Sinais Arish on Sunday
Defusal: A bomb was found and defused on Wednesday 7th May outside Barclays Egypt Bank in the district of Zamalik.
Clashes renewed at Al-Azhar university over student expulsions.
An """"urgent investigation"""" has been called for into the death of 46 year-old man who was killed inside Mattareya Police Station on 8 May.
Three MB members were arrested in Port Said over violence charges.
In Qina, six MB members were apprehended for storming a police station and inciting violence.
Al-Azhar University students clashed with police who fired tear gas to disperse the protesting students.
Supporters of ousted president Mohamed Morsi staged a protest after the Friday prayer in Al-Haram district of Giza.
In Al-Buhayrah governorate [north of Cairo], MB supporters held a march that roamed the streets to demand the release of MB detainees.
Supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) organized Friday [9 May] rallies and human chains in Cairos Alf Maskan district.
In Al-Minya, a number of MB elements raised photos of ousted president Muhammad Morsi and chanted anti-police/army slogans.
Supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) organized Friday [9 May] rallies and human chains in Al-Sharqiyah.
Clashes erupted in Al-Fayyum [south of Cairo] between anti-riot forces and MB protesters after the latter blocked several roads and fired fireworks. Three MB rioters were arrested.
In Ismailiyah security forces arrested three Muslim Brotherhood members involved in torching police cars.
Defusal: Bomb squads successfully diffused a bomb in Cairos Gesr al-Suez area on Friday

Unidentified gunmen opened fire on a camp for peacekeeping troops in the Goura area in North Sinai on Friday. Security forces in charge of securing the camp retaliated by shooting at the attackers who managed to escape. No one was injured in the shooting.
Bomb squads successfully diffused a bomb underneath Cairos Ahmed Orabi Bridge on Friday.
Dozens of pro-Sisi demonstrators gathered at al-Qaed Ibrahim Mosque in Alexandrias Mahatet al-Raml to express their support for Sisi in the imminent elections.
Security bodies arrested 22 pro-Muslim Brotherhood demonstrators with shotguns, ammunition, and petrol bombs in their possession in Cairo, Alexandria, Giza and Fayoum,
Police forces dispersed a pro-Muslim Brotherhood protest in Alexandrias Raml area on Friday. The police tear-gassed the demonstrators in front of al-Jihad Mosque in Raml after the noon prayer.
Security bodies arrested 22 pro-Muslim Brotherhood demonstrators with shotguns, ammunition, and petrol bombs in their possession in Cairo, Alexandria, Giza and Fayoum,
Police forces dispersed a pro-Muslim Brotherhood protest in Alexandrias Sidi Beshr area on Friday.
Arrests: Security officials said an operational leader of the Ansar Beit-al Maqdis group was arrested on Saturday in Beni Sueif, south of Cairo.
A conscript was killed and another was injured in exchange of gunfire with armed men in Al-Shaykh Zuwayyid [North Sinai governorate].
Arrests: Police arrested three leaders and four members of the Ajnad Misr group in Giza province.

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: Journalists at ""El-Badil"" newspaper started a sit-in inside Egypts Journalists Syndicate, in protest against the syndicates rejection of their appointments papers despite the fact that they met the eligibility requirements set by the syndicate.

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: More than 30 journalists at ""El-Badil"" newspaper continue, on Tuesday, their sit-in that was staged for the second day inside Egypts Journalists Syndicate, in protest against the syndicates rejection of their appointments papers despite the fact that they met the eligibility requirements set by the syndicate.

column16: Aswat Masriya (Egypt); Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: Police fired teargas on Tuesday to disperse dozens of student supporters of ousted president Mohamed Morsi protesting in front of Ain Shams University. A student was shot dead with bullet cartridges fired by the security forces on the student protest march.

Violent clashes left one person killed and 20 stores destroyed in Cairos Ezbet Nakhl district on Wednesday night. Confrontations erupted between the """"Muslim Brotherhood"""" and residents of the area. Four people were also arrested during the violence.
Students were arrested following violent clashes outside the Azhar University dorms in Cairos Nasr City on May 14.

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: Journalists will stage a protest, on 14th May, on the Syndicates staircase coinciding with the Syndicate councils meeting.
On 15 May students at Cairo University organised marches beginning at the universities dormitories but were confronted by security forces when they tried to leave the hostels.

At Al-Mansoura University, Muslim Brotherhood students set fire to the administrative security building. More than 500 Muslim Brotherhood students took part in violence during which five administrative security personnel were stabbed. Police forces interfered and dispersed the riot with tear-gas.
Supporters of ousted president Muhammad Morsi staged several protests following Friday prayers in Haram, causing traffic jams in many areas of the Giza district.

Security forces clashed with pro-Muslim Brotherhood students at the Cairo University hostel on Friday afternoon after the latter had tried to stage marches to roam the streets. Security forces then fired teargas bombs to disperse them. Students hurled stones at the police forces.

Clashes broke out at the Azhar University hostel after students organised a march at the hostel mosque. Security forces prevented the students from marching forward and tear-gassed them, prompting students to hurl stones and petrol bombs at the police.
Supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood in Alexandria torched a central security forces vehicle in Alexandria after police forces dispersed them using teargas in Abu Seliman area.
A police car was burned in Helwan, a south-Cairo suburb. Protesters allegedly dragged the driver out of the car and beat him before setting the car on fire.

Students at Alexandria University Faculty of Engineering rallied in front of the university on 17 May, burning banners with pictures of the two presidential candidates. Students attempted to march from the campus but after minor clashes with police retreated to university premises to continue their protests. No injuries were reported.

At least four people were wounded in a bomb explosion in a Cairo conference set up to support presidential contender Abdel Fattah al-Sisi at Ezbat al-Nakhl district. Two policemen and two civilians suffered mild injuries due to the explosion that was caused by an improvised explosive device.

A march organised by the Ain Shams Students Against the Coup (SAC) to mourn a student killed last week was forcibly dispersed by security forces Saturday. The march was forcibly dispersed with tear gas and birdshot with minor injuries to the students. Angry students vandalised buildings, burned the library and lab, destroyed administrative offices and trashed the deans office.
A police officer in Egypts Nile Delta province of Sharqiya was shot dead by unknown gunmen. Several militants opened fire on the policeman. A passerby was wounded in the attack.
Property destruction: Militants blew up a gas pipeline late Monday near Al-Arish airport in northern Sinai.
Gunmen shot dead two policemen in Minya, south of Cairo, on Monday.
Six ""extremists"" were killed in an air strike in North Sinai on Tuesday.
One student was killed and another was injured during clashes with the security forces inside Cairo University on Tuesday.

Army forces went inside Alexandria University on Tuesday afternoon to control clashes between security forces and protesting students who ""support the Muslim Brotherhood"". The security forces fired teargas bombs to disperse a protest by the Brotherhood students.
Gunmen travelling in a car opened fire on Tuesday on a group of Egyptian policemen outside Cairos Al-Azhar university, killing three and wounding nine others

250 students from Al-Azhar University dorms got out to the street of el-Khalifa el-Qaher, attempted to attack citizens and shops around the university and threw Molotov cocktails and fireworks at police.
Fierce clashes erupted Wednesday [21 May] between supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group and police outside al-Mahallah police station in Al-Gharbiyah Governorate, north of Cairo.

Seven police conscripts and two civilians were wounded on Wednesday in a bomb blast targeting a police vehicle in the town of Al-Arish. After the blast, gunfights erupted between the security forces and the assailants, who managed to escape.
The top leader of an al-Qaida-inspired group in Egypts restive Sinai and three of his associates were killed by security forces in the peninsula on Thursday.

Egyptian security forces dispersed on Thursday a protest staged in support of a political activist in Alexandrias Courniche Street. The police arrested a number of activists after dispersing their protest.

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: Egyptian security forces arrested a number of activists who took part in a protest march outside the headquarters of Egyptian Center for Economic & Social Rights (ECESR), after beating them. Security forces stormed the ECESRs headquarters, smashed its contents and arrested its employers.

A Christian was killed and two people, a Christian and a Muslim, were wounded when they were caught in the crossfire between two feuding groups of Muslims in the southern city of Luxor. The three were outside an Anglican church in the city center when the shooting took place.
Two Muslim Brotherhood members were killed when a bomb exploded in el-Tebbin area of Helwan. The bomb was believed to be in their possession

Clashes erupted after Friday [23 May] prayers between Pro-Muhammad Morsi protesters and security troops in Haram street. Police fired tear gas, while protesters hurled stones and firecrackers at the troops.
In the Delta city of Al-Mansurah, scores of MB members staged a protest. Security forces dispersed the protesters who tore up posters of the presidential candidates.
Twelve people were injured during clashes between supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood and residents of Abu-Hamad city in Al-Sharqiyah governorate [north of Cairo] on Friday [23 May].
Thousands of Hamdeen Sabbahi supporters gathered in a central Cairo square chanting: ""We the revolution are with Hamdeen.""
One person was killed and several wounded when Morsi supporters clashed with police after Friday prayers in Cairo.
Morsi supporters held brief protests in the central province of Minya. Police fired tear gas in some areas to disperse the protests.
Morsi supporters held brief protests in the Mediterranean city of Alexandria. Police fired tear gas in some areas to disperse the protests.
Suspected Islamic militants blew up a natural gas pipeline in Arish city, in the restive Sinai Peninsula.
A man was killed and three others were injured on Friday in Fayoum after clashes broke out between security forces and Muslim Brotherhood supporters.

A homemade bomb exploded on Friday afternoon next to al-Salam Mosque in Cairos Nasr City amid attempts of security forces to disperse a pro-Muslim Brotherhood march. No one was injured in the explosion.

In the northern Cairo district of Matareya, violence broke out during a protest by Muslim Brotherhood supporters. Anti-Brotherhood residents opened fire at the Islamist rally, but several protesters claimed the shots were fired by security forces dressed in civilian clothes.

Limited clashes broke out between supporters and opponents of presidential contender Abdel Fattah al-Sisi on Saturday in downtown Cairo. Several Sisi supporters attacked the marching demonstrators using petrol bombs and empty bottles.
Clashes took place in a polling station at Al-Umraniyah district but did not disrupt the presidential vote
Police dispersed a protest of Muslim Brotherhood members in Al-Fayyum.
Armed clashes erupted Monday [26 May] between members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group and supporters of presidential candidate Abd-al-Fattah al-Sisi in a village in Bani Suwayf [Upper Egypt].
Defusal: A bomb was defused in Al-Barajil village.
Defusal: A bomb squad dismantled two-barrelled explosive charge in the vicinity of school in Ausim [in Giza, near Cairo]"".
A youth activist who had campaigned for el-Sissi was killed. He was shot by gunmen as he drove home in the Islamist stronghold of Kirdassa on Cairos western outskirts.

At least 10 arrests were made early on the first day of voting as a number of Muslim Brotherhood affiliated protesters in Alexandria called for a boycott of the elections and voiced opposition to what it has called ""blood elections"".
Defusal: An explosive device was dismantled at a polling station in Al-Hawamidiyah in Sharqiyah.
A concrete bomb went off outside Al-Sadat school in the city of Al-Mahalla [north of Cairo].
A homemade bomb exploded in Fayoum on Monday outside of a polling station, resulting in no causalities. The event was denied by police and MENA news agency reported it to be defused.
One person was injured when a homemade bomb exploded in a Heliopolis neighborhood on Tuesday on the second day of a two-day presidential election.
An Egyptian soldier was shot dead by unknown attackers in Sinais Rafah on Wednesday.
A boy was wounded in a bomb explosion in Cairos southern suburb of Helwan on Wednesday
Unknown gunmen opened fire on Friday [30 May] at the central security forces camp in Rafah in North Sinai. Security forces exchanged fire with the attackers. No casualties were reported.
Supporters of ousted President Muhammad Morsi staged on Friday [30 May] a march in Haram district of Giza.
In Al-Qalyubiyah governorate [north of Cairo], MB supporters, staged rallies demanding the release of detained MB members.

Dozens of members of Muslim Brotherhood staged on Friday [30 May] rallies in a number of townships in Al-Minya. Security forces fired tear gas to disperse the crowds after the protesters chanted slogans against police and the army and the retired Field Marshal Abd-al-Fatah al-Sisi.
Two people were wounded in Fayoum during demonstrations held by the Muslim Brotherhood.
Two people were wounded in Cairo during demonstrations held by the Muslim Brotherhood.
Six people were wounded in Suez during demonstrations held by the Muslim Brotherhood.
A member of the Muslim Brotherhood [MB] group was severely injured when a homemade bomb, he was carrying, went off Friday [30 May] in Cairos neighbourhood of Manshiyah Nasir.

column8: Police Forces of Egypt (2013-2014) Prison Guards
column17: Egyptian security forces in Wadi al-Natrun prison, north of Cairo, stormed prison cells on 31 May and used water canons, electric shocks and batons to confront a prison uprising (sit-in) by Muslim Brotherhood (MB) prisoners. One prisoner died.
Tens of protesters gathered outside the Journalists Syndicate in central Cairo on Sunday to demonstrate the detention of an Al Jazeera journalist.
Egyptian police reported that a Brotherhood ""militant"" was killed in a raid in southern Cairo.

Students belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood staged a protest at Al-Mansurah University on Sunday [1 June] after the end of exams. Security forces fired tear gas canisters to disperse the protesters who answered back by throwing Molotov cocktail bottles.

A group of Islamic ""extremists"" burned shops owned by Coptic Christians near the ancient city of Luxor on Monday. The group threw gasoline bombs at the shops in the village of el-Mahameed near Luxor.

A number of political prisoners detained over membership in the Muslim Brotherhood shut down their prison cells from the inside at Wadi al-Natroon Prison and begun chanting against the army and police.
Activists organised protests with families of the detained activists at the Press Syndicate on Sunday evening and Monday at noon.
Workers at a nitrate company based in Suez continued to protest on Monday in objection to the dismissal of nine workers by a newly appointed company manager.
Unidentified gunmen fired a rocket propelled grenade (RPG) at the new civil protection building in Al-Zuhur neighborhood in Arish. No casualties reported.
Unidentified persons set fire to the Congress Party office in Al-Qalyubiyah governorate [north of Cairo]. They hurled Molotov cocktails at the party office.

column6: Police Forces of Egypt (2013-2014) Prison Guards
column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: There were reports of violence committed in a juvenile facility in Koum al-Dikka in Alexandria on the 4th of June amid the failure of the government to investigate the allegations and protect detainees from further abuse.
Al-Azhar University female students belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group staged on Wednesday [4 June] limited rallies on campus.
At the Fayoum prison, four detainees were whipped and subjected to electric shocks. The incident was denied by security sources.
Strikes: More than 20,000 prisoners began a hunger strike on Friday to protest ""against the ill-treatment and torture of detainees in Egypts prisons
Supporters of Morsi and the Muslim Brotherhood in Alexandria organised several protests on Friday. One police officer was injured with birdshot while ""security forces thwarted a Brotherhood rally.""

At least one was reportedly killed and two injured in clashes which followed a pro-Morsi rally in Ayat, in the suburbs of Giza. The casualties came after protesters clashed with other residents in the area.
A gunfight erupted between troops and Takfiri elements who were hiding in a building at Cairo-Assuit road in Minya province. The two were killed during the crackdown.
Al-Azhar University students staged on Friday [6 June] several rallies outside their dormitory in Cairos district of Nasr City.
Four rallies staged by supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood group were dispersed in Al-Minufiyah, north of Cairo, by residents without any clashes.
Al-Minya security forces dispersed Friday [6 June] anti-new President Abd-al-Fattah al-Sisi protests that were organized by members of the Muslim Brotherhood.

In Al-Fayyum [south of Cairo], security forces dispersed anti-Sisi protests and arrested four persons. Pro-ousted President Muhammad Morsi residents staged a protest in Tamiya where they cut off roads before security forces to disperse them and arrested four of them.

An arson attack on a police traffic booth outside the Al-Nahdah Square [outside Cairo University in Gizah, near Tahrir Square] was conducted by students belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group.

column6: Police Forces of Egypt (2014-) Prison Guards
column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: 19 girls were attacked by both of the jailers and prisoners in El Kanater prison on June 10, 2014; leaving them injured.

column8: Police Forces of Egypt (2013-2014) Prison Guards
column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: Al Azhar university students arrested during demonstrations, were punched, kicked and beaten with various objects including metal bars by both the common-law prisoners and the security agents in al-Qanater Prison.
An Egyptian soldier was killed on Wednesday in a shooting by unknown assailants in Arish city in Sinai. The shooting also resulted in the wounding of one conscript and a civilian.
Eight Muslim Brotherhood members were arrested in al-Hussainiya city during clashes.
A police officer was shot in the foot in clashes that occurred during a pro-Muslim Brotherhood march city in Sharqiya.
In Helwan, a number of protesters were caught with pistols and fireworks.
A police officer was killed on Friday as security forces dispersed a Muslim Brotherhood march in Cairos Maadi.
In Al-Minufiyah governorate [north of Cairo], two MB rallies were dispersed by residents, with no clashes reported.
In Al-Fayyum [south of Cairo], 22 rioters were arrested after the dispersal of rallies by scores of members of the group. Security forces used tear gas to disperse the rallies.
In Al-Buhayrah [north of Cairo] police dispersed a protest by MB members.
Demonstrators rallied for women's freedom after multiple attacks against women in Cairo.
Several hundred demonstrators gathered outside the Cairo Opera House on Saturday evening to protest the ongoing phenomenon of sexual harassment and sexual assault on Egyptian streets.

In the north Sinai city of el-Arish masked gunmen kidnapped a prominent Christian surgeon after they opened fire on his vehicle, wounding him in the leg. Hours later, they demanded a ransom of 10 million Egyptian pounds ($1.4 million).

A man died in a police station in Cairos Matariya district. He was suspected to have been beaten by police as he had blood on his lips, bruising on his face and head and his lungs were swollen and had hemorrhaged.

Eight suspected ""extremists"" were killed on Monday in clashes with the Egyptian military in Sheikh Zuweid city in north Sinai province. Troops raided two ""jihadist"" hideouts in the city, close to the border with the Palestinian Gaza Strip, killing eight militants and wounding one soldier.
On Monday, a Christian merchant was abducted near his house in el-Arish.
An Egyptian police officer was killed on Monday in a shootout during an ambush on a ""militant cell"" that belongs to the Muslim Brotherhood in South of Cairo.
Police arrested at least 14 protesters in Cairo and the southern city of Minya.
Cairo and Giza witnessed clashes between pro-Brotherhood demonstrators and local residents in the Bolaq al-Dakrour area.
The Interior Ministry said that security forces have dispersed protests by the Muslim Brotherhood and arrested scores in Alexandria, Port Said, Damietta, Fayyoum and Minya.
The Interior Ministry said that security forces have dispersed protests by the Muslim Brotherhood and arrested scores in Alexandria, Port Said, Damietta, Fayyoum and Minya.
The Interior Ministry said that security forces have dispersed protests by the Muslim Brotherhood and arrested scores in Alexandria, Port Said, Damietta, Fayyoum and Minya.
The Interior Ministry said that security forces have dispersed protests by the Muslim Brotherhood and arrested scores in Alexandria, Port Said, Damietta, Fayyoum and Minya.

column16: Daily News (Egypt); Egypt State Information Service
column17: The Interior Ministry said that security forces have dispersed protests by the Muslim Brotherhood and arrested scores in Fayyoum. Nineteen of the protesters in Fayoum were also charged with attacking the local security directorate.
Cairo and Giza witnessed clashes between pro-Brotherhood demonstrators and local residents in Matariya.
Two people were shot dead on Friday in clashes in Cairo between security forces, residents and supporters of Egypts ousted Islamist president Mohamed Morsi.
Four people were injured with gunshots and birdshot in clashes in Al-Qalyubiyah [north of Cairo].
On Saturday, a military raid in Sheik Zuweid killed eight militants and destroyed 31 huts, 10 vehicles and 20 bikes belonging to them.
Police arrested eight people in Cairos Boulaq neighbourhood, accused of attacking a police officer, attempting to take his weapon, and shooting and killing a passerby.
Police forces fired teargas bombs at clashing protesters to disperse them and arrested members from both parties near the presidential palace on Saturday.
At least 19 gunmen were killed in a security raid by the Egyptian army in Sheikh Zuweid city of Egypts North Sinai governorate.
An Egyptian police officer was killed in an exchange of fire during a security operation in the southern governorate of Sohag on Monday.

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: A police sergeant beat photojournalist on his head, which resulted in injuries to his head causing him to bleed before being transferred to the hospital. Skirmishes took place between a number of the newspapers journalists and a number of police secretaries from the other. As a result, five of the newspapers journalists were wounded. Afterwards, the sergeant along with a number of police secretaries besieged the newspapers building.
Five makeshift bombs exploded at four Cairo metro stations on Wednesday morning. One person was wounded at Ezbet en Nakhal
Five makeshift bombs exploded at four Cairo metro stations on Wednesday morning, wounding two people in Shubra al Khaymah.
A makeshift bomb placed under a car exploded near a courthouse north of Cairo, wounding a woman, and a second was defused at the site.
Five makeshift bombs exploded at four Cairo metro stations on Wednesday morning. No casualties were reported in Ghamra.
Five makeshift bombs exploded at four Cairo metro stations on Wednesday morning, wounding one person.
Defusal: A bomb was detected at Hilmiyat al-Zaytun [eastern Cairo] station at 8.20 a.m., but it was defused.
Unidentified gunmen opened fire intensively on Wednesday [25 June] against a security checkpoint in Aswan with no casualties reported. The attackers fled after security forces engaged in a shootout.
Two people were killed Thursday and their bodies burned in an attack by an Arab family on a rival Nubian clan.

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: A number of pro-Ashour lawyers severely beat journalists, tore the clothes of some of them, and seized some of their equipment.
One police officer, Captain Khaled Al-Sayed, was wounded in the face by birdshot during a protest dispersal on Haram Street in Giza.
The Ministry of Interior announced Friday evening that 51 alleged Muslim Brotherhood members were arrested during the latest round of post-Friday prayer protests.
The Ministry of Interior announced Friday evening that 51 alleged Muslim Brotherhood members were arrested during the latest round of post-Friday prayer protests.
The Ministry of Interior announced Friday evening that 51 alleged Muslim Brotherhood members were arrested during the latest round of post-Friday prayer protests.
The Ministry of Interior announced Friday evening that 51 alleged Muslim Brotherhood members were arrested during the latest round of post-Friday prayer protests.
The Ministry of Interior announced Friday evening that 51 alleged Muslim Brotherhood members were arrested during the latest round of post-Friday prayer protests.
The Ministry of Interior announced Friday evening that 51 alleged Muslim Brotherhood members were arrested during the latest round of post-Friday prayer protests.
Six Muslim Brotherhood members were caught in Ain Shams with two birdshot guns and ten Molotov cocktails.
Two vehicles driven by unknown militants exchanged fire with a checkpoint near Al-Arish city, but fled the area leaving nobody injured.
Two brothers were shot dead Friday [27 June] while accompanying a police officer in Al-Arish.
Two bombings on Saturday in a Cairo suburb killed a teenager and her mother. The makeshift bombs planted in a telecommunications being built in the October 6 suburb were detonated by a mobile phone.

Ansar Beit-al Maqdis shot four soldiers dead on Saturday night in North Sinais Rafah. The attackers stopped a bus the soldiers were taking by force and shot the four soldiers. The four recruits were coming back to the peninsula after a holiday and were not in security uniform.
A group of armed masked men in Sinai kidnapped at gunpoint a Christian engineer who works at a cement factory in the Peninsula on Monday.
Two Egyptian police officers were killed and 13 people wounded on Monday in bomb blasts near the Heliopolis presidential palace.

Egyptian security forces arrested seventeen high school students during a student protest in front of the Ministry of Education on Tuesday. A 16-year old student was photographed being beaten on the day of the protest by police officers and an unidentified militant.
In north Sinai on 2 July, an RPG was fired at a security convoy in Al-Arish area, but no casualties were reported.
Two men were killed while apparently preparing an explosive device in an apartment in Kirdasah, Giza.

column16: Aswat Masriya (Egypt); Menastream; Nile News TV
column17: Unidentified assailants threw two bombs at police stations in Giza on Thursday morning, no causalities were reported. The incident occurred in Imbabah, Giza, without injuries.
Three policemen were wounded when their checkpoint in a southern district of the capital was attacked and set on fire by protesters late Thursday.
Three elements were killed by army and police forces in Wefak Village south of Rafah while trying to plant bombs in the area.
Two militant extremists were killed by army and police forces as they rode a motorbike while carrying two bombs in Rafah.

Army forces killed eight militant extremists in a clampdown in the Sinai Peninsula on Thursday night, security sources said. Security forces killed eight and arrested two in the crackdown, which was south of Sheikh Zoueid and Rafah
Dozens of Brotherhood supporters demonstrated in Mohandseen and Matariya districts, raising photos of the ousted president. The security forces intervened to disperse them as well.

A crackdown by police and army forces aiming to purge Bab Sidot area south of Rafah from armed militants eliminated 12 militants, who are believed to be members of al-Qaida-inspired Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis group.
The ministry arrested 157 rioters in Alexandria, Daqahliya, Monofeya, Damietta, Fayoum, Minya, and Assiut and found petrol bombs and fireworks in their possession.
The ministry arrested 157 ""rioters"" in Alexandria, Daqahliya, Monofeya, Damietta, Fayoum, Minya, and Assiut and found petrol bombs and fireworks in their possession.

Dozens of Brotherhood supporters demonstrated in Mohandseen and Matariya districts, raising photos of the ousted president. The security forces intervened to disperse them as well.
Three Muslim Brotherhood supporters were arrested in Qena after demonstrating.

Egyptian security forces dispersed on Thursday a protest staged by supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood on the anniversary of President Mohamed Mursis ouster. The protesters blocked Haram road before the security forces fired teargas at them. The Anti-Coup Alliance claims that three protesters were shot dead in Haram when security forces dispersed protests. State-run Al-Ahram reported that one was killed and others were injured during the dispersal.
In the capitals Ain Shams district, black-clad riot policemen fired tear gas and shotguns to disperse a few dozen protesters who burned tyres on a road.
Muslim Brotherhood supporters were arrested for organising protests in Beni Suef.
Muslim Brotherhood supporters were arrested for organising protests in Beheira.
Muslim Brotherhood supporters were arrested for organising protests in Suez.
Unidentified assailants threw two makeshift bombs at police stations in the El-Abaseya district, earlier on Thursday, but they did not explode.

A conscript was shot dead while two officers and another conscript were injured in clashes between security forces and Muslim Brotherhood supporters in Cairos Helwan on Thursday night. Muslim Brotherhood elements hurled petrol bombs on a building for Ein Helwan security forces, causing the building to catch fire.
A bomb blast in a train in the Egyptian city of Alexandria on Thursday wounded nine people.
Clashes broke out on Friday afternoon between groups of Muslim Brotherhood supporters and security forces in Cairos Matariya. A 15 year old died of birdshot wounds.
Four members of the Muslim Brotherhood were injured at a square in Fayoum province.

Two coffeeshops in Alexandria were reportedly attacked by the police because they opened during daytime in Ramadan. The furniture was broken and persons inside assaulted. The two coffeeshops are owned by the two Coptic brothers.
Security forces fired teargas bombs at the demonstrators in Ain Shams to disperse them, injuring 17. There are reports of one death in the clashes, but they have not been confirmed.

In one demonstration in Cairos twin city of Giza, unrest started after a funeral service held in a mosque for a demonstrator who was killed in clashes on Thursday. Mourners began chanting as they filed out of the mosque to march in protest in the Haram district, but they were dispersed by police firing tear gas.
One member of the Muslim Brotherhood was injured in clashes at Gizas Pyramids City.

Four people were killed as an explosion occurred while they were making homemade bombs in a Fayoum village. The police found around 20 other bombs ready for detonation inside the poultry farm where the three were making the bombs.
Members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group staged on Friday two marches in Sidi Bishr and Hadra areas in eastern Alexandria. Troops managed to disperse both marches and arrested rioters.
Members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group staged on Friday two marches in Sidi Bishr and Hadra areas in eastern Alexandria. Troops managed to disperse both marches and arrested rioters.
Scores of citizens and drivers have gathered under a bridge connecting Shubra al-Khaymah city and Musturud, in Al-Qalyubiyay [north of Cairo] in protest at fuel price increase.

Unidentified gunmen shot dead a First Lieutenant in the Mediterranean city of Damietta. The officer was in his car accompanied by his fiance in the early hours of Monday morning when masked gunmen opened fire on the vehicle.

One conscript was killed and four others were wounded in a bomb blast in Rafah on Wednesday [9 July]. One conscript was killed and four others were wounded in a bomb blast in Rafah on Wednesday [9 July].

Security forces in North Sinai aborted on Thursday an attempt to smuggle 20 Grad rockets from Gaza through tunnels in Rafah. Violent clashes broke out between security forces on one hand and Egyptian and Palestinian extremists on the other as the latter attempted to smuggle 20 Grad rockets and their bases

Two people were shot dead in clashes in Cairo on Friday as supporters of deposed Egyptian president Mohamed Morsi staged protests after weekly Muslim prayers. The two were killed when hit by birdshot in the cities northern district of Matariya.
A number of pro-Morsi marches were staged in various provinces across the country, including Cairos neighboring city Giza.
A number of pro-Morsi marches were staged in various provinces across the country, including Beheira.
A number of pro-Morsi marches were staged in various provinces across the country, including Minya.

A number of pro-Morsi marches were staged in various provinces across the country, including Beni Sweif, where official media said Morsis supporters set four police vehicles on fire. A number of protesters were arrested.
Three small bombs exploded on Sunday in a western Cairo suburb, targeting an electricity transmission pylon and cutting power to the area for nearly an hour.
Two rockets targeting a military post killed one soldier and wounded three others in Al Arish. The attack was claimed by Ansar Beit al-Maqdis.

One rocket fell outside a shop in the south of El-Arish, capital of north Sinai, killing seven civilians, including a child, and injuring 25 other people. The attack was claimed by Ansar Beit al-Maqdis.
Dozens of activists staged a protest in Cairos downtown on Sunday in solidarity with the Palestinian people in the Gaza strip
A homemade grenade exploded in the north of Cairo governorate of Gharbiya on Monday, but no causalities or deaths were reported.

Two rockets, reportedly launched from Sinai in the early hours of Tuesday, landed in Eilat. Reuters cited Israeli security officials saying the rockets originated in Sinai, fired by Islamist militants in an attempt to upstage Cairos efforts to mediate a truce.
Seven militants and one soldier were killed in an army raid near the village of Sheikh Zuweid in Sinai on Tuesday evening.
A Sudanese man was assaulted by a group of Egyptian men with a blunt object in Aim Shams district of Cairo. It is believed he was attacked because he was Sudanese.
In mid July, close to Al Arish, Ansar Beit al Maqdis allegedly hit and damaged an Egyptian navy ship with a missile.

column6: Police Forces of Egypt (2014-) Prison Guards
column17: A 20-year old student was transferred to Wadi El Natrun prison on 16 July 2014 where he was beaten up by officers on several occasions. During his detention he had his hands handcuffed behind his back and repeatedly beaten by three officers on his entire body and face until he started to bleed heavily; he was also sexually harassed by two other detainees under the officers orders.
An explosive device, which was planted in the way where army carriers often pass, exploded on Al-Arish-Rafah road, northeast of Cairo. No causalities were reported.
Two conscripts were wounded on Thursday morning when gunmen shot at them in the Goura area south of Sheikh Zoueid.

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: The Muslim Brotherhood groups supporters demonstrated at Al-Mohandseen.

Bomb squads aborted an attempt to blow up the Giza railway using five gas cylinders. An unidentified man driving a motorcycle had placed gas cylinders at the railway next to the Saqiet Mekki underground metro station.
The Ministry of Interior said on Friday it arrested eight ""rioters"" in Giza organised by supporters of ousted Islamist President Mohamed Morsi to decry the latest Israeli offensive in Gaza.
Unknown gunmen killed on Friday a police officer who was on his way home in North Sinais Arish.
The Ministry of Interior said on Friday it arrested three ""rioters"" in Luxor organised by supporters of ousted Islamist President Mohamed Morsi to decry the latest Israeli offensive in Gaza.
The Ministry of Interior said on Friday it arrested seven ""rioters"" in Alexandria organised by supporters of ousted Islamist President Mohamed Morsi to decry the latest Israeli offensive in Gaza.
Property destruction: Unknown militants blew up a natural gas pipeline south of Egypts Arish city of North Sinai governorate late Saturday.

Ansar Beit al-Maqdis claimed responsibility for killing 22 soldiers in an attack on a military checkpoint in New Valleys Farafra Oasis on Saturday evening. Three gunmen were killed and four other soldiers were injured in the attack in which heavy weapons and rocket-propelled grenades were used. An exchange of fire between the soldiers and Ansar Beit al-Maqdis caused an ammunition warehouse to explode after a rocket-propelled grenade hit it.
A rocket believed to be fired from the Gaza Strip hit Egypts Rafah border crossing on Saturday, wounding a soldier.

Suspected Islamic militants gunned down two Bedouin tribal leaders in the restive northern region of the Sinai Peninsula over their alleged connection to authorities. Officials say that masked militants opened fire on each of them near their homes before fleeing.
The Egyptian army launched a security crackdown on Tuesday night in several areas in North Sinai, killing two ""extremists"".
Unknown gunmen killed on Tuesday a security guard who was on his way home in North Sinais Arish.

Army forces killed three extremists and injured two others in a security crackdown in North Sinai on Wednesday night including the brother of the alleged leader of an al-Qaida-inspired group called Ansar Beit al-Maqdis. ""The three extremists were carrying rockets on their way to the Egyptian borders, when the army blew up their car.' The army added that two others were injured in a fire exchange with security forces and 16 suspects were arrested.

Egypts pro-Morsi alliance staged demonstrations in the streets of the capital and governorates of Egypt for the third week running to denounce the Zionist aggression on the Gaza Strip. Reports by state-run Al-Ahram said that security forces used tear gas on the demonstrators.

At least 26 extremists were killed in military raids that continued from Friday afternoon until Saturday evening at Sheikh Zuweid in response to the killing of two police and military officers by gunmen on Friday. The extremists belonged to the Sinai- based al-Qaida-inspired Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis group.

Members of Ansar Beit al-Maqdis killed two policemen in North Sinais Sheikh Zoueid on Friday. The gunmen attacked a police vehicle carrying a brigadier-general and his son, a police officer. Security forces fired back at the gunmen who managed to escape.
Fifty protesters assembled in Fayoum to denounce Israels actions in Gaza. Reports by state-run Al-Ahram said that security forces used tear gas on the demonstrators.
A soldier was wounded by gunfire on Saturday near the town of Rafah.
Four children were killed on Saturday in Egypts Sinai Peninsula when a mortar round hit their home, in an apparent attack by militants targeting soldiers.

Security forces located and killed on Sunday night one of the most ""dangerous"" members of the militant group Ansar Beit Al-Maqdis, in the Canal governorate of Ismailia. The suspect was killed during his arrest operation, after he allegedly tried to attack security forces with an explosive device.
Seven ""extremists"" were killed and five were wounded in a fire exchange with security forces in North Sinais Rafah.
A nine-year-old girl was killed on Monday when a rocket hit the ground outside a house in Egypts Sinai Peninsula, in an apparent attack targeting soldiers.

The Armed Forces announced that a dangerous ""militant"" element"" was killed in an exchange of fire with army troops. The operation resulted in the arrest of three others in Al-Abtal village in Eastern Qunaytirah district.

Scores of Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group members protested on Abu Zabal al-Khanka road [north of Cairo] after clashes erupted between them and police forces that left several injured on both sides. Two police officers and conscripts were injured in then clashes.

The police dispersed a march staged by supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood group in Gizas district of Al-Talbiyah. Security troops fired tear gas at the participants as they set off fireworks at residents.

At least five extremists and a noncommissioned military officer were killed on Tuesday in a security raid on hiding spots in Egypts North Sinai province. The six were killed in a fire exchange during the raid launched by security forces on extremists hideouts in a town in south of Sheikh Zuweid city.

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: A journalist was assaulted by Al Ahram Foundations security personnel, while he was trying to enter its building, where he intended to stage a sit-in.
An Egyptian army officer was killed on Tuesday afternoon in clashes between security forces and ""militants"" in North Sinais Rafah.
Six Egyptian soldiers were killed in an Israeli airstrike at the Gaza border area.
Three people were killed when two bombs they were carrying in a pick-up truck went off prematurely south of Cairo.
Militants carried out a sabotage act in which it exploded the trestles of the 220kv tower in Atfih area in Giza, south of Cairo. The explosion caused the tower to collapse.

Muslim villagers of the village of Ezbet Yacoub al-Bahriya (Ezbet Yacoub North) attacked with Molotov cocktails a house under construction. Clashes broke out between the Muslim and Coptic villagers but the police intervened.
It was reported that the military police physically attacked a man on the Cairo-Suez Road. The military police then allegedly arrested the man from his car while breaking its windows.
At least 11 extremists were killed in a security crackdown in several areas in North Sinai. The security forces had a fire exchange with militants in their hideouts.
A shell fell in a residential area in Arish during clashes between the army and ""extremists"", but no causalities were reported.
A boy was killed and four people were seriously injured after a mortar shell fell on a house in North Sinais Sheik Zuwied on Sunday. No group has yet claimed responsibility for the attack.

Muslim ""fundamentalists"" in the Upper Egyptian village of Ezbet Yacoub al-Qibliya (Ezbet Yacoub South) in Minya, launched a Molotov attack against the homes and shops of the Coptic villagers. Fatalities are currently unknown.
A US soldier with the Multinational Force and Observers mission (MFO) in Egypts Sinai was wounded when gunmen shot at his camp near the northern Sinai village of El-Joura late Monday.

Five Egyptian police were killed Tuesday during a shootout with assailants. The unidentified men opened fire on a police car carrying an officer and four agents on the coastal highway between second city Alexandria and Marsa Matruh. Between 2 and 4 gunmen were also killed in the clash.
Scores of journalists on Tuesday [5 August] organized a protest at the headquarters of Syndicate of Journalists against the Israeli offensive on the Gaza Strip.

Three militants were killed in a security crackdown in North Sinai on Tuesday. The army also arrested six wanted extremists and destroyed an SUV vehicle along with 16 motorcycles used by them in their attacks on security forces.
Unidentified assailants shot and injured an army conscript on duty in the city of Rafah, North Sinai on Tuesday evening.
Ansar Beit al-Maqdis, which now calls itself the State of Sinai, announced that it killed a US oil worker in August 2014 in the Western Desert region.
A woman was killed and two other people were injured in an exchange of fire between security forces and unidentified gunmen at a Rafah checkpoint in North Sinai on Wednesday.

Demolition: Egypt's armed forces destroyed five tunnels and apprehended five Palestinian nationals attempting to cross into North Sinai at Rafah during operations taking place between 7 and 10 August.

An Islamist protester was killed during a clash with Egyptian police in Banha. Supporters of deposed Islamist president Mohamed Morsi confronted civilian opponents during the march firing birdshot and throwing petrol bombs at policemen. Location not specified.
Muslim Brotherhood members clashed with the security forces using guns and fireworks in Giza, Alexandria, Bani Suwayf, Al-Fayyum and Al-Minya.
Muslim Brotherhood members clashed with the security forces using guns and fireworks in Giza, Alexandria, Bani Suwayf, Al-Fayyum and Al-Minya.
Muslim Brotherhood members clashed with the security forces using guns and fireworks in Giza, Alexandria, Bani Suwayf, Al-Fayyum and Al-Minya.

Muslim Brotherhood members clashed with the security forces using guns and fireworks in Giza, Alexandria, Bani Suwayf, Al-Fayyum and Al-Minya.
Non-violent activity: Egypts administrative court dissolved the Freedom and Justice Party (FJP), the Muslim Brotherhoods political wing.
Three masked gunmen opened fire at residents as they attempted to catch a man with four makeshift bombs in Al-Qalyubiyah province. No casualties reported.

The army carried out counterterrorism raids in the governorate of North Sinai, during which an exchange of gunfire with militants left two dead, while 13 were arrested, and a number of vehicles 'used in the implementation of militant operations' were destroyed.

A South Sudanese journalist was attacked by an unidentified group on Monday [11 August]. The attackers are said to have been a mixture of South Sudanese, Egyptians and others. Some South Sudanese internet sources have speculated that the victim was targeted due to his work of being a journalist.
The armed forces killed nine militants in a fire exchange in North Sinai as part of its security crackdown on militants in the peninsula.
A child was injured in an improvised bomb that went off in Al-Miraj in Maadi [Cairo] and Civil Defence Forces defuse two other bombs.

Security forces dispersed a student protest staged outside Cairo University decrying the expulsion of university students. Students attacked security forces with fireworks before security used teargas to force them back inside the university campus.
Defusal: Sappers dismantled a makeshift bomb that was found inside one of the carriages of a train at Luxor station.
Arrests: Security forces arrested on Wednesday [13 August] a key Islamist militant who has been involved in attacking policemen and troops in Al-Arish.
Pro-Morsi supporters torched a police car in the Haram neighbourhood.
Defusal: Security experts defused six bombs found in the international garden in Fayyum, western south Cairo.
Police fired tear gas during clashes with pro-Morsi demonstrators in the town of Kerdasa, southwest of Cairo.
Police fired tear gas during clashes with pro-Morsi demonstrators in three neighbourhoods of the Mediterranean city of Alexandria.
Defusal: Bomb disposal teams defused 23 homemade explosive devices left behind by Brotherhood elements in the provinces of Cairo, Giza, Qalyoubiya, Daqahliya, Sharqiya, Gharbiya and Beni Sweif
Police forces clashed with Pro-Morsi supporters in Sharqiya.
Property destruction: Assailants set fire to electrical facilities in the Nile Delta town of Abu Hamad.
An Islamist protester and a policeman were shot dead in Cairos Mohandiseen.
A number of people were injured in Damietta in protests held by the Muslim Brotherhood.
A number of people were injured in Ismailia in protests held by the Muslim Brotherhood.
Defusal: Bomb disposal teams defused 23 homemade explosive devices left behind by Brotherhood elements in the provinces of Cairo, Giza, Qalyoubiya, Daqahliya, Sharqiya, Gharbiya and Beni Sweif
Two people were shot dead at a workshop in Ard al-Liwaa. Further details of the incident were not reported.
The family of a victim in Cairos Matariyah clashes were assaulted verbally and physically when they reported the incident at a police station.
Police arrested tens of protesters affiliated with the deposed president and his Muslim Brotherhood group in Qena.
Unknown men set alight a bus which carries the staff of the public transportation authority in Hilwan, south Cairo.
Scores of members of the Muslim Brotherhood group triggered violence on the first anniversary of the dispersal of two pro-MB sit-ins last year. Bomb disposal squads defused bombs left behind.
Scores of members of the Muslim Brotherhood group triggered violence on the first anniversary of the dispersal of two pro-MB sit-ins last year. Bomb disposal squads defused bombs left behind.
Scores of members of the Muslim Brotherhood group triggered violence on the first anniversary of the dispersal of two pro-MB sit-ins last year. Bomb disposal squads defused bombs left behind.
Scores of members of the Muslim Brotherhood group triggered violence on the first anniversary of the dispersal of two pro-MB sit-ins last year. Bomb disposal squads defused bombs left behind.
Two citizens were killed and three others were injured in Matariya area of Cairo following clashes between Muslim Brotherhood supporters and police forces.
A police sergeant was killed and one person was wounded, when unknown assailants fired at them in Cairos southern suburb of Helwan. They were in their private car.
A bomb exploded in Fayyum injuring a child.
Members of the Muslim Brotherhood blocked the Cairo-Fayyum highway and set fire to tires.
In Damanur [north of Cairo], MB supporters blocked Damanhur- Hush Isa highway. The Brotherhood supporters burnt car tires, disrupting traffic in the area.

In Al-Buhayrah [north of Cairo], MB female members staged a rally that roamed the streets of Abu-Hummus city on the occasion of the first anniversary of the dispersal of Rabiah al-Adawiyah and Al-Nahda sit-ins.
Supporters of former president Muhammad Morsi staged on Thursday [14 August] a protest on Haram Street [Pyramids area] in Giza.
In Al-Fayyum [south of Cairo], 10 were arrested after police dispersed a Brotherhood rally. They were arrested over charges of instigating violence, rioting and attacking police stations.

Minya security forces dispersed a rally staged by scores of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group to mark the first anniversary of the dispersal of their protest camps in 2013. Forces arrested six of the protesters with firecrackers and Molotov cocktails in their possession.

Police forces at Port Said Security Directorate dispersed a protest by members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group in Port Said. They also attempted to carry out riot acts and one of them was arrested while driving a motorcycle and carrying gasoline bottle to incite rioting.
In Suhaj, three MB members were arrested over charges of instigating violence, rioting and attacking police stations.
Members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group staged a protest in Abu-Zabal-El Khanka street. Police dispersed the protest.

column16: Youm7; Ikhwanweb; Nile News TV; ON TV
column17: Unknown men threw Molotov Cocktails at Al-Sharq Police Station in Al-Sharqiyah Governorate, eastern north Cairo.
Defusal: Security bodies defused a homemade after unidentified people planted it in a railway booth in Abu-Zabal level crossing.
Pro-Morsi protesters blocked roads with burning tyres in Cairos Maadi suburb.

column16: Ikhwanweb; Youm7; ON TV; Nile News TV
column17: 35 unknown men attacked the municipalities office in Ayn Shams and Al-Marj districts, destroying it.
Five people including a police officer were wounded in a protest in north Cairo.
An armed and masked Morsi supporter was killed by security forces south of Cairo when they intervened to break up a clash between two groups.
Two people were killed when pro-Morsi supporters clashed with their opponents in Cairos western neighbourhood of Faisal. Riot police later intervened with 3 conscripts injured.
A policeman sexually assaulted a 16-year-old girl with intellectual disabilities in Cairos Imbaba police station where the girl had been detained.
Protesters torched a public bus in a Cairo suburb after forcing the driver and passengers out. Police arrested at least 14 protesters at the events.
Defusal: Explosive experts dismantled a bomb found inside a train in Cairo.
Two bombs exploded in Al Minufiyah governorate knocking down an electricity pylon.

Democracy Index reported three attacks on journalists covering the protests (coded separately) commemorating the first anniversary of the protest camp dispersal last August. Locations were not specified.
Clashes between MB supporters and police forces were reported in Haram.
Clashes between MB supporters and police forces were reported in Alexandria.

Following Friday prayers 'elements of the [Muslim] Brotherhood' attempted to 'launch marches to block roads' and clashed with local residents. Reports of live ammunition and bird shot prompted the police to intervene.

Security authorities dispersed gatherings of Muslim Brotherhood members after Friday prayers in Qalyubiyah . Police dispersed the crowds after they blocked roads and clashed with residents.
The Freedom and Justice Party (FJP), reported that three people had been killed and tens injured during clashes with security forces in Matariya.

Arrests: Six militant cells affiliated to the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group were arrested in the governorates of Giza, Menoufiya, Gharbiya, Kafr el-Sheikh, Sharqiya and Alexandria. The arrested confessed about their plans which included blasting power stations, targeting policemen and army officers.

The arrested confessed about their plans which included blasting power stations, targeting policemen and army officers.

The arrested confessed about their plans which included blasting power stations, targeting policemen and army officers.

Arrests: Six militant cells affiliated to the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group were arrested in the governorates of Giza, Menoufiya, Gharbiya, Kafr el-Sheikh, Sharqiya and Alexandria. The arrested confessed about their plans which included blasting power stations, targeting policemen and army officers.
Defusal: Explosive experts defused a bomb planted inside a power transformer station in Shibin al-Kawm, Al-Minufiyah [north of Cairo] on Saturday [16 August].

On 17 August, the chairman of Zamalek sports club claimed members of the Ultra White Knights attempted to assassinate him outside the Zamalek club. He said he was forced to ""duck from the gunfire"" as he was leaving the club. He also claimed the two people accompanying him were shot.
A police conscript was killed and another injured on Monday [18 August] in an armed attack on a checkpoint in Al-Santah town, Al-Gharbiyah governorate [north of Cairo].

Security forces dispersed a demonstration in Alexandria that ended with the arrest of six supporters of former President Mohamed Morsi. The protesters were chanting slogans hostile to the army, the police, and attempting to provoke a wave of chaos and disrupting traffic.

Arrests: Security forces arrested 30 people suspected of taking part in militant operations as part of ongoing efforts to tackle militant activity in the Sinai Peninsula. 30 militant hotbeds, vehicles and tunnels were destroyed.

North Sinai residents launched on Tuesday [19 August] an anti-terror campaign dubbed ""We Will Not Forget You"". The campaign was launched following a militant attack that left eight policemen dead and wounded.
The decapitated bodies of four men were found in Sheik Zuweiyid in the Sinai Peninsula. Ansar Beit-al Maqdis later claimed responsibility.

column16: Aswat Masriya (Egypt); Egypt State Information Service
column17: Between 2 and 4 Islamist militants were killed in North Sinai in an extensive security campaign. The army also destroyed eight tunnels used for smuggling in Rafah.
Six army recruits were wounded after an explosive device blew up in a bus they were in in North Sinais Rafah.

Police conscripts of the Egyptian Central Security Forces (CSF) went on strike Friday in Ismailia, demanding better treatment and working conditions. The strike resulted into a confrontation between the soldiers and their officers, leaving two injured.
The Ministry of Interior said it arrested 35 ""rioters"" following nationwide protests organized by the Muslim Brotherhood.
The Ministry of Interior said it arrested 35 ""rioters"" following nationwide protests organized by the Muslim Brotherhood.
The Ministry of Interior said it arrested 35 ""rioters"" following nationwide protests organized by the Muslim Brotherhood.
