The Ministry of Interior said it arrested 35 ""rioters"" following nationwide protests organized by the Muslim Brotherhood.
One woman was killed in the Cairo neighbourhood of Ain Shams on Friday as a protest supporting ousted Islamist President Mohamed Mursi turned violent. The woman was shot by security forces.
One soldier was injured during a security campaign against a group of militants in Sinais Sheikh Zuweid region on Sunday.
A citizen was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Sheikh Zuweid, North Sinai. The citizen died due to a gunshot wound in to the abdomen.
Tens of protesters gathered outside the Press Syndicate in downtown Cairo on Monday condemning the ongoing detention of hunger-striking activists.
Egyptian troops killed a militant element on a motorcycle in Qawayat area in North Sinai in an extensive security campaign targeting their hideouts.
Three militants traveling in a 4x4 in Nasraniyah area, were killed in a shootout with military troops in North Sinai in an extensive security campaign targeting their hideouts.
Four militants riding a 4x4 in Zawara area were killed and six others were killed after clashes with troops in North Sinai in an extensive security campaign targeting their hideouts.
Demolition: Three tunnel openings were destroyed in Rafah. A field hospital used by militants was also destroyed in the security campaign. A power generator and an oxygen tank were seized.
Animal rights activists held a demonstration Tuesday in front of the Gezira Club in Zamalek to denounce the mass animal cruelty that recently took place and sparked outrage on social media.
A peaceful demonstration was held in the port of Damietta, 200km north of Cairo.
Several police officers beat an Egyptian citizen in reprisal for his participation in a demonstration in Damietta and his opposition to the government.

A man was kidnapped on Thursday and later found beheaded in Nagaa Shabana in North Sinais Rafah. In a video allegedly released by the Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis militant group on Thursday, the group claimed responsibility for the execution, accusing the deceased of providing intelligence to Israel.

A suspect was shot dead in a fire exchange with police forces in Al-Khankah city in Qalyubiyah. Al-Qalyubiyah prosecution ordered to remand three policemen in custody pending investigation over charges of humiliating the body.
21 Muslim Brotherhood protesters were arrested Friday [29 August] in Alexandria [Governorate, north of Cairo] over staging illegal protests and instigating violence.

column16: AP; Arabic Network for Human Rights Information; Daily News (Egypt)
column17: 8 people were arrested in Alexandria accused of protesting without authorisation. Some of them were beaten and their houses raided by security forces.
Sinai residents found two decapitated youths bodies in south Rafah after they were kidnapped on 30th August.

A large crowd of mourners attending the funeral service of a human rights lawyer, chanted against the Ministry of Interior, military rule, the Protest Law and called for freedom for those behind bars.
Six people were detained in a protest organised by the Ahrar movement. Security forces tried to disperse the rally which led to clashes in the Mohandiseen area.

36 members of Zamaleks Ultras White Knights (UWK) were arrested following clashes with security forces in Shubra neighbourhood of Cairo. They are accused of protesting without notice, joining an illegal group, practicing violence and acts of ""thuggery"", attacking citizens, vandalising public and private properties, blocking roads and possessing firearms.

Some supporters of the MB along with 6th April Movement staged two protests in Tahrir and Faysal streets in Giza, blocking the roads and causing traffic congestion. Police dispersed the two demonstrations.

At least three people died on Sunday during a security campaign in Arish including the leader of Ansar Beit-al Maqdis. A fire exchange occurred between the security forces and gunmen, leaving three central security officers wounded.
Military troops raided the village of el-Wefaq near Rafah killing six Ansar Beit al-Maqdis members, while 10 others were arrested.

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: 34 detainees in Ain Shams were beaten and their personal belongingness were stolen.
Two militants were killed amid clashes with security forces in North Sinais Sheikh Zuweid.
A number of university professors protested in front of Cairo University demanding the immediate release of their colleagues from prison.
Four Islamist militants were killed and six others were arrested in a security crackdown in North Sinais cities of Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid following an attack on a military convoy.
Four Islamist militants were killed and six others were arrested in a security crackdown in North Sinais cities of Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid following an attack on a military convoy.

Eleven security personnel were killed in an attack on a police convoy in North Sinai. A landmine exploded on the Rafah-Sheikh Zuweid road. Police forces and members of Ansar Beit-al Maqdis engaged in crossfire following the explosion.

column6: Police Forces of Egypt (2014-) Prison Guards
column17: An Egyptian citizen was was transferred to Gamasa prison, where he was tortured by the Head of the prison and his deputy.
Two policemen were wounded in a roadside bombing that targeted their armoured vehicle near North Sinais Al Arish.
Security forces conducted two raids in Sheikh Zuweid city and killed 18 militants, most of whom belonged to al-Qaida-inspired Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis group.
Assailants in a car gunned down a police sergeant just outside his house in the North Sinai town of El-Arish.

Police forces dispersed pro-Muslim Brotherhood rallies in Hadrah in Alexandria and arrested 16 protesters after Friday prayers for inciting violence, blocking the road, and distributing flyers against the police and the army.

Police forces dispersed pro-Muslim Brotherhood rallies in Wardian in Alexandria and arrested 16 protesters after Friday prayers for inciting violence, blocking the road, and distributing flyers against the police and the army.

Police forces dispersed pro-Muslim Brotherhood rallies in Raml in Alexandria and arrested 16 protesters after Friday prayers for inciting violence, blocking the road, and distributing flyers against the police and the army.

Police forces dispersed pro-Muslim Brotherhood rallies in Borg al-Arab in Alexandria and arrested 16 protesters after Friday prayers for inciting violence, blocking the road, and distributing flyers against the police and the army.

Police forces dispersed pro-Muslim Brotherhood rallies in Minya al-Basal in Alexandria and arrested 16 protesters after Friday prayers for inciting violence, blocking the road, and distributing flyers against the police and the army.
Security forces dispersed rallies by anti-government protesters in Fayoum, arresting 15.

Seven defendants that were arrested but later released for protesting outside the Shura Council, announced an open hunger strike in solidarity with three detainees still in custody on the same trial. The announcement was made during their sit-in that was initiated Sunday in the National Council for Human Rights.

column16: Egyptian Organization for Human Rights; Aswat Masriya (Egypt)
column17: An officer was killed and 10 conscripts were injured when an explosion targeted a security vehicle in North Sinais Arish. EOHR reported that the bomb was planted by a violent Islamist group.

'Thousands' of people joined in the Dank Movement protests in 19 governorates on Tuesday in front of subsidised supermarkets, public hospitals, and transportation facilities against the countries deteriorating services and high food prices. Locations of protests included Alexandria.

'Thousands' of people joined in the Dank Movement protests in 19 governorates on Tuesday in front of subsidised supermarkets, public hospitals, and transportation facilities against the countries deteriorating services and high food prices. Locations of protests included Giza, where five protesters were arrested.
A nail bomb went off in Al-Zahraa metro station in Old Cairo. No human or financial losses were reported.
Two members of Sinai-based militant group Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis were killed on Tuesday following altercations with security forces in North Sinais city of Sheikh Zuweid.

Police forces arrested on Tuesday at least 24 protesters from downtown Cairo for violating the protest law after the pro-Mohamed Mursi Anti-coup alliance called for demonstrations on Tuesday under the banner of ""revolution of the poor"" to protest ""worsening living conditions.""
A nail bomb went off in Sayeda Zeinab metro station in Old Cairo. It was thrown from a pedestrian bridge onto the metro tracks by an unknown person. No human or financial losses.
Three citizens were killed by militants in the past 24 hours in North Sinai.

column6: Military Forces of Egypt (2014-) Border Guards
column17: Demolition: Egypts border guards destroyed on Wednesday [10 September] 22 tunnels in coordination with the Armed Forces Engineering Authority to raise the number of tunnels that were neutralized to 1,740 tunnels. Two militants were arrested in the operation.
The son of a judicial counsellor in Mansoura city, in Al-Daqahliyah province was shot dead on Wednesday [10 September] by unidentified assailants.
At least three Islamist militants were killed and six were arrested on Thursday following clashes with Egypts third army on Ain Sokhnas Kattameya road
Unknown gunmen shot one civilian dead in North Sinais city of Sheikh Zuweid on Thursday.
An improvised explosive device exploded Thursday outside a police club in Tanta, a Nile Delta city and the capital of Gharbeya governorate. The explosion left five off-duty police personnel injured.
Unidentified gunmen killed an army conscript in North Sinais al-Arish city on Friday. The conscript was on duty at Al-Zohour military camp when armed men driving a car shot him dead on the spot.
One conscript was killed and three more were injured in an attack on a checkpoint on the Cairo-Suez road
Unidentified assailants killed a police sergeant and a driver whilst on their way to work in south Egypts Minya.

column6: Military Forces of Egypt (2014-) Border Guards

10 journalists started a hunger strike inside the syndicates headquarters in downtown Cairo.

Seven members of Ansar Beit al-Maqdis were killed in a shootout in Egypts Sinai peninsula during a joint operation by police and the army between 13th-15th September. They arrested 17 other militants in a security crackdown days in North Sinai, Al-Ismailiyah and Al-Daqahliyah

A number of activists staged a protest on outside the Journalists Syndicate in downtown Cairo in solidarity with some of the political prisoners who have started a hunger strike against their detention and the protest law.
Seven Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis operatives were killed when military forces targeted their hideout in a rough mountainous area in Um al-Jarf in the desert of Mount al-Jalala in Suez.
At least five militants were killed during security raids on their hideouts south of Sheikh Zuweid city in Egypts North Sinai province.
Two militants were killed in a raid at village in southern Rafah city.

Hundreds of Christian protesters clashed with police in Samalut, Al Minya after holding a demonstration in front of a police station demanding authorities locate an abducted housewife. Rioters threw molotov cocktails injuring three policemen.

Police clashed with Christian protesters calling for the return of a kidnapped Christian woman who has been missing for more than a week, demanding that the police locate her. The clashes resulted in nine injured, among them three policemen.
Six police personnel were killed and two injured when an armoured vehicle exploded on the Rafah-Arish road in North Sinai. Ansar Beit al-Maqdis later claimed responsibility.
A 22-year-old civilian was killed and his brother wounded when a rocket fired at soldiers by Islamist insurgents in the northern Sinais Sheikh Zuweid region hit their house.
Police stormed houses and shops belonging to Christians and beat people, including women and children. Some were tied and hit, others dragged, while men and women were 'insulted'.
Two Islamist militants were killed, 21 suspects caught and 54 militant hiding places destroyed in a security campaign south Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah.
Two Islamist militants were killed, 21 suspects caught and 54 militant hiding places destroyed in a security campaign south Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah.
Unidentified assailants fired two mortar shells at a Central Security Forces camp located on Arish airport road.
A nine-year-old boy was wounded on Friday after a bomb exploded near a security check point in North Sinais Sheikh Zuwied.

A total of 37 protesters were arrested after they gathered outside a number of mosques in Cairo, Giza, Alexandria, Fayoum and Sharkia. The Brotherhood supporters cut off roads during their protests, which prompted the security forces to disperse them and arrest 37 of them who possessed Molotov cocktails.

Defusal: An attempt to detonate an explosive device planted on the route taken by security forces in Sadat area at Rafah entrance was foiled when the device was defused safely.
Militants from the Ansar Beit al-Maqdis group beheaded a man and dumped the body on a road in the town of Sheikh Zuweyid.

column6: Military Forces of Egypt (2014-) Border Guards
column17: Security forces shot dead a Palestinian and wounded two others Saturday after they tried to enter Egypt from Gaza through a tunnel under the border town of Rafah.
Security forces launched a security campaign south of North Sinais Sheikh Zuweid on Saturday killing a leading member of the Sinai-based militant group Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis.
One Egyptian police recruit was killed and two others were injured when unknown militants opened fire at their police vehicle in the northern Fayoum province.

column16: AMNA; Macedonian Press Agency; BBC News
column17: A bomb explosion near the Egyptian foreign ministry in Bulaq Abu-al-Ila district, Cairo killed at least two police officers and injured six others.
Four members of Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis were killed in a security campaign in North Sinais Sheikh Zuwied. The army also arrested eight others.

Non-violent activity: Egyptian courts sentenced nearly 100 people to prison for up to 25 years Thursday after finding them guilty of violence during protests in support of ousted Islamist president Mohamed Morsi. The defendants, including four minors, were tried for clashes with security forces which had caused no casualties.
A kidnapped man who belonged to a prominent tribe was found shot dead after five days of absence in North Sinai.

Minor skirmishes erupted between supporters of former President Hosni Mubarak and his opponents as both groups gathered outside the police academy expectant of a verdict in his trial. Two people were left with minor injuries.

Egyptian security forces on Saturday [27 September] carried out a number of air raids on Ansar Beit al-Maqdis hotbeds and hideouts in eastern Al-Arish, South Al-Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah areas. Security sources asserted that raids on the hideouts coincided with large-scale ground operations that resulted in 18 killed.

A bomb exploded in Minya Al-Qamh injuring one person in the leg. The bomb was planted beneath the main waterline to Minya Al-Qamh in Sharqeya governorate.
A homemade explosive charge went off in a farmland in Al-Minyas Samallut district but no injuries occurred.
Two armed men shot a policeman affiliated with the Traffic General Management in Al-Salam City.

Students Against the Coup (SAC) movement members protested against a visit by President Abdel Fattah Al-Sisi to Cairo University. They were non-violently dispersed by what they described as 'armed men in civilian clothing'.

Non-violent activity: The Cairo Urgent Matters Court banned on Monday the activities of the Esteqlal (Independence) political party, one of the members of the pro-Mohamed Mursi Anti-Coup Alliance accusing it of ""harbouring extremist thoughts which harm national security"".

A police officer was killed and another wounded by unidentified masked gunmen on Tuesday near a checkpoint on the road between the governorates of Qena and Sohag in southern Egypt. An exchange of gunfire ensued between police and the assailants killing one of the assailants.
A military campaign was launched on against militants in South Sheikh Zuweid and South Rafah in Sinai that left 7 militants affiliated with Ansar Beit Al-Maqdis dead and 15 militants arrested.
A military campaign was launched against militants in South Sheikh Zuweid and South Rafah in Sinai that left 7 militants affiliated with Ansar Beit Al-Maqdis dead and 15 militants arrested.

Three people on Wednesday [1 October] were injured when unidentified gunmen opened fire on a main police station in the Upper Egyptian province of Asyut. The gunmen randomly opened fire on the police station and fled away.
Ansar Beit-al Maqdis released a video Sunday showing the execution of four men, including three being beheaded, accused of spying for the army and for Israels Mossad intelligence service.
An improvised explosive device (IED) exploded Thursday evening in front of Mahalla Police club in Gharbiyya governorate injuring a woman.
Mohammed Abu Sheeta, a leader of the al-Qaida-inspired group Ansar Beit al-Maqdis, was killed Thursday in the town of Rafah by Egyptian security forces.

Egypts army killed 12 militants and arrested 68 others in a large-scale security campaign in the governorates of North Sinai, Ismailia, Daqahleyya, and Port Said in the period from September 28 to October 2.
One of the vehicles of Port Said City Hall exploded on Thursday [2 October] after unknown men threw an anonymous device on it. No injuries were sustained.

Egypts army killed 12 militants and arrested 68 others in a large-scale security campaign in the governorates of North Sinai, Ismailia, Daqahleyya, and Port Said in the period from September 28 to October 2.

A bomb detonated in front of Gharbiyas municipal governors office, leaving two security personnel injured. Anonymous assailants placed an IED inside a bag which they threw at the governorates office prior to the arrival of Gharbiyya governor.
Members of the Muslim Brotherhood clashed with members of ""al-Daawa al-Salafiya"" (Salafi Call) in Alexandria on Saturday following Eid al-Adha prayers.
Anti-government protesters clashed with local residents, leading to several injuries. Police fired teargas to disperse the clashes.
A thirteen-year-old boy was killed when a roadside bomb planted by militants exploded in North Sinais Sheikh Zuwied.
An army offensive killed 16 members of Ansar Bayt Al-Maqdis group in the villages of villages of al-Goura, al-Muqataa and al-Agra in the northern Sinai Peninsula.

On Wednesday, the army killed seven militants belonging to the Ansar Beit-al Maqdis group in clashes in Sheikh Zuwid city and foiled an attempt to bomb two cars of the armed forces.
Four Islamist militants were killed and nine others arrested in a security operation in North Sinai, security sources said late on [8 October].
Unknown gunmen shot a civilian dead in Arish.
Egypts army on Thursday killed 15 suspected militants in a security raid and arrested 25 others suspected of being members of the Sinai-based Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis group.
Egyptian soldiers killed a top member of the Ansar Beit al-Maqdis group in a raid on the town of Rafah.
Egyptian police have arrested 40 supporters of ousted Islamist President Mohammed Morsis Muslim Brotherhood during protests after Friday prayers in Cairo (Giza) and Egypts second city Alexandria

An explosion hit Sharqiya province Friday morning targeting a bus in Minya al-Kamh city. No casualties reported.
An explosion hit Sharqiya province Friday morning destroying part of the railway tracks in the town of Belbeis and damaging a public transportation bus. No casualties reported.

Clashes broke out Friday between security forces and residents in Menoufiya province following the accidetal death of young man at the hands of the police. Relatives of the deceased gathered in front of the police station, chanting against the police. Security forces fired teargas after the families tried to break into the station, sparking clashes between both parties.

Students affiliated to the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group organized two protests on Saturday [11 October] on day one of the new academic year inside the campus of the Engineering Faculty in Alexandria University.

Arrests: Authorities arrested over 40 students, including organizers from 18 different universities ahead of scheduled protests. Security forces carried out dawn-raids across Egypt including Cairo and Mansoura on Saturday, at the homes of several Students Against the Coup members and arrested them.

A number of students belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood demonstrated inside the campus of Ayn Shams University Sunday [12 October]. Some MB students chanted anti-state slogans while others attacked the campus security guards and stormed electronic gates.
Students staged protests on campus at Mansurah university on Sunday [12 October].
Students staged protests on campus at Zagazig university on Sunday [12 October].
Protesters clashed briefly with police outside of al-Azhar University. Students attacked the newly installed metal detectors
At Fayoum University in Upper Egypt, tens of students protested on campus.
Residents in Egypts Sinai Peninsula found three dead bodies south of Arish. The three bodies, shot in the head, belonged to youth of known tribes in North Sinai.

At Alexandria University, campus security assaulted a group of students distributing flyers entitled 'Know Your Rights!'. The incident also witnessed the detention of two students before their later release by campus security following student protests against the detention of their colleagues.

Student protesters clashed with police outside of Cairo University. Employees of privately owned security company Falcon retreated from their posts at the main gate, as scores of students gathered outside to enter.
Egyptian police broke into Al-Azhar University in Ad-Daqahliya, north of Cairo and arrested a number of students following a protest on campus.
Professors at Cairo University protested against the amendments to the law regulating university affairs.
At Helwan University, AFTE reported that campus security clashed with students using sticks and rocks. SAC reported that police deployed agents in the metro stations leading to the universities.

Students in Alexandria University set the entrance of Faculty of Literature on fire, protesting the arrest of their colleague and clashed with security personnel. The police arrested a number of students in Alexandria University to prevent them from participating in protests inside campus.
At Mansoura University, tens of students from SAC protested, calling for the fall of the current regime.
The Students Against Coup (SAC) branch in Banha condemned the arrest of two student protesters from the city's university, promising more resistance.
Students Against Coup (SAC) stated that a number of protests took place in Menufiya University, before they were dispersed.
Protests continued in different universities across Egypt including Mansoura, Kafr Al-Sheikh and Ain Shams as part of the students' planned escalation.
A bomb targeting policemen standing guard exploded in the centre of the Egyptian capital Cairo late Tuesday wounding 12 people, including civilians.

Two policemen were wounded in clashes between students who ""belong to the Muslim Brotherhood"" and the security forces inside Alexandria University. The security forces arrested 37 students. A student died a week later as a result of his injuries sustained from the violence.

At Fayoum University students demonstrated against the 'kidnapping [of] students from the university gates and spreading police agents on campus' and the'continuation of humiliating the students' dignity'.
Protests continued in different universities across Egypt including Mansoura, Kafr Al-Sheikh and Ain Shams as part of the students' planned escalation.

A number of students were detained at Assiut Univertsity by campus security as confrontations broke out between the two.
Three police recruits were killed and ten others injured as an explosive device targeted their microbus on Thursday late evening in southern Arish city in Egypts North Sinai.
Two bombs exploded near a mosque in Egypts Nile delta city of Tanta, wounding at least 11 people. A bomb squad was able to dismantle a third explosive device.
The gas pipeline between Al-Arish in North Sinai and the Jordanian city of Aqaba was bombed for the 26th time in three years. No casualties were reported in this attack.
Arrests: The Egyptian military forces arrested a leading member of al-Qaida-inspired Sinai-based Ansar Bayt al- Maqdis group in a raid on southern Arish city of North Sinai province.

Residents of the south Rafah region in North Sinai found the dead body of a citizen shot in the head. The citizen was wearing ""clothes bearing the slogan of the Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIS)"".

In Giza, four people were arrested setting a train alight in Ramses Railway Station, sabotaging several high-pressure electricity towers and mobile network towers, and starting fires in car garages in Al-Warraq.
In Minya, tens of students along with the ""Students Against Coup"" movement marched from inside campus to the university gates and blocked the Misr-Aswan Agricultural road. The police intervened.
Clashes broke out between students ""supporting the Muslim Brotherhood"" and administrative security in the University of Tanta.
The Studens Against the Coup (SAC) group issued a statement on Sunday morning claiming that a new wave of protests took place at the universities of Suez, Beni-Suef , Al-Fayoum, and Helwan.

Students blocked the Kasr Al-Nil Road in front of Cairo University clashing with security forces. Special Forces from the army with armoured vehicles were standing guard outside campus, in anticipation of protests.
In Alexandria University, police officers took video footage of protesters which they used to arrest students outside campus.
Demonstrations took place Al-Azhar University. ""The police intervened and arrested 29 rioters who participated in acts of vandalism were determined through surveillance cameras.""
At Ain Shams Universities, Central Security Forces (CSF) broke into the campuses to disperse student protests.
The Studens Against the Coup (SAC) group issued a statement on Sunday morning claiming that a new wave of protests took place at the universities of Suez, Beni-Suef , Al-Fayoum, and Helwan.
Students call for reinstatement of four colleagues who were expelled in on-going protests in British University.
A roadside bomb killed seven Egyptian soldiers and wounded four in Al Arish, Sinai Peninsula.
in Mounifiya University, dozen of students staged a demonstration on campus to demand the release of their detained colleagues.
In Mansoura University large numbers of riot police stormed the campus gates, as students clashed with Falcon personnel destroying one security gate.

Demonstrations took place Al-Azhar, Mansoura, Minya Universities, and Cairo Universitys Faculty of Dentistry campus. ""The police intervened and arrested 29 rioters who participated in acts of vandalism were determined through surveillance cameras.""
Campuses in Damietta, Dakahlia, and Ain Shams witnessed minor confrontations between students and police forces, SAC official page reported.
Campuses in Damietta, Dakahlia, and Ain Shams witnessed minor confrontations between students and police forces, SAC official page reported.

On October 20, in Nasr City, police forces broke into Al-Azhar Girls University following protests organised by the Students Against the Coup (SAC) movement, with the security forces trying to arrest participants. Several girls were reportedly sexually harassed by security staff. [size=no report]
A power pylon in Fayyum was attacked by rioters on Monday [20 October].
Campuses in Damietta, Dakahlia, and Ain Shams witnessed minor confrontations between students and police forces, SAC official page reported.
A student was abducted by the Egyptian security forces at the Al Azhar University campus in Cairo on 20 October 2014. She was released on 6 November with signs of torture.
A number of students from the University of Alexandria organised a demonstration protesting a student death and calling for retribution on Tuesday.
Unknown assailants shot a civilian dead in Northern Sinais Rafah. Two people were injured.
Demonstrations at Al-Azhar University and Ain Shams University took place Tuesday morning inside the university campuses were ended when security forces stormed in and broke them up.
Demonstrations at Al-Azhar University and Ain Shams University took place Tuesday morning inside the university campuses which were ended when security forces stormed in and broke them up.
A bomb targeting police forces was claimed by Ajnad Misr, after it exploded outside the gates of Cairo University Wednesday, wounding at least nine people, including a senior police officer.
Two people suffered minor injuries following the explosion of a homemade bomb in Tanta on Wednesday.
At Helwan University, students staged silent protests condemning dawn arrests of fellow students.
Police stormed Kafr Al-Sheikh University and fired tear gas at students protesting the arrest of their colleagues.
A drive-by shooting in the southern governorate of Minya killed one policeman, injured another.

Two Israeli soldiers were wounded in an attack on the Israeli-Egyptian border on Wednesday. Identity of attackers was in dispute, although one of the killed attackers was a Bedouin from a local tribe. At least three attackers were killed when soldiers responded.
Police clashed with students in Cairo University. Security forces arrested 12 students accused of attempting to ""storm the campus"".
Unknown assailants threw a Molotov cocktail at two police cars early on Thursday in the Nile Delta city of Damanhur, northwest of Cairo, leaving three policemen injured.
Muslim Brotherhood members torched two cars that belong to the Saudi consulate in Suezs Arbaeen district early on Friday.

A police officer was shot and killed on Friday by masked gunmen on a motorcycle in Sharqeya governorate, northeast of Cairo. The officer was shot in the chest and head while on his way home from work. He was killed immediately. The assailants have yet to be captured.

An eight year-old child was killed Friday in the Cairo neighbourhood of Matariya, as supporters of ousted president Mohamed Morsi took to the streets following Friday prayers. Six others were injured, amid clashes between local residents.

column16: Daily News (Egypt); Egypt Independent; AP; Menastream; AFP
column17: A suicide car bombing in Egypts Sinai Peninsula killed over 30 soldiers and wounded 31 in an attack in al-Shaykh Zuwayid district. Ansar Beit al-Maqdis later claimed responsibility for the attack. A car of explosives was driven into the Karam al-Qawadis checkpoint, killing 33 members of the armed forces and injuring 26.
Ansar Beit-al Maqdis shot dead three soldiers on Friday at a checkpoint south of El-Arish.
An IED explosion in the vicinity of a security centre in Kafr El Zayat, Gharbiya injured one of two Muslim Brotherhood assailants targeting the centre. Security forces arrested the suspect.
Five militants were killed in military air raids on North Sinais Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid regions.

Student protests took place in universities in Menufiya, Beni Suef, Al-Azhar, Port Said, Ain Shams, Minya, as well as Al-Azhar University branches in Damietta and Zagazig, amid a heavy security presence.

Four women were injured in an explosion south of Rafah in Egypts North Sinai.
Three IEDs exploded Monday inside two electricity transformers in 10th of Ramadan City resulting in a power outage in two districts and damage to the two transformers.
Egypts armed forces eliminated eight Islamist militants including one who is implicated in an attack on security personnel in Sinai.
An unidentified man threw a bomb at the fence of civil defence headquarters in Fayyum on Monday [27 Oct]. The agency said there were no damages or casualties at the HQ.
Education Minister Mahmud Abu-al-Nasr said on Monday [27 October] that 45 bombs that targeted schools across the country have been defused.
Civil protection forces dismantled an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) planted near a primary school in Gizas Faysal neighbourhood.
A video was posted on Tuesday on a Palestinian news page showing members of the Egyptian army as well as plain-clothed men kicking and beating citizens during their Sinai operations.

Beni Suef University witnessed protests. Protestors smashed the windows of a police vehicle. Three others were arrested during an attempt to block the ring road during a rally but police forces dispersed them.
Students protested at Cairo University. Three were arrested.

Movement of forces: Soldiers from the Second and Third Field Armies, and Rapid Intervention Units, were transported by air to the Sinai peninsula as reinforcements for Egypts counter-terrorism operations.
14 students were arrested in Al-Azhar University, as they were attempting to block the road whilst chanting opposition slogans.
Egyptian aircraft continued airstrikes against militant outposts across Al-Arish, Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah. A number of Islamist militants were killed after an attack in western Al-Arish.
As many as six makeshift bombs and some firecrackers were seized [28 October] during a protest staged by supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group in Al-Mansurah city, northern Egypt.
Around 50 pro-Morsi and MB students staged a protest on Mansoura campus, security forces dispersed the demonstration and arrested 15 of them.

Two bombs exploded in a sewage project under construction in Sharqia, north of Cairo, which destroyed two pipes. No causalities were reported. Unidentified assailants placed the makeshift explosive devices underneath the sewage pipes of the project.
Two prominent Egyptian activists started a sit-in on Wednesday in Cairos Supreme Court to protest the imprisonment of their family members.
The head of the office for the Libyan Deputy Minister of Housing was kidnapped Wednesday while on a trip to Cairo and released 12 hours later.
Three makeshift bombs were defused Wednesday [29 October] at the Faculty of Science, Al-Fayyum University [south of Cairo].
Police forces dispersed a rally staged by female students ""supporting the Muslim Brotherhood"" outside Azhar University campus.
Protest by workers of Misr Spinning and Weaving Company in Mahalla to condemn recent ""terror acts"" in the country.
Seven Egyptian soldiers were wounded in an explosion near El-Arish. The explosive device had been planted on a road used by army patrols and police.
Unidentified assailants gunned down a civilian in Sinais Rafah on Friday.
Scores of the Muslim Brotherhood [MB] groups supporters set fire to a traffic services post in Faysal Street of Giza Province [south of Cairo], on Friday [31 October].
Three people were injured when an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) went off in downtown Cairo.
A group of lawyers gathered to protest the assault of a lawyer by a police officer. A police general ordered the Central Security Forces to disperse the protesting lawyers.
Two explosive devices went off on Al-Arish/Rafah International Road Saturday [1 November]. Two security elements were injured. A third bomb was defused.
Student protests took place at the universities of Cairo, Al-Azhar, and Beni Suef, where students chanted against the arrests of colleagues.
Arrests: Security forces arrested four militant cells comprising of 34 members affiliated with the Muslim Brotherhood across Damietta, Sharqiya and Ismailia

At Helwan University, students staged a silent protest expressing their condemnation of what they called 'military rule'.
Masked police stormed the Ain Shams University campus and fired birdshot, injuring a number of protesting students.
A bomb remotely detonated while security forces were proceeding with the evacuation of houses in the Sinai region. The explosion left behind no injuries.
Hundreds of university students protested in Sohag about the conditions of the road where a deadly crash happened, saying that it is ""unpaved"".

Two mortar shells fell near a security camp in North Sinais al-Arish, in the vicinity of the governorates building. It was followed by an exchange of fire and ""light bombs"" by security forces. No injuries reported.
An April 6 demonstration took place on 4 November on 6 October bridge, Cairo calling for the release of detainees.

Two Egyptian policemen and two civilians were killed and 15 people injured when a bomb exploded inside a train carriage in Menouf, Menufiya province, north of Cairo. The explosion was not targeting the train but a nearby security checkpoint.

column16: Egyptian Organization for Human Rights; Menastream
column17: Three people were injured when a home-made bomb went off in Al-Marj metro station (eastern Cairo),
Unknown gunmen killed four civilians in North Sinais al-Arish city.
A bomb exploded near El Kobba presidential palace in Cairo, on November 6. The bomb was planted by unidentified people in a garbage bin, injuring a man and a woman.

Demolition: Egyptian forces have steadily cleared out residents and dynamited several homes each day in Rafah. The goal is to raze 800 homes and force out 10,000 residents to secure a buffer zone in the Sinai Peninsula.
Five Ansar Beit al-Maqdis militants were killed and three others were injured in a military aerial bombardment over North Sinais city of Sheikh Zuweid.
A student was killed in clashes between supporters of Egypts ousted president Mohamed Morsi and police in Itsa, in Fayyum, south of Cairo.
One peron was killed when pro-Morsi protesters clashed in the Ain Shams district northeast of Cairo with residents opposed to the Islamist president.
A bomb exploded in the vicinity of Cairo Universitys Faculty of Dentistry on Saturday morning, with no injuries reported.
The armed forces killed eight militants who participated in ambush attacks on the armed forces planting improvised explosive devices, and arrested 13 others in raids in North Sinai.

The 6 April Democratic Front called for the release of the detainees arrested under the Protest Law. Security forces cornered one of the protesters, smashed his car and threatened him with weapons while searching him. He was not detained however.
Egyptian armed forces carried out ""successful strikes against militants in North Sinai"", killing one.
Egyptian armed forces carried out ""successful strikes against militants in North Sinai, Ismailia, Port Said and Daqahliya"".

Egyptian armed forces carried out ""successful strikes against militants in North Sinai, Ismailia, Port Said and Daqahliya"".
A police officer was killed Sunday and another was injured in Fayoum when ""unknown assailants"" shot at a police vehicle.
Student protests took place at Cairo University, Al-Azhar, and in the universities of Assiut and Mansoura.
Student protests took place at Cairo University, Al-Azhar, and in the universities of Assiut and Mansoura.
One man was killed in clashes between supporters of ousted president Mohamed Morsi and police forces in El-Maymoun village in the Beni Suef governorate.
In Beni Suef, police forces fired tear gas and birdshot, after campus security attacked a student protest. No reported injuries.
In the University of Alexandria, police forces stormed into campus after clashes broke between members of the Student SAC group and students supporting President Abdel Fattah Al-Sisi.
At Zagazig University, police forces fired tear gas at students after they clashed with Falcon personnel.
Student protests took place at Cairo University with violations by campus security against students.
A member of the Islamist political organisation Salafi Front was kidnapped. His arrest/disappearance has been blamed on the Ministry of Interior.
Student protests took place at Cairo University, Al-Azhar, and in the universities of Assiut and Mansoura.
Defection: Ansar Beit al-Maqdis, based in the Sinai Peninsula pledged allegiance to the Islamic State group.
Student protests took place at Mansoura University, the Al-Azhar branch in Daqahleya, and in the private University of Sadat. In Minya, police forces fired tear gas and stormed the campus.
Student protests took place in the private University of Sadat.
In Minya, police forces fired tear gas and stormed the campus against student protesters.
Eight militants were killed Monday in a military aerial bombardment over North Sinais city of Sheikh Zuweid.

Police forces stormed into Al-Azhar Girls University to disperse a protest with armoured vehicles. Two female students who were not taking part in the protests in Al-Azhar University were assaulted by police forces, and sustained injuries.

A bomb exploded near the Beni Suef city council building, next to the city's police station, with no injuries reported. Security forces located two more bombs in the same area, which explosive experts were able to defuse.
Two alleged members of the Muslim Brotherhood group attempted to plant homemade bombs near a police station in the city of Tanta. The suspects were arrested.
Two mortars rounds were fired at a security checkpoint in Rafah on Tuesday, according to state-owned Al-Ahram. No injuries or losses were reported.

Demolition: Egypts armed forces announced the arrest of 14 alleged militants and destruction of 30 militant hideouts in an area south of Al-Arish and Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai as part of an ongoing security campaign.
A car bomb was discovered in Al-Arish. Police forces detonated the bomb which led to between 4 and 11 minor injuries.

An Egyptian military navy vessel came under attack off the coast of Damietta, leaving five servicemen injured and eight others missing. According to state-owned media, four of the attackers were killed during the clashes. The military has not yet confirmed. Four boats used by the assailants were destroyed and 32 arrested.
One man was killed when the Improvised Explosive Device he was carrying exploded as he was driving through Giza on a motorbike.
Arrests: During security raids on militant hideouts in North Sinai, Ismailia, Port Said and Daqahliya provinces, ""armed forces managed on Wednesday to arrest 26 militant and criminal elements"".
A protest erupted in a Damietta village after reports that the military arrested fishermen at sea following an exchange of fire.
An explosion occurred on the Sharqiya railroad early Wednesday, leaving no injuries.

Arrests: During security raidss on militant hideouts in North Sinai, Ismailia, Port Said and Daqahliya provinces, ""armed forces managed on Wednesday to arrest 26 militant and criminal elements"" including Ansar Beit al-Maqdis leading member Awwad Radwan.
Arrests:During security raids on militant hideouts in North Sinai, Ismailia, Port Said and Daqahliya provinces, ""armed forces managed on Wednesday to arrest 26 militant and criminal elements"".

In Cairo, 16 people were injured in a panicked crush on a Cairo metro train after a small bomb exploded during rush hour.
The military carried out air strikes in Sinai, killing three members of the Islamist militant group Ansar Beit al-Maqdis.
Two police conscripts were taken out of their vehicles and shot dead in North Sinai. The attack bore the hallmarks of Ansar Beit al-Maqdis. All the victims were off-duty and wearing civilian clothes.

Three military conscripts were taken out of their vehicles and shot dead in North Sinai. The attack bore the hallmarks of Ansar Beit al-Maqdis. All the victims were off-duty and wearing civilian clothes.
Arrests: Security forces arrested 54 militants in the governorates of Ismailia and Daqahliyah between the 13th and 14th November.
Arrests: Security forces arrested 54 militants in the the governorates of Ismailia and Daqahliyah between the 13th and 14th November.
In Alexandria, the police arrested six protesters who allegedly belonged to the Muslim Brotherhood group, after clashes between protesters and security men who dispersed their gathering.
Five members of Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis were killed and seven other militants arrested in al-Husainat village south of Rafah during two military and police security campaigns in North Sinai.
Gunmen fired at a police officer at al-Arish rescue police station in North Sinais al-Arish city on Friday injuring him in a failed assassination attempt.

In various cities of Beheira province, about 130 km north of the capital Cairo, the police arrested 15 pro-Morsi protesters including high school and university students who were among tens of others shouting anti-government statements and raising posters of the deposed Islamist president.

Tens of journalists marched to the prosecutor generals office to file a set of complaints against the chairman of the Zamalek Sports Club for insulting sports critics and Journalists Syndicate members.

A student who supports the Muslim Brotherhood died inside Hadayek Al-Kobba police station. His family and the pro-Mohamed Mursi ""Students against the coup"" movement accused the police of torturing him to death. A security source denied the accusation.
During a raid in Ismailia, one militant, allegedly from the Sinai-based militant group Ansar Beit Al-Maqdis, was killed, and three others were arrested.
Students Against the Coup (SAC) formed protests at the universities of Helwan, 6th of October City, Zagazig, Mansoura, and Beni Suef.

Army and police forces raided a cell of ""Ansar Beit al-Maqdis"" in Salihiyah city in Al-Sharqiyah Governorate [north of Cairo]. One militant was killed and three arrested.

Defusal: A bomb was defused on Sunday [16 November] near the building of North Sinai security directorate with no casualties reported. Unidentified men planted the bomb behind a coffee shop near the security directorate.
Security forces dispersed a limited rally in Al-Azhar University campus in Cairo. During the rally, they chanted slogans against Armed Forces and also hurled sound bombs.
Students Against the Coup (SAC) formed protests at the universities of Helwan, 6th of October City, Zagazig, Mansoura, and Beni Suef.
A group of approximately fifty people staged a flash protest in downtown Cairo, chanting anti-government slogans.

column17: Egyptian police hit a student who was trying to film the dispersal of a student protest and fired tear gas on the students which lead to several injuries in the female section of Al-Azhar University after a protest was organised by Students Against the Coup.

A 28 year-old teacher was shot in the thigh while passing a security checkpoint later that night in Dahiyat al-Salam neighbourhood of Al-Arish. The man is currently at Al-Arish hospital and his condition is stable.
The armed forces killed on Monday one militant during a security campaign in Ismailia.
Arrests: 32 militants were arrested in the governorates of North Sinai, Daqahliyah, and Port Said.
Arrests: 32 militants were arrested in the governorates of North Sinai, Daqahliyah, and Port Said.
Arrests: 32 militants were arrested in the governorates of North Sinai, Daqahliyah, and Port Said.
Two Islamist fighters were killed by the Egyptian army in North Sinai between 17th-19th November.
At least 10 people including Bedouin civilians were killed on Tuesday evening in a fire exchange between security forces and militants in the village of Nega Shabana, south of Rafah city.
A homemade bomb went off near an electricity pole in Al-Minufiyah Governorate [north of Cairo]. No casualties were reported and no one claimed responsibility.
Al-Wafd Party staged on Tuesday [18 November] a rally in front of the Qatari Embassy in Cairo to protest against the Gulf states interference in the domestic affairs of Egypt.
A human rights lawyer and three others, were also arrested in Alexandria following a protest and sent to Raml police station. They were later released.
Police forces arrested 48 protesters commemorating the third anniversary of Mohamed Mahmoud clashes. Police fired warning shots and dispersed protests around the Talaat Harb Square using teargas.
Security forces dispersed on Wednesday [19 November] a limited protest by pro-Muslim Brotherhood Al-Azhar female students. Using teargas and birdshot.
Unidentified gunmen opened fire on a non-commissioned police officer in Al-Arish, North Sinai, on Wednesday [19 November].
Student protests were reported inside Cairo University.
An explosive charge was defused near a schools complex in Al-Arish. North Sinai Governor said the explosive charge was a militant act.
Student protests were reported inside Ain Shams University.
Arrests: Five militant cells, including 38 MB members, were arrested in Al-Gharbiyah over violence and traffic blocking.
Arrests: Egyptian police arrested one of the last Muslim Brotherhood leaders not already in detention or in exile, in Shibin al-Kawm city of Al-Minufiyah Governorate.
Unidentified men set three buses ablaze in Al-Zaqaziq, Faqqus and Abu-Kabir cities of Al-Sharqiyah Governorate, north of Cairo, but no causalities were reported.
Two militants were killed in a shootout with the security forces in the Sinai Peninsula.
Unidentified men set three buses ablaze in Al-Zaqaziq, Faqqus and Abu-Kabir cities of Al-Sharqiyah Governorate, north of Cairo, but no causalities were reported
Unidentified men set three buses ablaze in Al-Zaqaziq, Faqqus and Abu-Kabir cities of Al-Sharqiyah Governorate, north of Cairo, but no causalities were reported
Four people were injured in a stampede at Cairos Ramses station after a blast inside a compartment of a train that pulled in from the Nile Delta.

Five policemen, including two officers, were hurt when an IED exploded at a small post near Helwan University in southern Cairo. A militant group called Ajnad Misr (Soldiers of Egypt) claimed Thursdays bombing.
Defusal: Egyptian police managed to defuse two structural bombs hidden in wooden boxes under a bridge in Minufya province, about 65 km north of Cairo.
Five militants were killed in a raid by the military on their hideout in the Sinai Peninsula on Friday.

An IED went off near a train station in Al Wasta, Beni Suef killing one person believed to be the planter of the bomb. Police found three other explosive devices planted on railway tracks in the region.
A security campaign by the Egyptian army in Rafah and Sheikh Zuweyid left a total of 10 Islamist militants killed on 22 November. [Fatalities split between two events].
A security campaign by the Egyptian army in Rafah and Sheikh Zuweyid left a total of 10 Islamist militants killed on 22 November. [Fatalities split between two events].
A minor explosion on the Sharqiya railroad broke part of the track.
The Egyptian armed forces killed on Sunday 11 militants during raids in the Sinai Peninsula.
A police officer was killed and another injured in a blast which targeted an armoured security vehicle in North Sinais al-Arish.
The Students Against the Coup (SAC) said it blocked another road in Nasr City and disrupted a metro line for half an hour.
Two men who were kidnapped by State of Sinai were found dead 10 days later in the village of Abu Tawila in North Sinai. The men had been shot in the head.
The Students Against the Coup (SAC) blocked two major roads in Greater Cairoin Gizas 6 October and Haram neighbourhoods on Monday.
The Students Against the Coup (SAC) blocked two major roads in Greater Cairoin Gizas 6 October and Haram neighbourhoods on Monday.
A non-commissioned officer was killed by gunmen in Al-Fayyum Governorate [south of Cairo] on Wednesday [26 November].

Five militants were killed in crossfire with army forces in North Sinais capital city of al-Arish. Six storehouses containing incendiary publications against the army and police forces and Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis badges (now renamed as State of Sinai) were also destroyed.

Four militants were killed while on motorbikes targeting military forces in the border town of Rafah. Six storehouses containing incendiary publications against the army and police forces and Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis badges (now renamed as State of Sinai) were also destroyed.
Two police officers and a conscript were gunned down by unknown assailants while driving near al-Arish Police Station in North Sinai.
Families of the children sentenced by Alexandria juvenile court gathered outside the court, chanting against the military and the police.
Defusal: Two makeshift bombs were defused on Thursday [27 November] near Abu-al-Matamir post office in Al-Buhayrah Governorate, north of Cairo.
Arrests: 107 alleged members of the blacklisted Muslim Brotherhood were detained on Thursday and Friday on suspicion of planning violent protests after Friday prayers.
Residents of North Sinai found three dead bodies dumped on al-Arish-al-Tawil road south of al-Arish city. The three bodies, shot in the head, belonged to tribes in North Sinai.
In Ain Shams, hundreds of Muslim Brotherhood group [members] gathered, where some of them fired birdshots and live rounds randomly at passersby. No injuries reported.
Police forces were accused of torturing an economics professor and his brother for four days in a National Security building in Sheikh Zaid city, southwest of Cairo.
An army brigadier and another soldier were killed and one other soldier injured after the State of Sinai (formerly Ansar Beit al-Maqdis) assailants shot them at Gesr al-Suez area in Cairo.
A sound bomb went off in the vicinity of Attaba in downtown Cairo, no injuries were reported.
Seven explosive devices were defused in Cairo, Alexandria, Sharqiyah and Bani Suaif.

Three protesters were killed in clashes between security forces and the protesters in Matariya district of Cairo after the Salafi Front called on peple to rally to """"impose the Islamic identity"""".
Seven explosive devices were defused in Cairo, Alexandria, Sharqiyah and Bani Suaif.
In Aswan, Egypt police arrested six Muslim Brotherhood members after staging a protest.
In Banha [north of Cairo], security forces dispersed a number of limited protests by the Muslim Brotherhood group in Al-Qalyubiyah province.
Defusal: Seven explosive devices were defused in Cairo, Alexandria, Sharqiyah and Bani Suaif.
Defusal: Seven explosive devices were defused in Cairo, Alexandria, Sharqiyah and Bani Suaif.
In Cairos Haram district, 20 protesters turned up for the rally called for by the Salafi Front. They were dispersed by the police forces.
A homemade bomb went off Friday in Heliopolis, Cairo, but no injuries were reported. Also Abdel Moneim Riad Square in downtown Cairo.
Four policemen and two civilians were injured on Friday as a blast targeted a police vehicle in Arish city of North Sinai province. The State of Sinai claimed responsibility.
An army officer and a policeman were wounded in an exchange of gunfire with unknown assailants in the Mediterranean city of Alexandria.

Six people were injured Friday after an improvised explosive device (IED) went off in the Nile Delta province of Sharkiya. The IED exploded as a police patrol car was driving by in Sharkiyas city of Abu Kabir.
Rallies in support of Egypts President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi also took place in a number of Egyptian cities, including Alexandria, Suez, and Damietta.

Four tribal youths were kidnapped by unidentified militants in Sheikh Zuweid and later found dead alongside one other citizen. All five bodies had been shot in the head.
An army officer was killed and a conscript was injured after they were shot at the Abu Zaabal area in Qalyubia province north of Cairo. State of Sinai later claimed responsibility.

column17: Two people were killed in clashes between Egyptian police and Muslim Brotherhood protesters in central Cairo on Saturday after a court dropped a murder case against ousted strongman Hosni Mubarak.
Three militants were killed and 21 others were arrested in a security crackdown in North Sinai, Military Spokesman Muhammad Samir said on Saturday [29 November].
In Port Said province, east of Cairo, members of the Al-Dustur Party staged a protest against the court ruling in the Mubarak case.
In Al-Minufiyah province, north of Cairo, the police arrested three MB members after dispersing a protest at the provinces Sadat City. No clashes or injuries were reported

In Suez city, east of Cairo, the police dispersed a demonstration staged at one of the provinces main squares to protest against the court ruling in the Mubaraks case. The demonstration was dispersed as participants protested without permission.

Security forces were reported to fire teargas at a group of peaceful protesters at Abdel Moniem Riad square in downtown Cairo. An eye-witness told Aswat Masriya that security forces used water cannons, tear gas and birdshot to disperse the protest.
Tens of former president Mohamed Hosni Mubarak supporters gathered outside Cairos Police Academcy chanting for Mubaraks release.
Arrests: Security forces arrested 297 members of the Muslim Brotherhood and rioters in 15 governorates over charges of attacking police facilities and instigating violence.

In Kafr al-Shaykh [north of Cairo], students staged anti-Mubarak protests outside the universities main gates where security forces tightened security measures.
Protests were staged at Ain Shams university denouncing the court ruling to dismiss murder charges against Mubarak.

Dozens of students protested on Sunday at Zagazig University over a court ruling dropping charges against Egypts toppled President Hosni Mubarak. Clashes erupted between protesting students and the universities administrative security.

Dozens of students protested on Sunday over a court ruling dropping charges against Egypts toppled President Hosni Mubarak. In Cairo University, students blocked one of the gates of the university to prevent the police from entering campus.

Dozens of students protested on Sunday at Tanta University over a court ruling dropping charges against Egypts toppled President Hosni Mubarak. Clashes erupted between student protesters and security forces, where eight students were arrested.

Dozens of students protested on Sunday at Alexandria University over a court ruling dropping charges against Egypts toppled President Hosni Mubarak. Security forces briefly broke into the University of Alexandrias faculty of commerce following protests staged on campus.

Police forces assaulted and briefly detained two photojournalists from private newspaper Al-Masry Al-Youm and two other journalists on Sunday night, as they were covering protests in Abdel Moneim Riyadh Square.
Four militants were killed in a wide-scale security campaign in North Sinai between November 29 and December 2. Fifteen others were arrested.

Scores of activists demonstrated on Monday [1 December] in a major square in Mansoura city to protest against a court ruling dismissing charges against former president Husni Mubarak in the killing of peaceful protesters in 2011.
A policeman was shot and killed by unidentified assailants on his way back from work in Assiut.
Protests took place in universities in Menufiya, Beni Suef, Al-Azhar, Ain Shams, as well as at the 10th of Ramadan Institute and Al-Azhar University branch in Zagazig, amid heavy security presence.

Ten protesters were arrested in the vicinity of Abdel Moneim Riad Square in downtown Cairo amid skirmishes with security forces while attempting to enter the nearby Tahrir Square to stage a demonstration. A policeman was injured in clashes between security forces and protesters.
Men brandishing broken glass bottles attacked demonstrators during a small protest next to Tahrir Square on Friday evening.
Two militants were killed in crossfire with armed forces in a security campaign in North Sinai.
Defusal: Two bombs were defused in Sheikh Zuweyid town in North Sinai. No casualties were reported.
Arrests: As many as 39 supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood group were arrested on Saturday [6 Dec] over charges of attacking police stations and provoking riots nationwide.

An army conscript was injured on Saturday when an improvised explosive device (IED) planted by Islamist militants went off at a security checkpoint in the Sadout area on the Arish-Rafah international road in North Sinai.
The Egyptian army killed five members of State of Sinai (formerly Ansar Beit al-Maqdis), and arrested 15 others in the Sinai Peninsula.

A man was shot in the chest with birdshot and later died during clashes between alleged Muslim Brotherhood supporters and local residents. Demonstration comprising of 50 Muslim Brotherhood members took place in Alexandria which led to clashes with residents, with police forces later intervening to disperse the protests.

A bomb was planted by unidentified assailants in the vicinity of a school complex in Al-Arish in North Sinai. It was defused by security forces. Another bomb exploded on an international road west of Arish, leaving no casualties.

On Thursday [10 December], seven militants were killed and four others were arrested in a crackdown on militant hotbeds in Arish city. Security forces also averted a car bomb attack on a checkpoint in Arish, killing the driver and a passenger.

A dozen pro-Morsi protesters were arrested during their Fridays anti-government marches in Cairo, Fayoum and Alexandria after the police confronted them for shouting slogans against the police and the military-oriented leadership.
A total of ten militants were killed in a security campaign in North Sinai targeting al-Arish and Sheikh Zuweid [fatalities split between events].

Militants opened fire at an armed forces row officer in al-Marg district north-east of Cairo injuring him.

Suspected Islamic militants bombed on Tuesday the main gas pipeline south of al-Arish in Sinai. Unverified online reports speculated that members of the militant group State of Sinai, were behind the incident.
At least 25 Ultras Ahlawy were arrested following an attempted break in and clashes with security forces at a Cairo basketball arena Tuesday evening.
A police sergeant was shot dead Tuesday [23 December] in an armed attack on a police vehicle in Alexandrias Sidi Gaber district by members of the Muslim Brotherhood.
Police thwarted an attempt by Muslim Brotherhoods supporters to block Fayyum-Cairo road.
A roadside bomb struck an Egyptian army vehicle late Thursday killing an officer and a soldier in the Sinai Peninsula.

Armed forces killed a ""highly dangerous"" militant from the State of Sinai and arrested 297 other suspects during raids in the Sinai Peninsula over the past two days.

Gunmen killed a policeman and wounded three others in a drive-by attack on a patrol in Al Muntazah district, in Alexandria on Sunday.
Egypts armed forces killed 13 militants during raids in the Sinai Peninsula from 27th to 31st December.
An electric tower collapsed in Quwisina town in Al-Minufiyah [north of Cairo] after two makeshift bombs placed beneath it went off on Monday [29 December].
Dozens of families of fishermen killed in the sinking of a boat in the Red Sea two weeks ago demonstrated outside a South Sinai court on Tuesday.
A student was shot dead by security forces following a Muslim Brotherhood protest in 10th Ramadan City in Sharqiya on Wednesday.

On 31 December, the Egyptian Coordination of Rights and Freedoms reported that a 16-year-old boy accused of robbery died due to torture during detention whilst being held at Khanka police station in Qaliubiya.
Two people were injured in a bomb blast in Al Haram [Pyramids] in Giza [Greater Cairo].
An explosive charge went off at the entrance of a church in al Nazlah village in Fayyum, wounding one person and causing limited damage to the building.

Defusal: Bomb disposal experts defused an explosive charge planted by unidentified persons near Mar Girgis church in Niqalifa village in Al-Fayyum governorate [south of Cairo] on Wednesday [31 December].

A militant group named ""Popular Resistance"" released a video claiming responsibility for setting a police van on fire on the Ring Road in Cairo. The van was reported to have been burnt by ""unknown assailants"" during Friday clashes between anti-government protesters and police personnel.
Security forces dispersed at least three marches in Ain Shams, Helwan, and 6th October neighbourhoods on Friday. Three were arrested in Helwan and four in 6th October City.

A military soldier was killed on Sunday while dismantling explosive devices (IED) in North Sinais Sheikh Zuweid. Two other officers and a soldier were also injured.

Two policemen were injured in a shooting on Sunday with militants in the Mohandessin district of Giza. The Popular Resistance militant group claimed responsibility, saying that a policeman was killed. Aswat Masriya reported that one of the assailants was killed in an exchange of fire that broke out when policemen approached the site of an explosion near the police station.
On 5 January 2015, two brothers were killed near a security checkpoint in the north-eastern Suez province after reportedly refusing to adhere to orders to stop.
Two Egyptian policemen were injured by a mortar attack in Al-Arish on Monday.
An explosive charge went off at dawn Tuesday [6 January] beside a police station in Abu-al-Matamir Township in Buhayrah governorate [north of Cairo] leaving one guard injured.
Two policemen were shot dead by gunmen in a pre-dawn attack while they were on patrol in the southern city of Minya.

An Egyptian police officer was killed Tuesday while trying to defuse a bomb outside a petrol station in Cairo. Three employees were also wounded. Ajnad Misr (Soldiers of Egypt) claimed responsibility for planting the bomb.
Following the attack of two policemen outside a church in Minya, dozens of policemen gathered at the vicinity of the Minya University Hospital in protest of the murder their colleagues.
An improvised explosive device exploded near a police station in Fayoum on Wednesday night and injured a policeman.
On January 8 (or before), Military Forces detained a father and his sons in Sheikh Zuweiyid. Their whereabouts remain unknown.
A non-commissioned police officer was killed on Thursday [8 January] after he was shot by unknown gunmen in Fayyum governorate.
On January 8, in North Sinai, a 14 year old child was detained by military forces. His where about remain unknown. (location unknown coded as Al Arish geoprecision 3)
One protester died in clashes between Muslim Brotherhood protesters and police forces in Cairos Matariya district.
A 19-year-old civilian suffered a gunshot wound on Friday in North Sinais town of al-Arish by unidentified assailants.
Two protesters were killed in Al-Haram street in Giza in clashes between the Muslim Brotherhood and police forces.
Two headless bodies were found in Sheikh Zuweid village in Egypts North Sinai region on Saturday.

Unidentified assailants planted an explosive device on Beheira railroad. The explosion temporarily halted traffic but caused no casualties.
State of Sinai militants (formerly Ansar Beit-al Maqdis) kidnapped an off-duty police officer on his way home in North Sinais Rafah. He was found dead in el-Muqatta village on Tuesday 13th January.

On January 10-11 (or before, unclear), Military Forces and militia men arrested a man, owner of a jewelry shop in Sheikh Zuweiyid. Soldiers reportedly looted his shop. The following day, his body was found with 9 gunshot wounds in al-Shaarawy intersection in Sheikh Zuwayed. The man's brothers and father had been detained two days earlier by the army.

Unidentified assailants bombed a building on the outskirts of North Sinais Rafah which security forces use to monitor the militant group Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis. The building was empty when the gunmen bombed it.
Unknown gunmen attacked a checkpoint in Giza, injuring three policemen.
A group of Egyptian journalists protested in front of the Press Syndicate in Downtown Cairo in objection to the attack on French satire newspaper Charlie Hebdo.

Army forces and police forces raided areas hiding militants in North Sinais al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid. The raids left 10 militants killed. Xinhua reported that the militants belonged to State of Sinai.

Late Wednesday, bodies of four civilians, three of them beheaded, were found in the southern Sheikh Zuweid city. Three of the bodies had been tortured and severely burned, while the fourth one was shot dead.
Three people were killed and a girl was injured when unidentified gunmen opened fire toward them in Rafah.
Security forces killed seven militants on Wednesday in North Sinai, including five who were complicit in the abduction and murder of an officer.

An Egyptian soldier was killed trying to defuse a roadside bomb in Sheikh Zuweid in the Sinai Peninsula on Thursday.
A police officer was injured early Thursday in a blast outside a police station in Alexandria.

Protests in Cairos Matariya district.
A woman was killed after a shell from an unknown origin fell over her house in North Sinais Rafah.
A car bomb went off outside a police station in Egypts second city, Alexandria, on Friday, leaving no deaths or casualties behind.
Property destruction: A public transportation bus was set on fire in Alexandria on Friday by unidentified persons, damaging the bus but leaving no casualties behind.
Security forces allegedly killed an 18-year-old university student during clashes with protesters in the Giza governorates Hawamdeya neighbourhood on Friday.
A group of students in Alexandria University, Engineering Faculty, organized a march on Saturday [17 Jan] to denounce the abuse of Islams Prophet Muhammad by the French Charlie Hebdo weekly.
An Improvised Explosive Device (IED) went off on the Suez-Ismailia railroad early Saturday, leaving no injuries behind.
Security forces killed two Islamist militia members, arrested 14 suspects, destroyed 23 militant hideouts and seized six motorcycles in Arish on Sunday.
A suspect in the attack on security personnel guarding a church in the Upper Egypt governorate of Minya was killed in a police shootout.

A roadside bomb exploded Sunday evening in the area around Al-Tawil village, west of Sheikh Zuweid, leaving one army officer and three conscripts injured. Members of the State of Sinai were accused of planting the bomb.
A child was injured when a homemade bomb went off in eastern Alexandria on Monday [19 January].
A total of four alleged militants were killed and 27 people were arrested in military operations over the last two days in the Sinai Peninsula.

An officer and two conscripts were injured Tuesday after an explosive device detonated south of Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai. State of Sinai claimed responsibility.
A total of four militants were killed in a shootout with military troops in Shaykh Zuwayid and Al-Arish cities in North Sinai, the army spokesman said Wednesday [21 January].

Defusal: An anti-tank mine was defused in Naj Shabana area in Rafah as part of a campaign of raids on militant hideouts.
Security forces dispersed Wednesday evening a march organised by Muslim Brotherhood supporters in downtown Cairo.

On the night of 22 January 2015, several members of the Homeland Security - Egypt's main domestic security services - and of the General Investigations Department - the Criminal Investigations Department - broke into the home of a freelance journalist in 6th of October City, 30km west of Cairo. Without showing any warrant, they searched the rooms and confiscated his computer, mobile phones and identification papers before arresting him. Brought to the Security Forces camp of Sheikh Zayed, he was detained incommunicado and tortured for two consecutive days to force him to confess to crimes.

Two people, including a police officer were injured when a small bomb exploded outside the presidential palace in Cairo. An unknown assailant on a motorbike threw the bomb in front of the main entrance of the Al-Qubba palace before fleeing.

A bomb exploded in Helwan damaging the house of the judge presiding over the ""prison break"" trial in which ousted president Mohamed Mursi is a defendant. The incident was denied by the Cairo Security Directorate.

Dozens of members of the Ahrar youth group held a protest in Downtown Cairo. Security forces dispersed the rally, arresting sixteen. Daily News Egypt reported the protesters using molotov cocktails and bricks in clashes with police.
An IED exploded in front of a police station in Shubra Al Kheima, Cairo, while another one planted at the same police station was dismantled. No causalities reported.
Four homemade bombs went off beneath an electricity pole in Gizas Marryutiyah district on Friday 23 January. No casualties reported.

The son of Mohamed El Beltagy, Secretary General of the Freedom and Justice Party - the political wing of the Muslim Brotherhood was brought to Nasr City Police Department, where he was tortured for two consecutive days by means of beatings and electrocution, and eventually charged by the Public Prosecutor, on 25 January 2015, with ""participation to illegal demonstrations"".

A young woman was shot dead and another was injured on Friday amid clashes between Muslim Brotherhood supporters and residents in east Alexandria. Security forces opened fire to disperse the demonstrators.
Three militants were killed in a military campaign in Sinai between 21 January and 26 January. 23 hotbeds were destroyed, two RPGs, as well as two suicide belts and a sticky bomb were also seized.
Protests in support of Mohamed Morsi erupted in Cairo and other provinces including Port Said, Minya, Minufiya, Sharqiya and Qalioubiya and 15 more were arrested.

A bomb in Alf Maskan district of Cairo wounded four policemen and a civilian Friday. Ajnad Misr claimed responsibility.
Security bodies in Al-Gharbiyah [north of Cairo] arrested 10 elements of the Muslim Brotherhood group during protests in Al-Mahallah.

Two explosions in Boulad village, in Beheira led to the collapse of an electricity tower and a power outage.

A movement called the Popular Resistance claimed responsibly for an attack on the Central Security barracks in Kafr al-Dawar city, in Beheira province, north of Cairo.

A Muslim Brotherhood-linked group called Revolutionary Punishment Movement in Suez claimed responsibility for detonating two sound bombs near police stations in Suez governorate. No casualties.
Two high-pressure electricity towers in Quwisna and Kafr al-Zayyat were subjected to sabotage acts at 0400am (0200gmt) on Sunday.

Two high-pressure electricity towers in Quwisna and Kafr al-Zayyat were subjected to sabotage acts at 0400am (0200gmt) on Sunday.
A home-made bomb went off near a railway in Al-Minufiyah governorate. No casualties were reported.
A protest was staged by Kifayah movement and revolutionary forces at Sawaqi Square in the Fayyum governorate.

Security forces dispersed two rallies staged by several members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group in Kafr al-Shaykh. Security forces used tear gas to disperse the protesters who set fire to wood and car tires.
Injuries were reported in Minya governorate during protests on 25th January.
A reporter for the daily Al-Fagr was assaulted by pro-government demonstrators near Tahrir Square.
A number of members of the Muslim Brotherhood threw fireworks on the central security camp in Al-Zaqaziq in Al-Sharqiyah province, north of Cairo, but no casualties were reported.

A Muslim Brotherhood rally took place in Ain Shams district of Cairo. One man was killed after being shot in the head by live rounds during clashes.
A pro-Mohamed Mursi protester was killed when security forces dispersed a Muslim Brotherhood rally in Muntazah district of Alexandria. The protester was armed and shooting at residents.
