column17: One police officer was injured in a protest in Giza, where around 200 reported Brotherhood members gathered. The protesters fired bullets and birdshot at security forces and set fire to the Haram district building using Molotov cocktails.
Skirmishes between supporters of al-Sisi and people injured during the 2011 uprisings were reported outside the press syndicate in Cairo. Security forces fired teargas to disperse them.
State of Sinai members were accused of kidnapping a young man in North Sinai who belongs to one of the tribes south of Sheikh Zuweid.
Explosions targeted a main gas pipeline, two buses and five electric transformers located in residential neighbourhoods in the 10th of Ramadan City in Sharqeya on Sunday with no reported casualties.
The Students Against the Coup movement (SAC) posted a picture of an overturned police truck on the side of the road in the city of Balteem.
Protests were reported in the city of Menufiya, ""repeating anti-army and -police chants, which provoked the locals to clash with them"".
Four photojournalists and one reporter were injured as a result of birdshots, in addition to three who were assaulted and beaten whilst covering protests in Cairo.
A group called The Death Cell opened fire against the police forces that were guarding El-Labban Police Station leaving several conscripts injured.
A group called the Death Cell opened fire against police forces that were guarding Khorshid Police Station, affiliated with Montazah Police Station.

A group called The Death Cell opened fire against a logistical vehicle of Sidi Gaber Police Station leaving a corporal dead. The group also set fire to the Factories Police Station, affiliated with Sidi Gaber Police Station.
Defusal: A group called The Death Cell planted several explosive charges in public squares and streets in Alexandria; several of them were defused by bomb experts.
Protesters set ablaze the road leading to the Zohour police station in the Port Said governorate.
Defusal: Disposal experts defused a bomb that was fixed to a utility pole in Al-Matamir village in Beheira [north of Cairo] on Monday.
Defusal: Security forces in North Sinai detonated Monday [26 January] an explosive charge planted by unidentified men on the 23 July Street in Arish.
Arrests: Security forces at Port Said Security Directorate foiled an attempt to explode one of the electricity pylons in the governorate. The suspect was arrested.
Security forces found three bodies with gunshots in a desert area in eastern Arish.
Unidentified gunmen opened fire at an ambulance carrying a wounded civilian in southern Rafah but no casualties were reported.
One person was reported killed and at least two people were injured in acts of violence during protests in Hilwan [southern Cairo] Monday night [26 January].
A conscript was wounded in a shootout between gunmen and police forces at Shaykh Zuwayid police station.
A home-made explosive charge went off in a toilet at Aswan court complex on Monday. Civil defense forces and bomb-disposal experts rushed to the scene to look for more bombs.

Three explosive charges went off in a sanitary drainage line and transformers in Minya al-Qamh and Al-Zaqaziq cities, in Al-Shaqiyah. No casualties reported. Disposal experts and defense forces rushed to the scene to search for more bombs and put out the fire in the transformers.

Three explosive charges went off in a sanitary drainage line and transformers in Minya al-Qamh and Al-Zaqaziq cities, in Al-Shaqiyah. No casualties reported. Disposal experts and defense forces rushed to the scene to search for more bombs and put out the fire in the transformers.
A city tram was set on fire in Alexandria by unidentified people. The tram was burned after a number of Molotov cocktails were thrown at it. Nobody is reported to have been injured in the blaze.
Clashes between Muslim Brotherhood protesters and security forces in Matariya, Cairo renewed Monday night. One reportedly killed.

A fire erupted in a store of Mobinil, the countries second-largest mobile services provider, in Shubra al-Khaymah in Al-Qalyubiyah [north of Cairo] on Monday. Someone threw a Molotov cocktail at the store. One of the attackers was reported dead of severe burns he got during the attack.
Defusal: A bomb disposal team defused eight bombs in Cairo, three of them outside the New Cairo Court on Monday.
Defusal: One bomb was defused in Nasr Citys City Stars shopping mall.
A train carriage was set ablaze in Shebin al-Kom station in Menufia, leaving at least 25 injured. Unknown men threw molotov cocktails inside.
Student protesters carried out ""surprise morning marches"" early Monday morning in Cairos Alf Maskan and Ain Shams neighbourhoods
""Revolutionaries"" set fire to the highway in front of Mall of Arabia in 6th October city.
Protesters in Assiut escalated their demonstrations and blocked the Assiut-Cairo highway.
Protesters created a number of road blockades in Cairo and other governorates.
Protests erupted Monday in Alexandria, Damietta, Fayoum, Beni Suef, Kafr Al-Sheikh and North Sinai.
Protests erupted Monday in Alexandria, Damietta, Fayoum, Beni Suef, Kafr Al-Sheikh and North Sinai.
Protests erupted Monday in Alexandria, Damietta, Fayoum, Beni Suef, Kafr Al-Sheikh and North Sinai.
Protests erupted Monday in Alexandria, Damietta, Fayoum, Beni Suef, Kafr Al-Sheikh and North Sinai.
Protests erupted Monday in Alexandria, Damietta, Fayoum, Beni Suef, Kafr Al-Sheikh and North Sinai.
Protests erupted Monday in Alexandria, Damietta, Fayoum, Beni Suef, Kafr Al-Sheikh and North Sinai.
Defusal: Nine explosive devices were found in the vicinity of a church and a mosque in Fayoum, which were defused by police officers.
Student protesters carried out ""surprise morning marches"" early Monday morning in Cairos Alf Maskan and Ain Shams neighbourhoods.
A bomb went off Tuesday morning in Port Said near the temporary headquarters of the Workers Union Federation. No casualties were reported.
The Muslim Brotherhoods political wing, the Freedom and Justice Party (FJP), said that protesters marched in Fayoum.
The pro-Morsi group Students Against the Coup (SAC) reported protests in Daqahleya governorate.

A car carrying an explosive device exploded in the vicinity of a police station in Montazah district of of Alexandria, killing one of the Muslim Brotherhood passengers and injuring two other passengers.

Unidentified men Tuesday [27 January] set fire to a police station in Hannoville district in western Alexandria governorate. The fire broke out after those unknown persons hurled Molotov cocktails at the police station.
Defusal: Two bombs were defused in Al-Wifaq area in Rafah and Al-Barahmah area in Al-Shaykh Zuwayid
Defusal: Two bombs were defused in Al-Wifaq area in Rafah and Al-Barahmah area in Al-Shaykh Zuwayid.
Defusal: Unidentified assailants targeted railway stations in Aswan with two bombs. Bomb-disposal experts diffused them.
Defusal: Bomb-disposal experts and civil defence forces managed on Tuesday [27 January] to defuse several bombs planted by unidentified persons in the governorate of Kafr al-Shaykh.
Defusal: Bomb-disposal experts and civil defence forces managed on Tuesday [27 January] to defuse several bombs planted by unidentified persons in the governorate of Al-Minufiyah.
Eight people were injured at a police checkpoint when unknown assailants threw a bomb in Shubra al-Khaymah in Al-Qalyubiyah.
Security forces evacuated a building at the Heliopolis Court on Tuesday after finding two explosive devices in its vicinity. One of the bombs detonated upon inspection.
An unidentified person threw a bomb against the Abu Zabal police station in Kankha in Qalyubia province. No injuries reported.
A bomb went off in Fayoum close to a police station leaving one minor injury. Bomb-disposal experts and civil defence forces managed to defuse other bombs planted by unidentified persons.
An Improvised Explosive Device (IED) exploded inside the Kom Ombo court in the southern Egyptian city of Aswan on Wednesday. No casualties were reported.
A sound bomb was detonated in Qena, while another was dismantled by security forces close to a checkpoint on Wednesday.
Defusal: In Cairos downtown, bomb experts dismantled an explosive device, which was found at a bus stop in Abdel Moneim Riyadh Square on Wednesday morning.
A number of Muslim Brotherhood members were arrested as they attempted to block the Cairo-Alexandria road in Damanhur.
Security forces in Al-Qalubiyah province, north of Cairo, broke up a rally that was staged by supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood on Wednesday [28 January].
Property destruction: Unidentified assailants set fire to a train in Shibin Qanatir- Marj on Wednesday [28 January]. No casualties reported.
A police officer was killed when militants threw a bomb at him in the canal city of Suez.
An officer was killed when a rocket struck an army checkpoint in the town of Rafah.

Dozens of women protested Thursday against Egypts police in the central Cairo square where a female demonstrator was shot dead on the eve of the anniversary of the 2011 uprising. A rival demonstration was held across the road.
A policeman sustained gunshot wounds to his head after four unknown assailants opened fire at him in upper Egypts Minya governorate.
An improvised explosive device (IED) exploded on the Fayoum-Wasty railroad. No casualties were reported.
A decapitated body was found in North Sinais Sheikh Zuweid city.

Two people were arrested Thursday while trying to plant bombs in the Al-Warraq neighbourhood in Giza. Police forces shot at them, and one of them was injured and transferred to Agouza hospital to receive medical treatment.
State of Sinai attacked a number of army checkpoints, police HQs and military bases in North Sinais Al-Arish, killing at least 30 people.
On Friday, police arrested tens of pro-Morsi protesters affiliated with the Brotherhood in the provinces Alexandria, Fayoum, Qena, Sharqiya and Gharbiya.
Egypts army clashed with militants responsible for killing over 26 security officers the day before in North Sinai, leaving two children dead.
An Egyptian interior ministry employee was killed in North Sinai. He was shot in the head in his home in the regional capital of El-Arish.
On Friday, police arrested tens of pro-Morsi protesters affiliated with the Brotherhood in the provinces Alexandria, Fayoum, Qena, Sharqiya and Gharbiya.
On Friday, police arrested tens of pro-Morsi protesters affiliated with the Brotherhood in the provinces Alexandria, Fayoum, Qena, Sharqiya and Gharbiya.
On Friday, police arrested tens of pro-Morsi protesters affiliated with the Brotherhood in the provinces Alexandria, Fayoum, Qena, Sharqiya and Gharbiya.
One person was injured when an improvised explosive device targeting security forces exploded in Alexandria.
On Friday, police arrested tens of pro-Morsi protesters affiliated with the Brotherhood in the provinces Alexandria, Fayoum, Qena, Sharqiya and Gharbiya.
Armed forces killed three militants during an exchange of fire in North Sinais Rafah on Saturday evening. Six military personnel were injured.
In Fayoum, a member of the now banned Muslim Brotherhood was arrested on charges of firing flares near the Fayoum police station.
The Ministry of Interior announced Saturday night that it arrested three suspects after they attempted to burn the Giza police station using birdshot and flares.
In Menufiya governorate, a police sergeant killed a citizen during a fight. The victim was involved in an altercation with the sergeants brother and when the sergeant arrived he shot the victim dead.
Unidentified gunmen opened fire on a security patrol in Suez governorate on Saturday [31 January]. Security forces exchanged fire with the gunmen and chased them. No injuries were reported.
Two sound bombs went off near one of the electricity towers in Tukh on Saturday [31 January 2015]. No injuries reported.
In the neighbourhood of Matariya in eastern Cairo, two people were arrested for torching a public transportation bus and attacking security forces.
An Egyptian policeman shot dead a Muslim Brotherhood member detained in a Cairo hospital with injuries from his arrest.
A detainee in Rod Al-Farag police station, a northern Cairo neighbourhood, died Saturday while in police custody. It is claimed he was tortured.
Local residents and relatives of a man who died in police custody, demonstrated in front of Rod Al-Farag police station, claiming he was tortured to death.
In Cairos Imbaba district, a civilian was shot dead by police after he failed to produce a proper license.
State of Sinai claimed in a statement Sunday an attack on a military vehicle in northern Al-Al-Arish, but did not mention casualties.
Defusal: Explosive experts dismantled a bomb beside the Borg Al-Arab post office in Alexandria Sunday.
A stun bomb went off in Arish on Sunday with no casualties reported.
Unidentified gunmen shot at an army conscript in North Sinais al-Arish city on Monday, causing his injury.
A child was killed and two people were injured in mortar attacks on two houses near North Sinais Rafah city.
Arrests: Security forces raided an educational center in Alexandria and arrested 29 people, mostly students and members of the Muslim Brotherhood, for allegedly planning protests.
The gas pipeline in Al-Arish exploded for the 28th time Monday night, while a bomb was successfully diffused near the south of the city.
Defusal: On Monday evening, a bomb was dismantled in Qaliubya planted by unidentified men.
Six members of the Muslim Brotherhood used shotguns, stones and petrol bombs to attack a bank and restaurant branches in Giza on 2 February.

Non-violent activity: An Egyptian court on Monday sentenced 183 people to death over the ransacking of a police station and the killing of 15 policemen after the 2013 ouster of President Mohammed Morsi.
An improvised explosive device (IED) exploded Tuesday near a branch of the defence ministry in Nasr City. No casualties reported.
A number of people belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood set the Alexandria tram in Al-Wardian area ablaze by throwing molotov cocktails at the carriage, but no casualties were reported.

Some two dozen demonstrators gathered at the Doctors Association in the Egyptian capital on Tuesday, demanding that the army release information about a promised cure for AIDS and hepatitis it has delayed since last year.

Defusal: Security forces thwarted on Tuesday [3 February] an attempt to detonate the main water pipeline in Tukh city of Al-Qalyubiyah Governorate [north of Cairo]. People affiliated to the Muslim Brotherhood were arrested and the bomb was defused.
An explosive device went off after the passage of a military convoy in North Sinais Rafah on Tuesday, leaving no casualties or losses.
Defusal: Security forces discovered an explosive device on a road south of al-Arish, which they dismantled.
A militant group called Popular Resistance in Giza released a two-minute video showing masked gunmen setting fire to an Emirates National Bank branch in Haram Street in Giza with molotov cocktails.
Defusal: Two explosive devices were discovered at the Cairo International Airport. Both devices were dismantled before they exploded.
One person was killed when unknown militants on a motorcycle threw flammable materials and shot at a Kentucky Fried Chicken restaurant in Birket al Saba, Quweisna city, Menoufia province.

column16: Daily News (Egypt); Menastream; Aswat Masriya (Egypt); AP
column17: Three people were killed in an IED explosion in Agami district of Alexandria on Tuesday. Another bomb went off close to a gas station but with no injuries reported.
An Improvised Explosive Device went off in the vicinity of Talaat Harb Square in downtown Cairo early Tuesday, leaving four people injured.

column6: Military Forces of Egypt (2014-) Border Guards
column17: Egyptian soldiers opened fire on Tuesday at Palestinian national security forces stationed at the borderline area between southern Gaza Strip and Egypt, no injuries were reported. A large explosion was followed by intensive gunshots fired at the borderline area. Palestinian authorities claimed they did not fire back.
The Ministry of Religious Endowments organised a demonstration Tuesday, in front of Abbasiyas Al-Noor Mosque, in solidarity with the armed forces and the police.
One conscript was killed and another was injured in a drive-by shooting by unidentified assailants outside a hotel in North Sinais al-Arish.
Two home-made bombs went off on Friday [6 February] near 6th of October police station. No injuries were reported.
A girl was killed and four men were injured when a homemade bomb exploded on Friday [6 Feb] in eastern Alexandria.
A number of citizens gathered in Cairos downtown Square of Abd-al-Munim Riyadh to support the army and police in their fight against terrorism.
A number of rallies were staged nationwide to condemn terrorism and to support the army and police. The rallies were launched in Tanta, Damietta and Marsa Matruh.
A number of rallies were staged nationwide to condemn terrorism and to support the army and police. The rallies were launched in Tanta, Damietta and Marsa Matruh.
Security forces shot dead a civilian at a security checkpoint in North Sinais Sheikh Zuweid late Friday.
Twenty-five State of Sinai militants were killed and at least 20 others were injured on Friday in a military aerial bombardment over North Sinais town of Sheikh Zuweid.
A bomb exploded Friday night near a police facility stationed around the Saqqara area, after ""unknown assailants planted the device"".
State media reported that pro-army demonstrations took place in the cities of Mahallah and Hurghada. No reports mentioned that the protests were dispersed by the police.
State media reported that pro-army demonstrations took place in the cities of Mahallah and Hurghada. No reports mentioned that the protests were dispersed by the police.

Fierce clashes erupted Friday [6 February] between security forces and members of the Muslim Brotherhood group in Cairos densely populated neighbourhood of Matariya [East of Cairo]. The Brotherhood members attacked police and citizens with fireworks.

A number of rallies were staged nationwide to condemn terrorism and to support the army and police. The rallies were launched in Tanta, Damietta and Marsa Matruh. State media mentioned that some police personnel participated in the protest in Marsa Matruh.
Three policemen were shot dead and two others injured when they came under fire near the southern city of Minya. The policemen were conducting a raid against assailants in Damshou Hashem.

""State of Sinai"", formally known as Ansar Beit Al-Maqdis, claimed responsibility on Sunday for an IED explosion that resulted in ""the burning and destruction"" of a military vehicle in Rafah. Although a number of deaths reportedly occurred in the incident, an official statement was not released regarding the explosion.
Following the violent dispersal of fans by police forces in Cairo, numbers of them rallied outside the stadium and set a police car ablaze in protest of the violence against them.

Students at Al-Azhar University kicked off the new semester with short protests on campus. Security forces entered Al-Azhar University shortly after female students joined for a protest in front of the cafeteria.
A bomb exploded in front of the Sheikh Zayed youth centre in 6th of October City.
Students at Cairo University and Al-Azhar University protested on campus.
Defusal: In Ismailia, bomb squads defused three devices that were left inside three schools across the area of Qantara Gharb in Ismailia.
Strikes: More than 50 Syrian and Palestinian refugees detained in an Alexandria jail announced a hunger strike to protest ""inhumane treatment"".

At least 26 fans arrested following a deadly stampede at a Cairo football stadium last week were tortured in Abu Nomros police station in Giza. Detainees were subject to electrocution and beatings with weapons at the hands of police in the station.

At least 22 Egyptian soccer fans were killed and some 20 others injured on Sunday night in the capital Cairo. The fans were killed due to suffocation and stampede after police forces used teargas to disperse them.
Two people were injured, and five shops were shattered in separate bomb explosions across Helwan on Sunday.
A video released by State of Sinai militants showed the assassination of two Egyptian soldiers by masked militants in Arish.

At the Faculty of Engineering of Alexandria University, students organized a march in protest against the incidents that took place Sunday night when scores of fans were killed and wounded in a stampede during the Zamalek-Enppi soccer match in Cairo.
Unidentified assailants shot dead a North Sinai resident they had earlier kidnapped under the pretext that he was ""cooperating with security apparatuses"".
Demolition: Eight hideouts were destroyed on Monday during security campaigns in the North Sinai city of Sheikh Zuweid.
On Monday, State of Sinai released a video purporting to show the beheading of 6 Bedouin men, over allegations of providing the Egyptian army with information about their bases.
The army killed 15 Islamist militants in an air raid late on Monday in three villages of Sheikh Zuweid city. The raids targeted houses of members of State of Sinai.
Seven militants were killed and eight others arrested in clashes with the armed forces in Sheikh Zuweid city on Tuesday.
Two bombs exploded in Smouha (Sidi Gabir) in Alexandria causing no casualties.
A bomb exploded outside a police station in Raml wounding one civilian.
A conscript was injured in North Sinais town of Sheikh Zuweid on Tuesday after unidentified gunmen shot at him.
A child received a gunshot wound to the head during clashes between security forces and ""extremists"" in North Sinais Rafah and was rushed to hospital.
A bomb, planted outside a police station in the Sidi Beshir part of Alexandria exploded, causing no casualties.
At least nine civilians were wounded on Tuesday when a bomb went off at a police station in Egypts coastal city of Alexandria
Contracted workers protested on the premises of Tourah Cement company.
13 militants were killed in an airstrike during security raids in Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai.
4 militants were killed in land raids during security operations in Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.
A soldier was killed on Thursday [12 February] when unknown gunmen opened fire at him in the district of Al-Hassana, central Sinai.

Over the past week, five bombs exploded on railways from Cairo to Alexandria, Cairo to Aswan, and Giza, while two exploded on the Cairo-Tanta and Gharbeya railways. The explosions delayed up to seven trips per day in both directions, and damaged the rails for a distance of up to 80km.

Over the past week, five bombs exploded on railways from Cairo to Alexandria, Cairo to Aswan, and Giza, while two exploded on the Cairo-Tanta and Gharbeya railways. The explosions delayed up to seven trips per day in both directions, and damaged the rails for a distance of up to 80km.

Over the past week, five bombs exploded on railways from Cairo to Alexandria, Cairo to Aswan, and Giza, while two exploded on the Cairo-Tanta and Gharbeya railways. The explosions delayed up to seven trips per day in both directions, and damaged the rails for a distance of up to 80km.
Over the past week, two bombs exploded on the Cairo-Tanta and Gharbeya railways.
In Alf Maskan district, protests were forcibly dispersed by police.

Between 8 and 18 suspected militants were killed on Friday in military air strikes over North Sinais border town of Rafah. One of the suspected militants belonged to the Sinai-based militant group Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis (State of Sinai).
Families of the 20 Coptic Egyptians kidnapped in Libya demonstrated outside the journalists syndicate in downtown Cairo on Friday demanding their release.
Eight security personnel and a civilian were injured early Friday in a blast in Ain Shams district from a makeshift bomb. Ajnad Misr claimed responsibility. A police officer was killed.
Two suicide car bombs from Islamic militants wounded six people on Saturday when officers fired on the vehicles as they approached a police station in Sheikh Zuweid, in the Sinai Peninsula.
A soldier was injured after armed assailants shot him in the head. The 24-year-old soldier was attacked while standing at a security site in central Sinai.
Defusal: Al-Qalyubiyah police forces defused a primitive bomb that was planted near the electricity administration building in Banha city.
A conscript was killed and three others injured in an armed attack on a security checkpoint in the Kafr al-Jazzar area of Banha, in the governorate of Qalyubia to the north of Cairo.

In February 2015, two brothers arrested two days before at their home in Al Arish by military forces and taken to military prison Battalion 101 were allegedly shot by soldiers. They were found dead on the road, close to Al Raysan village, South of Al Arish. The exact date of each incident is not known.
A bomb exploded and damaged parts of the railway in the Tanta neighbourhood of Kafr Dima Shoubra, and no injuries were reported.

Dozens of Egyptian Muslims and Christians organized a march outside Saint Mark Coptic Orthodox Cathedral in Cairo in protest of the beheading of 21 kidnapped Egyptian Copts by Daish militants in Libya.
Following a funeral for the 21 Egyptians killed in Libya, a large protest was staged in the village of Al-Our in Minya to condemn the beheadings.
At a protest gathering outside the union of journalists in Cairo, relatives of detained Egyptian men in Libya appealed to the Egyptian authorities to help secure their release.
Unidentified gunmen attacked a security checkpoint in North Sinais al-Arish on Monday night, injuring a conscript and two civilians.
Three militants were killed in ground raids by the Egyptian military near Sheikh Zuweid.
A conscript with the Central Security Forces was injured in an attack by unidentified assailants while on duty in Rafah.
Six militants were killed in air raids by the Egyptian army near North Sinais Sheikh Zuweid.
A North Sinai citizen was killed in a mortar attack on his house in Rafah. The source of the mortar shell remains unknown.
A conscript was killed and a police officer was injured when unidentified gunmen shot at a security patrol in Suez.
A civilian was killed in an explosion in the vicinity of the October 6 Police Station in Giza.
Protests were held by students supporting ousted President Mohammed Morsi and the Muslim Brotherhood at universities in Cairo and Alexandria.
Protests were held by students supporting ousted President Mohammed Morsi and the Muslim Brotherhood at universities in Cairo and Alexandria.
Two militants were killed on Thursday [19 February] in a blast from an explosive device in the city of Samalut, Al-Minya [Upper Egypt].

Defusal: Sappers in Al-Gharbiyah Governorate [north of Cairo] on Friday [20 February] defused five home-made bombs. The bombs were placed by unidentified men under a high voltage tower in Samanud city.
One person was killed and two others were injured in clashes between protesters and other residents in Cairos Matariya district after police peacefully dispersed them.
A policeman was killed on Saturday after unidentified assailants driving a car hit him near North Sinais Sheikh Zuweid city.
A bomb exploded inside a car belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood leaving one passenger dead and another injured in Beni Suef. Two passersby were injured.
A bomb attached to railway tracks at Kafr al-Zayyat station blew up. Sappers also found another explosive device but they managed to defuse it.

A lawyer died on 22 February inside Matariya police station. His death occurred after """"being tortured by electric shocks and being tied from the ceiling for eight hours, which caused an internal hemorrhage"""".

Around 100 farmers from Sadat in the Delta governorate of Menufiya gathered outside the Press Syndicate in Downtown Cairo Monday to protest against the government ignoring their demands over land sales.
Two men died Tuesday night inside the detention room of the Matariya Police Station, with the families of the deceased accusing the police of torture as their bodies showed signs of beatings.

At least 38 extremists were killed and 27 others were injured in raids launched by the Egyptian Armed Forces on militant hideouts in Rafah, Sheikh Zuweid and Al Arish cities of North Sinai province. Aerial raids started on 24th and carried on until the 25th February.
Defusal: A car bomb was dismantled and 12 militant hotbeds were destroyed, security sources said on Wednesday [25 February].
An explosive device killed a road sweeper in 6 October City.

At least 38 extremists were killed and 27 others were injured in raids launched by the Egyptian Armed Forces on militant hideouts in Rafah, Sheikh Zuweid and Al Arish cities of North Sinai province. Aerial raids started on 24th and carried on until the 25th February.

At least 38 extremists were killed and 27 others were injured in raids launched by the Egyptian Armed Forces on militant hideouts in Rafah, Sheikh Zuweid and Al Arish cities of North Sinai province. Aerial raids started on 24th and carried on until the 25th February.
One person was killed and two other people were wounded Thursday in a bombing outside a pizzeria in Imbabah.

Two bombs targeted the offices of Vodafone in Mohandeseen neighbourhood of Cairo, leaving one injured. A third bomb went off outside a branch of United Arab Emirates-owned Etisalat, damaging the store fronts but causing no casualties.
Two improvised explosive devices went off at a bus station in the governorate of Daqahliyah on Thursday, leaving no casualties. Security forces dismantled a third explosive device in the station.
A conscript was injured in a shooting incident near the Rafah border crossing in Sinai on Thursday. The source claimed that the shooting came from the Palestinian side of the crossing.
An explosion occurred on the border crossing between Sinai and the Palestinian Gaza Strip. No injuries reported.
A police conscript was killed during a drive-by shooting at a police checkpoint in Fayyum, with a 21-year-old conscript injured in the same attack.
The Egyptian military carried out raids in Rafah in North Sinai. 13 militants killed.
A government official was kidnapped in North Sinai governorate on Wednesday.
A conscript was injured in an attack on a police station in the town of Ibsheway.

Tens of Muslim Brotherhood supporters reportedly protested in different cities across Egypt. The demonstrations took place in various areas in several Egyptian governorates including Giza, Alexandria, Suez, Qaliubiya, Al-Arish, and Sohag.

Tens of Muslim Brotherhood supporters reportedly protested in different cities across Egypt. The demonstrations took place in various areas in several Egyptian governorates including Giza, Alexandria, Suez, Qaliubiya, Al-Arish, and Sohag.

Tens of Muslim Brotherhood supporters reportedly protested in different cities across Egypt. The demonstrations took place in various areas in several Egyptian governorates including Giza, Alexandria, Suez, Qaliubiya, Al-Arish, and Sohag.

Tens of Muslim Brotherhood supporters reportedly protested in different cities across Egypt. The demonstrations took place in various areas in several Egyptian governorates including Giza, Alexandria, Suez, Qaliubiya, Al-Arish, and Sohag.

Tens of Muslim Brotherhood supporters reportedly protested in different cities across Egypt. The demonstrations took place in various areas in several Egyptian governorates including Giza, Alexandria, Suez, Qaliubiya, Al-Arish, and Sohag.

Tens of Muslim Brotherhood supporters reportedly protested in different cities across Egypt. The demonstrations took place in various areas in several Egyptian governorates including Giza, Alexandria, Suez, Qaliubiya, Al-Arish, and Sohag.

At least 15 militants were killed and four others were injured on Friday in a security air raid launched by the Egyptian Armed Forces targeting the hideouts of State of Sinai, south of Sheikh Zuweid in the restive North Sinai province.
Unknown assailants bombed an electricity pylon in Egypts Sharqiya.
A conscript was injured when armed assailants attacked a security checkpoint in North Sinais Rafah city on Saturday evening.
Animal rights enthusiasts held a demonstration outside Cairo Opera House condemning the killing of a dog and calling on President Abdel Fattah Al-Sisi to issue a stricter animal rights law.
Two people were killed and seven others, including a police conscript, were injured in a blast outside a police station in Upper Egypts city of Aswan.

A militant group, named the Popular Resistance in Giza, released a two-minute video Sunday showing masked gunmen setting fire to a police checkpoint belonging to the Traffic Police department in Talbiya in Giza.
Approximately 150 members of Cairos lawyers syndicate demonstrated against the death of a colleague, who is believed to have died at the hands of police officers at Matariya police station .
Outside Samalout bishopric, dozens of Copts from the village of al-Galaa gathered to protest their suffering at the hands of Islamists in their village.

An improvised explosive device exploded in front of the main gate of the High Court in central Cairo, killing 2 civilians and injuring 11. Seven of the injured are security personnel, believed to be the intended target. A group named ""Revolutionary punishment"" claimed responsibility.
An explosive device went off in front of a police station in Al-Nozha, causing no injuries.
Minor clashes erupted in Assiut between student protesters and administrative security officials at Al-Azhar University. The clashes left the universities gate burning.
An improvised explosive device went off near Maadis fire station, causing no injuries.
Two bombs exploded in the neighbourhood of Matariya. No injuries were reported. However, the explosions damaged two branches of telecommunications company stores.

A total of eleven Islamist militants were killed in a wide-scale security campaign on Al-Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah cities in North Sinai, on 3 March. Warplanes and ground forces took part in the crackdown.

A total of eleven Islamist militants were killed in a wide-scale security campaign on Al-Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah cities in North Sinai, on 3 March. Warplanes and ground forces took part in the crackdown.
A civilians body was found dead near Sheikh Zuweid city in North Sinai and another citizen was kidnapped from his home by armed men.
The Egyptian military said that a total of 70 militants were killed in airstrikes and security raids in North Sinai this week.
The Egyptian military said that a total of 70 militants were killed in airstrikes and security raids in North Sinai this week.

A protest was organised by a group of teachers in front of Al-Azhar University. The teachers demanded employability in their protest and clashed with the security forces. Many of them were arrested. Four journalists were arrested while covering a protest.
The Egyptian military said that a total of 70 militants were killed in airstrikes and security raids in North Sinai this week.
In the village of al-Shamiya in Assiut, police set an ambush for a man who kidnapped Copts. He shot at the police but was caught.

On March 5, five prisoners held and tortured since February in Camp Al Zohor military prison, among which a 17 years old child and a mute man, were found dead by local residents in Al Sabkha, West of Sheikh Zuweiyid. The corpses had gunshot wounds in the head. On March 6, the Military Spokesperson claimed in a statement that the army killed five â€œterroristsâ€ after they attacked soldiers in al-Sabkha.
A bomb went off in the Al-Marg neighborhood of Cairo. No casualties reported.
A bomb blast in front of a mobile phone service store in Egypts textile town of Mahallah killed three policemen and wounded another 11 people.
Ten alleged members of State of Sinai militant group were killed, and 12 others were injured in army air strikes over North Sinais town of Sheikh Zuweid.
A policeman was injured in a drive by shooting in Fayoum on Friday.
Two explosive devices went off outside a gas supply unit in the suburban 6 October city.
A bomb went off in the Al-Amerya neighborhood of Cairo.
An explosive device went off in Zaytoun, causing no casualties.
An explosive device went off outside an electricity unit in Cairos Maadi neighborhood, damaging three cars.
A primitive explosive device went off outside a cell phone company in Delta city of Shibin Al-Kawm, leaving no injuries.
A bomb exploded early Sunday near the main gate of a central security camp in eastern Cairo. No causalities were reported

column16: Aswat Masriya (Egypt); Agence Tunis Afrique Presse
column17: A bomb blast took place outside a supermarket in the Seyouf district of eastern Alexandria, killing one person and injuring five.
A bomb blast took place outside the Bab Sharq police station in Alexandria, without causing casualties.
A bomb blast took place outside the Moharam Bek police station in Alexandria leaving four people injured. Another bomb outside the police station was dismantled.
Individuals belonging to the Revolutionary Punishment group admitted to placing a bomb under an officers car in Nasr City. Two cars were bombed around 8 March in the embassy district of Nasr City.
Dozens of farmers from Menufiya protested outside the High Court Sunday, against the alleged clearance of agricultural land by the Ministry of Housing.
Defusal: In Mahalla, four bombs were found and dismantled.

Three military conscripts were killed and three injured in an explosion when gunmen remotely detonated a roadside bomb when a military vehicle drove by, near a security checkpoint in Sheikh Zuweid city in North Sinai on Monday.
Tens of Ultras White Knights students protested in Cairos Helwan university.

An improvised explosive device went off in the coastal Alexandria cities Semouha neighbourhood early Monday, leaving no injuries. The blast damaged a large part of one of the telecommunication branches.
A bomb exploded Monday morning in front of a bank in Alexandria, leaving no injuries.
In Al-Fayum, a policeman was wounded when gunmen riding a bike opened fire at him.
Two people were killed in the early hours of Tuesday when an improvised explosive device they were carrying exploded in Fayoum to the southwest of Cairo.

A blast outside a central security forces camp in North Sinais al-Arish city killed two people, including a an electrical worker and the suicide bomber and left 30 injured on Tuesday. Security personnel responded by firing at the car. Ansar Beit al-Maqdis (Partisans of Jerusalem), said on Twitter it carried out the assault on the police base.

column16: Aswat Masriya (Egypt); Nile News TV; Menastream
column17: Militants set up a fake security checkpoint on a road, south of al-Arish city. When an armoured security vehicle moved toward the fake checkpoint, an improvised explosive device detonated. Two officers were killed and three conscripts injured.
Four bombs went off in the 10th of Ramadan City of Al-Sharqiyah governorate, north of Cairo. They caused no damage. Security forces dismantled four other bombs placed under two electricity pylons.
Three policemen were injured Wednesday [11 March] when a bomb planted under a police vehicle went off near a police station in Al-Mansurah [district of Al-Dakahliyah province, north of Cairo].

Security forces of North Sinai Security Directorate launched Wednesday [11 March] a security campaign in southern Al-Arish and Al-Shaykh Zuwayid. A total of 45 militants were killed in the second week of March in gunfire exchange, air raids and targeting of headquarters in North Sinai.

Security forces of North Sinai Security Directorate launched Wednesday [11 March] a security campaign in southern Al-Arish and Al-Shaykh Zuwayid. A total of 45 militants were killed in the second week of March in gunfire exchange, air raids and targeting of headquarters in North Sinai.
500 workers in a Suez Cement factory protested a proposed profit share distribution.
A military officer was killed in North Sinais Rafah city during an attack on a security checkpoint on Wednesday.
A home-made bomb went off near a mobile company store in Al-Manyal district [Giza province] early Thursday with no casualties reported.
A makeshift bomb exploded outside the Commercial International Bank [CIB] in Sadat City in Al-Munufiyah [north of Cairo] on Thursday but no casualties or damage were reported.
A sound bomb exploded near Luxor court complex on 12th March. No injuries were reported. Sappers defused another bomb in the precincts of the complex.
Three small bombs went off in an upscale Cairo neighbourhood popular with expatriates. No casualties were reported.
Three soldiers were wounded in a rocket attack in Sinai, north of Sharm El-Sheikh.

Egyptian army troops stationed on the border with Gaza opened fire on posts of the Palestinian national security forces on the evening of 13 March. Al-Risalah correspondent reported that a volley of heavy gunfire was opened at security posts in the Egyptian-Palestinian border area. No injuries were reported.

Defusal: Security forces arrested six members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group who planted homemade bombs in a number of districts in Tanta city, Gharbiyah [governorate, north of Cairo]. Bomb disposal experts defused the bombs.
A small bomb killed a street cleaner in the Egyptian capital Cairo.

The Egyptian army conducted a wide-scale security campaign in North Sinai, security sources said Saturday [14 March]. A total of 45 militants were killed in the second week of March in gunfire exchange, air raids and targeting of headquarters in North Sinai.

The Egyptian army conducted a wide-scale security campaign in North Sinai, security sources said Saturday [14 March]. A total of 45 militants were killed in the second week of March in gunfire exchange, air raids and targeting of headquarters in North Sinai.
A bomb exploded next to a bank in the Sidi Beshr neighbourhood of Alexandria, wounding four people.
A blast was also reported at the Kom al-Dekka district in central Alexandria, leaving no injuries yet destroying a number of vehicles, shops and buildings nearby.
Defusal: Militants planted a fake bomb at Al-Badrashin train station in Giza governorate. Bomb disposal teams dismantled the fake bomb.
Students from the German University in Cairo (GUC) took part in a sit-in after a student died after being run over by a university bus.

An internal scuffle erupted on the evening of Sunday 15 March in Wadi al-Rayan in Fayoum and escalated into a fight with knives that led to two monks being moved to hospital suffering various injuries.
Defusal: Sappers managed to defuse six explosive charges that were planted at a crossroad and under a bridge in Bahr Muwas district between Al-Zaqaziq and Mit Ghamr [north of Cairo].
Arrests: Security forces arrested 153 members of the Muslim Brotherhood as part of the interior ministries efforts to arrest those who committed violence in the country.
Non-violent activity: Egyptian courts in Giza condemned to death Muslim Brotherhood leader Mohamed Badie and 21 other members of the banned movement in two separate cases over incitement to violence.
A police officer died late Tuesday due to wounds sustained in a drive-by shooting in the border governorate of Marsa Matrouh.
A civilian was shot dead and another injured south of al-Arish city. Elsewhere in Arish a number of unidentified gunmen opened fire at a citizen who was rushed to hospital with wounds to the chest.
Security troops stormed a number of hotbeds of militants in the North Sinai cities, sources said Wednesday [18 March].
Security troops stormed a number of hotbeds of militants in the North Sinai cities, sources said Wednesday [18 March].
Security troops stormed a number of militant hotbeds in the North Sinai cities. An Islamist element was killed and 14 suspects arrested.

A crude bomb went off near a television transmission station in Bani Suwayf [south of Cairo] on Wednesday [18 March]. Bomb squads managed to defuse four other bombs in the site. No casualties were reported in the blast.

Five people were injured when an explosive device, planted by unidentified people, exploded Wednesday [18 March] near the headquarters of the Holding Company for Drinking Water and Waste Water (HCWW) in Fayyum governorate.

Arrests: 68 militant elements were arrested in a security campaigns carried out nationwide. Members of the Muslim Brotherhood group were arrested in a large-scale campaign in Cairo, Al-Minufiyah, Al-Daqahliyah and Al-Buhayrah.

Arrests: 68 militant elements were arrested in a security campaigns carried out nationwide. Members of the Muslim Brotherhood group were arrested in a large-scale campaign in Cairo, Al-Minufiyah, Al-Daqahliyah and Al-Buhayrah.

Arrests: 68 militant elements were arrested in a security campaigns carried out nationwide. Members of the Muslim Brotherhood group were arrested in a large-scale campaign in Cairo, Al-Minufiyah, Al-Daqahliyah and Al-Buhayrah.

Arrests: 68 militant elements were arrested in a security campaigns carried out nationwide. Members of the Muslim Brotherhood group were arrested in a large-scale campaign in Cairo, Al-Minufiyah, Al-Daqahliyah and Al-Buhayrah.
A security campaign targeting militant hotbeds in North Sinai on Thursday left a total of 28 suspected militants killed.
A security campaign targeting militant hotbeds in North Sinai on Thursday left a total of 28 suspected militants killed.
A security campaign targeting militant hotbeds in North Sinai on Thursday left a total of 28 suspected militants killed.

Two people were killed in an attack on a youth centre in the neighbourhood of Kerdasa in Giza early Thursday. Unidentified assailants attacked it with Molotov cocktails. The centre was burnt to the ground.
Six suspected members of Sinai-based militant group State of Sinai were killed in a ground operation, south of Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai on Friday.
Two suspected members of Sinai-based militant group State of Sinai were killed in an aerial raid south of al-Arish city in North Sinai on Friday.
Security forces killed 10 suspected militants in an aerial raid on a deserted house in North Sinais Sheikh Zuweid region.

A sit-in was started by students of Fayoum University, protesting the security crackdown and the arrest of their colleagues. The sit-in started on 21 March, and ended with ""success"" as the detained students from the Faculties of Engineering and Science were released.
Security forces killed seven Islamist militants and arrested eight suspects during a security operation in Arish city.

Arrests: 11 militant cells, belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood group, were seized over charges of exploding a number of electricity stations and towers in the governorates of Al-Gharbiyah [north of Cairo], Al-Minya and Al-Fayyum [south of Cairo].

Arrests: 11 militant cells, belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood group, were seized over charges of exploding a number of electricity stations and towers in the governorates of Al-Gharbiyah [north of Cairo], Al-Minya and Al-Fayyum [south of Cairo].

Arrests: 11 militant cells, belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood group, were seized over charges of exploding a number of electricity stations and towers in the governorates of Al-Gharbiyah [north of Cairo], Al-Minya and Al-Fayyum [south of Cairo].
Gunmen in a car shot dead a policeman in the city of El-Arish in the north of the Sinai peninsula.
A roadside bomb killed two Egyptian soldiers and wounded six in an armoured vehicle. The explosion took place as army forces patrolled an area near the village of el-Kharouba near Sheikh Zuweid.
Defusal: Five suspects were arrested in a security campaign in Sheikh Zuweid and a bomb squad safely detonated a bomb planted to target the troops.

Two conscripts securing an embassy in Giza were injured in a drive-by shooting on the embassy. Two assailants driving a motorbike shot at the forces securing the embassy in Gizas Mohandeseen neighbourhood.
A 10-year-old girl was killed on Wednesday when an explosive device detonated outside her school in the Al-Hawatim area of Fayoum city, south of Cairo.
An official at a Suez police station was shot dead early Thursday during a chase with masked men which also left one of the assailants killed.
Scores of mostly young Muslims demonstrated in front of a church in Samalout, Minya.
The Church of the Virgin Mary in Samalout near to Minya was attacked by assailants using Molotov Cocktails and stones. In the attack, seven people were injured and one car was left burning.

Scores of hardline Muslims of al-Our village waged demonstrations that marched through the village in protest against the building of a new church. The demonstrators pelted the house of a Coptic family with stones. The police restored calm.
A bomb wounded four civilians and four policemen outside Cairo University on Saturday, in an attack claimed by Ajnad Misr.
A security campaign carried out in North Sinai on Saturday left a total of three suspected militants dead across Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.
A security campaign carried out in North Sinai on Saturday left a total of three suspected militants dead across Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.
A security campaign carried out in North Sinai on Saturday left a total of three suspected militants dead across Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.
Defusal: A civil guard squad deactivated a bomb and said it was a primitive one connected to an electric circuit.
Two Muslim Brotherhood members were arrested and charged with staging an illegal protest on 29 March. The location was not specified.
Security agents stormed the home of a journalist in Cairo, confiscated his cell phone and laptop, blindfolded him and escorted him to an unknown location in an enforced disappearance.
Six suspected militants were killed in clashes with security forces south of Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai.
Two policemen were injured on Monday while dismantling two explosive devices in the Egyptian coastal city of Alexandria.

On Tuesday 31 March Muslims in the village of Nassriya in Beni-Mazar, Minya held demonstrations against Christians and Christianity and pelted the Copts homes with stones, knocking threateningly on their doors and windows. The elders of the village Muslims intervened and calmed the situation, and security forces descended on the village to work at controlling the situation.
Defusal: Alexandria security forces dismantled on Wednesday [1 April] a home-made bomb found near the Al-anfushi Children Hospital, western the governorate.
A policeman in the Homeland Security branch was shot dead by unknown assailants in Menoufia to the north of the Egyptian capital.
Detonation: Three people were killed in a blast in the governorate of Sharqiya while manufacturing an explosive device inside their home.

State of Sinai released a video showing a soldier being shot in the head by a masked militant after another unidentified captive is beheaded. They were captured after an ambush on an army outpost in North Sinai on April 2.
A mortar shell fell on a house east of El-Arish, wounding three civilians.
Defusal: On 2 April, two bombs were dismantled in Beheira governorate.
Defusal: In Sharqiya province, the security forces managed to defuse two explosive devices targeting a power transmission tower.
A blast went off at a mall on a highway in Qalioubiya province without casualties.
Demonstrations by Muslim groups continued in the village of Nassriya in Beni-Mazar, Minya against Coptic Christians.

column16: AFP; Xinhua; Algeria Press Service; Aswat Masriya (Egypt)
column17: Seventeen security personnel and two civilians were killed in attacks by State of Sinai on five security checkpoints in Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai. The main target was Kharouba checkpoint. Security personnel were quick to respond to the attacks, killing 15 militants.

Thirty-five suspected State of Sinai militants were killed in military aerial raids on North Sinai late Thursday, hours after security personnel were killed in clashes with militants. Hideouts at Al-Hadaida and Al-Fitat towns southern Sheikh Zuweid were targeted.
Security forces launched an extensive campaign in North Sinai on Friday, killing a total of 15 suspected militants.
Security forces launched an extensive campaign in North Sinai on Friday, killing a total of 15 suspected militants.
A policeman was shot dead on Friday by unknown assailants on the Fayoum-Cairo road. Three masked men opened fire at two policemen, killing one while the other survived.

Security forces, led by Minyas chief of police for the north region, raided a building affiliated to the Maghagha archbishopric in Minya. During the raid, security forces seized belongings and assaulted youth inside the church house.

Demonstrations by Muslim groups continued in the village of Nassriya in Beni-Mazar, Minya and grew more violent following the Muslim Friday noon prayers. A Coptic-owned photo studio, pharmacy and several homes were damaged.

Arrests: Police arrested 44 members of the Muslim Brotherhood and its affiliated groups across the nation. The arrest is part of the interior ministries pre-emptive campaign that is targeting middle-ranked leaders of the Brotherhood.

The Armed Forces on Saturday [4 April] killed 35 militants and injured several others during raids against groups who were involved in Thursdays attacks on security points in Al-Arish and Al-Shaykh Zuyawid, North Sinai.
A homemade bomb went off outside Ahmad Urabi Primary School in Giza [south of Cairo] Saturday [4 April]. No casualties reported.

Some 11 men, a majority of whom were Coptic Christians, were injured during an assault by a group of fanatic Muslim villagers against Coptic Christians on Saturday 4 April in the village of al-Galaa in Samalout, Minya.
Arrests: Police raided a radio station and detained a rights advocate for broadcasting without a license in Cairo.
A total of 13 Islamist militants were killed in a wide-scale security campaign launched in south Arish, Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah cities in North Sinai governorate.
A total of 13 Islamist militants were killed in a wide-scale security campaign launched in south Arish, Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah cities in North Sinai governorate.

An explosive device went off at a bridge running over the uptown island of Zamalek in Cairo on Sunday, leaving one policeman dead and three people injured. Ajnad Misr (Soldiers of Egypt) claimed responsibility.
A total of 13 Islamist militants were killed in a wide-scale security campaign launched in south Arish, Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah cities in North Sinai governorate.
The founder of the militant group Ajnad Misr was killed in an exchange of fire with security forces in an apartment in Gizas Haram district.
A policeman and four civilians were injured in an attack Sunday evening that targeted a security station in the vicinity of a church in Agami area in Alexandria. No one claimed responsibility.

column16: Association for Freedom of Thought and Expression
column17: Police forces stormed the girls branch of Al Azhar university on 5 April, to break up a demonstration of the movement Students against the Coup.
A total of seven Islamist militants were killed in a security campaign in North Sinais Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.
A total of seven Islamist militants were killed in a security campaign in North Sinais Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.
Unidentified gunmen fired RPG shells at Al-Shaykh Zuwayid police station in North Sinai whilst riding a car and then fled the scene. No injuries reported.
Three people were wounded in a bomb blast near a camp of the central security forces in Al-Aqqad area south of Aswan on Monday [6 April].

A missile landed on a house in a village near Sheikh Zuweid, North Sinai, killing two civilians. Simultaneously, a mortar landed on a residential area south of Sheik Zuweid, a town in northern Sinai, hitting a house and killing nine of its residents.

At least two policemen were killed and three recruits injured on Wednesday night as their armored vehicle was hit by a blast in Arish city in Egypts North Sinai province. State of Sinai militant group were blamed.
Five militants were killed on Wednesday during clashes with security forces in North Sinai as part of the security raids on militants hideouts in the peninsula.
State of Sinai claimed responsibility for the killings of two people on Saturday, including a conscript and another individual, in footage that was released Friday.
Security forces dispersed a protest in Cairos Al-Waraq neighbourhood on Friday.
Security forces dispersed a protest in the Cairo neighbourhood of Mattariya and arrested a photojournalist.

On 10 April, a 63-year old lawyer was assaulted and arrested in the Mataria neighborhood where a demonstration was taking place against the government. He was detained in Mataria police station where he was allegedly subjected to torture, including a severe beating to his head. He later died in hospital on 22 April.

An explosive charge went off near Itay al-Barud police station in the Delta province of Al-Buhayrah [north of Cairo] Saturday [11 April]. No casualties reported. Police also cordoned off the area as sappers combed the vicinity of the police station in search for more bombs.
A resident of Manial, said an officer from the Old Cairo Police Station arrested his father and took him to the station where he died of low blood circulation. His body showed signs of torture.
An army captain and two soldiers were wounded in an attack on a checkpoint near the town of Rafah that borders the Palestinian Gaza Strip. State of Sinai said one of its snipers shot at them.
A roadside bomb attack on an army vehicle killed six soldiers and wounded two near the North Sinai town of Sheikh Zuweid. The attack was claimed by State of Sinai militants.
Police forces dispersed Sunday night a minor protest by the anti-government group Ultras Nahdawy in the vicinity of Tahrir Square, Cairo. No arrests or injuries were reported.
A spokesman for the victims of the 25 January Revolution, was found dead in Giza with torture traces on his body.

column16: AFP; Aswat Masriya (Egypt); Al Masry Al Youm (Egypt)
column17: A suicide car bomb targeting a police station in North Sinais provincial capital of El-Arish killed eight people and wounded 45 others. The attack was claimed by State of Sinai militants. The head of the investigation unit later died of injuries sustained.

A booby-trapped car exploded near a Coptic Church in Zagazig city, north of the capital Cairo. No injuries or damages were reported. Another bomb at the same location was dismantled by bomb squads before it detonated.
Gunmen shot dead a soldier at a checkpoint near the village of Abu Shinnar in the Rafah area. Another soldier was wounded at another checkpoint. There was no immediate claim of responsibility.
A bomb exploded in front of the Helwan district building Monday morning, reportedly leaving two security guards injured.

Six improvised bombs went off at electricity pylons in 6 October city, west of Giza province, near the media city located on the outside of the capital. Security forces defused two other devices. Revolutionary Punishment (Al-iqab Al-Thawri), an anti-government Islamist militant group, claimed responsibility for the attack.
A bomb exploded in 6 October city, west of Giza province, near the media city as Prime Minister Ibrahim Mehleb visited the site of blasts targeting the area the day before.
Gunmen on a motorcycle shot dead a policeman manning a checkpoint in Shibeen al-Qanatar, Qalyubia. Two policemen were wounded in the shooting.
A top-ranking policeman at Al-Arish Police Station in North Sinai was injured after he was shot by a sniper on Tuesday.
Arrests: Twenty-one leaders and elements of Jund Ansar Allah were arrested in manhunt campaigns in Alexandria and Al-Sharqiyah [north of Cairo], the Interior Ministry said Wednesday [15 April].
Arrests: Twenty-one leaders and elements of Jund Ansar Allah were arrested in manhunt campaigns in Alexandria and Al-Sharqiyah [north of Cairo], the Interior Ministry said Wednesday [15 April].

Two Egyptian military cadets were killed in a bombing in the Nile Valley city of Kafr al-Sheikh that also wounded 10 other people. One more military cadet died of injuries sustained from a bombing later in the week.
1,700 workers at the Construction Company and the Beheira Joint Company for Land Reclamation entered an open sit-in in April over unpaid salaries.

An armored military vehicle struck a roadside bomb during a raid on militant hideouts in Sheikh Zuweid, North Sinai Peninsula and the explosion killed one officer and wounded another. In a separate incident, security forces using a helicopter killed three suspected militants they accused of complicity in an explosion in Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai earlier on Thursday.
North Sinai police launched Friday [17 April] a security campaign in southern Arish and Shaykh Zuwiyd. A total of 10 Islamist militants were killed.
North Sinai police launched Friday [17 April] a security campaign in southern Arish and Shaykh Zuwiyd. A total of 10 Islamist militants were killed.
Four people were detained in the neighborhood of Matariya in Cairo after police tried to break up a protest rally organised by the Muslim Brotherhood.

Egyptian demonstrators took to the streets and formed human chains in the capital, Cairo, as well as other cities, including Alexandria, Giza, the Nile Delta provinces of Sharqiya, Dakahlia, Beheira and Kafr el-Sheikh as well as the Upper Egypt provinces of Fayoum, Bani-Suef and Minya, calling for the reinstatement of former president, Mohammed Morsi.

Egyptian demonstrators took to the streets and formed human chains in the capital, Cairo, as well as other cities, including Alexandria, Giza, the Nile Delta provinces of Sharqiya, Dakahlia, Beheira and Kafr el-Sheikh as well as the Upper Egypt provinces of Fayoum, Bani-Suef and Minya, calling for the reinstatement of former president, Mohammed Morsi.

Egyptian riot police attacked Muslim Brotherhood demonstrators in Alexandria's el-Safira neighborhood, firing bird shots and tear gas. A number of people were wounded and some others arrested in the incident.

Egyptian demonstrators took to the streets and formed human chains in the capital, Cairo, as well as other cities, including Alexandria, Giza, the Nile Delta provinces of Sharqiya, Dakahlia, Beheira and Kafr el-Sheikh as well as the Upper Egypt provinces of Fayoum, Bani-Suef and Minya, calling for the reinstatement of former president, Mohammed Morsi.

Egyptian demonstrators took to the streets and formed human chains in the capital, Cairo, as well as other cities, including Alexandria, Giza, the Nile Delta provinces of Sharqiya, Dakahlia, Beheira and Kafr el-Sheikh as well as the Upper Egypt provinces of Fayoum, Bani-Suef and Minya, calling for the reinstatement of former president, Mohammed Morsi.
Security forces dispersed a peaceful protest held by the Muslim Brotherhood in the Nasser neighborhood of Bani-Suef, south of Cairo, taking several participants into custody.

In the city of Alexandria, security guards stormed a mosque in the Raml neighborhood, arresting at least a dozen people who were to join an anti-government protest rally organised by the Anti-Coup Alliance which is led by the Muslim Brotherhood movement.

At least 13 militants were killed by the Egyptian armed forces on Saturday during their raids on militants cells south of Sheikh Zuweid and Arish cities in North Sinai province. The militants are believed to belong to the State of Sinai group.

At least 13 militants were killed by the Egyptian armed forces on Saturday during their raids on militants cells south of Sheikh Zuweid and Arish cities in North Sinai province. The militants are believed to belong to the State of Sinai group.
13 Islamist militants were killed and nine suspects arrested in a crackdown in Al-Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah cities, North Sinai. Three bombs were remotely exploded.
13 Islamist militants were killed and nine suspects arrested in a crackdown in Al-Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah cities, North Sinai. Three bombs were remotely exploded.
Two army conscripts and four civilians were injured on Sunday in a bomb blast in the Matariya district of Cairo.

Two persons were killed and one injured on Sunday in Daqahliya province, in a shootout on the international road near Gamasa city. Three attackers opened fire at a security point near to Delta University, when the police shot back. The attackers tried to escape, but the police manage to shoot two of them, injuring the third. No policemen were injured.

column16: Al Masry Al Youm (Egypt); Daily News (Egypt)
column17: Clashes broke out between Cairo University students and administrative security guards (Falcon security guards) leaving many injured and one student dead. Central Security Forces occupied the campus following the clashes. Un-uniformed men with weapons, including electric batons and knives were fighting alongside the campus security, severely beating students.

column16: Daily News (Egypt); Association for Freedom of Thought and Expression
column17: Security forces stormed the campus of Al-Azhar University in Cairo (COB) on 19 April, to break up a demonstration of the movement ""Students against the coup"", who were demonstrating against students being detained.
Defusal: Two bombs were defused near Ramses Square on 19th April.
Defusal: Two bombs were reportedly defused near the Al-Shorouk suburb of Cairo on 19th April.
Five police officers from the Salam Police Station reportedly beat and electrified a 16-year old girl who claimed to have been kidnapped by a thug, claiming she had fabricated the story.

A roadside bomb struck an armoured military vehicle on the Egyptian side of the city of Rafah on the Gaza border, killing an army officer and two soldiers. State of Sinai, an affiliate of the Islamic State group, said they carried out the bomb attack.
Mortar rounds struck a residential area south of the town of Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai late on Monday, killing two five-year old boys.

Non-violent activity: An Egyptian court confirmed death sentences against 22 supporters of ousted Islamist president Mohamed Morsi on Monday over an attack on a police station in which one officer was killed.
Egyptian police used tear gas to disperse a demonstration, allegedly organized by members of the Muslim Brotherhood, in Juhaina Square in the 6th of October City on Monday.
The militant group State of Sinai claimed the killing of an army officer at a security checkpoint Monday following a bomb attack earlier in the day.
The Cairo-Alexandria Agricultural Road was blocked by angry Menoufiya residents over the kidnapping of two students.
The Electricity and Energy Ministry on Tuesday [21 April] said a new sabotage act targeted an electricity pole in Al-Buhayrah Governorate [north of Cairo].

column16: Association for Freedom of Thought and Expression
column17: At Aim Shams University, students from the the ""Students against the Coup"" group set fire to tyres and cut off the road leading to Ramses.
Security raids in Rafah city left four militants killed during a combing operation.
Security forces clashed with suspected militants during a raid in Sheikh Zuweid, killing four and arresting nine suspects.

The Homeland Security Colonel and a police conscript were killed after being shot by unidentified gunmen in Helmeyet al-Zaytoun, Cairo. They were on their way to work. After an attack on two policemen, assailants threw a homemade bomb as a distraction and ran away. The minor explosion injured one women and a child.

A detained 63-year-old lawyer died in Matariya hospital amid conflicting reports between police torture and residents assaults for """"suspicion of Muslim Brotherhood ties"""". Coded as police torture.
Clashes on Wednesday night between security forces and purported members of the Sinai State left six of the suspected militants dead. The clashes occurred south of Sheikh Zuweid.
Security bodies in North Sinai launched an intensive security campaign in North Arish, Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah. A total of six Islamist militants were killed and nine arrested.
Security bodies in North Sinai launched an intensive security campaign in North Arish, Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah. A total of six Islamist militants were killed and nine arrested.
Security bodies in North Sinai launched an intensive security campaign in North Arish, Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah. A total of six Islamist militants were killed and nine arrested.

A veterinarian and his son, who were affiliated with the Muslim Brotherhood, both disappeared after their unlawful arrest by the Egyptian Security Forces on 23 April 2015 in Qotour, 100km north of Cairo. The security forces took some money, phones and computers before forcibly dragging the two men outside without clothing.

On 23 April, a man died in the Shubra Al-Khaimah police station. A police officer and two of his aides were detained, pending investigations into torture allegations that led to the death of a suspect in their custody.

A rocket-propelled grenade landed on a residential home in Sheikh Zuweid, killing one person and injuring at least four more on Thursday. It is unclear whether the shelling was attributed to the armed forces or North Sinais militants.

Four Islamists were killed in an accidental explosion while preparing bombs in the province of Beni Suef. Another later died in June. Police said the suspected militants were members of the blacklisted Muslim Brotherhood movement. Conflicting report: The pro-Morsi Coup Alliance and families of the dead claimed the police tried to arrest the men but failed and therefore threw explosives at them.
A bomb exploded near a person driving a motorcycle in Al-Matriya district of Cairo, leaving him with severe injuries.
In the Beheira governorate, three explosions targeting gas pipelines occurred on Friday.
Two bombs exploded above Hilmeyt al-Zaytun bridge. One person, allegedly a Muslim Brotherhood member, later died from their injuries. Sappers managed to defuse another bomb in the area.
Suspected militants were shot and killed by army forces in Rafah while allegedly attempting to assault security forces in the area.

A group of journalists took part in a demonstration in front of the Press Syndicate building in downtown Cairo Saturday afternoon. The demonstration took place in solidarity with the five journalists who were referred to investigations Monday.

Farmers from the village of Srso in Daqhaleya, protested on farm land, where they clashed with relatives of businessman Farid El-Masry, who also claims ownership to the land. The Egyptian Center for Economic and Social Rights (ECESR) said that the family of El-Masry hired thugs to attack the farmers using firearms and threats. During and after the clashes, police forces launched an arrest campaign, leading to the detention of 24 farmers, along with two members of the Socialist Popular Alliance party (SPAP).
A member of the Al-Tarabeen tribe was killed by gunshots from State of Sinai militants. The tribe reportedly aims to retaliate his death, in cooperation with the Egyptian army and other tribes.
Yemeni protesters gathered Sunday in front of the Yemeni embassy in Dokki district of Cairo chanting against the ambassador, amid a heavy presence of riot police.
Two police officers and three conscripts were injured during an exchange of fire with wanted assailants
Two bombs exploded and another was dismantled Monday morning in Beheira governorate resulting in six injuries. The bombs targeted electricity pylons.

On Tuesday 28 April, unknown assailants hurled two Molotov bombs at the home of Coptic Christian in the village of Al-Our. One bomb caused damages to the door and windows; the other fell inside the house but did not detonate and therefore caused no casualties or damages.
Journalists staged a march outside the Syndicate of Journalists, accusing former interior minister Muhammad Ibrahim of killing a female reporter.

After the Al-Tarabeen tribe handed over four militants allegedly affiliated with the ""State of Sinai"" militant group to the Egyptian armed forces in North Sinai, the State of Sinai bombed a house belonging to an Al-Tarabeen tribe leader Ibrahim Al-Argani for being an ""army informant"". The tribal leader was involved in signing the statement announcing the retaliatory attacks against ""State of Sinai"".
A five-year old child was killed on Thursday when an explosion occurred outside his home in a city in Sharqiya, north of Cairo.
Security bodies in northern Arish, Shaykh Zuwayd and Rafah launched wide scale security campaigns in which a total of six Islamist militants were killed and 13 suspects arrested.
Security bodies in northern Arish, Shaykh Zuwayd and Rafah launched wide scale security campaigns in which a total of six Islamist militants were killed and 13 suspects arrested.
Security bodies in northern Arish, Shaykh Zuwayd and Rafah launched wide scale security campaigns in which a total of six Islamist militants were killed and 13 suspects arrested.
Al-Masry football club fans marched in Port Said Friday, protesting 11 death sentences handed to fans of the club in the ""Port Said Killing"" trial.

The Revolutionary Alternative group organised a protest that was moved from Talaat Harb Square to outside the Press Syndicate in Cairo demonstrating against what they described as ""the military capitalist regime"". Five youth members of the group were arrested in Talaat Harb square.

Following the death of a civilian in custody, a dozen local residents gathered in front of the police station in the Beheira governorate, accusing the police of torturing him to death. They were dispersed by force, and there were at least eight injuries reported.
A man was arrested in a security raid on 1 May in the Beheira governorate and died in custody. Police officers are accused of torturing the victim.
Assailants attacked an Al-Ahram Foundation bus and injured at least six people on the road to 6th of October City.
Clashes broke out between student protesters and security forces Saturday night in 6th of October City.

Arrests: Seventy middle-ranking leaders of the Muslim Brotherhood group were arrested in the past 24 hours across Egypt, including in the governorates of Qalubiyah, Minufiyah, Kafr al-Shaykh and Suez.

Arrests: Seventy middle-ranking leaders of the Muslim Brotherhood group were arrested in the past 24 hours across Egypt, including in the governorates of Qalubiyah, Minufiyah, Kafr al-Shaykh and Suez.
The Revolutionary Punishment group claimed responsibility for detonating an explosive device outside the royal palace of Princess Fawzia in Fayoum, used by the governor and visiting officials.
Scores of Yemeni nationals gathered outside the ministries headquarters in Dokki district on 3rd May, demanding the Egyptian authorities help facilitate their return to Yemen.
The Sinai-based militant group ""State of Sinai"" remotely detonated a bomb Sunday in the Sinai Peninsula in the city of el-Arish, killing an army conscript and wounding two soldiers and a policeman.
Unidentified men destroyed an electricity tower using explosives between Fayyum [south west of Cairo] and Bani Suwayf [south of Cairo] governorates on Sunday [3 May].

Arrests: Seventy middle-ranking leaders of the Muslim Brotherhood group were arrested in the past 24 hours across Egypt, including in the governorates of Qalubiyah, Minufiyah, Kafr al-Shaykh and Suez.

Arrests: Seventy middle-ranking leaders of the Muslim Brotherhood group were arrested in the past 24 hours across Egypt, including in the governorates of Qalubiyah, Minufiyah, Kafr al-Shaykh and Suez.

Suspected Islamic militants attacked a security forces base in northern Sinai. Explosions rocked the Central Security base in the border town of Rafah around noon on Monday after attackers fired mortars targeting the camp. According to Daily News Egypt, State of Sinai claimed that 14 security personnel were injured.

North Sinai security forces killed as many as twelve Islamist militants in South Arish, Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah. As many as nine shacks were destroyed, a jeep vehicle and seven unlicensed motorbikes were seized during the campaigns.

North Sinai security forces killed as many as twelve Islamist militants in South Arish, Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah. As many as nine shacks were destroyed, a jeep vehicle and seven unlicensed motorbikes were seized during the campaigns.

North Sinai security forces killed as many as twelve Islamist militants in South Arish, Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah. As many as nine shacks were destroyed, a jeep vehicle and seven unlicensed motorbikes were seized during the campaigns.
An improvised explosive device (IED) went off in an apartment rented by three Al-Azhar students in the Nasr City neighbourhood, injuring two. Police detained the third pending investigations.
20 militants launched an attack on the Egyptian army by firing mortar shells in a security zone in Sheikh Zuweid. The exchange of fire left three militants injured.

A dozen local residents gathered in front of the police building in the Beheira governorate where policemen were accused of torturing a victim to death. They were dispersed by force, and there were at least eight injuries reported.
A man was arrested by a security force from his workplace in Rashid (Rosetta) and severely beaten as he was taken to the Rashid police station. He later died on the 5 May.

Clashes erupted on 5th May when police arrested a group of Morsi supporters, including 13 women, who were demonstrating in a nighttime rally in Al-Basratah village in Damietta. One policeman was killed and a total of 22 people were wounded in the clashes.
The Egyptian military Wednesday shot dead three Palestinian gunmen who infiltrated through a smuggling tunnel in the Sinai town of Rafah on the border with Gaza.

Aerial bombardment of two locations near North Sinais Rafah city on Wednesday left 21 State of Sinai militants dead. An attack helicopter hit the southern Matalla town, killing six militants and exploding a warehouse for ammunition and explosives.
Aerial bombardment of two locations near North Sinais Rafah city on Wednesday left 21 State of Sinai militants dead. An Apache attacked a farm at Sahel al-Bahr area in Rafah, killing 15 militants.
An Egyptian lawyer was assaulted by a police officer at Nasr City police station and injured in the leg.
Gunmen attacked an Egyptian police camp in Rafah in the Sinai Peninsula, killing two officers. Egypts border security forces chased and killed three suspected militants.
Suspected State of Sinai militants opened fire on a group of policemen in the city of El-Arish late on Friday, killing two and wounding a third.
Five suspected State of Sinai militants were killed and three others were injured in an army operation east of Arish.

A second operation by Egypts military killed 11 more suspected State of Sinai militants and saw three others arrested. The militants fired three mortar shells on a security focal point in Karm al-Qawadis area South of Sheikh Zuweid, but the mortars missed their target. One conscript suffered shrapnel wounds in the attack.
Unidentified gunmen gunned down a policeman outside a school in Al-Arish town in North Sinai.
A retired police officer is killed in El-Arish marketplace by unidentified gunmen.
On 9 May, a Muslim Brotherhood sympathiser disappeared from Cairo. Although suspected of being held at a police station in Southern Cairo, officers denied holding him.
