A gunfire exchange left a security watchman for the police and three Muslim Brotherhood members dead on Saturday in Egypts northern governorate of Damietta.

Suspected militants set off three small bombs outside the home of an Egyptian judge in Helwan who sentenced Islamists to death, wounding four people and damaging the building. Building security caught one of the militants who planted the bombs.
Three suspected militants believed to belong to the State of Sinai militant group were killed in a security campaign in North Sinai.
A woman was injured when unidentified assailants fired at her in central Sinai.

A police officer stopped a driver at a checkpoint in the north-eastern Cairo district of Hadayek Al-Qubba, and started to inspect him. This led to a quarrel, in which the officer hit the driver, causing severe injury. The police officer was arrested.

Defusal: Two bombs were found near a power tower in the Delta city of Kafr al-Dawwar [northern Egypt] Tuesday [12 May]. Three more bombs were found near another power tower in the same city and were defused.

column6: Police Forces of Egypt (2014-) Prison Guards
column17: A journalist imprisoned in Tora Prison on charges relating to his conversion to Christianity over seven years ago was severely physically beaten and subject to verbal abuse.

A roadside bomb, believed to be planted by State of Sinai, killed four Bedouin tribesmen (civilians) south of Rafah in North Sinai. The source added that the device was planted with the purpose of targeting military vehicles, but it exploded when the private car hit it.
Two officers and two soldiers were killed in a bomb blast during a search operation in Rafah.
Four suspected militants were killed and 23 people were arrested in a campaign in the North Sinai cities of al-Arish, Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah.
Four suspected militants were killed and 23 people were arrested in a campaign in the North Sinai cities of al-Arish, Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah.
Four suspected militants were killed and 23 people were arrested in a campaign in the North Sinai cities of al-Arish, Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah.
A bomb exploded in a house belonging to four police officers in North Sinai on Wednesday morning who were evacuated prior the explosion.
Eight State of Sinai militants were killed in confrontations with security forces in North Sinais city of al-Arish on Thursday. Two more were injured.
A civilian was shot dead south of al-Arish by armed assailants.
Three people were gunned down by armed assailants in North Sinai, leaving two killed and a third person injured.
Arrests: The Ministry of Interior announced that it had arrested 94 ""middle ranking"" Muslim Brotherhood leaders across Cairo, Daqahleya, Beheira and Fayoum.
Arrests: The Ministry of Interior announced that it had arrested 94 ""middle ranking"" Muslim Brotherhood leaders across Cairo, Daqahleya, Beheira and Fayoum.
Arrests: The Ministry of Interior announced that it had arrested 94 ""middle ranking"" Muslim Brotherhood leaders across Cairo, Daqahleya, Beheira and Fayoum.
Arrests: The Ministry of Interior announced that it had arrested 94 ""middle ranking"" Muslim Brotherhood leaders across Cairo, Daqahleya, Beheira and Fayoum.
Eight explosive devices, planted by unidentified people, exploded beneath two electricity towers in Qina governorate [south of Cairo].
Four bombs went off targeting two power pylons in the city of Al-Dilingat in Al-Buhayrah province on Tuesday [14 May]. Sappers managed to defuse two other bombs in the area.
16 cases of forced disappearance were reported in the governorate of Giza since April. The recent cases of forced disappearance have reportedly been linked to rising mobilisation in the streets.

31 cases of forced disappearance were reported in the governorate of Kafr El-Sheikh since April. The recent cases of forced disappearance have reportedly been linked to rising mobilisation in the streets.
60 cases of forced disappearance were reported in the governorate of Cairo since April. The recent cases of forced disappearance have reportedly been linked to rising mobilisation in the streets.

In Matariya, protesters staged a flash protest in Matariya Square, where they chanted against the police and the army, clashing with some residents after Mohamed Morsi was sentenced to death. Some female protesters were arrested but later released.

Gunmen killed two Egyptian judges and a prosecutor Saturday in Al-Arish in North Sinai. The shooting also killed the officials driver and wounded another prosecutor. Police sources said the attack was carried out by militants belonging to the State of Sinai.

Non-violent activity: The Cairo Criminal court on Saturday sentenced deposed Islamist president Mohamed Morsi and more than 100 other people to death for their role in a mass jailbreak during the 2011 uprising.
A bomb targeted the main courthouse in the southern city of Assiut late Saturday, seriously injuring a policeman.
Six masked gunmen on three motorbikes shot and killed a policeman exiting a security facility in Gizas town of Kerdasa.
In Menufiya, alleged members of the Muslim Brotherhood group set fire to the Sadat Court Saturday night. The protesters threw Molotov cocktails at the court house.

Fayoum city witnessed protests Saturday night, following the death sentences handed down to former president Mohamed Morsi and scores of Muslim Brotherhood members and leaders. Clashes were reported between riot police and anti-government protesters, where the demonstrators blocked the Cairo-Fayoum road using tires.
Security Measures: An Egyptian court banned militant football fan groups or ultras as ""militant"" organisations in a bid to break the backbone of anti-government protests.

The neighbourhoods of Matariya and Ain Shams in Cairo witnessed angry demonstrations by anti government protesters in response to the execution of six people by the Egyptian state who were accused of involvement in the """"Arab Sharkas"""" clashes.

The neighbourhoods of Matariya and Ain Shams in Cairo witnessed angry demonstrations by anti government protesters in response to the execution of six people by the Egyptian state who were accused of involvement in the ""Arab Sharkas"" clashes.
Early Sunday, a bomb wounded a young girl near a courthouse in the Mediterranean city of Port Said.
A security patrol exchanged fire with unknown assailants Sunday in Fayoum, with no reported casualties on either side.

A small group of demonstrators gathered outside the Press Syndicate in Downtown Cairo Sunday afternoon to mark the launch of their campaign against what they call mass unfair dismissals from Egypts media outlets
Arrests: On Monday, 35 students were arrested by security forces from their place of residence in Nasr City, with no clear charges mentioned.
Gunmen on a motorbike shot dead a policeman near a court in Belbeis, a town around 60 kilometres (about 38 miles) northeast of Cairo. Another policeman was injured.

Defusal: Bomb disposal squads dismantled four highly-explosive bombs that were installed at an electricity pylon in Al-Buhayrah on Monday. The four bombs were planted at the base of the transmission tower.
A police sergeant was injured after unidentified persons opened fire on him in Al-Fayyum [south-west of Cairo].
One conscript was wounded in an attack targeting a security checkpoint on Al-Islamiiliyah-Suez desert road. Security forces launched a manhunt for the attackers.

Unidentified persons detonated two high-voltage power towers in Damanhur, north of Cairo. Eight explosive charges were planted under the towers, destroying their bases and causing the towers to collapse in the villages of Balba and Zarqun on Al-Mahmudiyah-Damanhur road.

Unidentified persons detonated two high-voltage power towers in Damanhur, north of Cairo. Eight explosive charges were planted under the towers, destroying their bases and causing the towers to collapse in the villages of Balba and Zarqun on Al-Mahmudiyah-Damanhur road.

Unidentified persons bombed an electricity tower at the entrance to Faris village on Aswan-Cairo desert road [in southern Egypt]. Three makeshift bombs went off causing a blackout in a number of areas in Kalabshah city in Aswan. The blast caused damage to the tower. Sappers were able to detect a fourth bomb and are acting to defuse it.

Police killed two men suspected of involvement in a failed bomb attack that targeted a judge in Cairo last week. They were shot dead in a firefight in a Cairo suburb when police went to arrest them, the ministry said without specifying when they were killed.

Arrests: Security forces arrested 88 medium-ranking members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group in the past 24 hours. 43 members of quality operations committees affiliated to the group were also arrested in Cairo, Alexandria, Sharqiyah, Beheira and Assiut. 22 militants were also arrested nationwide.

Arrests: Security forces arrested 88 medium-ranking members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group in the past 24 hours. 43 members of quality operations committees affiliated to the group were also arrested in Cairo, Alexandria, Sharqiyah, Beheira and Assiut. 22 militants were also arrested nationwide.

Arrests: Security forces arrested 88 medium-ranking members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group in the past 24 hours. 43 members of quality operations committees affiliated to the group were also arrested in Cairo, Alexandria, Sharqiyah, Beheira and Assiut. 22 militants were also arrested nationwide.

Arrests: Security forces arrested 88 medium-ranking members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group in the past 24 hours. 43 members of quality operations committees affiliated to the group were also arrested in Cairo, Alexandria, Sharqiyah, Beheira and Assiut. 22 militants were also arrested nationwide.

Arrests: Security forces arrested 88 medium-ranking members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group in the past 24 hours. 43 members of quality operations committees affiliated to the group were also arrested in Cairo, Alexandria, Sharqiyah, Beheira and Assiut. 22 militants were also arrested nationwide.
Clashes broke out between State of Sinai militants and security forces in North Sinais al-Arish City late Wednesday, leaving eight suspected militants killed and three more injured.
Security forces killed one of two suspects in a shooting incident which left two policemen killed last month. The raid took place on 20 May on the outskirts of Cairo.
A lawyers arm was broken after being attacked by a police officer in Sohag.

A student was found dead on a desert road near the Fifth Settlement district Wednesday morning after security forces purportedly took him from the Ain Shams University campus the day before. Contradictory report: the Ministry of Interior however stated that the student was killed after clashes and a chase by security forces. The ministry also accused the student of killing a police officer.
The Students Against the Coup movement reported a series of protests inside various university campuses on Thursday following the death of a student.

A police conscript was killed and another was injured on Thursday during fire exchange with militants in the Nile Delta governorate of Sharqiya. One of the militants was also killed. Armed men opened fire at security forces during the campaign in the town of Abu Hammad, leaving the conscript dead another sergeant wounded.
A bomb exploded near a court in Assiut. No injuries were reported in the attack in Upper Egypt.
The Revolutionary Punishment group claimed responsibility for killing a low-ranking police officer in Beni Suef on Friday for 'being involved in arresting and torturing many people in his town.'

On Friday, security forces shelled an area south of Rafah in North Sinai, killing 10 suspected militants and injuring 5 others, military sources said. The militants are believed to belong to State of Sinai.

The Revolutionary Punishment group claimed responsibility for the killings of two police officers on their way to Biyahmu in Fayoum on 22 May, as part of an operation of ""cleansing the country of murderers and criminals [who] assault unarmed Egyptians in the streets and squares, torture detainees in police stations and cellars of the National Security apparatus, and kidnaps students from the exam rooms to murder them"".
Two Egyptian women were killed when a shell bombarded their house in Sheikh Zuweid village of Qaber Omair. There are no details of the source of the shell.

column9: Military Forces of Egypt (2014-); Health Workers (Egypt)
column17: State of Sinai militants abducted an injured Egyptian soldier Friday from an ambulance and then killed him in an ambush south of the town of Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai.
Seven militants were killed in clashes between armed forces and a ""militant cell"" in Rafah on Friday.

Muslim Brotherhood reported on its official website that 15 protests were flocked into streets in seven provinces including the capital. During the security dispersal of Morsi loyalists on Friday evening, at least 13 Brotherhood members, most of whom were wanted in violence cases, were arrested.
Defusal: Security forces dismantled 19 explosive devices found in Sheikh Zuweid, two of them were planted near a natural gas station.
Two soldiers were injured after a bomb targeted their armoured vehicle during a security campaign in North Sinais Al-Shaykh Zuwayid city.
Members of the Muslim Brotherhood torched tires and blocked the international road in Arish, in protest for the death sentence against Morsi.
A bomb went off near Al-Dilingat Court in the Delta province of Al-Buhayrah [north of Cairo] early Saturday [23 May]. Another explosive charge was also detonated near the cities post office.

A high-voltage electricity tower in East-Saqr Quraysh line [southern Cairo] came under an act of sabotage on Saturday [23 May]. Four bombs were found around the electricity tower and three of the bombs went off.
12 suspected State of Sinai militants were killed late Sunday in an operation launched by security forces in North Sinai.
Six alleged militants were killed and six others were arrested in clashes with security forces early on Sunday in the North Sinai governorate.
An explosive device detonated inside a tunnel in Abu Hamad city, killing the vehicles two occupants Sunday morning. One of the bodies identified was a lawyer.

On 24 May, 50 masked security men raided a retired army officer sons apartment, seizing him and also taking his brother and father in a case of ""forced disappearance"". He was blindfolded and detained. Both men were reportedly subject to physical assault, from beating with sticks and electrocution.

A number of radical Muslim youth waged an attack against the homes of Copts in the village of Kafr Darwish, in Fashn, Beni Sweif Sunday evening. They hurled stones and Molotov explosives at Coptic-owned homes; more than 10 houses were torched and damaged. A car owned by a Copt was smashed. A number of Muslim youth helped the Copts defend their homes against the assailants, and the police moved to swiftly contain the matter.

On 25 May 2015, residents detained, beat and hospitalised a police officer who attempted to stop a gunfight between two Christian families in which a woman was killed in the cross fire in Al Muqattam.
State of Sinai militants killed a conscript and wounded an officer in clashes near the town of Sheikh Zuweyid.

Security forces killed 12 suspected militants during raids on North Sinais cities of al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid late Monday. 8 of these fatalities recorded in events in Sheikh Zuweyid and Rafah on 25th May.

Security forces killed 12 suspected militants during raids on North Sinais cities of al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid late Monday. 8 of these fatalities recorded in events in Al Arish and Sheikh Zuweyid on 25th May.

Security forces killed 12 suspected militants during raids on North Sinais cities of al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid late Monday. 8 of these fatalities recorded in events in Al Arish and Rafah on 25th May.
A 44-year-old employee of the US Embassy, has been missing after government security forces visited his house on 25 May. It is believed to part of the forced disappearences by security forces.

Attacks against Coptic Christian property continued in Kafr Darwish, in Fashn, Beni Sweif. Coptic houses were set on fire and fields belonging to the senior Tawfiq were damaged and the crops uprooted.
Unidentified shelling in the North Sinai town of Rafah on Monday evening left a nurse dead and her daughter injured.

A cleric accused of inciting against the government in his writings, was taken from his home on May 26, along with his two brothers. The cleric resurfaced four days later when he was taken to the prosecutors office, but only after he had been subjected to electrical shocks.

Scores of Fayoum Central Security Forces (CSF) troops protested late on Tuesday over mistreatment by the leadership of their security camp. The conscripts in Al-Azab village blocked the Fayoum-Beni Suef road.
An Egyptian policeman was killed and eight wounded in three roadside bombings on Wednesday in Al Arish in the Sinai Peninsula.
Two improvised explosive devices detonated on a railroad track in the North of Egypt on Wednesday, halting train movement in the governorate of Gharbia.
Arrests: A political activist was ""kidnapped"" on May 28 by security forces, only to surface days later at Cairos Tora prison.

An explosive device went off at a level crossing in Al-Sharqiyah Governorate [north of Cairo] on Thursday [28 May], cutting off part of the rail tracks and disrupting train traffic on Zaqaziq/Kafr Saqr and Zaqaziq/Al-Salhiyah lines. No casualties reported.
Police forces dispersed a pro-Muslim Brotherhood rally in Talbiyah in Giza on Friday and arrested a number of alleged supporters.
Two Islamist militants were killed while 13 suspects were arrested during a campaign targeting in North Sinai, security sources said Friday [29 May].
Arrests: Police arrested 16 members of the Muslim Brotherhood, 5 members of the operations room run by the Brotherhood and 12 militants wanted in cases in a security campaign.

At least two students, from Students Against the Coup (SAC) and 6 April Movement were forcibly disappeared after being arrested by security forces on 31 May. The April 6 member was taken in an ""arrest campaign"" in Alexandria and the SAC member was taken from Cairo.
Suspected Islamic militants blew up up a natural gas pipeline outside el-Arish, the provincial capital of North Sinai. Unidentified assailants placed an explosive device beneath the pipeline.

At least two students, from Students Against the Coup (SAC) and 6 April Movement were forcibly disappeared after being arrested by security forces on 31 May. The April 6 member was taken in an ""arrest campaign"" in Alexandria and the SAC member was taken from Cairo.
A 23-year old freelance photojournalist was reported by her family to have been snatched on June 1 by security forces from a street in downtown Cairo, along with two male friends.
Arrests: Two Muslim Brotherhood leaders were arrested on 1 June in Giza provinces 6th of October district. The members were the Brotherhoods top religious cleric and its former spokesman.
At the beginning of June, a group called the ""Black Bloc"" claimed to block the Qaroun-Fayoum road, resulting in clashes with riot police, who later dispersed the protesters and reopened the road.

A protest at the Press Syndicate held Monday denounced the imprisonment of journalists. Dozens gathered at the stairs of the Press Syndicate in Cairo holding banners calling for the freeing of journalists and activists. The protest witnessed quarrels with civilians, who threw stones at the protesters driving them to step back inside the syndicate headquarters.

Two freelance photojournalist were announced missing Tuesday after disappearing since Monday near the Maadi Nile Corniche, in south Cairo, in more arrests and forced disappearances across Egypt. Approximately 150 people were arrested in the Maadi proximity that night.
A Sinai-based activist died on 2 June after being detained for several hours by the military in a case of forced disappearance.

On 2 June 2015, dozens of workers in the North Sinai based Al-Arish Cement factory demonstrated due to the lack of medical services after their colleague was seriously injured in the leg. According to the workers, as they escalated their demonstration in front of the managements caravans, an army APC stormed into the factory with an army soldier allegedly opening fire on the workers, killing one and injuring several others. One worker died from a fatal shot to the neck, while one of the injured was shot in the leg. Conflicting report: According to the military, the deceased worker was injured at the factory and was rushed to the hospital, along with three other colleagues, when militants purportedly fired at them.
Gunmen on a motorbike killed two Egyptian policemen who worked as guards at the Giza pyramids in Cairo.
On Wednesday, a soldier was shot dead by a sniper while manning a checkpoint in Sheik Zuweyid.
Clashes erupted between armed men and security forces south of Rafah, leaving 12 suspected militants killed. Those killed are believed to belong to the State of Sinai militant group.
On Wednesday, a police officer at the Farscur police station in Damietta beat and humiliated a lawyer.
Three students were disappeared after dining at a Cairo restaurant. After two weeks they appeared in different prisons.
Security forces killed eight suspected militants in the city of Rafah in North Sinai on Friday, including a leading member of the State of Sinai militant group.
A bomb explosion on Friday in the city of Mahalla injured one person who is believed to have planted the bomb. The homemade explosive device went off close to Mahallas first district police station.
A policeman was killed in a blast inside a warehouse while trying to defuse an explosive device in a farm in Gharbiya, north of Cairo on Saturday.
Protesters and family members of a man who died whilst in police custody chanted anti-government slogans at the funeral in Banha.
A detainee died inside a Central Security Forces (CSF) camp in Banha after allegedly being tortured, four days after his forced disappearance.
Two journalists were forcibly disappeared by homeland security from their prison cell in Tora Prison.
The State of Sinai militant group released a video showing the killing of a man in North Sinai after accusing him of being a police ""spy"".
Attackers detonated an IED as an armored vehicle passed, wounding four soldiers near the city of Rafah.
On Monday, fighters ambushed a military checkpoint near the town of Sheikh Zuweyid, firing several mortar shells that killed one conscript and wounded a soldier.

Two suspected militants were killed after clashes with security forces near North Sinais Sheikh Zuweid city on Monday. The suspected militants are believed to have been members of the Sinai-based militant group State of Sinai.
Three teachers were injured Monday after a roadside bomb exploded near a bus in the North Sinai town of Sheikh Zuweid.
A militant was killed by security forces whilst attempting to plant an explosive device east of al-Arish.
Security forces killed four militants in the Sheikh Zuweid region of North Sinai. A child was killed and three people injured when a rocket hit a house during the clashes.

Security personnel detonated two vehicles in North Sinai, killing at least six suspected militants. The men in the vehicles were attempting to attack the peacekeepers camp with mortar shells. Those killed belonged to the State of Sinai militant group.
State of Sinai militants fired rockets in the direction of multinational peacekeepers at Al-Goura airport in North Sinai. No casualties were reported.
A video by militant group ""State of Sinai"" claimed the killing of a man under the accusation he was an informant for the security forces. The video does not show the date of the incident.
Dozens of journalists organised a demonstration at the press syndicate in Cairo, calling for freedoms, fair wages and syndicate protection.

A suicide bomber blew himself up at the ancient Egyptian temple of Karnak in Luxor. Another Islamist attacker was killed and another wounded in the resulting shootout with security forces. Two civilians and two policemen were injured, but no tourists were hurt. The 12-strong militant cell received its instructions from the State of Sinai group.
On 11 June, a police officer was injured outside Al-Hamouly police station in Fayoum by fire from unknown assailants.
An Egyptian National Security officer was killed in a shoot-out with unidentified assailants in Sharqiya.
A group of plainclothes police detained an April 6 activist in Alexandria. She was detained off official records in continued forced disappearances and secret detentions.
Seven members of the same family were injured Friday night by a bomb in the North Sinai town Al-Arish, which was planted near a police officers house.
A firefight erupted between security forces and a number of militants in Sinai, causing a landmine in the area to explode. No casualties were reported.
One militant was killed and two others were injured in an attack on a checkpoint in Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai. The attack resulted in no casualties amongst military forces.
On 14 June, unknown assailants attacked an off-duty police officer on his way home from work in Fayoum, leaving him injured.
On 14 June, an off-duty police corporal who worked at the Tamia police station was shot dead by unknown assailants after he left his house.
Policemen shot dead a man who was allegedly carrying Molotov cocktails in Old Cairo on Monday, after he stabbed a policeman, leaving him injured.
Arrests:In Gharbeya governorate, 28 Muslim Brotherhood members accused of planting homemade bombs in different populated areas were arrested.
Unidentified assailants bombed the home of a police officer and set two others ablaze in Al-Arish on Tuesday. No casualties reported.
Arrests: Security forces arrested a man on Tuesday in the Daqahleya governorate, claiming he was the leader of a local ""Islamic State"" (IS) cell consisting of six members.
Security forces carried out a ""preemptive strike"" which left seven militants killed and two weapons warehouses destroyed.
A police officer was shot Wednesday morning by unknown assailants in a drive-by shooting in front of the Abshoway police station in the city of Fayoum.

Security forces seize a journalist from his house in Toukh, Qaliubiya governorate, seizing his laptop and mobile phone. The continuation of his detention and the unknown location of his detention is considered a forced disappearance.

A roadside bomb killed an Egyptian policeman on Wednesday in the North Sinai provincial capital of El-Arish. Four police were also wounded by the bomb, which was detonated remotely as their armoured vehicle passed. State of Sinai are believed to be responsible.
A 35-year-old policeman was injured on Thursday when a blast hit his house in North Sinais city of Arish. Two gunmen on a motorbike threw a bomb at the security personnels house.
On Friday, violent clashes occurred between protesters and riot police in the district of Matariya in Cairo.
Security forces shelled an area in North Sinais Sheikh Zuweid late Friday, killing 15 suspected State of Sinai militants and injuring 20.

Tens of Muslim Brotherhood supporters organised a rally and chanted against state institutions in Sharqiya governorate. They were dispersed by police forces after approaching the Diyarb Najm police station.
A 23-year-old student was killed on Friday during a protest in Diyarb Najm in Sharqiya governorate. The student, who was a passer-by, was shot by anonymous assailants.
An explosion severely damaged an electricity pylon and damaged part of the Fayoum stadiums wall. There were no injuries reported.
A protest was held at the Press Syndicates Cairo HQ calling for the release of a journalist from Akhbar Al-Youm newspaper.
Police forces dispersed a minor protest by the anti-government group Ultras Nahdawy at Abdel Moneim Riad Square. No arrests or injuries were reported.
Two militants were killed and 100 kilograms of explosive materials were seized during security campaigns launched by army officers in North Sinai.

Dozens of women held a vigil outside Egypts presidential palace, challenging a law that restricts protests and calling for the release of thousands of prisoners detained for violating the protest law.

Arrests: Security forces arrested 15 middle-ranking members of the Muslim Brotherhood as well as three members of quality operations committees affiliated with the group. 17 militants were also arrested in security campaigns nationwide.
Two houses belonging to policemen were bombed in North Sinais Al-Arish city leaving 8 injured (five civilians and three policemen).
16 suspected State of Sinai militants were killed in a military operation in Sheikh Zuweid. Army forces shot and shelled the militants using Apache helicopters.

Security forces shelled a car carrying four State of Sinai militants as they made their way to the Karam al-Qawadis checkpoint in Sheik Zuweid. All four were killed. Simultaneously two suspected State of Sinai militants were shelled and killed as they drove to a Sheikh Zuweid checkpoint, riding motorcycles.
An improvised explosive device (IED) exploded on the outskirts of Al-Arish in the North Sinai governorate Tuesday. No injuries reported.
Anti-government groups in Cairo held flash protests in main streets in the 6th of October district.
In Mohandessin, a protest was organised in Al-Sudan Street, with the protesters blocking the road and clashing with local residents.
A police van that was stationed in Nasr City was reported to have been burnt by ""unknown assailants"" during clashes between anti-government protesters and police personnel.
Workers protested in front of the Misr-Iran factory in Suez, refusing the managements decision to temporarily suspend 2,000 workers.

Security forces dispersed rallies by anti-government protesters in Matariya. The protesters used fireworks to confront the forces, who were stationed in the districts main square and around mosques that are known to be meeting points of protesters.
An improvised explosive device (IED) exploded, halting trains between Cairo and Alexandria. The precise location of the bomb was not given. No injuries were caused.
Clashes occurred between security forces and armed men near the Rafah border crossing, leaving one killed and two more injured. The men are believed to belong to the State of Sinai militant group.

Security forces shelled an area east of al-Arish and Sheikh Zuweyid in North Sinai, killing a total of 9 people believed to belong to the State of Sinai militant group. 4 fatalities recorded in Sheikh Zuweyid.

Security forces shelled an area east of al-Arish and Sheikh Zuweyid in North Sinai, killing a total of 9 people believed to belong to the State of Sinai militant group. 5 fatalities recorded in al-Arish.
A sound bomb went off Friday outside of the Egyptian Media Production City (EMPC) in 6th of October City.
In Gharbeya governorate, three alleged members of the Muslim Brotherhood were arrested, on charges of possessing anti-government flyers and protesting without a permit.

Nine alleged members of the militant Revolutionary Punishment group were arrested by the police on charges of killing a man and filming his execution. The video showed an alleged Helwan resident confessing to helping the police to point out protesters and activists. The exact date was not reported.
A bomb explosion occurred in front of a church in Assiut on Saturday, damaging three cars and the fronts of two houses.
A traffic office in Talbiya, Giza was torched Saturday night after assailants attacked it with Molotov cocktails.

A bomb exploded in a bus station in Damanhour, in the Beheira governorate, leaving two dead and damaging a bus parked at the station. The bomb is believed to have exploded on the motorcycle that the two attackers were riding, killing them and damaging the vehicle.

A total of 11 militants, believed to be State of Sinai militants, were killed and four suspects were arrested on Saturday during security raids on their hideouts south in Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid cities of Egypts North Sinai province. 5 fatalities recorded in Sheikh Zuweyid.

A total of 11 militants, believed to be State of Sinai militants, were killed and four suspects were arrested on Saturday during security raids on their hideouts south in Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid cities of Egypts North Sinai province. 6 fatalities recorded in Rafah.
A protest was staged at the Press Syndicate in Cairo to support a number of photojournalists that are being detained.

Two bombs detonated while a third planted beneath a pylon in Manshait al Fayyum village was defused by sappers on Sunday [28 June]. The explosion did not leave any casualties or material damage except for the base of the pylon.
Defusal: Three bombs were defused and 18 suspects arrested on 28th June in Sheikh Zuweid.

A bomb exploded in a village between Al-Arish and Sheikh Zuweid, killing three engineers and injuring nine others riding in a bus. The militants who triggered the bomb apparently thought the bus was carrying soldiers.
An attack on a police vehicle in a village near Beni Suef Monday night left a police officer dead and four conscripts injured.
Four civilians were injured Monday night in an attack by unknown assailants on a microbus in a village near Qena.

Egypt's state prosecutor was killed in a remote-controlled bombing that hit his convoy on Monday in Heliopolis, in Cairo. 10 others were injured. An unknown militant group, calling itself Tahrir Brigades, claimed responsibility for the assassination. The post is the first on the groups newly established YouTube channel. There are no earlier activities or statements known from Tahrir Brigades. The authenticity of the post and claim has not been confirmed.

On Tuesday, at least three militants were killed and ten others arrested during security raids in Arish and Sheikh Zuweid cities of Egypts North Sinai. The militants are believed to be loyalists of the Sinai-based, Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis (ABM) militant group, which has changed its name to ""Sinai State"" and vowed loyalty to the regional Islamic State (IS) militant group. 2 fatalities recorded in Al-Arish.

On Tuesday, at least three militants were killed and ten others arrested during security raids in Arish and Sheikh Zuweid cities of Egypts North Sinai. The militants are believed to be loyalists of the Sinai-based, Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis (ABM) militant group, which has changed its name to ""Sinai State"" and vowed loyalty to the regional Islamic State (IS) militant group. 1 fatality recorded in Sheikh Zuweyid.
In Cairo, hundreds of people protested against ""terrorism"" at a state prosecutors funeral after he was killed in a car bomb attack.

Detonation: Three suspected militants were killed in a car explosion in the 6th of October suburb of the Egyptian capital. The incident occurred when explosives the militants were carrying went off accidentally.
A mortar shell of an unknown source hit a house near a security base in North Sinais Sheikh Zuweid on Tuesday, killing two children and injuring three others.
The bodies of two children and an adult were found in Sheikh Zuweid. The bodies contained signs of gunshot wounds, yet the causes of their death remain unknown.
One man was shot dead in Al-Arish by unknown assailants on Tuesday morning.
Gunmen shot dead a policeman outside the Helwan Wax Museum in a south Cairo suburb. A museum worker was wounded.
On 30 June 2015, a 22-year-old student in the eighth district of Nasr City was arrested and forcibly took to Lazoghly State Security facility in Cairo where he was detained and repeatedly tortured.
Egyptian security forces killed 9 suspected Islamist militants, as well as a senior Muslim Brotherhood member named Nasser al-Houfi, during a gunfight in the October 6 district of Giza.

A 22-year old student who was one of five students that faced trial in the Al Jazeera retrial (called the ""Marriot Cell"" trial) was forcibly disappeared on 1st July 2015. During the time of his forced disappearance he was hung by his wrists for three full days and electrocuted all over his body in Tora Prison.

An 18-year-old student was arrested and taken to Ibshway police station, he was detained incommunicado for a week during which he was repeatedly electrocuted and beaten up because of his affiliation to the Muslim Brotherhood.
At least 205 suspected State of Sinai militants have been killed by security forces between Jul.1-3, following the coordinated attacks the group carried out on Jul.1 (144 coded in other events).
Arrests: The Interior Ministry has reported that in the last 24 hours security forces have arrested at least 56 ""members and loyalists"" of the Muslim Brotherhood.

Egyptian military raids backed by the Egyptian Air Force have killed 100 suspected Islamist militants in North Sinai following a wave of attacks in the Sheikh Zuweiyid, while many militants were said to have been wounded and 20 of their vehicles destroyed, according to a statement aired by the military on state television. At least 38 militants out of the total were killed during clashes at Sheikh Zuweiyid. Fatalities disaggregated across locations.

column16: AP; AFP; Jamahiriya News Agency; Aswat Masriya (Egypt); Daily News (Egypt); Xinhua
column17: More than 70 State of Sinai militants on Wednesday carried out numerous simultaneous attacks on military positions, checkpoints and a police station, including at least 3 suicide bombings (included in fatality count). The Eygptian militaries official casualty figures were set at 17 soldiers killed, including 4 officers, and 13 injured, but a variety of higher figures were given by both media and unofficial security sources (coded as 17). One car bomb alone was responsible for at least 15 military fatalities. The majority of the attacks took place in Sheikh Zuweiyid with the State of Sinai claiming it ""gained full control over several locations"", while al-Arish was also reported targeted by some of the attacks. The militants also took soldiers captive, seized several armored vehicles, mined the roads leading to the main police station to prevent military reinforcements, and were reported to be using Kornet anti-tank missiles, mortars and other heavy weapons. The Egyptian military claimed it killed 38 militants during clashes following the attack around Sheikh Zuweiyid, while at least 10 civilian casualties were also reported during the clashes. Fatalities disaggregated across locations.

column16: Xinhua; AP; AFP; Jamahiriya News Agency; Aswat Masriya (Egypt); Daily News (Egypt)
column17: More than 70 State of Sinai militants on Wednesday carried out numerous simultaneous attacks on military positions, checkpoints and a police station, including at least 3 suicide bombings (included in fatality count). The Eygptian militaries official casualty figures were set at 17 soldiers killed, including 4 officers, and 13 injured, but a variety of higher figures were given by both media and unofficial security sources (coded as 17). One car bomb alone was responsible for at least 15 military fatalities. The majority of the attacks took place in Sheikh Zuweiyid with the State of Sinai claiming it ""gained full control over several locations"", while al-Arish was also reported targeted by some of the attacks. The militants also took soldiers captive, seized several armored vehicles, mined the roads leading to the main police station to prevent military reinforcements, and were reported to be using Kornet anti-tank missiles, mortars and other heavy weapons. The Egyptian military claimed it killed 38 militants during clashes following the attack around Sheikh Zuweiyid, while at least 10 civilian casualties were also reported during the clashes. Fatalities disaggregated across locations.

At least 22 militants who were involved in the Jul.1 attacks on security forces were killed by Egyptian air strikes carried out by 2 Apache helicopters in Rafah early on Thursday. Soldiers also raided a house in Rafah, killing 6 suspected State of Sinai militants wearing military uniforms. At least 1 civilian was also killed when a stray rocket hit his home during the clashes.
Two unidentified gunmen on a motorbike shot dead an Egyptian traffic police officer in Fayoum.

35 suspected State of Sinai militants total were killed and a number of others injured in the Sheikh Zuweiyid and Rafah areas in North Sinai on Thursday according to security sources (28 coded in another event in Rafah).

Students Against the Coup (SAC) organized a protest in Maadi to mark the anniversary of his removal from power. Police dispersed protesters with tear gas after clashes broke out. A student protester was allegedly killed by the police, the second alongside a student allegedly killed in Menoufia.

Pro- and anti-Morsi protests, including Muslim Brotherhood members, took place after Friday prayers. The pro-Morsi demonstrators demanded his reinstatement, while the anti-Morsi protesters demanded ""the execution of every Brotherhood member in Egypt"".

A protester and a conscript were injured during clashes between student demonstrators and police in the Menoufia area to mark the anniversary of Morsis removal from power. The demonstrations were called by the Students Against the Coup (SAC) organization. Protesters attempted to block at least one road and were dispersed with tear gas. A student protester was also allegedly killed after being shot by police.

Two marches took place in Giza in Kerdasa town and the Imbaba neighbourhood in support of Morsi on the anniversary of his removal, and were dispersed by police. The protest in Kerdasa town was dispersed after clashes between protesters and residents.
The State of Sinai claimed the firing of between 2-3 rockets into Israeli territory which caused no casualties or material damage.

Protests took place after Friday prayers by Morsi supporters and Muslim Brotherhood members in Cairo, where security forces used tear gas to disperse protesters who shot at police with fireworks. Other protests also occurred in Giza and Alexandria, and towns around Cairo.
5 civilians were killed and 2 seriously injured in separate incidents of stray rockets and mortars fired by unidentified armed groups hitting houses in Sheikh Zuweiyid.
10 suspected Islamist militants were killed and others wounded during a military operation in Sheikh Zuweiyid. Vehicles and hideouts were also destroyed.
A child was killed and 4 others wounded when an IED detonated near a checkpoint in Rafah.
An IED planted by suspected Islamist militants exploded at the Aswan railway station, causing no injuries or damage.
An IED planted by suspected Islamist militants exploded at a power station in Fayoum, causing some damage to the station.
A bomb exploded outside the home of a Police Secretary in the North Sinai town of Al-Arish on Saturday evening. No injuries or fatalities were reported .
Arrests: Security forces arrested 52 ""medium-ranking"" Muslim Brotherhood members Saturday evening.
Defusal: The Egyptian armed forces found and destroyed five explosive devices in Al-Arish on Saturday.
A total of 241 State of Sinai militants were killed from July 1-5 by the Egyptian army. The other 215 fatalities are recorded in events in North Sinai from 1-4 July.

An improvised explosive device (IED) exploded early Sunday outside the branch of a telecommunications company in Fayoum. The explosion caused damage to the Etisalat branchs exterior, and also damaged another neighbouring store.
A police officer was shot while guarding a checkpoint in Sharqeya. The police said that the officer was attacked by birdshot bullets by two assailants riding a motorcycle.
A bomb exploded Monday night near the Al-Qaren Police Station in Sharqeya, leaving no injuries.
A group that proclaims itself as the Revolutionary Punishment claimed to have 'executed' a man from Sharkia governorate on 7 July due to his alleged cooperation with security bodies.
Five people were injured Tuesday in the city of Beheira after a bomb went off near a court.
Four militants were killed and one was arrested while attempting to escape from Al-Shaykh Zuwayid in North Sinai. Three explosive devices were detected then blown up without any casualties.
Five Egyptian civilians were killed and four injured on Wednesday when a mortar round hit a house in North Sinais Sheikh Zuweyid. The shell reportedly was targeting a security camp.
Arrests: A political activist was ""forcibly disappeared"" from Cairo International Airport by security forces.
Two militants were killed and 13 others were arrested during a security raid that led to an exchange of fire between the army troops and the militants in Al-Khurayzah district in central Sinai.
A roadside bomb blast wounded 20 Egyptian policemen and 1 civilian on Thursday as they travelled in a bus on the outskirts of Al-Arish in North Sinai.
Gunmen on a motorbike shot dead a police captain near his home in the Nile Delta town of Beni Sueif, south of Cairo.
Four children and a woman were killed Friday when a mortar round crashed into their home in Sheikh Zuweyid in North Sinai.
Egypts army killed two suspected militants and destroyed an explosives warehouse in Sheikh Zuweyid in North Sinai on Friday.

An Egyptian lawyer was shot and injured by a policeman in the Nasr City court when a quarrel between him and a colleague on the one hand, and a prosecution employee and a number of policemen on the other, broke out. He was transported to hospital with serious wounds.
Armed men fired a mortar shell at Al Masurah military checkpoint in Rafah, but the mortar hit a civilian car, killing a civilian and wounding two others.
The State of Sinai militant group carried out a car bomb attack on the Italian consultate in Cairo, killing one civilian and injuring nine others.
Egyptian lawyers protested a police officer shooting a fellow lawyer at a courthouse in Nasr City.
Military forces killed a militant in the Sinai Peninsula region, and arrested another as part of ongoing efforts to rid the area of Islamist insurgents.
Seven suspected militants were killed and 13 others were arrested on Tuesday in a wide-scale security campaign in North Sinais towns of Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah.
Seven suspected militants were killed and 13 others were arrested on Tuesday in a wide-scale security campaign in North Sinais towns of Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah.

A mortar shell targeted a military vehicle in Sheikh Zuweid on Tuesday, killing one military personnel. The targeted vehicle was combing the area, in search of militants. State of Sinai militants claimed responsibility for the attack.
Six people were injured, including a police officer, three conscripts and two civilians, as a result of a bomb explosion in Fayoum.
Defusal: Police bomb squads defused two improvised explosive devices (IEDs) in the Haram district of Giza.

A suicide bomb attack by the Egyptian affiliate of the Islamic State was foiled after the vehicle was destroyed and its driver killed. A suicide bomber drove an explosives-laden vehicle in an attempt to strike a military outpost on a highway leading to Suez. The assault took place on the Suez road near the district Al-Qatamiyah, on the outskirts of Cairo.
Security forces thwarted an attempt to attack a security checkpoint in the North Sinai town of Sheikh Zuweid early Wednesday, killing 20 suspected militants.

A roadside bomb went off at a busy square in the Heliopolis district, injuring a traffic policeman. The bomb targeted the part of Roxy square where traffic and other policemen routinely gather. The militant group Ajnad Misr claimed responsibility for the attack.
The armed forces killed 22 militants in an air raid while gathering in al-Laftat village in Shaykh Zuwayid, North Sinai.
The Islamic State Egyptian-affilate group said it carried out a missile attack on an Egyptian navy vessel north of Rafah, North Sinai on Thursday. A firefight ensued but no losses were sustained.
A bomb exploded outside a cinema house in Gizas Haram Street, but no casualties were reported. Bomb disposal experts managed to defuse two other bombs.
In Alexandria, police arrested 20 Islamist protesters after they directed fireworks at policemen.

At least five people were killed on Friday in clashes between pro-Islamists and Egyptian police in Cairo. Skirmishes broke out between marchers on one side and local residents and police on the other. Initial skirmishes quickly escalated with live ammunition and shotguns.
Protest clashes were reported in the village of Nahya near Cairo between police and Muslim Brotherhood supporters, leaving one dead.

The armed forces released three videos of army jet fighters targeting State of Sinai militant positions and trucks in North Sinais Sheikh Zuweyid, killing a total of 14. Apache helicopters shelled the area killing six, and eight more were killed by shelling in another part of Sheikh Zuweyid.

The armed forces said it intensified its operations in the restive Sinai Peninsula, announcing it killed 59 alleged militants Saturday in different confrontations. They later claimed that 7 soldiers had been killed in the fighting, including 3 in an attack on a checkpoint in Sheikh Zuweiyid (coded separately).

Between three and five army personnel were killed Saturday in Sheikh Zuweid after State of Sinai militants attacked a checkpoint with live rounds and RPGs. Seven others were injured in the ongoing clashes.
Nine suspected militants were killed in shelling which targeted Arish in North Sinai.

Protesters clashed with police following Eid Al-Fitr celebrations. Police say that the protesters clashed with civilians first, before firing on the police when they used tear gas. Daily News Egypt reported that eye witnesses claimed that the protesters were peaceful before being engaged by police.
""Police arrested 8 pro-Morsi individuals on charges of rioting and inciting violence.""
An explosion occurred near an electricity facility on the outskirts of Fayoum. The blast was allegedly caused by an IED.
Property destruction: The Fathers Church in eastern Alexandria was attacked by unidentified assailants using molotov cocktails, causing no injuries but damaging the church.

On 22 July, A Croatian man working for French geoscience company CGG was kidnapped in Cairo by State of Sinai militants. The militants later released a video threatening to kill the abducted man if Muslim women jailed in Egypt were not freed.
4 soldiers, including 1 officer, were killed by a roadside bomb in the border village of al-Mahdiya, near Rafah. The State of Sinai claimed responsibility for the attack.
2 IEDs detonated at the houses of 2 policemen in Al-Arish. No casualties were reported, and the attacks were claimed by the State of Sinai.
12 suspected State of Sinai militants were killed and 2 warehouses for explosive material damaged during a raid by the military in Sheikh Zuweiyid.

17 suspected State of Sinai militants were killed during clashes with Egyptian military forces in Sheikh Zuweiyid. 1 soldier was killed and 5 others wounded when his tank was hit by a rocket during the clashes. A police officer was also killed.
The Egyptian army killed a total of 88 suspected militants in security campaigns in North Sinai in the period between July 20 and July 31. Other events record the remaining 59 fatalities.

The main eyewitness in a torture case was reportedly beaten by police forces on 25 July, in the northern coastal city of Rosetta. He was severely beaten and dragged on the ground in the process, then taken to Rashid (Rosetta) police station, where he was accused of possessing a firearm, and the charge of resisting authorities.

Workers at the Ministry of Religious Endowments staged a protest demanding more economic rights, including ""health and social insurance"". They have been calling on the ministry to grant them the right to be included on the ministries insurance lists since 2011.

State of Sinai militants attacked three separate checkpoints near al-Arish injuring three military conscripts.Heavy clashes took place between security forces and militants belonging to Islamic State-affiliated group, involving ""heavy and medium weapons.""
A roadside bomb attack claimed by Islamic State militants (State of Sinai) wounded 18 policemen near Al-Arish on Sunday.
In a checkpoint attack, militants damaged two vehicles belonging to peacekeeping forces. No peacekeepers were injured in the attack south of Rafah.
A woman was killed and two children were injured when their house in North Sinai was hit by a shell from an unknown source on Sunday.

Egyptian police killed two alleged militants belonging to Ajnad Misr (Soldiers of Egypt), suspected of involvement in the recent bombing of the Italian consulate in Cairos Giza district in a raid Monday on an apartment in Cairo.

Two unidentified militants escaped a military pursuit in a mountainous area between North and Central Sinai. The suspects were injured and their vehicle was seized in a security patrol. Security forces found a Kalashnikov and automatic rifles with ammunition, in addition to explosive material and equipment.

Two explosions in the eastern Cairo district of Nasr City targeted electricity switches on Tuesday, leaving no injuries or fatalities. Improvised explosive devices (IED) were planted near the switches.

A bomb explosion took place on Tuesday morning in the North Sinai town of Al-Arish with no casualties reported. The explosion targeted a military vehicle but detonated immediately after the vehicle passed it by.

On 29 July 2015, security forces raided an Egyptians apartment, without an arrest warrant, and proceeded to beat him up before throwing him out of his third-floor window. The man was badly injured, and taken to Al-Nuzha police station, which refused to take him due to the seriousness of his injuries. Security forces had no choice but to take him to Heliopolis Hospital in Cairo where doctors determined he had fractured his pelvis and spinal cord, and was suffering from concussion and low blood pressure. His wife was released, but the man remains at hospital, handcuffed to his bed.

An Egyptian police officer guarding Nigers embassy was shot dead by gunmen who then fled the scene. A second officer was wounded by. Three gunmen in a car opened fire on the policemen outside of Nigers embassy in Gizas Al-Haram district, southwest of the capital, No group immediately claimed responsibility for the shooting.

A security campaign in southern Al-Shaykh Zuwayyid and Rafah districts resulted in the death of two Islamist militants, the arrest of seven suspects and the destruction of militant vehicles and infrastructure.

A security campaign in southern Al-Shaykh Zuwayyid and Rafah districts resulted in the death of two Islamist militants, the arrest of seven suspects and the destruction of militant vehicles and infrastructure.

Pro-Qaddafi demonstrators protested in Cairo at the death sentences given to Saif Al-Islam, Abdullah Senussi and seven other leading former regime figures. The demonstrators gathered outside the UN World Health Organization headquarters in Nasr City.
Police officers attacked a lawyer in Mallawy police station in Minya, resulting in stitches below his eye.

column16: Al Masry Al Youm (Egypt); Daily News (Egypt)
column17: Angry colleagues demonstrated at Mallawy General hospital in Minya where lawyers rejected reconciliation and apologies of the ministry after a lawyer was beaten the previous day.
Security forces shelled areas of the North Sinai towns of al-Arish and Sheikh Zuweid on Friday, killing 20 suspected State of Sinai militants. 10 fatalities coded in Sheikh Zuweyid.
Security forces shelled areas of the North Sinai towns of al-Arish and Sheikh Zuweid on Friday, killing 20 suspected State of Sinai militants. 10 fatalities coded in Arish.

On 1 August:"" The Special Forces raided the house of Salim Sulyman al-Harim, the leader of State of Sinai, in Al-Shaykh Zuwayid. He refused to give himself in and tried to detonate his explosive belt, but the Special Forces shot at him. He was killed with a gun and ammunitions in his possession.""
Unknown gunmen attacked a policemans car in Fayoum on Sunday, killing his four-year-old daughter and his friend.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a policeman standing guard outside a police station in Sharqiya on Tuesday.

Ongoing clashes were reported between security forces and militants said to belong to Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis (State of Sinai), a North Sinai-based militant group. The number of militants killed by air strikes rose to a dozen, after eight had been reported killed earlier on Tuesday. Five civilians were also killed and nine wounded in Sheikh Zuweid city in the Sinai Peninsula after their house was hit by a stray missile. The attack seems to be accidental, as the security checkpoint was the intended main target.
Defusal: Security forces dismantled six roadside bombs planted to target military vehicles in Sheikh Zuweid.
Egyptians staged demonstrations protesting against President Abd-al-Fattah al-Sisi.

A suspect in the Niger embassy attack was killed by security forces. Conflicting reports: his family, who protest his innocence, accuses the police of kidnapping him from his house in Al Ayat and killing him, without any legal reference, and in a situation ""where he didn't resist"". The Ministry of Interior claims that the accused attacked security forces guarding the Niger Embassy in Giza, which killed one conscript and injured three others and that he fired at the forces trying to arrest him, who fired back killing him.

The Egyptian ministry of interior announced on the morning of 6 August that it had killed a member of the Hazmoon opposition movement, at his apartment in Giza. A security statement published in various Egyptian newspapers admitted that security forces had no cause to shoot at the man. There was no mention of any resistance, exchange of fire, or if the man was armed.

The Interior Ministry staged a raid in Giza province, killing ""the leader of a militant cell"" which was allegedly behind a 28 July shooting outside the Nigerien embassy in Giza in which a security guard was killed.

column16: Channel 1 TV (Egypt); Daily News (Egypt); AFP; Ikhwanweb
column17: Policemen killed five suspects in a village called Sanoris in Fayoum province, southwest of Cairo. Their bodies were bloody and disfigured, showing signs of bullet holes and apparent signs of torture, with one man appearing to have a severed arm. The Muslim Brotherhood accused the security forces of killing 5 Muslim Brotherhood members, outside of the law (according to Ikhwanweb) although Channel 1 TV refuted this claim, stating that the MB members fired back at security forces.

Security forces killed a total of 18 suspected militants belonging to the State of Sinai in Apache shelling of areas of North Sinais Sheikh Zuweyid and Rafah towns throughout the past two days (7 & 8 June). (5 fatalities recorded, 13 fatalities recorded in three other events in Rafah and Sheikh Zuweyid).

Security forces killed a total of 18 suspected militants belonging to the State of Sinai in Apache shelling of areas of North Sinais Sheikh Zuweyid and Rafah towns throughout the past two days (7 & 8 June). (5 fatalities recorded, 13 fatalities recorded in three other events in Rafah and Sheikh Zuweyid).

Security forces killed a total of 18 suspected militants belonging to the State of Sinai in Apache shelling of areas of North Sinais Sheikh Zuweyid and Rafah towns throughout the past two days (7 & 8 June). (4 fatalities recorded, 13 fatalities recorded in three other events in Rafah and Sheikh Zuweyid).

Security forces killed a total of 18 suspected militants belonging to the State of Sinai in Apache shelling of areas of North Sinais Sheikh Zuweyid and Rafah towns throughout the past two days (7 & 8 June). (4 fatalities recorded, 13 fatalities recorded in three other events in Rafah and Sheikh Zuweyid).
On Saturday following the deaths of 5 Muslim Brotherhood members, an electricity tower was bombed in Fayoum, leading to a power cut for around 20 villages in the governorate.

column16: Aswat Masriya (Egypt); Daily News (Egypt); AP; AFP
column17: Gunmen killed an Egyptian policeman and wounded three on the Cairo-Fayoum highway, in Fayoum on Saturday. The assailants were hiding in a field and fired on a convoy transporting two prisoners due for release, before fleeing the scene. A group calling itself ""Revolutionary Punishment"" claimed responsibility.

A roadside bomb killed an Egyptian police captain and a conscript Sunday in North Sinais provincial capital of Al-Arish, where security forces are fighting an Islamist insurgency. Three others were wounded in the explosion, which was activated by remote control.
Defusal: The army detonated nine explosives found on a road in Al Arish frequently used by troops in North Sinai.

In Suez, two militants opened fire on a joint police and army patrol, killing a police lieutenant colonel and wounding a soldier. Members of the patrol returned fire, killing one of the two assailants. The attack occurred in the area of Faysal police station.

An Egyptian photojournalist was found dead in the village of Abu-Taweela, in North Sinai on Monday. The circumstances around the death are unclear but it comes 10 to 15 days after he disappeared from Al-Arish.
A video was released showing a man being beaten by policemen in Dar-Al-Salam metro station on Monday.

At least 2,000 tax and customs workers protested in Cairo against a new law seeking to reform the countries civil service, calling it unfair and unconstitutional in one of the largest anti-government protest in recent time.
Defusal: Egyptian bomb experts reportedly dismantled an explosive device found near a Heliopolis court.

A small bomb exploded Monday near a traffic post near a court house in the Heliopolis district in the Egyptian capital of Cairo. Four policemen were wounded, two of them seriously. The attack was claimed by Ajnad Misr (Soldiers of Egypt). A senior police officer later died on 17th August 2015.
in Hurghada, a detainee died in the cities police station. The 23-year-old was found with cloth coiled around his neck and bruises on his face.
Apache helicopters carried out air strikes on State of Sinai militants in Rafah in North Sinai on Tuesday, leaving 15 dead and 10 injured.
An Improvised Explosive Device (IED) exploded Tuesday morning in Fayoum near the governorates police station. Losses were limited to three damaged cars.

A tourism policeman was killed on his way home after finishing his working hours on Wednesday when armed assailants shot him in Fayoum south of Cairo. On the entrance of Senro village in Abshwai city, unknown elements, on a motorcycle, directed several shots at him.

column16: Al Jazeera; Menastream; AP; Daily News (Egypt); AFP
column17: The Islamic State affiliate group State of Sinai said Wednesday it has beheaded a Croatian hostage, and released a picture of a body. The attack took place in Egypts Western Desert area near Bahariya.
Protests were reported in Alexandria by Muslim Brotherhood supporters on the anniversary of the Rabaa Al-Adaweya and Al-Nahda Square sit-in dispersals, which occurred on 14 August 2013.

In Gharbeya and Suez, protests were dispersed and some participants were arrested. Other protests took place in Kerdasa, Nasr City, Sharqeya, Ismailia, and Minya. The protests were a response to the pro-Morsi Anti-Coup Alliances calls to protest on the second anniversary of the dispersal of the pro-Muslim Brotherhood sit-ins in Rabaa Al-Adaweya and Al-Nahda Square that left hundreds dead in 2013.

In Gharbeya and Suez, protests were dispersed and some participants were arrested. Other protests took place in Kerdasa, Nasr City, Sharqeya, Ismailia, and Minya. The protests were a response to the pro-Morsi Anti-Coup Alliances calls to protest on the second anniversary of the dispersal of the pro-Muslim Brotherhood sit-ins in Rabaa Al-Adaweya and Al-Nahda Square that left hundreds dead in 2013.

In Gharbeya and Suez, protests were dispersed and some participants were arrested. Other protests took place in Kerdasa, Nasr City, Sharqeya, Ismailia, and Minya. The protests were a response to the pro-Morsi Anti-Coup Alliances calls to protest on the second anniversary of the dispersal of the pro-Muslim Brotherhood sit-ins in Rabaa Al-Adaweya and Al-Nahda Square that left hundreds dead in 2013.

In Gharbeya and Suez, protests were dispersed and some participants were arrested. Other protests took place in Kerdasa, Nasr City, Sharqeya, Ismailia, and Minya. The protests were a response to the pro-Morsi Anti-Coup Alliances calls to protest on the second anniversary of the dispersal of the pro-Muslim Brotherhood sit-ins in Rabaa Al-Adaweya and Al-Nahda Square that left hundreds dead in 2013.

Protests were reported in Cairo by Muslim Brotherhood supporters on the anniversary of the Rabaa Al-Adaweya and Al-Nahda Square sit-in dispersals, which occurred on 14 August 2013. The Talbiya neighbourhood in Giza witnessed some resistance by protesters, who used fireworks against the forces, but were also dispersed into smaller streets. Five were arrested in the area.

In Gharbeya and Suez, protests were dispersed and some participants were arrested. Other protests took place in Kerdasa, Nasr City, Sharqeya, Ismailia, and Minya. The protests were a response to the pro-Morsi Anti-Coup Alliances calls to protest on the second anniversary of the dispersal of the pro-Muslim Brotherhood sit-ins in Rabaa Al-Adaweya and Al-Nahda Square that left hundreds dead in 2013.

In Gharbeya and Suez, protests were dispersed and some participants were arrested. Other protests took place in Kerdasa, Nasr City, Sharqeya, Ismailia, and Minya. The protests were a response to the pro-Morsi Anti-Coup Alliances calls to protest on the second anniversary of the dispersal of the pro-Muslim Brotherhood sit-ins in Rabaa Al-Adaweya and Al-Nahda Square that left hundreds dead in 2013.

In Gharbeya and Suez, protests were dispersed and some participants were arrested. Other protests took place in Kerdasa, Nasr City, Sharqeya, Ismailia, and Minya. The protests were a response to the pro-Morsi Anti-Coup Alliances calls to protest on the second anniversary of the dispersal of the pro-Muslim Brotherhood sit-ins in Rabaa Al-Adaweya and Al-Nahda Square that left hundreds dead in 2013.

Protests were reported in Cairo by Muslim Brotherhood supporters on the anniversary of the Rabaa Al-Adaweya and Al-Nahda Square sit-in dispersals, which occurred on 14 August 2013. In the smaller streets of Matariya, demonstrators gathered after the Friday prayers, but were dispersed by large amounts of tear gas fired by the Central Security Forces stationed at Matariya Square.

Unknown assailants in Beni Suef shot at a police officer, who works as a lower-ranked officer in the Fayoum Security Directorate, while he was on his way to work. It was later reported (on 24th Aug) that he died from his wounds.

A photojournalist was found dead in the city of Sheikh Zuweid. He was found along with at least six other bodies in the same area. The cirumstances surrounding his death remain unknown, although North Sinai militants known as ""State of Sinai"" kill civilians for allegedly being ""army informers"".
Two bombs went off in two pipe lines of drinking water in Damanhur in Al-Buhayrah [northwest of Cairo]. Both lines were destroyed due to the bombing.

An improvised explosive device (IED) detonated Tuesday morning in Assiut, southern Egypt. The explosion occurred as explosives experts were attempting to dismantle the IED; however no casualties occurred as a result.
Security forces reportedly forcibly disappeared a lawyer after he was arrested at his house in the city of Belbees in Sharqeya. So far, information on the lawyers location is still lacking.
Scores of Libyans staged a rally outside the Arab Leagues headquarters in Cairo on Tuesday [18 August], demanding the lift of an arms embargo on the North African state.

Gunmen in Egypt boarded a bus carrying Palestinians from Cairo to Gaza and seized four of the passengers before letting the others continue. The kidnapping took place on Wednesday in the northern Sinai region as the bus headed for the Rafah border crossing into Gaza. The assailants reportedly held laptop computers on which they checked passengers names before separating the four from the group and taking them away. The individuals taken were members of the Palestinian Islamic group Hamas.

column16: AP; Nile News TV; AFP; Aswat Masriya (Egypt); Daily News (Egypt); Xinhua
column17: A powerful car bomb blast tore through a police building in the Shubra el-Kheima neighbourhood (on the northern tip of Cairo in Qalyubia) Thursday injuring at least 29 people. The attack was claimed by the Islamic State group and was targeting security forces. Affiliates of the """"Islamic State"""" militant group in Egypt, known as """"State of Sinai"""", claimed responsibility for the incident """"to avenge six young men who were executed last March, after being charged of forming a militant cell in Qaliubiya named Arab Sharkas"""", according to a statement by the militants.
Security forces in Al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweyid in North Sinai launched an extensive security crackdown, killing a total of 8 militants. 3 fatalities recorded in Rafah and 2 in Sheikh Zuweyid.

Security forces in Al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweyid in North Sinai launched an extensive security crackdown, killing a total of 8 militants. 3 fatalities recorded in Al-Arish and 2 in Sheikh Zuweyid.
Security forces in Al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweyid in North Sinai launched an extensive security crackdown, killing a total of 8 militants. 3 fatalities recorded in Al-Arish and 3 in Rafah.
A bomb exploded Friday morning in Zagazig city in Sharqeya North of Cairo. The bomb targeted the railway line. No injuries or casualties were reported.
Three police conscripts were shot by unknown assailants on Saturday, as they participated in a raid in Fayoum. They are currently hospitalised.

Dozens of policemen staged protests in demand of improved working conditions and pay outside the Al-Sharqiyah governorate building. A security source accused Brotherhood elements of ""buying off"" some non-commissioned police officers to stage protests.

Militants blew up a tank in the town of Qawadis, near Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai. One soldier was killed and two wounded. The Sunday morning roadside explosion was set off remotely, destroying the M-60 tank.
A police officer was shot dead Sunday in Qaliubiya when a security forces raid targeted three suspects who fired at the security personnel.
An alleged member of the Muslim Brotherhood died at the Abshawi police station in Fayoum police. His family claims he was tortured.

Three men disappeared following their abduction from their home in Shubra El Kheima by Homeland Security officers on 23 August 2015. Men in civilian clothes claiming to be from Homeland Security broke into their home, destroyed objects and forced them into a vehicle that left for an undisclosed location.

column16: Channel 1 TV (Egypt); Aswat Masriya (Egypt); Menastream; Al Ahram
column17: Dozens of policemen in Sharqiya protested for the second day in demand of improved working conditions and pay. Central Security Forces (CSF) fired tear gas to disperse protesting policemen. Contrasing reports: Channel 1 TV and Daily News Egypt reported that police and army forces attacked the protesting policemen after protesting police personnel stormed Al-Sharqiyah Security Directorate following an exchange of gunfire. Al-Ahram Gate reported that a spokesperson for the ministry said the low-ranking officers did not use violence.

A bomb struck a bus carrying Egyptian policemen Monday, killing three and wounding 33. The blast targeted a police bus at Rashid township (Rosetta) in the Nile Delta province of Beheira, while the policemen were travelling on a civilian bus to work. No group immediately claimed responsibility for the attack.
A roadside bomb targeted an armoured military vehicle in el-Arish city, wounding five security personnel.
The army destroyed a store that contained explosive devices, located in the town of Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai.

Gunmen killed two Egyptian policemen in Al-Arish in the Sinai Peninsula, after unidentified assailants on a motorbike opened fire on two police. The corporals were en route to work when shot. The attack was claimed by the Islamic State group State of Sinai.
Arrests: Security forces arrested 34 middle-ranking leaders of the Muslim Brotherhood group and violence-inciters in the past 24 hours.

A policeman was shot dead by unidentified assailants in the Upper Egyptian city of Sohag on Friday. The policeman received three gunshot wounds to the abdomen. He was shot on his way back from work. No militant group has claimed responsibility for the attack so far.

Two people were killed by security forces in the village of Tamiyah in Al-Fayyum. The ministry issued a statement saying that its forces killed two MB wanted leaders after an exchange of fire. Eyewitnesses, Daily News Egypt and the pro-Mohamed Mursi Anti-Coup Alliance meanwhile said the two individuals were unarmed and sleeping and killed by security forces in an extra-judicial killing.

A student - who resided in Al-Zawya Al-Hamra - was killed Saturday on suspicion of being a member of Ansar Beit Al-Maqdis (State of Sinai). Students Against the Coup (SAC) said that the police ""claimed to have killed the student after exchanging fire with security forces during his attack"". It added that the whole process was an ""extra-juridical killing, which follows forced disappearances"" and a spokesperson for the Salafi Front claimed the student was kiilled in ""cold blood"" by security forces.
Police killed an Islamic State affiliate belonging to the State of Sinai militant group in 15 May district of Cairo.

On Sunday, the governorates Security Director, Nasser Al-Abd, said a sound bomb exploded near a security campaign that he was leading, with no injuries reported. The Revolutionary Punishment militant group, which is the most active group in the city, claiming attacks on policemen and officials, took responsibility for the minor attack.

Unknown assailants fired at a police car along the Fayoum-Beni Suef road on Monday, wounding four policemen. The Ministry of Interior said that after being fired at, the policemen exchanged fire with the assailants.

A suicide bombing attempt in North Sinais al-Arish city was ""thwarted"" on Tuesday and the assailant was killed in a gunfire exchange. The attacker was driving a car loaded with explosives during curfew hours and refused to adhere to security forces instructions at a checkpoint. One civilian was also injured.

Two bombs exploded Wednesday in front of a shopping mall in Qena, causing damage to some residential flats. Local media reported that the shopping mall was owned by a Coptic Christian, named as Anis Dimitri. The purpose of bombing, however, remains unclear.

A total of three Islamist militants were killed in a security campaign in North Sinai on Wednesday [2 September]. Troops raided hideouts in Al-Arish, Al-Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah cities. Fatalities split between Rafah, Arish and Sheikh Zuweyid.

A total of three Islamist militants were killed in a security campaign in North Sinai on Wednesday [2 September]. Troops raided hideouts in Al-Arish, Al-Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah cities. Fatalities split between Rafah, Arish and Sheikh Zuweyid.

A total of three Islamist militants were killed in a security campaign in North Sinai on Wednesday [2 September]. Troops raided hideouts in Al-Arish, Al-Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah cities. Fatalities split between Rafah, Arish and Sheikh Zuweyid.

Six international peacekeepers, including four Americans, were wounded Thursday in two roadside bombings near al-Gorah in Egypts Sinai Peninsula where Islamic State group militants are active. No group yet has claimed responsibility.
The Armed Forces announced Thursday the killing of three alleged militants who attempted an attack on a security checkpoint in the North Sinai town of Sheikh Zuweid.

At least 13 militants were killed in overnight military air raids in Egypts North Sinai province. The raids targeted the hideouts of State of Sinai militants in south of Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid cities. 6 fatalities recorded in Sheikh Zuweyid.
Two unknown assailants were shot dead after an exchange of fire in the Haram district of the Giza governorate, on Friday morning, which also resulted in the death of one policeman.

At least 13 militants were killed in overnight military air raids in Egypts North Sinai province. The raids targeted the hideouts of State of Sinai militants in south of Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid cities. 7 fatalities recorded in Rafah

A rocket hit a security checkpoint in the North Sinai town of Al-Arish Saturday morning. The source of the rocket, which detonated at the scene, remains unknown, with security officials asserting that the explosion was minor and left no casualties.
Defusal: Unknown assailants planted a road bomb in the Masaed area of North Sinai, which was quickly spotted and dismantled by the security forces.

ISs Egyptian affiliate said it killed the two soldiers with a roadside bomb that struck an Egyptian military vehicle in the Taweel al-Amir area south of Rafah in northern Sinai as it left a military base with a large convoy.
Gunmen open fired on a police patrol in the Nile Delta province of Beheira, wounding five policemen.

A video was released showing two women being assaulted by policemen in a shopping mall in Cairo. The video shows policemen in plain clothes insulting and destroying the goods of street vendors. It also shows the policemen yelling at and assaulting two women by kicking them, after destroying their mobile phones.

Egypts Muslim Brotherhood accused Egypts Interior Ministry (police forces) of murdering a young leader within the Freedom and Justice Party after kidnapping him in Beni Suwayf. He died of gunshot wounds in the chest and back. The Interior Ministry claims he exhcanged fire with police forces, others claim he was unarmed.

column7: Military Forces of Egypt (2014-) Special Forces
column17: Egypts army with the assistance of Special Forces and anti-terrorism units launched a ""major military operation"" against the Islamic State (State of Sinai) group around Rafah, Al-Arish and Sheikh Zuweyid in the Sinai Peninsula on 7 September, killing a total of 29 militants. 10 fatalities recorded in Rafah, 9 fatalities recorded in Sheikh Zuweyid.

column7: Military Forces of Egypt (2014-) Special Forces
column17: Egypts army with the assistance of Special Forces and anti-terrorism units launched a ""major military operation"" against the Islamic State (State of Sinai) group around Rafah, Al-Arish and Sheikh Zuweyid in the Sinai Peninsula on 7 September, killing a total of 29 militants. 10 fatalities recorded in Al-Arish and 10 fatalities recorded in Rafah.

column7: Military Forces of Egypt (2014-) Special Forces
