The Egyptian air force has destroyed 15 vehicles carrying weapons and ammunition after they illegally crossed into the country from Libya, a military official said on Monday. The operation lasted 48 hours with surveillance and air strikes. Five four-wheel-drive vehicles carrying weapons, ammunition and smuggled goods were destroyed. No casualties were mentioned. The bombing operation took place over two days.

Demolition: The military spokesperson announced on Monday that forces from the second army arrested 22 suspects in North Sinai and destroyed tunnels suspected of being used by militants.Those arrested were suspected of having participated in militant operations in North Sinai, according to the statement.

Dead and wounded reported amidst clashes between Tarabin tribesmen and ISIS fighters in Al-Barth south of Rafah, North Sinai. Security Officials said that 10 tribesmen were killed in an ambush by the State of Sinai.
ISIS claimed to have destroyed an EG army tank by IED yesterday near Al-Gorah, south of Sheikh Zuweid, North Sinai
At least four takfiri militants were killed during military air raids in Egypt's North Sinai Province bordering Israel and the Gaza Strip, the military spokesman said in a statement on Thursday.

Manshiat Nasr residents are demonstrating the government's action of displacing them in favor of a big Arab real estate developer,calling on the government to provide them with alternative housing for the ones they have been displaced from.
ISIS claimed the killing of an EG policemen by sniping at the Safa checkpoint south of El-Arish.

For the second day in a row, Manshiat Nasr residents are demonstrating the government's action of displacing them in favor of a big Arab real estate developer,calling on the government to provide them with alternative housing for the ones they have been displaced from.
Amaq claimed that IS had targeted two other tanks - one in the town of Rafah and another to its south - and a military vehicle to the east of al-Arish town, deploying IEDs. This is the regional code
Two officers were killed and five soldiers injured in a militant attack in the North Sinai city of Sheikh Zuweid, the source said.

Amaq added that IS had targeted two other tanks - one in the town of Rafah and another to its south - and a military vehicle to the east of al-Arish town, deploying IEDs. On the same day, a military vehicle struck a landmine in central Sinai, killing one colonel and injuring three others.
The group's news outlet Amaq said IS carried out a vehicle bombing targeting the Egyptian army and armed allies south of Sheikh Zuweid town, leaving at least 15 dead.

For the third day in a row, Manshiat Nasr residents are demonstrating the government's action of displacing them in favor of a big Arab real estate developer,calling on the government to provide them with alternative housing for the ones they have been displaced from.
In mid-May, a young man, detainee in Battalion 101 military prison, located in Al Arish, was tortured to death.
Egypt: ISIS claimed 3 IED detonations damaging/destroying armored vehicles/MRAPs south of Rafah and near Sheikh Zuweid, North .Sinai
Egypt: ISIS claimed 3 IED detonations damaging/destroying armored vehicles/MRAPs south of Rafah and near Sheikh Zuweid, North .Sinai
Two civilians were abducted and killed in North Sinai cities of Rafah and Arish.
Seven gunmen were killed by army shelling in southern Rafah in the northern Sinai Peninsula.
Two civilians were abducted and killed in North Sinai cities of Rafah and Arish.
ISIS claimed to have killed 4 EG policemen by sniping & 3 IED attacks targeting armored vehicles in the area of El-Arish, North Sinai

Pottery shops in Tunis Village, Fayoum were closed to protest the arbitrary demolition of shops and disputes over land claims, after security forces decided to build a police station in the small village.The government demolished the fence of one of the potters in the village, Alaa Ibrahim.
Egyptian Air Force destroyed 2 presumed ISIS 4x4 vehicles in North Sinai.
Security forces stormed the sit-in of security workers at Tura Cement Company and arrested 22 workers and were taken to the police station.

Arrests: Khaled Ali, a former Egyptian presidential candidate and rights lawyer who challenged the government for handing over islands to Saudi Arabia was detained on suspicion of illegal political work.Khaled Ali was summoned by the prosecution for questioning on suspicion of having set up an unregistered political party. The prosecution ordered his detention for 24 hours.

Security authorities in the Red Sea governorate, on Monday, arrested 280 illegal gold miners in areas of Al-Qoseir and Marsa Alam. Illegal miners exchanged fire with security forces at Marsa Alam-Edfu road during the campaign, resulting in the injury of Major Rami al-Gendi, head of the Marsa Alam investigation department, who was promptly transferred to a Hurghada hospital for treatment.
Workers at Star Apparel Egypt Company in the free zone in Ismailia held a sit-in inside the company's headquarters to protest the delayed salaries and financial dues for about two months.
ISIS claims to have detonated an IED on an EG army minesweeper south of el-Arish. No mentioned fatality.
ISIS claims to have killed an Egyptian soldier by sniping west of el Arish.
Three soldiers were killed as an improvised explosive device targeted their armored vehicle during their patrol at the coastal side of the city. ISIS claims the attack.
In Arish city of North Sinai, a 38-year-old non-commissioned policeman was gunned down by unknown militants.
ISIS claimed an ambush against EG army near Rafah border crossing w ensuing clashes.

Masked gunmen attacked a bus of Coptic Christians south of the Egyptian capital, killing at least 28 people (death toll was later corrected to 29).Assailants in three pick-up trucks attacked a bus as it was heading for the Saint Samuel monastery in Minya province, more than 200 kilometres (120 miles) from Cairo. ISIS claimed the attack.

The north Minya town of Maghagha saw scenes of anger and despair on Friday. A group of around 50 men gathered near a church where the funeral of two victims from an earlier bus attack was held, calling for the interior minister to quit.
The Egyptian army has reportedly killed three takfiri militants in central Sinai and arrested a supporter, military spokesman Tamer al-Refae said on his official Facebook page on 28 May.
ISIS claimed destroying 2 M-60 tanks by IED detonations on May 29 in al-Masaaed and the Industrial Area of El-Arish, North Sinai.

Three army officers and a soldier were killed during an army operation against militants in the Western Desert's Bahariya Oasis, the military said. The attack took place as troops were carrying out a raid against militants in the region after air forces conducted reconnaissance in the area. The military personnel were killed after ""an explosives belt belonging to terrorists blew up while land troops were combing the area.

Two policemen were shot dead by gunmen in Al-Arish city in North Sinai, security and medical sources said on Tuesday. ISIS later released images documenting the assassination and therefore claiming the attack.
ISIS claimed to have executed 4 ""spies working for the benefit of the EG police"" south of El-Arish, North Sinai.
ISIS claims to have destroyed an army truck near the al-'Abidat checkpoint, west of Sheikh Zuweid, North Sinai.
ISIS claimed to have damaged an army truck by detonation of an IED east of El-Arish, North Sinai.

A non-commissioned police officer was assassinated by IS militants on Saturday while buying vegetables from a street market in the city of al-Arish. According to a statement released from Northern Sinai's security directorate, a number of IS militants abruptly opened fire against the police officer and killed him in front of local residents. Moreover, the statement said that following the shooting, one of the city's residents, Ahmed Mohamed, chased the militants and was subsequently killed.

Workers at a Security and Cleaning Company of Alexandria Railway Authority entered an open strike in front of their company headquarters at the Alexandria railway station to protest against the failure to pay the 10% bonus approved by President Abdel Fattah Al Sisi for the month of Ramadan.

Head of the Investigation bureau in Sherbin, Lieutenant Colonel Ahmed Hussein, was killed in the early hours of Monday. He sustained fatal injuries when his car was attacked by unknown assailants in Dakhiliya. The officer's car was attacked on the Mansoura-Damietta Road. A conscript accompanying Hussein was injured, and is being hospitalised. Hussein died hours after being transferred to the hospital. The Daqahliya Security Directorate said that the attack was a terrorist attack. As of now, no militant group has declared responsibility for the attack.

Egyptian police have dispersed a demonstration organised by journalists and activists in protest at the parliament's vote on a controversial deal to transfer the two Red Sea islands of Tiran and Sanafir to Saudi Arabia. The protest was organised outside the press syndicate, the country's union of journalists, on 13 June evening. Videos on social media websites show part of the protest and the anti-government slogans they chanted. Other videos show the moment the security forces dispersed the protest and the journalists resorting to the union's headquarters.

A number of employees of a car company organized a protest on Tuesday to demand May salaries, asserting that they have not received incentives and profits since 2015. It is not reported where the protests took place.

Arrests: As many as 40 people detained amid calls on social media for mass protest against Saudi deal on Friday at Tahrir Square. Egyptian police stormed the homes of political opponents of a disputed 2016 agreement to transfer control of two Red Sea islands to Saudi Arabia, arresting dozens in raids in Cairo and at least 10 provinces across the country.
3 presumed ISIS militants killed, 1 arrested & 2 motorbikes destroyed by sec forces at unspec. location in Sinai.

Egyptian security forces have quickly dispersed small protests against a disputed deal which gives control of two Red Sea islands to Saudi Arabia. Anti-riot police were deployed on Friday after calls spread on social media to rally in Cairo's Tahrir Square against the agreement.

Masked men last Friday, 16 June, attacked a bakery in the North Sinai town of al-Arish and shot dead its Muslim owner, 45-year-old Ayman Zaki Sanad, in front of his wife and children. It is believed they killed him because they suspect he is a police informer. General Sayed al-Habaal, Security Director of North Sinai, said that the masked gunmen in all probability belong to a militant jihadi group in Sinai.
One killed in renewed clashes between the families of Farghal and Saeed in Ezbet Shahin village, Farshout. Days later, at his funeral, gunmen opened fire on mourners, leaving one passerby injured.

Looting: During the early hours of Friday 16 June, Egyptian police broke into a Church-owned three-story building in Saft al-Kharsa, which Copts use as a de facto church and a community service centre. Police threw the furniture, rugs, icons, pictures, and worship utensils that had been in the building outside, and closed down the building with seals and chains. They took the belongings into their homes.
Non-violent activity: An Egyptian court on Saturday has sentenced 31 persons to death over killing former public prosecutor in a bomb attack on his car in 2015, state media reported.
One killed in renewed clashes between the families of Farghal and Saeed in Ezbet Shahin village, Farshout. Days later, at his funeral, gunmen opened fire on mourners, leaving one passerby injured.
Egypt: Police officer killed and 4 others wounded amidst IED detonation on police vehicle near Carrefour Maadi, southeast Cairo. Hasam very much suspected to be the perpetrators.

Egypt's Interior Ministry says a roadside bomb struck a police vehicle in a Cairo suburb, killing an officer and wounding four others. In a statement carried by the state news agency, the ministry said the bomb was remotely detonated early Sunday in Maadi. Hasam Movement claimed repsonsibility for the attack.
The military spokesman has announced the killing of three jihadist elements during a security operation by law-enforcement troops in North Sinai.

Egypt's security forces killed 12 militants in airstrikes in the restive Sinai peninsula and according to two a statements by the Interior Ministry and the armed forces on Tuesday.The armed forces said the strikes in North Sinai also destroyed four vehicles as it targeted a militant stronghold"" of the local Islamic State affiliate, formerly known as Ansar Beit al-Maqdis.
MoI announces killing of 3 Hasam militants in arrest raid turned firefight in Old City Burj al-Arab, greater Alexandria.

Security Measures: The Egyptian government on Thursday agreed to prolong a state of emergency for three months across the country. Egyptian President Al-Sisi declared on April 10, 2016, a state of emergency in the country for three months and the formation of a supreme council to fight terrorism and extremism after some explosions targeted two churches, killing and wounding scores of people. Two days later, Egyptian President pardoned 502 prisoners over different protest cases.
MoI announces killing of 7 ISIS militants during raid in the mountains near Manfalut, Assiut Governorate.
ISIS claimed to have damaged a Humvee, a BMP & another military vehicle by detonation of IEDs in al-Qawadis, east of El-Arish.

The MoI said in statement that the national security sector received confirmed information that some militants from the Harakat Hasm had planned to hold a meeting. The forces dealt with the situation, and killed a terrorist and seized large amounts of ammunition, the statement added.

Dozens of workers of natural gas field west of Port Said province protested against the issuance of instructions from the Director of the General Department stating that the holiday of Eid al-Fitr is only one day. The workers denounced this this arbitrary decision especially that workers need to return to their homes which takes them about 12 hours.

Agreement: Egyptian President Abdel Fattah Al-Sisi issued on Friday 23 June an official pardon for 502 prisoners, including some of the prisoners in cases related to holding demonstrations and protests, according to the Egyptian presidency statement.

Workers of the Suez Canal Company, affiliated to Suez Canal Authority, refused on Monday to allow Engineer Issam Dabash, the chairman of the board of directors to leave his office, to protest the delay in the payment of the allowance approved by the House of Representatives.
Nestle workers began a strike at the company's factory in Qalyub to protest the dismissal of their colleagues.
ISIS claimed the killing of 2 EG soldiers by sniping near al-Safa checkpoint, El-Arish.
Sinai Province released a photo of a beheaded individual who group said was an ""agent for EG intelligence & police"".
ISIS claimed to have damaged an EG army MRAP & tank truck in twin-IED blast near al-Kharouba CP, El-Arish, North Sinai.

Fights and quarrels occurred on Thursday between citizens and drivers of micro-buses and transportation vehicles after they raised fares upon an increase in the prices of fuel, without waiting for the official fare prices to be announced by the Cabinet.

Fights and quarrels occurred on Thursday between citizens and drivers of micro-buses and transportation vehicles after they raised fares upon an increase in the prices of fuel, without waiting for the official fare prices to be announced by the Cabinet.

Fights and quarrels occurred on Thursday between citizens and drivers of micro-buses and transportation vehicles after they raised fares upon an increase in the prices of fuel, without waiting for the official fare prices to be announced by the Cabinet.

Fights and quarrels occurred on Thursday between citizens and drivers of micro-buses and transportation vehicles after they raised fares upon an increase in the prices of fuel, without waiting for the official fare prices to be announced by the Cabinet.

Fights and quarrels occurred on Thursday between citizens and drivers of micro-buses and transportation vehicles after they raised fares upon an increase in the prices of fuel, without waiting for the official fare prices to be announced by the Cabinet.

Fights and quarrels occurred on Thursday between citizens and drivers of micro-buses and transportation vehicles after they raised fares upon an increase in the prices of fuel, without waiting for the official fare prices to be announced by the Cabinet.
Protesters parked their cars on 6 October bridge to protest against a recent gas price increase. The protests blocked the route for other drivers, were arrested and face charges of assembly.

Dozens of Alexandria residents rallied on Friday after Friday prayers at Qa'ed Ibrahim Mosque to celebrate the 4th anniversary of the June 30 revolution amid tight security. They held photos for President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi, Egyptian flags and photos for late President Gamal Abdel Nasser that read 'Egypt Will Never Kneel Down!'

Arrests: On 1 July in Cairo, a masked SWAT team stormed an Uighur restaurant and arrested nearly 40 Uighurs inside, as Egypt assists China in its crackdown against the group in the aim to ""curb Islamic extremism"".

Employees of the General Assembly for the Care of the Elderly in Damanhour entered into an open strike at the Welfare House in Al-Abbadia, against the inequality between them and the workers at orphans' care, and to demand the application of Law 60/2016 on the minimum wage.
ISIS claimed a serie of attacks in El-Arish, North #Sinai incl. assassinations of a military-rank Major & an intelligence agent.
ISIS claimed the killing of 3 EG soldiers and wounding others by detonation of 2 IEDs in the east of El-Arish, North Sinai.
ISIS claimed the assassination of an officer in the EG police yesterday in downtown El-Arish, North Sinai.
An attack on a security checkpoint on 5 July killed three in al-Ayyat district, Giza Governorate. The Islamic State group later claimed responsibility through al-Naba.
Egypt's armed forces killed 40 militants Friday after suicide bombing and shooting on an army check point in North Sinai that left 23 soldiers killed or wounded (40 fatalities coded).
Hasam Movement claimed the assassination of police captain Ibrahim Azazi earlier today in Al Khankah, Al Qalyubia Governorate.

Three Egyptians who worked at a building site in the Western Desert were killed by an airstrike from a military aircraft in what appears to have been an accident, their family members said Friday. The men were traveling on a road near the Bahariya Oasis some 300 kilometers (186 miles) southwest of Cairo when their vehicle was struck earlier this week.

The Egyptian police killed 14 militants in a fire exchange in a desert area in the Suez Canal province of Ismailia, the Interior Ministry said in a statement on Saturday. The statement said that the gunmen were among the militants wanted over involvement in militant operaions targeting policemen and soldiers in North Sinai province bordering Israel and the Palestinian Gaza Strip.

The Egyptian police killed two militants on Saturday in a shootout in Giza province, official news agency MENA reported. The national security sector was tipped off that these terrorists had been sheltering in a hotbed in October City, the report added.
At least two policemen were killed and nine others wounded in an explosion on Saturday in Egypt's North Sinai province, the Egyptian state TV reported.

A number of workers at Faraj Allah resorted to Alexandria labour office to protest against their arbitrary transfer from the Borg El Arab headquarters to Cairo and the Red Sea, saying that this transfer came after they have participated in a protest to demand their secondary profits.

Egyptian police killed six IS militants when a gunfight erupted Monday during a raid on their Nile valley hideout, the government said. The militants opened fire on the police as they approached the hideout in Dairut, a town in the southern province of Assiut, the interior ministry said in a statement on its Facebook page.

Egypt-MoI killed prominent ""Muslim Brotherhood"" militant responsible for training for future attacks in Sinnuris, Fayoum; 2 others escaped. According to the MoI the militant belonged to the Hasam movement.

One conscript was injured Tuesday in an explosion in North Sinai's Al-Arish, local media reported. The bombing targeted an armed personnel carrier (APC). No details of the bomb were provided by officials. The bombing also injured two civilians who were passing by when the incident happened.

Security forces on Wednesday [12 July] killed a member of Hasm terrorist group who was accused of involvement in several terrorist operations including killing five policemen. The security apparatus received a tip-off that Ahmed Mohamed Omar Swelim; a civil servant, was hiding in a hired apartment in Cairo's al Marg district.
Egypt: ISIS claimed damaging an armored vehicle of the EG army by IED near the Maydan CP, area of western entrance to El-Arish, N Sinai

Hundreds of workers in Dakahlia sugar factory went on strike and stopped production lines, announcing their sit-in inside the factory, in protest against the non-inclusion of the social allowances in the basic salary, a step that was taken by Delta Sugar Factory, in addition to demanding 28 million pounds as a supplemental bonus.
5 policemen killed in shooting targeting checkpoint in al-Badrasheen, 15km south of Cairo/Giza, in an attack by Hasam.

Two german women were killed on Friday and four others were wounded when an assailant stabbed them at an Egyptian Red Sea beach resort, officials said. An injured Ukrainian woman later died of her wounds. The perpetrator tried to join the Islamic State and faces terrorism charges, said Egyptian security sources some weeks later. The two sources confirmed a Facebook page belonging to the attacker contains a series of references to the Daesh group, with the militant group's flag displayed prominently in his profile.
On 15 July, police forces killed two militants from the Hasam movement in a shoot-out in Badrashin, Giza.
On 15 July in the Gelbana area of Qantara Sharq city, Ismailia, police forces attacked a group of militants, leaving 4 dead. MENASTREAM reported that they were militants dispatched from Sinai.
On 15 July, hundreds of citizens blocked Qeft, Qena agricultural road to protest the death of man in police custody.

On 15 July, a church guard was stabbed in the neck by a razor blade at the All Saints Church in Alexandria. A researcher at Al-Ahram Centre for Political and Strategic Studies identified the attack as a ""lone wolf"" attack and an unnamed security source claimed that the attacker was a supporter and agent of the Islamic State militant group.
On 15 July, Egyptian warplanes destroyed 15 vehicles carrying weapons and explosives on the western border with Libya.
On 15 July, State of Sinai claimed to have destroyed a Humvee using an IED near the al-Saha military camp in Rafah, North Sinai.
Security forces killed three Islamist militants in Central Sinai. The exact date of the event was not provided - source published on 16 July.
Security forces killed six militants in a mountainous area of Central Sinai. A booby-trapped car was also detonated. The exact date of the event was not provided - source published on 16 July.
On 16 July in al-Warraq, one person was killed when security forces clashed with squatters as they tried to evict them from 'unlicensed buildings'. 56 people were injured, including 37 policemen.
On 17 July, dozens of people marched through Warraq to protest propane tank and flour shortages.

On 17 July, Islamist militants opened fire on an armored vehicle before setting it onfire in el-Arish. The militants set off a roadside bomb when reinforcements arrived, leaving a total five policemen dead and five wounded.
On 17 July, Egyptian F-16 fighter jets bombed suspected militants in different areas across northern Sinai, leaving 30 dead.
Islamist militants detonated a roadside bomb that wounded six police officers when it hit their armored vehicle near the airport south of el-Arish.
On 18 July a Coptic Christian man was arrested by police and held in Cairo's Mensheyet Nasir's police station. Amnesty found evidence that officers were implicated in torturing the man to death.

On 18 July, two senior members of the Hasam movement were reportedly killed by security forces in New Cairo.

On 20 July, the Hasam militant group attacked a police vehicle in Fayoum. A recruit was killed and three others were injured.

On 21 July, two Hasm movement militants were killed in a firefight with security forces in Fayoum governorate. They were hiding in Tamiya town.

Egyptian security forces have killed eight suspected militants belonging to the Hasm movement in what officials said was a training camp in Al Fayyum.

Early pension workers at Tanta Flax and Oils Company protest labour issues on or before 24/07.

column16: Anadolu Agency; Agence Tunis Afrique Presse; Egypt Independent
column17: From the 18th, the Egyptian Armed Forces launch the 8 day operation 'Martyr's Right', which kills 40 State of Sinai militants across Sheikh Zewaid, Al-Arish and Rafah in North Sinai in ground and airstrikes. Fatalities split across events.

Seven civilians, including two young children, were killed by a car bomb that exploded at a security checkpoint in the Sinai Peninsula on Monday (July 24). The military said it intercepted the vehicle at a checkpoint near the city of Arish and tried to contain the expected blast by running over the car with a tank. No group claimed responsibility for the attack. It was observed from security footage that the bomber stopped at the checkpoint and fled before a tank attempted to dampen the effect of the blast by driving on top of the suspected automobile.
Egyptian police shot dead four militants and arrested two others accused of involvement in the mid-July killing of five policemen. Another two are arrested in a nearby hideout.
Employees of four sugar factories protest for labour incentives.

More than a thousand workers protested at the Delta Fertilizers Company headquarters to demand the resignation of the board of directors due to the doubling of losses. The workers detained the company's president, Nabil Makkawi in his office, demanding his departure due to the deteriorating conditions of the company.

Workers at the Ministry of Manpower organized a protest end July to demand incentives and better wages. Workers called on the ministry to provide a constant incentive for equality with the Ministry of Immigration. They also said that their salaries are low, and demanded better wages. Precise date of the protest not known - source dated 26/07.

Military forces stopped an attempt by ""terrorists"" (no other identification) to attack a military unit which is located within the northern military zone, near Alexandria. The soldiers shot and killed the driver of the explosive laden vehicle.

Second Field Army forces destroyed on 26/07 three armed vehicles, three improvised explosive device (IED) workshops and overall 24 militant shelters, in the fourth stage of the ""Haq el-Shaheed"" operation in the area to clear shelters used by militants in North Sinai. Causalities not listed.

Security forces of the Interior Ministry shoots and kills between 2-4 members of the Muslim Brotherhood who they believed had been responsible for the death of several police officers earlier in the month. The date of this operation is not known - the announcement was made on 27/07.
One Takfiri element was killed and five terrorist hotbeds were destroyed during raids by Second Army forces bases in North Sinai near or adjacent to Gaza.
Sugar factory employees protest over wages.
Defusal: Law enforcement forces of the Third Field Army arrested a militant and dismantled three bombs near Ahmed Hamdi tunnel in Suez.

On Sunday dozens of people gathered in front of Esna police station in Qena, in solidarity with the mother of deceased 28 year-old Ahmed who police claim committed suicide on Saturday. Ahmed, whose last name has not been printed, was detained on Wednesday on charges of motorcycle theft. Police say the man cut his arteries and hung himself in a prison cell Saturday. However, Ahmed's family, along with other protesters, believe that it was the police who killed the young man. Rioters blocked the road to Qantara Bridge and smashed the concrete barriers in the streets near Esna Preparatory School.

Egyptian army raided a hideout of extremist elements in North Sinai province on Monday and killed one militant. Two militants were also arrested during the raid which was carried out by land troops in cooperation with the air forces.

Dozens of workers and employees of the quarry project belonging to the Minya governorate, protested to demand full time employment and equality, stressing that ""some officials replaced workers who have been working for more than ten years with others.
Two assailants stabbed two conscripts & seized their weapons at checkpoint in Batrah, Dakahlia Governorate.
Shooutout at checkpoint around 10h40 in Esna, Qena, left a police officer & a civilian dead, three other bystanders woundedLater, one of the two assailants arrested and 2 AKs & their vehicle seized.

Egypt's army has destroyed a major illegal tunnel crossing the Egyptian border in North Sinai, a military spokesman said in a statement on Sunday. Security forces killed two militants in the raid on the tunnel, with two 4x4 vehicles also destroyed, according to the statement.

Six-thousand workers began an open-ended sit-in at the state-owned Misr Spinning and Weaving company in Mahalla on Monday, demanding promised 10 % bonuses and late payment which lasted for a few days.

A number of workers of ""Mukhtar' Contracting and Investment company in Sohag demanded the change of the current the Director of the company; because he dismissed more than 1600 workers who have been working in this company for more than 20 years.
Egyptian army announced it had killed five militants in Central Sinai. In coordination with the air forces they struck an underground bunker used by them. Three other militants were arrested.

Egypt's interior ministry said Thursday its forces had killed three jihadi militants suspected of involvement in deadly attacks against the country's Coptic Christian minority. An officer also died in a shootout in the southern province of Qena on Tuesday, security officials said.
An army officer and three policemen were killed in am ambush by assailants on Wednesday near Al-Arish in North Sinai. The Islamic State later claimed responsibility for the attack.
Unknown gunmen aboard a vehicle opened fire on a security checkpoint in Shubra Al Khaymah, Cairo without causing any casualties.
Two policemen were killed and six were injured late Saturday after their vehicle was struck by an improvised explosive device in the town of el-Arish in the northern Sinai Peninsula.
Local media reported that two army soldiers were killed by sniper fire in two different incidents in the Sinai.
Two members of the Hasam movement were killed in an exchange of gunfire with the police according to the Egyptian MoI.

The workers of Shebin El Koum Spinning and Weaving Company decided to cut the production to 10 tons a day, while it was previously 22 tons, to protest the rejection of their demands by the company to pay the special allowance approved by President Al Sisi and the living cost allowance, in addition to the incentive and meal allowance.

Egypt Trade Union Federation workers organized a protest to demand the payment of the Eid grant, the special allowance paid to the employees of the state and the removal of the current administrative committee. The workers announced the start of an open sit-in at the headquarters of the Union. The deputy chairman of the union committee pointed out that this crisis does not only include workers in the Union, but extends to the employees of the local unions in the governorates.
ISIS claimed killing a soldier by sniping yesterday at the Mahdiya checkpoint south of Rafah, North Sinai.

Egyptian security officials say suspected Islamic militants have shot dead two policemen in el-Arish. The officials say gunmen sprayed a police lieutenant's car with gunfire on Tuesday, killing him instantly. Later, assailants shot dead a policeman as he left his home.

Hundreds of the Egyptian Spinning and Weaving Company workers moved their sit-in, on Tuesday, from the company's factories in Mahalla city, Gharbiya, to the front of the company's headquarters on Talaat Harb Street in Cairo, to protest the Cabinet negligence of their demands. Thousands of workers started their sit-in eight days ago in Mahalla.
The Interior Ministry announced that two terrorists were killed in an exchange of fire with security forces at Farafra road in the New Valley.

Dozens of workers in Fayoum General Hospital protested in front of the hospital chanting slogans demanding their financial rights. A number of workers in the Sanawrs Central hospital joined their protest, and requested from the undersecretary of the Ministry of Health in the province to intervene and support their demands.
Law enforcement forces of the Third Field Army killed two jihadi militants and destroyed to 4x4-cars in Central Sinai.
ISIS claimed killing soldier by sniping at checkpoint in El-Arish, North Sinai.

A police colonel and his driver were injured on Sunday as a result of a drive-by shooting conducted by two unidentified gunmen. Reports said the incident took place in front of the colonel's house in Damietta as he was heading to work.
Around 16,000 workers from the state-owned Misr Spinning and Weaving in Mahalla ended on Sunday their 12-day sit-in, after being promised to have their demands looked into by the company.

Skirmishes between Christians and Muslims took place in Ezbat al Forn, Abu Qurqas. According to the head of Abu Qurqas city council fights broke out on Sunday after some Coptic citizens tried to pray at the house of a citizen under the guidance of a priest, prompting some Muslims to intercept for not possessing a license. Some suspects were arrested.

Egyptian Air Forces managed to destroy nine armed four-wheel vehicles, loaded with different weapons and explosives, near Egypt's western borders. The vehicles were destructed following several air strikes. No information was provided regarding the identity of the militants.
A militant sniper killed a policeman on duty at a checkpoint.
A soldier was killed and five others injured when their vehicle was struck by a roadside bomb in the border town of Rafah.
8 State of Sinai militants were killed in raids by the Egyptian military, supported by the air forcce.
Egypt's Interior Ministry says security forces have killed two members of the Hasam movement in a shootout at their hideout in Wadi el-Natroun, northwest of Cairo.
An army sergeant was killed in an attack on a checkpoint in Rafah. No official statement has been published to confirm and report on the incident but a military funeral was held for him 2 days later.

The Egyptian army has killed six militants in North Sinai, according to the army spokesman. Brig Gen Tamer al-Refei posted a statement on his official Facebook page saying that four other militants were injured in a raid by the army's Law Enforcement Forces.

7 State of Sinai militants were killed in raids by the Egyptian military. A tribal source from North Sinai reported that Ouda El-Hamadeen, one of the leaders of the State of Sinai, has been killed in one of the raids.
Dozens of Nubian activists were arrested Sunday in Aswan after rallying to demand their right to return to their lands.
Police officer shot dead by unknown gunmen while travelling aboard motorcycle in Beni Suef.
Two gunmen were killed in clashes while attemping to attack a checkpoint in al Arish.
2 police officers were wounded after being subjected to heavy gunfire.
ISIS claims killing 2 EG soldiers by sniping at CP in El Arish. On the same day, ISIS claimed damaging two armoured vehicles at Kilo 17 near al-Arish with a heavy sniper.
08 September. Approximately 24 demonstrators including human rights defenders were arrested at a peaceful protest to campaign for the rights of the Nubian population in Aswan. [size=no report]
ISIS claims two previous IED attacks on Armed Personl Carriers in Al Arish.

Ten militants from Egypt's Islamic State group affiliate were killed on Sunday in a police raid and a near three-hour shootout in Ard al-Lewa neighbourhhood. Five policemen were wounded in the clashes at two apartments.
Arrests: A human rights lawyer was arrested at Cairo International Airport as he was travelling to a UN conference on enforced disappearances. He was held incommunicado for 3 days.
ISIS claims to have repelled an army campaign in the Rafah area, engaging in combat & forcing army to withdraw. ISIS burned a bulldozer & destroyed another bulldozer by IED amidst army withdrawal
ISIS claims to have repelled an army campaign in the Rafah area, engaging in combat & forcing army to withdraw. ISIS burned a bulldozer & destroyed another bulldozer by IED amidst army withdrawal

State of Sinai attacked a police convoy with an SVBIED before ambushing the convoy in person and killing the rest of the police forces in a shootout. 18 policemen (plus the driver) were killed in the attack in Bir el-Abed.
ISIS claims destroying an armored vehicle/MRAP of the EG army by IED detonation on the road between Hasna & Nakhel, Central Sinai.
The prime suspect in the Badrashin attack (July 14) was shot dead by security forces in Al Bitash, Alexandria governorate. The Hasam movement had claimed repsonsibility for the attack in July.

Two soldiers and six militants from the Islamic State were killed in a foiled suicide bombing near Rafah on Wednesday. The bomber had taken advantage of a fog to creep up on an army ""installation"" when troops spotted and killed him. The military said five other ""jihadists"" were killed in ensuing clashes. ISIS also claims killing a soldier in Rafah by sniper on the same day
The Egyptian military killed 3 militants of the Islamic State in North Sinai.
Cluster bombs and bomblets dropped by Egyptian Air Forces aircraft, said to have been dropped today, were found near al-Barth.

Non-violent activity: Cairo criminal court on Monday sentenced 43 defendants to life in prison. The defendants include several high-profile Muslim Brotherhood youth cadres and preachers known to have supported the group.
A subway sit-in took place to demand allowances for working on Saturdays, like other companies, as metro-workers work full-time on Saturdays and official state holidays.
ISIS claims to have damaged an armored vehicle of the EG army by IED detonation west of El-Arish, North Sinai .
ISIS claims to have executed 4 alleged ""informers"" of the Egyptian army in the area of Qabr Umair, Rafah.
A subway sit-in took place to demand allowances for working on Saturdays, like other companies, as metro-workers work full-time on Saturdays and official state holidays.
ISIS claimed to have destroyed MRAP by IED in west El-Arish.
A subway sit-in took place to demand allowances for working on Saturdays, like other companies, as metro-workers work full-time on Saturdays and official state holidays.
Armored vehicle struck by IED on the road linking El-Arish & Bir Lahfan, North Sinai, one conscript killed and another one wounded.
The Egyptian military killed six Islamic State Militants and arrested 31 more in North Sinai.
The Islamic State executed 6 civilians accused of spying for the Egyptian government/military.
ISIS claimed IED detonation that struck armored vehicle between Abu Tawilah & Sheikh Zuweid, one conscript killed & another wounded.
The Egyptian air force said it destroyed a convoy of 10 all-terrain vehicles in the country's western desert suspected of smuggling weapons from Libya.
ISIS claimed damaging a water tank truck near Abu Tawilah, Sheikh Zuweid by IED. No known human casualty.
ISIS claimed damaging a minesweeper by IED near Safa CP, El-Arish.
ISIS claimed the assassination of a police officer & a civilian (described as ""army informer"") in downtown El-Arish, North Sinai.
ISIS claimed the assassination of a police officer & a civilian (described as ""army informer"") in downtown El-Arish, North Sinai.
Hasam Movement claimed IED attack against the Myanmar Embassy in Cairo's Zamalek district, in response to the violence targeting Myanmar's Rohingya.
A conscript was killed by sniping at a military checkpoint in El-Arish.
An attack was foiled on a ring road south of Arish: soldiers fired repeatedly at a SVBIED which was driving towards the checkpoint, detonating it before it reached the soldiers on duty.

Egyptian police forces have killed three Hasm militants in a shootout in 15 May City, a southern Cairo suburb. The gunfire exchange took place at a cemetery under construction as security forces were trying to arrest them.

Nubians protested in front of the courthouse in Aswan against a judge's decision to extend the detention of relatives and friends who had been detained for protesting recently. Police Forces used teargas to disperse the protest and arrested seven of them.

The family of 13-year-old Sameh Youssef organized a silent stand in front of the House of Representatives to protest against the failure of police to arrest the criminals who fatally shot Youssef. Youssef, namely known in the media as 'Youssef, the martyr of October', was shot in the head in May 2017 during a wedding ceremony in 6th of October city.

Dozens of cleaning workers went on strike in the city of Minya ALQmh in Sharkia province and gathered at their headquarters in the city center in order to protest the mayor's decision that cleaning workers be supervised.
ISIS continues attempting to project governance in North Sinai, releases photos of hand amputation of thief if Sheikh Zuweid.
Wilayat Sinai released photo report showing execution of individual abducted in Rafah on October 8 accused of being EG army informer.
Demolition: Egypt's military has bulldozed at least 140 homes and more than 200 acres along the Gaza Strip border, expanding a buffer zone in an effort to cut off the flow of weapons and militants.

A soldier was killed on Tuesday while foiling an attack on a checkpoint guarding a Cement factory in central Sinai. The force guarding the checkpoint reportedly warned the car and its driver who were suspected to belong to the militant group Sinai Province. Afterwards, the force fired at the car causing an explosion which lead to the killing of the solider and the attacker.
Gunmen opened fire on three policemen who responded in Masaed, W El-Arish. No casualties reported.

Police forces broke up a demonstration of postgradute students, who protested against a prime ministerial decree that concerns employment. The protest took place outside of the Cabinet headquarters on Qasr al-Aini street. Police forces broke up the protest, after which, protesters then announced a sit-in. 'We are starting a sit-in, we are here not leaving,' they chanted.

Security Measures: Egypt has decided to extend the nationwide state of emergency for another three months starting from Friday over security challenges, according to a presidential decree published in the official gazette on Thursday. President Sisi first imposed a three-month nationwide state of emergency in April, following a twin bombings at two churches in northern provinces of Gharbiya and Alexandria that killed at least 47 and wounded over 120.
AQ-linked Jamaat Jund al-Islam makes comeback by claiming ambush against an ISIS unit on October 11, killing four militants and acknowledging two dead in its own ranks.

A Coptic priest was killed and another wounded on Thursday. The priest was stabbed by a man in Cairo's northeastern suburb of El-Marg. A young unemployed man blocked the way in front of the priest's vehicle and asked him to get out. He then hit the priest's head with cleaver and ran away. It is believed that the perpetrator is a religious extremist. He has been arrested.
8 ISIS militants killed, 6 severely wounded & 4 pickups seized following ambush by Tarabin tribesmen near Gora Airport. Also an unknown number killed in the ranks of the Tarabin.

Egyptian officials say an attack on al-Gaz checkpoint south of el-Arish led to the death of six soldiers and another four people were wounded. The assailaints fled and three of them were killed in a following exchange of fire.
The Third Field Army law enforcement forces in cooperation with the Air Force managed to destroy a terrorist hotbed in Central Sinai, Military Spokesman Tamer el Refai said on Friday.
The Egyptian armed forces on Saturday prevented a terrorist attack that was targeting 101 Brig. HQ security check point East of Al-Arish, killing at least two militants.
Wilayat Sinai releases pic of Humvee destroyed by IED, beside a M60 Patton MBT, a NIMR & army clothing + piece of Humvee hood put on display.
Two rockets fired from Sinai into Israel.

At least seven Egyptian soldiers and 24 attackers from the State of Sinai have been killed in a series of assaults on security posts in Karm al Qawadis and al-Ajra. Clashes also reported in the areas of Wifaq & Balaa and the security HQs in Al Arish. 37 soldiers were reportedly wounded.

At least seven Egyptian soldiers and 24 attackers from the State of Sinai have been killed in a series of assaults on security posts in Karm al Qawadis and al-Ajra. Clashes also reported in the areas of Wifaq & Balaa and the security HQs in Al Arish. 37 soldiers were reportedly wounded.

At least seven Egyptian soldiers and 24 attackers from the State of Sinai have been killed in a series of assaults on security posts in Karm al Qawadis and al-Ajra. Clashes also reported in the areas of Wifaq & Balaa and the security HQs in Al Arish. 37 soldiers were reportedly wounded.

At least seven Egyptian soldiers and 24 attackers from the State of Sinai have been killed in a series of assaults on security posts in Karm al Qawadis and al-Ajra. Clashes also reported in the areas of Wifaq & Balaa and the security HQs in Al Arish. 37 soldiers were reportedly wounded.

At least seven Egyptian soldiers and 24 attackers from the State of Sinai have been killed in a series of assaults on security posts in Karm al Qawadis and al-Ajra. Clashes also reported in the areas of Wifaq & Balaa and the security HQs in Al Arish. 37 soldiers were reportedly wounded.

Libyan students staged a sit-in in front of the Libyan embassy in Cairo demanding the dismissal of the Minister of Education from the GNA because scholarships, medical insurance and other support has been suspended.

Wilayat Sinai militants shot and killed three bank/church guards, one soldier and three civilians in an attack on an unused Coptic church and a bank that was then robbed my the militants in Al Arish. 3 civilian fatalities recorded in another event.

Wilayat Sinai militants shot and killed three bank/church guards, one soldier and three civilians in an attack on an unused Coptic church and a bank that was then robbed my the militants in Al Arish. A bank employee appears to have been kidnapped in the attack. 4 security force fatalities recorded in another event.

Dozens of Damietta hospitals cleaners protested in front of the governorate's general office to demand a meeting with the governor of Damietta, in order to complain about the non payment of salaries for more than 4 months.
ISIS claims to have destroyed a MRAP-vehicle south of Rafah.
ISIS claimed executing an alleged ""spy/informer"" for the Egyptian army in Sheikh Zuweid.

At least 16 policemen and 15 militants (EG MoI figures) were killed when a military raid on a militant hideout was ambushed near Bahariya Oasis (a large area of 135km^2). Other sources speak of at least 52-54 dead. A new group Jamaa Ansar al-Islam claimed the attack two weeks later.

Masked men kidnapped leading businessman and military contractor Ayman Sahmoud from his car in front of his house in southern Arish. Sahmoud, who is from one of Arish's biggest tribes, Al-Fawakhreya, was taken to an unknown location.
Armored vehicle of the EG army struck by IED south of Sheikh Zuweid, North Sinai. Provisional toll 3 wounded conscripts.

Around 100 workers at the Majestic Ceramic Factory in Suez organized a protest in front of the company's headquarters to protest against the management preventing them from entering the factory and demanding them to resign.
Workers of the first LED bulbs factory in southern Sinai called on authorities to reopen it, as it was closed two months ago soon after its opening in the Sinai industrial zone near el-Tor.
Egyptian warplanes struck a eight vehicles entering Egypt from Libya which killed suspected militants inside the vehicles. Egyptian Air-Force did not specify the number of casualties.
Egyptian security killed six militants and seized a large amount of weapons during a raid on a hideout in North Sinai.
Armed clashes between security forces and militants between al-Kharga and Assiut have led to the death of at least 12 militants. Bodies were transferred to Assiut University hospital.

Coptic inhabitants of Ezbet Zakariya in Minya, some 250km south of Cairo, were attacked by a Muslim mob because they were praying in a de facto church in the village. They threw stones at the Copts and broke the doors to their homes, wounding a Coptic woman. Police swiftly secured the scene and closed to church for fear of further unrest. Noone was arrested since the mob had dispersed quickly.
Militants target a police vehicle with an IED and then opened fire on the truck, killing two conscripts and wounding 10 on the outskirts of Al Arish.

Egypt's air force had carried out a desert raid west of Fayoum that killed a large number of militants responsible for the deaths of 16 policemen earlier this month. Police Forces attacked the militants and freed a kidnapped police officer after the air-raids.

Egypt's air force had carried out a desert raid west of Fayoum that killed a large number of militants responsible for the deaths of 16 policemen earlier this month. Police Forces attacked the militants and freed a kidnapped police officer after the air-raids.
Four civilians have been killed when a mortar shell fired by militants hit their tractor in Al-Arish. A fifth civilian was wounded.
The Egyptian armed forces announced the destruction of six four-wheel-drive vehicles loaded with ammunition and weapons near the Libyan border.

Member of Parliament Mangowd El Hawary had his car attacked and smashed by Fayoum University students after he physically assaulted a female security guard who asked his daughter to show her university ID to enter university.

The Egyptian army foiled a militant attack against a checkpoint in North Sinai province, exchanging fire with the assailants who fled. The Egyptian air force then targeted the militants in their hideouts and killed five of them.

The Egyptian army foiled a militant attack against a checkpoint in North Sinai province, exchanging fire with the assailants who fled. The Egyptian air force then targeted the militants in their hideouts and killed five of them.
ISIS, Wilayat Sinai, claimed sniping a police officer & a policeman in central El-Arish. Fatalities not confirmed.
