column17: 05 November. A civilian working in indigenous rights was denied medical treatment and died in prison in Aswan, Aswan.
ISIS claimed damaging EG army bulldozer & destroying vehicle by IEDs, today & y'day respectively, area of Rafah near Gaza border.
Nubians blocked major streets and railway tracks in Kalabsh villages, 50km south of Aswan, to denounce the recent death of a prominent Nubian activist in jail.
ISIS claimed damaging EG army bulldozer & destroying vehicle by IEDs, today & y'day respectively, area of Rafah near Gaza border.

Nubians blocked major streets and railway tracks in Kalabsh villages, 50km south of Aswan, to denounce the recent death of a prominent Nubian activist in jail. 10 of them were arrested by police for organizing the event.
A total of five militants were killed, another seven were injured and further suspects were arrested in a joint army-police crackdown in the cities of al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.
A total of five militants were killed, another seven were injured and further suspects were arrested in a joint army-police crackdown in the cities of al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.
A total of five militants were killed, another seven were injured and further suspects were arrested in a joint army-police crackdown in the cities of al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.
On November 8, the Military Spokesman announced the arrest of 249 militants during military raids in North Sinai between October 27 and November 7.
Militants from an Islamic State affiliate ambushed a convoy of cement trucks from an army factory in the central Sinai Peninsula, killing eight civilian employees and two soldiers.
Pope Kyrillos stages a sit-in after the power is cut to his church. The sit-in is joined by a wider protest by Copts who fear that the power cut is a pre-text to close the church down.
Ten militants were killed during Apache helicopter raids on hideouts in Sheikh Zuweid.
Egyptian air forces destroyed 10 vehicles loaded with arms attempting to infiltrate into Egypt through its western borders. All militants inside the vehicles were killed.

Villagers in Zawyat Ghazal blocked the road in front of the village after poor road conditions caused an accident which led to the death of 7 children. Police-troops were deployed anticipating serious riots but did not have to intervene.
Islamic State (IS), Wilayat Sinai, has claimed a missile attack on a cement factory linked with the Egyptian army at Jabal Libni. No casualties were reported
In November, 14 men from central Sinai were kidnapped and interrogated by Daesh over accusations that they had been agents for Egyptian security.
Egypt's armed forces said that they have killed three ""high-level"" suspected militants and arrested 74 others in sweeps in the troubled northern Sinai Peninsula in recent days.
Delta textile workers in Tanta have been protesting in solidarity with 25 of their colleagues who were referred to investigation because they demanded payment of outstanding salaries.
Head of Egypt's Central Security Forces and other police personnel survived an assassination attempt by an Improvised Explosive Device (IED).
About 400 dismissed workers from Shebin Textile protested at the headquarters of the General Union of Spinning and Weaving.
A militant was killed and 18 other arrested by military forces during a clash in central Sinai.
The military kill four militants in North Sinai
Egyptian airstrikes destroyed a dozen four-wheel vehicles loaded with vast quantities of weaponry and explosives on Wednesday, in Egypts Western desert.
Police killed three Lwaaa Al-Thawra members during a raid in Beheira
A Bedouin was killed during a gunfight between two Bedouin groups in Nekle City. Another two were injured in the clash.
Arrests: 29 suspects are detained and arrested on charges of espionage on behalf of Turkey.

Police arrest 15 protesting workers at the Sinmar plant in Port Said. The protest followed the dismissal of 24 workers who demanded the activation of environmental safety measures for the surrounding population area and the workers in the factory.

The air force launch air-raids in Bir al-Abd, the site of an attack upon a Sufi mosque. The planes targeted vehicles used in the attack, killing their occupants, according to a spokesman. A later report indicates that 22 people had been killed in the military's response to the mosque attack
30 armed men carrying an IS banner attack and bomb a Sufi mosque in Bir Al-Abd. The most recent estimates are of 311 dead.
On Nov 24, in North Sinai, Military Forces killed 2 IS militants, and allegedly destroyed vehicles, weapons and hideouts. (location unknown, coded as Al Arish, geoprecision 3).

Thousands took to the streets in North Sinai to protest against the recent bombing. ""No to terror, only prayer houses,"" thousands of students in North Sinai chanted in a spontaneous protest against the massacre Al Rawdah mosque in Bir al-Abed. The exact location of the protests is not mentioned

ISIS says its Sinai Province assaulted gatherings of Egyptian soldiers in the buffer zone near the ""artificial border"" with Gaza. Reports that the clashes and the IED detonations resulted in dead and wounded in the ranks of the Egyptian army.
Two Palestinians were shot and injured by Egyptian forces on Monday night while attempting to cross from Gaza into Egyptian territory in the northern Sinai Peninsula.

Egypt's Interior Ministry said on Tuesday that 11 militants were killed in a shootout with police forces during a raid in Ismailia Governorate aiming to arrest a group of militant leaders with links to North Sinai.
Security forces killed three and arrested another five suspected militants in a crackdown in central Sinai.

Dozens of workers of Tanta Lenin Company held a protest in front of the headquarters of the Holding Company for Spinning and Weaving, to protest against the non-payment of the settlement due to compensate workers for the closure of the company.
State of Sinai claimed killing EG soldier by sniping at checkpoint south of Rafah

Demolition: Security forces in central Sinai destroyed three hideouts used by militants and seized large quantities of weaponry, according to a statement published by the spokesperson for the Armed Forces, Tamer al-Refaei. No armed clashes mentioned
Arrests: Colonel Ahmed Konsowa was detained by Egyptian military prosecutors for 15 days after he announced plans to run in the country's 2018 presidential election.
ISIS Sinai has released images showing the beheading of a young man from the Tarabeen tribe which is considered as cooperating with security forces.
Egyptian security forces killed five militants in a shooting during a raid on a hideout between the 10th of Ramadan city and Belbeis town.

On Dec 5 (and before), in North Sinai, Military Forces destroyed several IS hideouts, weapons and several vehicles. Several militants were killed during the operation (unknown fatalities). (geoprecision 3, coded as Al Arish)
Students held protests at the American University in Cairo against the recent decision of the US president to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital.

Journalists held protests outside the Syndicate headquarters in Cairo against the recent decision of the US president to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital. Security forces arrested eight protesters while dispersing the protests.
Protesters demonstrated in Cairo to denounce US president Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital.
Protesters demonstrated in Alexandria to denounce US president Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital.

On Dec 9, following the death of a suspected thief the day before in Shibin Qanatir police station, allegedly from a heart attack, dozens of his relatives protested in front of the hospital, accusing Police Forces of torturing him to death.
During 2 days Wilayat Sinai (ISIS) claims to have detonated 10 IEDs targeting army vehicles, bulldozers and a foot patrol in Rafah area. No casualties were reported
During 2 days Wilayat Sinai (ISIS) claims to have detonated 10 IEDs targeting army vehicles, bulldozers and a foot patrol in Rafah area. No casualties were reported
The Egyptian army killed a presumed ISIS militant, arrested two suspected militants, and also discovered and destroyed 6 hideouts, two motorbikes and two IEDs in Central Sinai.
Students and staff protested at Ain Shams University University to denounce US president Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital.
Students and staff protested at Damanhur University to denounce US president Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital.
Students and staff protested at Cairo University to denounce US president Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital.
Students and staff protested at Minya University to denounce US president Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital.
ISIS, Wilayat Sinai, claims to have damaged an Egyptian army bulldozer by IED detonation near the border with Gaza.
Several Libyan men tried to enter the HQs of the Libyan delegation to the League of Arab States by force. Doors were broken and staff assaulted. The scene was captured on video.
Students and staff from a university in Alexandria protested to denounce US president Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital.
Students and staff from Mansoura University protested in al Mansoura to denounce US president Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital.
ISIS/Sinai claims to have destroyed an EG army bulldozer by IED detonation in the Zahur neighborhood of Rafah ""amidst campaign to expand the buffer zone"" on the border with Gaza.
ISIS/Sinai claims to have killed three EG soldiers by sniping yesterday west of Sheikh Zuweid and east of El-Arish.
ISIS/Sinai claims to have killed three EG soldiers by sniping yesterday west of Sheikh Zuweid and east of El-Arish.
Militants from ISIS, Wilayat Sinai, attacked a checkpoint in Rafah. Two militants died and one soldier was injured.
A lieutenant was injured in the city of Arish after an IED detonated at the entrance of the city.
Egyptian security forces raided a militant hideout in Obour City and killed five militants.
ISIS/Sinai claims to have killed an EG soldier by sniping in the Zahur neighborhood of Rafah.
Two officers were killed by a rocket strike on an Apache helicopter at Al Arish airport during a visit by defence and interior ministers. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.

Taxi drivers launched a general strike in Tanta and blocked the road in front of the security directorate to denounce Uber, Kareem and unlicensed tourist buses. Security forces dispersed the demonstrators.
ISIS/Sinai claimed sniping an EG soldier at the ""Abu Attiyah"" checkpoint south of Sheikh Zuweid.
Five militants from the Islamic State were killed by EG military forces near El-Arish airport.
Workers of a ceramic company in el-Adabiya staged a protest against the planned relocation of the company to 10th of Ramadan city.

Hundreds of Muslim Egyptians stormed a church in Atfih and destroyed what was inside it, after assaulting the Christians there. Several were wounded before security forces intervened and disperses the crowd.
Dozens of protesters staged a demonstration at al-Azhar mosque condemning the decision of US president Trump proclaiming Jerusalem as the capital of Israel.

Workers of a ceramic company in el-Adabiya continued their protest against the planned relocation of the company to 10th of Ramadan city, especially after 650 workers were arbitrarily dismissed after the first protest.
ISIS/Sinai claimed to have killed two EG soldiers by sniping south and west of Sheikh Zuweid.
ISIS/Sinai claimed damaging an army bulldozer by IED detonation west of El-Arish Airport, North Sinai.
Masked gunmen opened fire on a cafe in Al Ayat, killing three civilians. Five others were wounded.
Nine people suspected of belonging to a cell behind attacks in the Sinai Peninsula were killed during a police raid on a hideout in al Salehiya el-Gadida. Nine others were arrested.

The Egyptian army announced that its troops have killed 12 militants in the Sinai Peninsula in the past days. The Egyptian army launched several anti-militant operations in central and northern Sinai in cooperation with the Egyptian Air Force.

The Egyptian army announced that its troops have killed 12 militants in the Sinai Peninsula in the past days. The Egyptian army launched several anti-militant operations in central and northern Sinai in cooperation with the Egyptian Air Force.
Four Islamic State vehicles were destroyed and passengers inside killed in a counter-militant operation by the Egyptian army.
ISIS attack in the area of Gafgafa, central Sinai. Reports indicate that a conscript was killed and two others wounded after being targeted by a barrage of mortar shells.
When the army approached a militant hideout east of Bir el Abed, an IED blew up the military vehicle, killing all 6 soldiers.
Three Islamic State militants were killed in a counter-militant operation by the Egyptian army. In a separate attack the same day a police conscript was killed by the militants.
ISIS/Sinai claimed to have damaged and destroyed two MRAPs btw two IED detonations in Balaa west of Rafah. The attack resulted in 'dead and wounded' in the ranks of the EG army.
ISIS/Sinai claimed to have killed a soldier through sniping in Karm al-Qawadis.
The Islamic State claimed responsibility for an attack on a church and a Coptic shop in Helwan that left at least nine people dead. The attacker from ISIS was shot dead as well.
3 Hasam militants killed in security raid near Atfih, Giza. AKs (including local Maadi variant), AP IEDs seized.
On or around 01 January, 2018, employees of an egyptian housing company held a protest at the company's headquarters in Cairo demanding better treatment and wages [size=numerous].
Unidentified militants attacked a liquor shop on al-Omraniya Street in Greater Cairo's Giza district, killing two Copts.
Security Measures: By decree, President Sisi renewed a nationwide state of emergency for three months. It was first imposed after deadly bombings targeted two churches in April 2017.
An Egyptian police officer was killed in an IED blast near Bir el-Abed.

The Islamic State in Sinai has published a video declaring war on the Palestinian Hamas movement and showing the killing of an IS member who had been allegedly convicted by an IS court of supplying weapons to Hamas's military wing Izz al-Din al-Qassam brigades.

column9: Military Forces of Egypt (2014-); Police Forces of Egypt (2014-)
column17: On a set of released pictures, ISIS can be seen operating a checkpoint near Bir el-Abd and singling out a soldier whom they execute in place. Two policemen are also shown to be executed.

Security Measures: ISIS released pictures where they can be seen operating a checkpoint openly, in broad daylight for a prolonged time, stopping vehicles, searching them and checking credentials without interference.
A quarrel reportedly broke out between political detainees and criminal inmates in Kerdasa police station in Giza which led to at least one dead and several injured.
The Egyptian army has killed two militants in central Sinai, arrested two others and destroyed two hideouts and several vehicles.
Three policemen and a civilian have been killed by an ambush by Islamic State militants near al-Arish.
Islamic State militants dumped the head of a Fawakhiriya tribesman on a main square in al Arish.
An inmate in Mukattam police station was reportedly tortured to death by police forces.
Police allegedly tortured to death a male from Semari village near Qena.

Family and friends of an inmate who was reportedly tortured to death clashed with police forces outside the police station in Muqattam. Rioters threw stones at police forces and vehicles. Police responded violently which led to 20 arrests and nine others injured.
A number of residents from Semari village near Qena blocked a road in protest over the police allegedly torturing to death a male from the village.
Union employees protested to denounce a number of social and professional problems. It is not specified where protests took place.
ISIS militants executed a civilian in the Safa neighborhood of Rafah, North Sinai. They claim that the individual worked as an informant on behalf of the EG army.
Police forces killed 8 militants in Al Arish when it raided a suspected hideout.
A police general from the Security Directorate of Daqahliya survived an assassination attempt as his convoy was attacked by masked assailants.

Non-violent activity: Giza Criminal Court passed 15-year prison sentences to 233 defendants involved in the Rabaa Dispersal case and acquitted 109 others. Many prominent MB members (e.g. Badie) were among the defendants.
ISIS claimed to have sniped two EG soldiers in the area of Rafah.
ISIS claimed to have executed a civilian they consider a ""spy/informant"" for the EG army in the area of Rafah.
ISIS claimed sniping two EG soldiers in Kharouba and Karm al-Qawadis east of El-Arish, North Sinai.
ISIS claimed sniping two EG soldiers in Kharouba and Karm al-Qawadis east of El-Arish, North Sinai.
Demolition: The Egyptian army has destroyed a large number of militant hideouts and arms caches in central Sinai.
Workers of Montazah Company for Tourism and Investment organized a protest, asking their administration to pay legal grants and salaries.

Security measures: Egypt has imposed a curfew in some parts in North Sinai. The curfew will be imposed from 5pm to 4am in Al Arish and it's surrounding areas, where it will be effective from 1am to 6am.
Hundreds of workers of the Egyptian National Cement Company started an open-ended strike inside the company's headquarters and protested physically.
ISIS claimed to have sniped two soldiers in the Touma area (Sheikh Zuweid), North Sinai.
Militants killed a Coptic man in the Sinai Peninsula. They did so after seeing a cross tattoo on his wrist. It is supposed that the perpetrators belonged to the Islamic State.
ISIS claimed to have damaged an army vehicle by IED detonation in the Touma area (Sheikh Zuweid), North Sinai.
Workers of Tanta Flax company entered into an open-ended strike and protested at the work place to ask for payment of delayed wages.
On or around 17 January, 2018, dozens of residents of Souk Al-Sebt city in the province of Ismailia gathered to protest against the removal of their homes [size=dozens].
The Egyptian army has killed a militant in a raid in North Sinai and arrested 22 others.
ISIS militants opened fire and stopped a Tarabin tribesman, abducted him and later killed him, accusing him of cooperating with Egyptian authorities.
Police captain killed and four others wounded by IED detonation that targeted an armored signal jamming vehicle on the road El-Arish-Qantara. Attack claimed by ISIS.
The Egyptian army killed one ISIS-Sinai militant and destroyed five hideouts in Central Sinai.

ISIS Sinai has claimed an attack on Egyptian military & police in the vicinity of al Arish, killing many through several IED explosions. They claimed to detonate three IED's targeting M-60 army tanks, destroying two and damaging one. Militants were also said to have destroyed a police armoured vehicle.
Fishermen in the area of ""Al-Mikas"" in the Alexandria province protested because of the repetitive decisions by authorities to prevent fishing at sea during the past few weeks.
The Egyptian police killed six ISIS militants in a shootout in Al Arish.
The Egyptian army killed two ISIS militants in an operation in North Sinai. Two others were arrested.

Arrests: Egypt's former chief of staff Sami Anan was arrested in what appeared to be a calculated move to force out the last potentially serious challenger to President Sisi for the upcoming elections.
Checkpoint established: Army & police forces establish 9 new check points on the road b/w El-Arish & Bir El Abd cities.
ISIS claimed damaging an EG army MRAP by IED detonation near the ""Shaer"" checkpoint in Rafah.
Unknown assailants stabbed and seriously wounded former head of the Central Auditing Orgnisation, who was also top aide to arrested presidential candidate Sami Anan.
ISIS claimed to have carried out a suicide attack targeting an EG army convoy south of El-Arish
Demolition: Egyptian troops have arrested two ISIS suspects and destroyed 14 hideouts in the central part of North Sinai province.
ISIS claimed damaging an EG army bulldozer by IED detonation yesterday near the ""Shaer"" checkpoint in Rafah.
A recruit soldier lost his life to sniper fire while on duty guarding the church of Abu-Seifein in Al-Arish.
On 02 January, 2018, Egyptian security forces discovered and seized 50 kg of explosives and three bombs in an apartment in 6th October City.
ISIS claimed the attack that killed a conscript and wounded another near checkpoint on the Ring Rd. south of El-Arish.

Demolition: The EG army started to bulldoze homes and olive groves to build a buffer zone around Arish airport which is seen as providing a 'hinterland' for Islamic State militants. Dozens of civilians have been displaced already.
Demolition: The EG army arrested 8 militant support elements, destroyed 12 hideouts, 2 4x4 vehicles and 7 motorbikes in Central Sinai.
Three soldiers wounded amidst armed assault south of El-Arish.
Demolition: Egypt's army has destroyed an ammunition cache and 16 militant hideouts in central Sinai.
Two policemen were killed in an IED attack in Al Arish. Five other conscripts were injured in the attack.

Egypt's army killed an Islamic State militant in a raid in North Sinai. Two vehicles and six motorbikes belonging to militants were also destroyed, as well as two warehouses where explosive devices were kept.

Two journalists, Hassan al-Bana Mubarak and Mostafa al-Aasar, disappeared as they were heading to their work place in Dokki. The families believe that there sons disappeared forcibly. One of the two is reportedly held in National Security HQs in Giza province.
Egyptian police forces have killed three suspected militants of Hasm group in an exchange of gunfire in Cairo. 10 members were arrested.
The EG air force targeted a number of homes and hideouts in the north and west of the Sinai.

Security Measures: The EG army launched a major operation called ""Operation Sinai 2018"" against Islamic State militants in the area. Maritime security was boosted, roads blocked, schools shut down, medical provision increased and the border to Gaza closed.

Arrests: The Supreme State Security Prosecution ordered deputy head of Misr al-Qawia Party, Mohamed al-Qasas, be detained for 15 days pending investigation on accusations of belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood.
The EG air force targeted a number of homes and hideouts on the Libyan border in the framework of the recently launched 'Operation Sinai 2018'.
The EG air force targeted a number of homes and hideouts in the north and west of the Sinai in the framework of the recently launched 'Operation Sinai 2018'. The operations led to 8 dead.
10 ISIS militants have been killed on Sunday during a police raid in Arish city.
On the third day of the extensive military operation Sinai 2018, the military spokesperson announced Monday that 12 militants have been killed in action.

EG Air forces destroyed 60 targets after intelligence confirmed the existence of militants in the surrounding area. In the process, 20 cars, 27 motorbikes, and 30 small houses were destroyed as well as some materials used for making explosives.
Egypt's army said it arrested 400 militants, defused 79 explosive devices and destroyed 143 hideouts.
On the fifth day of the extensive military operation Sinai 2018, the military spokesperson announced that 10 militants have been killed in Al Arish.
Egypt's army has said it killed 15 militants in crossfire on the sixth day of its latest security operation in Sinai.
Egypt's army said it arrested 153 militants, destroyed a tunnel in the border area with the Gaza strip and destroyed 181 nests and arms cashes. 63 IEDS were destroyed as well.
On 15 February, 2018, thousands of people gathered in Qalyub to attend the funeral of a soldier killed in combat in the Sinai and to demonstrate ""against terrorism"" [size=thousands].
The army said that airstrikes in the Western Desert near the Libyan border destroyed 10 SUVs laden with weapons and ammunition.
Egypt's army has said it killed 3 militants and arrested 244 others during the ongoing security operation in Sinai.
ISIS claims to have repelled attacks by the EG army, attacking soldiers by an RPG near Rafah and clashing with them which led to the death of several soldiers. Unknown fatalities
ISIS claims to have repelled attacks by the EG army, by an IED explosion in El-Kharouba which killed several soldiers. Unknown fatalities
Defusal: Egyptian forces detected and defused 45 explosive devices and destroyed 158 militant dens and hideouts containing arms and ammunition during raids. 408 militants have also been arrested.
ISIS claims to have repelled attacks by the EG army, destroying military vehicles in al-Touma by IED attacks.
ISIS claims to have repelled attacks by the EG army, clashing with soldiers near Sheikh Zuweiyid wounding some of them.
ISIS claims to have repelled attacks by the EG army, clashing with soldiers and destroying some vehicles by IED attacks in Jabal al-Halal. 4 reported dead.
ISIS claims to have repelled attacks by the EG army, sniping a soldier in el-Qawadis.
ISIS claims to have repelled attacks by the EG army, destroying 5 vehicles by carrying out IED attacks south of Rafah.
Egypt's army has said it killed 7 militants as part of the recently launched 'Sinai 2018' military operation.
ISIS claims to have repelled attacks by the EG army, clashing with soldiers in Central Sinai wounding some of them.
Egyptian security forces tried to stop a strike of workers of the Ceramic Company 'La Beaute' in Cairo through raiding their homes, beating and arresting them.

The Islamic State claimed to have killed around 40 EG military personnel since the start of Operation Sinai 2018 through IED attacks, armed clashes and sniper attacks. Fatalities split between events.
Demolition: Military engineers destroyed 101 explosive charges that had been planted in areas of the operation in Sinai. Four caves and hideouts were destroyed as well. 417 militants were arrested.
The EG army flew airstrikes against the Islamic State. 166 targets have been shelled in North and Central Sinai.
The EG army killed four ISIS militants in shooutout. One officer and two conscripts were killed as well.

The Islamic State claimed to have killed around 40 EG military personnel since the start of Operation Sinai 2018 through IED attacks, armed clashes and sniper attacks. Fatalities split between events.

The Islamic State claimed to have killed around 40 EG military personnel since the start of Operation Sinai 2018 through IED attacks, armed clashes and sniper attacks. Fatalities split between events.
The EG army killed four ISIS militants in a shooutout.
The EG army flew airstrikes against the Islamic State and destroyed eight hideouts.

At least seven army personnel have been killed and six others injured during an Islamic State attack on an army base of the 101 brigade in Al-Arish. Four IS-militants detonated their suicide vests after having exhausted their ammunition.
ISIS claims to have killed and wounded 6 soldiers including two officers by sniping west of Sheikh Zuweid (3 fatalities coded)
Security forces killed 11 armed ISIS-militants when foiling a suicide attack attempt and during an exchange of fire in Al Arish. In another battle, 3 Egyptian troops were killed by ISIS militants.

Arrests: The Egyptian army arrested 641 criminal suspects on or before 27 February, bringing the total number of the arrested since the start of operation 'Sinai 2018' on 9 February to 2,235 individuals. Several hideouts were destroyed. On 1 March, another 86 were militants were arrested and 100 terrorist shelters and warehouses were destroyed.
Defusal: EG Air Force discovered and destroyed two four-wheel-drive vehicles loaded with quantities of ammunition and highly explosive materials in the Sinai Peninsula.

Egypt's armed forces announced the death of 13 armed men in northern Sinai on day 21 of operation 'Sinai 2018' aimed at eliminating ISIS in Sinai. 2 officers also died in the battles. The Air Force destroyed nine hideouts and two booby-trapped vehicles used by ISIS militants.
ISIS released footage showing an M60 Patton MBT burning after having been targeted by an IED detonation, south of El-Arish.
The EG airforce destroyed six militant hideouts and two booby-trapped vehicles.
A small group of Ghad party members have gathered in downtown Cairo in support of Moussa Mustafa Moussa, the sole candidate running against President Sisi.
4 soldiers and 10 militants were killed in new fights during military operation 'Sinai 2018' in the Sinai.

IS claims attacking an Egyptian army foot patrol with an IED in al-Wadi area, east of Al-Arish, and targeting soldiers in another location south of Al Arish on the same day. 10 military personnel were killed and injured in the two attacks.

IS claims attacking an Egyptian army foot patrol with an IED in al-Wadi area, east of Al-Arish, and targeting soldiers in another location south of Al Arish on the same day. 10 military personnel were killed and injured in the two attacks.

Clashes broke out between security forces and fans from the Ahly football club during a match between Ahly SC and Gabon's CF Mounana in Cairo stadium. Security forces tried to arrest some hooligans which consequently sparked a fight between fans and the police. Fans set two police vehicle on fire, lit firecrackers and chanted against the police.
IS claims to have thwarted an army advance on IS positions south of al-Mayadin village in Sinai, killing two soldiers and wounding others in the fighting.

On March 6, after a policeman reportedly killed a man at a coffee place by mistake in Manzala (coded in a separate event), a group of people destroyed two police vehicles, set tires on fire, blocked traffic and broke the morgue door in Manzala's hospital.
On March 6, a policeman reportedly killed a man at a coffee place by mistake, in Manzala. People rioed after the event (coded in a separate event).

Property destruction: on 8 March, the Egyptian army destroyed an olive-squeezing factory in an effort to clear the area around Al Arish airport. Leading up to the 5 May, residents also reported at least 5 instances where olive trees were razed including in southern Sheikh Zuweid, the Karm al-Qawadis area, southern Rafah and southern Arish.
Over 8-11 March, Egypt's military killed 16 militants in Al Arish in the framework of Operation 'Sinai 2018'. Two were killed on their side.
Over 8-11 March, Egypt's military killed 16 militants in Al Arish in the framework of Operation 'Sinai 2018'. Two were killed on their side.
A small group of Ghad party members have gathered in downtown Cairo in support of Moussa Mustafa Moussa, the sole candidate running against President Sisi.
Over 8-11 March, Egypt's military killed 16 militants in Al Arish in the framework of Operation 'Sinai 2018'. Two were killed on their side.
Over 8-11 March, Egypt's military killed 16 militants in Al Arish in the framework of Operation 'Sinai 2018'. Two were killed on their side.
Around 15 March, Egyptian armed forces raided a camp of Islamist militants in Rafah and seized a communication centre. No report of fatalities.

Around 15 March, a military operation carried out by the security forces on Islamic State militants in Al Arish left 36 militants and 4 soldiers killed. Egyptian warplanes hit 12 militant hideouts south of Al Arish during the operation. 345 militants were detained.
A former spokesman of the Muslim Brotherhood was reportedly physically assaulted in Tora (Scorpion) Prison by a police officer. The event was reported on 18 March.
On 20 March, a police officer killed an employee of the consumer association in Menufia governorate after a disagreement over irrigation of agricultural land.
On 21 March, thousands of Muslim villagers rioted against there being a church in the village of al-Toud in Abu-Tesht, Qena. They attacked Coptic houses with stones and blocked access to the church.

On 23 March, hundreds of people protested in the Darin village of Nabaruh city in Egypt's al-Dakahliya governorate at the house of a senior female citizen they claim was tricked by her neighbor into trafficking drugs to Saudi Arabia.
On 24 March, dozens of people protested at the scene of an earlier car bomb attack in Alexandria's Roushdy neighbourhood to condemn the attack.
On 24 March, two policemen were killed in a car bomb explosion targeting the security chief in the Roushdy area of Alexandria. There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the attack.

On 25 March, police forces killed six Islamist militants in Beheira province. The militants were reported to belong to the Hasam Movement and were blamed for the attack on the Alexandria security chief on 24 March.
On 26 March, Islamic State targeted an M60 tank and other military vehicles with improvised explosive devices (IEDs) near Al-Arish.
On 27 March, Islamic State militants ambushed members of the Egyptian army south of Al-Arish. One navy captain killed.
On 28 March, a group of Islamic State fighters clashed with security forces guarding a police station in al-Arish.
On 28 March, the Islamic State group claimed a suicide bomber attack against Egyptian army vehicles, south of Al-Arish. No reported fatalities (other than bomber).

On the week of 26 March, six Islamist militants were killed in an operation by the Egyptian army in North Sinai. Two soldiers were also killed in other operations on that week, including at least one on 27 March.
Around 7 April, Egyptian armed forces killed four militants suspected of being members of the State of Sinai militant group in North Sinai. They also detonated 30 IEDs.
On 11 April, two State of Sinai militants claimed responsibility for two IED attacks in the Rafah area. No fatalities or target reported (presumed military target).
State of Sinai militants claimed responsibility for an ambush against an Egyptian army foot patrol near the Husaynat village north of Rafah (day not specified and outcome unknown).

In security operations against Sinai militants ""over the past few days"" (source date 14 April), 27 were killed, including 12 in a shootout with police and 6 in aerial bombardments. It is unclear if these attacks all occurred at once or separately.

In security operations against Sinai militants ""over the past few days"" (source date 14 April), 27 were killed, including 12 in a shootout with police and 6 in aerial bombardments. It is unclear if these attacks all occurred at once or separately.
On 14 April, fourteen State of Sinai militants and eight Egyptian soldiers were killed in an attack on a military camp in Al-Qossima, central Sinai. The militants blew themselves up outside the camp.

Security Measures: On 14 April, the Egyptian government extended the nationwide state of emergency for three months. An overnight curfew was also extended in parts of North Sinai by Prime Minister Sherif Ismail.

On 15 April, 2018, thousands of people from Dakahlia gathered in Al Mansura to mourn the death of egyptian soldiers in Central Sinai a day before. The funerals turned into a demonstration against terrorism [size=thousands].
On 17 April, the State of Sinai group claimed to have killed an officer and wounded three soldiers in a series of IED attacks south of Sheikh Zuweyid.

column16: Anadolu Agency; Egypt State Information Service
column17: On 18 April, the Egyptian military killed Nasser Abu Zaqul, an Emir of State of Sinai and four other militants in an operation in mountainous area of Central Sinai after significant exchanges of fire.

On 18 April, the Islamic State group claimed an IED attack on an M113 armoured personnel carrier near al-Gora airport, south of Sheikh Zuweid town in northern Sinai. The report stated that the attack killed everyone on board.
On 19 April, 2018, hundreds of people gathered in Toukh to attend the funeral of a soldier killed in combat in the Sinai and to protest ""against terrorism"" [size=hundreds].
On 20 April, members of the Ultra White Knights (UWK) demonstrated against the chairperson of the club. At least 21 people were arrested. Location not provided.
On 21 April, State of Sinai militants claimed to have killed a soldier by sniping east of El-Arish, North Sinai.
In the week of 18-25 April, eight militants were reportedly killed during military raids in north and central Sinai. 4 fatalities coded in North Sinai and 4 in Central Sinai.
In the week of 18-25 April, eight militants were reportedly killed during military raids in north and central Sinai. 4 fatalities coded in North Sinai and 4 in Central Sinai.
Three police officers were killed in clashes with militants during a raid on their hideout in the North Sinai city of Arish. Two policemen were injured and 17 militants killed.
Around 22 April, airstrikes in the Western Desert destroyed 10 vehicles laden with weapons and ammunition.
On 22 April, hundreds of workers at Bisco Misr in Alexandria staged a sit-in inside the company HQ over unpaid annual profits.

On 27 April, the Islamic State group claimed to have inflicted casualties in the ranks of the EG army and destroyed a bulldozer and an APC by detonations of two IEDs west of Rafah and east of El-Arish in North Sinai.

On 27 April, the Islamic State group claimed to have inflicted casualties in the ranks of the EG army and destroyed a bulldozer and an APC by detonations of two IEDs west of Rafah and east of El-Arish in North Sinai.
On 30 April, it was reported that 4 militants were killed in confrontations with the Egyptian army in Sheikh Zuweyid.
On 30 April, it was reported that Egyptian airstrikes killed 12 gunmen in the area of Jihad Abu Tabel and Red Head south of Al Arish.
On 05 February, 2018, hundreds of people gathered in Mit El-Khouly to attend the funeral of a soldier killed in combat in the Sinai and to demonstrate ""against terrorism"" [size=hundreds].
On 7 May, the Islamic State group in Egypt (State of Sinai) claimed to have killed an Egyptian soldier by sniper fire near the Riyadh checkpoint, south of Rafah, North Sinai.

On 8 May, seven people were killed - including a judge, prosecutor, four policemen and a civilian and 17 wounded when a suicide bomber rammed his car into a hotel as security forces opened fire. The car exploded, killing the bomber. A second blast took place 10 minutes later, killing another bomber.
On 8 May, a blast cocurred 10 minutes after another blast that had killed 8 people including the suicide bomber. In the second blast, the suicide bomber died as he detonated his explosives.

In a recent statement, the Egyptian Armed Forces reported 21 Islamic State (State of Sinai) militants were killed in Central and North Sinai during the last security operation. Six militants were arrested while seizing weapons and explosives and another 232 suspects arrested. Exact date not reported. Fatalities split between three events.

In a recent statement, the Egyptian Armed Forces reported a total of 21 Islamic State (State of Sinai) militants killed in Central and North Sinai during the last security operation. 18 were killed in exchanges of fire in Central and North Sinai and 3 were killed by air forces. Exact date not reported. Fatalities split between three events.

In a recent statement, the Egyptian Armed Forces reported 21 Islamic State (State of Sinai) militants were killed in Central and North Sinai during the last security operation. Six militants were arrested while seizing weapons and explosives and another 232 suspects arrested. Exact date not reported. Fatalities split between three events.
On 12 May, around 50 protesters jumped over the barriers in al-Marg metro station in Cairo to protest the increased ticket fare.

On 12 May, Egyptian police arrested 21 people who protested the government decision to increase Cairo's metro ticket fares. Protesters chanted anti-government slogans. The arrests took place mostly at Helwan metro station.
On 14 May, State of Sinai militants claimed to have damaged an armoured Egyptian army vehicle with an IED in Al-Arish, North Sinai. No reported fatalities.
On 14 May, four people were killed and one injured in an explosion in the New Administrative Capital in New Cairo. The explosion was due to a forgotten landmine left over from previous wars.

Around 17 May, a total of 10 Islamist militants were killed in exchanges of fire in North and Central Sinai as part of the on-going ""Operation Sinai 2018"" campaign. Fatalities split between two events. Another 9 were killed in clashes with the police forces.

Around 17 May, a total of 10 Islamist militants were killed in exchanges of fire in North and Central Sinai as part of the on-going ""Operation Sinai 2018"" campaign. Fatalities split between two events. Another 9 were killed in clashes with the police forces.
On 18 May, presumed State of Sinai militants attacked an Egyptian army position south of Sheikh Zuweyid killing two soldiers.

On 18 May, presumed State of Sinai militants set off an IED and killed the chief of the special police forces and wounded others as they were travelling in convoy towards the al-Safa checkpoint south of Al-Arish.

Between 17-29 May, the Egyptian army announced that eight militants had been killed in an operation against State of Sinai militants in Central and North Sinai. Two soldiers were also killed. 10 fatalities spread over 4 events in May.

On 21 May, dozens of union committee candidates gathered in front of the Election Commission in near Cairo Football Stadium in protest against the delay in a final candidate statement by the trade union committees of the Ministry of Manpower.

Between 17-29 May, the Egyptian army announced that eight militants had been killed in an operation against State of Sinai militants in Central and North Sinai. Two soldiers were also killed. 10 fatalities spread over 4 events in May.

On 23 May, the Islamic State group's media outlet Amaq reported a video showing the effect of an alleged Israeli airstrike on residents houses in North Sinai. The video is likely a recruitment tool to discredit the Egyptian government.
Between 17-29 May, the Egyptian airforce destroyed two weapon-laden vehicles in the Western Desert while attempting to enter the country from the western border with Libya. No reported fatalities.

Between 17-29 May, the Egyptian army announced that eight militants had been killed in an operation against State of Sinai militants in Central and North Sinai. Two soldiers were also killed. 10 fatalities spread over 4 events in May.

Between 17-29 May, the Egyptian army announced that eight militants had been killed in an operation against State of Sinai militants in Central and North Sinai. Two soldiers were also killed. 10 fatalities spread over 4 events in May.
On 3 June, three policemen including an officer were killed in an IED attack on their armoured vehicle as they were travelling near Al Arish in North Sinai.
On 5 June, Egyptian security forces reportedly killed 15 militants in clashes near the Al-Arish ring road.

On 6 June, assailants attacked a Ramadan party hosted in Cairo by the Civil Democratic Movement (a liberal political movement including opposition parties), hitting them with plates and water bottles and chanting ""long live Egypt!"", the slogan of el-Sissi supporters. Several people were lightly wounded.
On 9 June, unidentified assailants shot and killed a man in Al-Arish, North Sinai. Their identity and motive was not confirmed.

On 9 June, the State of Sinai militant group claimed to have destroyed an Egyptian army minesweeper near a checkpoint west of Rafah, North Sinai. On the same day, they claimed to have damaged an MRAP by IED detonation south of Rafah.
On 10 June, Egyptian security authorities killed four militants in an exchange of fire in North Sinai's al-Arish, one day after the reported death of a civilian in the same area.

On 13 June, the Islamic State group reportedly set up an ambush on the International Road west of the town of Arish, killing three Egyptian soldiers. The attack occurred near the salt production facility in Sebika on the road between El-Arish and Bir el-Abed, North Sinai. In a conflicting report it was stated that the Islamic State fighteres set up a checkpoint and stopped passing cars without violence.
On 14 June, 2018, thousands of people gathered in Kafr ash Shaykh to mourn the death of a soldier killed on 12 June in Al Arish and to protest against terrorism [size=thousands].
In June, six Egyptian policemen tortured to death a prisoner in Cairo.
On 19 June, the Islamic State group released a photo report showing two individuals who were accused of spying for the Egyptian army who were forced to dig their own graves before being beheaded.
On 19 June, the Islamic State group claimed to have killed at least one Egyptian army officer and damaged a Humvee by IED detonation south of El-Arish, North Sinai

On 22 June, after the family heard about the death of a detainee in Hadayek Al-Quba police station, dozens of people protested in front of the police station, demanding those allegedly responsible for the death to be held responsible. Riot police were deployed and five people arrested.
On 22 June, a detainee in the Hadayek Al-Quba police station died after he was arrested and interrogated for theft-related charges. Several policemen were detained, suspected of torture.
Security Measures: on 24 June, Egypt extended its state of emergency for 3 months.
On 25 June, IS militants clashed with Egyptian soldiers at the ""Sabah barrier"" near Rafah port, killing and wounding many of them, before allegedly returning safely to their positions.
On 25 June, an IED blast targeted a group of soldiers in the Abu Rashoud area south of Sheikh Zuweid during a military operation, killing one soldier and wounding several others.
On 26 June, an employee at Egypt's national broadcasting company was killed when unidentified gunmen entered his home in Arish, northern Sinai, and shot him.
On 27 June, four militants, allegedly from the Hasam Movement, were killed in an exchange of fire with security forces in Sohagyia of al-Ghanaim town in Assiut province.
One civilian was killed and two others injured in an explosion in Al-Arish. The explosive was remotely detonated as a truck drove on the ring road south of Al-Arish.

On or around 3 July, the Egyptian army killed 3 suspected Islamist militants in North Sinai and destroyed tunnels near Rafah. A conscript was wounded and 2 civilians were killed as a result of an explosion from a device targeting forces.

On the week of 2 July, IS claimed that it targeted military vehicles in Sinai's border town of Rafah. The group said it targeted ""two bulldozers and a cougar vehicle"" belonging to the Egyptian army, allegedly during operations for constructing the buffer zone in the area.

No specific date provided, source dated 9 July. Management of the Ghazal Kafr El Dawar company delayed in paying workers' salaries for 9 consecutive days, which prompted them to protest in front of the administration building to ask for the payment of their salaries.

On 10 July, an IS statement said that IS militants targeted a military vehicle with an IED in al-Sabeel area near the town of Arish, leaving it destroyed. On the same day, according to the group, IS militants also targeted a ""Hummer vehicle"" with an IED at Abu al-Walid checkpoint south of Arish town, killing or wounding all of those on board.

On 11 July, IS militants allegedly set up an ambush at the ""17 Kilometres"" position west of Arish town. According to the group's statement, IS militants clashed with Egyptian soldiers using light and medium arms, also leaving ""many"" killed or injured, including an officer.

Around 11 July. At least 11 Islamist militants were killed in an exchange of fire with police forces in the city of Al-Arish in Egypt's Sinai Peninsula. Two explosives dismantled. The report did not say when the raid took place exactly (report dated 11 July) or whether any security forces were killed or wounded.

On 12 July, the Islamic State group said that its militants targeted a group of Egyptian soldiers with two improvised explosive devices (IED's) at the ""8 Kilometres"" position west of Arish town, leaving ""many"" killed or wounded.

On 22 and 23 July, the region south of Rafah witnessed clashes between Egyptian armed forces backed by local tribes and State of Sinai militants. During this operation, a Daesh leader, Abou Jaafar al-Maqdesi, was killed.

On 22 and 23 July, the region south of Rafah witnessed clashes between Egyptian armed forces backed by local tribes and State of Sinai militants. During this operation, a Daesh leader, Abou Jaafar al-Maqdesi, was killed.
On 24 July, Egyptian police forces killed 13 suspected State of Sinai militants in a shootout in al-Arish.
On 31 July, police killed 5 Hasam militants and arrested 5 during a shootout in El Obour.

column6: Police Forces of Egypt (2014-) Prison Guards
column17: On January 8, an Egyptian American was arrested at Cairo airport and detained in Tura Prison. During the following weeks, he was tortured, submitted to electric shocks on his genitals and raped by security agents.

In the days leading up to August 5th, Egyptian forces claimed to have killed 52 ""jihadists"" and arrested 49 in Northern and Central Sinai. Coded as two events in the week of July 30th with a date precision of 2.
On 3 August, gunmen assassinated former Sinai parliament candidate, Sami al-Kashef, outside his house.

In the days leading up to August 5th, Egyptian forces claimed to have killed 52 ""jihadists"" and arrested 49 in Northern and Central Sinai. Coded as two events in the week of July 30th with a date precision of 2.
On 5 August, Egyptian forces claimed the killing of 11 ""jihadists"" in clashes close to th Arish police station, North Sinai.
On 11 August, a suicide bomber targeted the Virgin Mary Church in Mostorod, Shubra al-Khaima north of Cairo, injuring two people and killing himself.
Shortly prior to 12 August, Egyptian security forces said 12 ""terrorists"" were killed in a shootout in El Arish, North Sinai.
Shortly prior to 13 August, police killed 6 Islamist militants during a raid on their hideout in the 6 October district of Cairo.

On 16 August, 800 workers at the Needle Kraft factory in Shebin El Koum, Menoufia province, gathered in front of the factory refusing to work in protest against the ill-treatment by the administration.
Around 19 August, IS snipers allegedly killed three Egyptian soldiers. The statement did not specify the date or location of this attack.

On 19 August, the State of Sinai claimed that one of its militants used a car bomb to attack a group of Egyptian soldiers west of Arish airport. 1 soldier dead and 4 wounded. Fatalities coded include suicide bomber.

On 25 August, suspected State of SInai militants attacked Egyptian forces at a checkpoint in Arish. Four policemen and four militants were killed before detonating explosive belts. A total of 10 explosive devices, four automatic weapons, three bomb belts, as well as a number of hand-made bombs and projectiles were seized. 10 policemen wounded.
On August 26, unknown gunmen attacked a checkpoint in Wadi Al-Allaqi south of Aswan (coded as Aswan at geoprecision2) killing an officer and wounding a soldier.

On August 26, Islamic State militants detonated IEDs near the Kharafin checkpoint east of Sheikh Zuweid (coded as Sheikh Zuweiyid at goeprecision 2), killing two soldiers and wounding two others, an armored vehicle was destroyed and a bulldozer damaged.

On August 27, police forces raided a militant hideout in Markaz Akhmim on the desert road between Sohag and Assiut (coded as Markaz Akhmim at geoprecision 2), killing five militants and seizing weapons, ammunition and other objects.
On August 27, Islamic State militants killed three police officers by armed assault in central Al-Arish.
On August 27, Islamic State militants detonated an IED destroying an armored vehicle of the Egyptian army near the Safa neighborhood (coded as As Safa at geoprecision 2) in southern Al-Arish.
On August 27, Islamic State militants detonated an IED destroying an ambulance of the Egyptian army near the Faydi checkpoint south of Al-Arish (coded as Al Arish at geoprecision 2).
On August 28, residents in Mit Silsal protested in solidarity with a man accused of having killed his two sons, the protesters clashed with security forces who fired tear gas to disperse the crowd.

On August 29, the Egyptian Ministry of defense announced that the armed forces had carried out a combined air and ground operation in the Western Desert (coded as Bahariya Oasis at geoprecision 2), killing seven militants and seizing large amounts of weapons, explosives and other equipment.

On August 29, the Egyptian Ministry of defense announced that the armed forces had killed thirteen militants amidst shootouts in Central and Northern Sinai. Fatalities spread across two events at Al Arish and Al Hasna at geoprecision 2.

On August 29, the Egyptian Ministry of defense announced that the armed forces had killed thirteen militants amidst shootouts in Central and Northern Sinai. Fatalities spread across two events at Al Arish and Al Hasna at geoprecision 2.

On August 31, suspected Islamists militant ransacked homes in a village in the area of Minya (coded as Minya at geoprecision 2), stealing valuables and setting houses ablaze, three members of the Coptic community were wounded.
On August 31, security forces killed a militant while carrying out a raid on a house in Belqas.

column17: On September 1, Islamic State militants detonated an IED which destroyed an armored vehicle of type MRAP, and killed at least two soldiers and wounding two others at Jabal Halal, Central Sinai.
Detonation: On September 4, an IED exploded prematuraly while being carried in a backpack by an unknown gunmen near the U.S. embassy in Cairo, the suspect was arrested.
On September 5, two informants were wounded amid confrontations between residents of the Awlad Shaarawy al-Rifai area of Toukh during the execution of a court order.
On September 6, Islamic State militants carried out a dual-IED detonation against a convoy of the Egyptian army at Jabal Halal, killing an officer, two soldiers and wounding two others.
On September 6, Islamic State militants shot dead two policemen on the Rifai Square in downtown Al-Arish.
On September 9, Islamic State militants detonated an IED against an Egyptian army vehicle, killing two soldiers.
On September 10, security forces (police) killed eleven suspected militants amidst shootout in the Gisr al-Wadi area of Al-Arish.
On September 11, Islamic State militants detonated an IED against an Egyptian army vehicle in the area of El Fitat, killing three soldiers and wounding four others.
On September 12, Islamic State militants targeted an Egyptian army vehicle with an RPG west of Rafah (coded as Rafah at geoprecision 2), killing a soldier and wounding three others.
On September 13, teachers gathered in front of the administrative office in Qalyub to protest against the decision to transfer them to other departments.
On September 16, Islamic State in Sinai published the execution of three Bedouin militiamen taken prisoners in the area of Al-Barth south of Rafah. Date unclear.

On September 17, workers at the water and sanitation company staged a protest in Salhiya, demanding changes to the collection rate and expressed opposition to rules regarding the collection of bill payments.
On September 18, Islamic State militants detonated an IED destroying a bulldozer west of the Arish Airport killing those inside. Unknown casualties coded at low-estimate of 3.

column17: On September 19, Islamic State militants detonated an IED killing two soldiers and wounding three others in the area of Shabbanah, south of Rafah.
On September 21, an IED detonated on a car damaging it and other cars in the Turil area of Mansurah.
On September 21, Islamic State militants destroyed a bulldozer and damaged another by detonation of two IEDs near Arish Airport.

On September 23, parents of students at a school in Banha gathered outside the school to protest the decision to move the students to an old school in the area which the parents deemed to be in bad condition.
On September 23, Islamic State militants detonated an IED damaging a bulldozer west of Al-Arish Airport.
On September 24, security forces stormed the newspaper Al-Mesryoon in Cairo and detained journalists and employees while checking files and the website.
On September 25, four civilians were wounded by the explosion of a suspected remnant of war in the Ahmed Hamdi Tunnel.
On Sept 26, in Badr city, two Bedouin families clashed over land dispute, using firearms. Two were killed and 10 injured.
On September 26, artillery shellings and clashes between the army and Islamic State militants were reported west of Rafah, militants destroyed an army tank.
On September 26, Islamic State militants destroyed a bulldozer by IED detonation south of Sheikh Zuweid.
On September 27, Islamic State militants detonated a number of IEDs destroying three bulldozers and damaging another west of Al-Arish Airport.
On September 28, artillery shellings and clashes between the army and Islamic State militants were reported west of Rafah.

On September 29, residents on the island Warraq al Hadar staged a silent protest in solidarity with their imprisoned relatives, detained for protesting the allocation of the area to the Urban Communities Authority of the Ministry of Housing.

On September 30, students at the Workers University in Cairo staged a protest against the decision of the Supreme council of universities to limit the duration of studies to two years and not grant a four-years diploma.
On September 30, Islamic State militants shot dead a government employee in the Safa area of Al-Arish.

On September 30, Islamic State militants detonated an IED damaging an army vehicle south of Sheikh Zuweid (coded as Sheikh Zuweiyid at geoprecision 2), an unknown number of soldiers reportedly killed and wounded. Unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3.
On October 2, Islamic State militants killed an Egyptian soldier by sniping near the Mahdiya checkpoint in Rafah.
On October 2, Islamic State militants detonated an IED against an army foot patrol south of Rafah (coded as Rafah at geoprecision 2), killing three soldiers.

October 1 (week of), the Egyptian ministry of defense announced that security forces had killed 26 militants in an operation in Al-Arish and destroyed 7 militant hideouts and other equipment, and seized arms and other materiel.
On October 5, two civilians were wounded by the explosion of an unidentified object in a garage in Mansurah.
On or around Otober 6, security forces raided a farm in Al-Arish, killing 15 militants and seizing weapons.
On October 7, the army targeted Islamic State militant positions with artillery in the area of Al-Jahamat, south of Rafah.

On October 8, parents and students protested outside the Uqba Bin Nafi school in Alexandria against the decision by the school to close the doors for hundreds of students due to the high density at the school.
On October 8, the army and Islamic State militants clashed south of Rafah.

column17: On October 8, parents and students in private and special schools protested outside the Ministry of Education in downtown Cairo, demanding that the student should be able to study advanced levels and a second foreign language from the first grade.
On October 8, the army targeted Islamic State militant positions with artillery in villages south of Rafah (coded as Rafah at geoprecision 2).
On October 8, Islamic State militants destroyed an army Humvee by IED detonation in the area of Lahfan, south of Al-Arish.
On October 9, army artillery targeted Islamic State militant positions on the outskirts of the village Mowasi, south of Rafah.

On October 15, an IED detonation targeted an army vehicle in the area of Zuhayr, south of Sheikh Zuweid with reports of dead and wounded, unknown fatalities coded.
On October 15, security forces raided a cave in the area of Ghanayim between Sohag and Assiut, nine presumed Islamist militants were killed and arms, ammunition, and explosives were seized.
On October 17, workers of the Unionaire factory protested in the 6th October City, Giza, demanding an increase in salary and better working conditions.
On October 18, a woman was killed and her husband wounded when a mortar shell fired by unknown party fell on their home in Sheikh Zuweid.
On October 19, presumed Islamic State militants assassinated a civilian in the village of Houseinat for allegedly aiding government forces.
On October 19, an IED destroyed a bulldozer at unspecified location in Central Sinai (coded as Hasna at geoprecison 2), killing the occupants, unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3.
On October 19, Islamic State militants killed a soldier by sniping south of Sheikh Zuwied.
On October 22, Islamic State militants shot dead four civilians for working for the Egyptian army.
On October 20, Islamic State militants targeted soldiers with sniper fire wounding two south of Sheikh Zuweid.

On October 21, journalists and employees at the Al-Alam Al-Youm newspaper in Cairo staged an open sit-in in protest against unpaid salaries and social security contributions and the would-be closure of the newspaper.
On October 21, Islamic State militants damaged an army vehicle by IED detonation east of Rafah.
